articles.title: Philippines Department of Energy instructs renewable energy plants to add energy storage
articles.summary: Large-scale renewable energy power plant developers in the Philippines must integrate energy storage into their proposed facilities. The Department of Energy has issued an instruction requiring such plants to implement energy storage systems, a move aimed at ensuring grid stability and reliability. This development marks a significant shift towards incorporating energy storage solutions in the country's renewable energy landscape.

articles.title: Germany’s battery sector calls for faster grid connections amid backlog
articles.summary: Germany's battery industry is urging regulators and grid operators to speed up utility-scale connection approvals due to a backlog of applications exceeding available grid capacity, hindering the growth of large-scale battery storage. The "Large-Scale Battery Storage Cooperation Forum" has identified four action areas to address this issue, involving grid connection requests, flexible agreements, storage grid fees, and co-location. As many as 58 companies from the grid and storage sectors participated in the forum.

articles.title: Industry alliance calls for 100% renewables for Australian data centers
articles.summary: An alliance of 11 industry groups is urging the Australian federal government to require new data centers to secure 100% additional renewable energy and fund workforce training as a condition of approval. The proposal, endorsed by major environmental and union groups, aims to strengthen grid stability and ensure data center investments provide clear community benefits. Data centers are expected to consume 6% of Australia's grid-supplied electricity by 2030, according to the Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO).

articles.title: Google: Minnesota data centre energy deal includes 30GWh ‘multi-day’ iron-air batteries from Form Energy
articles.summary: Google's data centre in Pine Island, Minnesota, is getting 30GWh of "multi-day" iron-air batteries from US startup Form Energy through an energy deal with Utility Xcel Energy. The batteries are designed to provide long-lasting backup power and reduce the reliance on traditional fossil fuels.

articles.title: Solar, storage to lead record 86 GW of US capacity in 2026
articles.summary: Solar power is expected to account for 43.4 GW of new utility-scale capacity, with solar and battery storage combined making up 79% of all planned additions, representing the largest single-year capacity addition in over two decades. The US electric grid will see a historic expansion with 86 GW of new utility-scale generating capacity coming online in 2026. Solar power continues its growth trend as the fastest-growing source of new generation.

articles.title: La. Energy Leads Say Determined Approach Lands Data Center Contracts
articles.summary: Louisiana's energy industry leaders attribute their success in landing data center contracts to a determined approach, which prioritizes providing agility and adaptability to attract hyperscalers. The state is set to host multiple multibillion-dollar data centers, including a $12 billion Amazon facility near Shreveport, which will be supplied by Southern Electric Power Company. Utilities are being forced to compete for new load and invest in their infrastructure to remain competitive in the power market.

articles.title: Senators propose to bring back 5% safe harbor to utility-scale solar projects
articles.summary: US senators are proposing to revive a 5% safe harbor for utility-scale solar projects, allowing companies to secure investment tax credits with good-faith efforts in 2026. The guideline was initially released by the Treasury and IRS in August 2025 but has since been proposed for reintroduction. This move aims to provide greater certainty for investors in the solar industry.

articles.title: Renewable Properties, Pathward, BridgePeak Close $280 Million for Clean Energy Projects
articles.summary: Renewable Properties, a California-based clean energy developer and investor, has closed over $280 million in capital facilities with Pathward, N.A. and BridgePeak Energy Capital for various renewable energy projects, including small-scale utility, community solar, energy storage, and electric vehicle infrastructure initiatives. The funding will support the development of clean energy projects across multiple states. Renewable Properties now surpasses $280 million in total corporate and project capital raised.

articles.title: The Energy Storage Game Is Afoot: Form Energy Faces Off Against Tesla Megapack 3
articles.summary: Form Energy is launching a new 100-hour iron-air battery to challenge Tesla's Megapack 3, with deployments planned in Minnesota and six other states. The startup claims its technology offers significant advantages over Tesla's product. Form Energy has already started deploying its batteries in the US market.

articles.title: SolarPower Europe issues due diligence guide for PV-BESS
articles.summary: SolarPower Europe has released technical due diligence guidelines for utility-scale solar-plus-storage projects to strengthen best practices for large-scale hybrid projects combining photovoltaics and battery energy storage systems. The guidelines provide a framework for risk management and engineering standards across the full project lifecycle, from feasibility studies to operation and decommissioning. They call for independent technical health reviews at each stage and recommend engaging qualified advisers from the earliest development phase to protect long-term bankability and system reliability.

articles.title: REC sales on WV school district’s solar project free up money for two teacher salaries
articles.summary: The Wayne County School District in West Virginia has completed four solar systems, which are being sold through the Evergreen marketplace as renewable energy certificates (RECs), freeing up funds to pay for two teacher salaries. The sale of RECs is expected to generate revenue for the school district from the environmental attributes associated with the solar project. This deal showcases a creative way schools can monetize their renewable energy investments.

articles.title: Switzerland streamlines construction of large-scale solar plants
articles.summary: Switzerland will implement amendments to its Energy Act on April 1, 2026, to simplify and shorten planning and permitting for solar, wind, and hydropower projects of national interest. The changes aim to streamline grid expansion planning, as well as permitting and appeal procedures, making large-scale renewable energy projects advance more quickly. Cantons will be required to introduce a centralized plan approval process for these projects, with limited appeals to the superior cantonal court.

articles.title: RE Developments eyes 1GWh battery storage system in Western Australia
articles.summary: RE Development Pty Ltd is planning to build a 250MW/1,000MWh battery energy storage system in Baldivis, Western Australia. The project involves a 1GWh battery storage system, which will help stabilize the grid and provide renewable energy.

articles.title: 400MWh grid-forming New England BESS registered with Australia’s AEMO
articles.summary: The 200MW/400MWh New England battery energy storage system in New South Wales has been registered with AEMO's Market Management System. The system is a grid-forming energy storage project, storing 400MWh of energy. It marks one of the first grid-forming BESSs to be registered in Australia.

articles.title: Australian state backs pumped hydro as long-duration energy storage
articles.summary: The New South Wales government has granted priority status to two large-scale pumped hydro projects in Australia, totaling 1.8 GW, which will provide long-duration energy storage (LDES) to strengthen grid reliability and support the transition towards renewable electricity. The projects, valued at AUD 3.5 billion and AUD 3.6 billion respectively, have been declared Critical State Significant Infrastructure (CSSI). The declaration highlights their strategic importance in stabilizing the grid and supporting energy reliability during peak demand periods.

articles.title: Google to deploy world’s largest iron-air battery for US data center
articles.summary: Google plans to deploy a 300 MW/30 GWh iron-air battery system in Minnesota under an agreement with Xcel Energy, pairing it with 1.6 GW of new wind and solar, making it the largest battery system by energy capacity announced globally. The project aims to provide long-duration energy storage (LDES) for the relentless power demands of the AI era. Form Energy's iron-air batteries can store renewables-sourced electricity for 100 hours at system costs competitive with conventional power plants.

articles.title: Italy’s new energy provisions could boost gas use, undermine renewables and storage competitiveness
articles.summary: Italy's new energy decree may slash solar revenues by 30% due to reimbursement of gas transmission tariffs and EU Emissions Trading System costs. The measures could also slow down the power purchase agreement (PPA) and battery storage markets, potentially making the Italian electricity market riskier for investors. Industry experts warn that these changes could lead to a decline in renewable energy competitiveness.

articles.title: Solar electricity during night-time
articles.summary: Night-time in solar PV systems averages 16 hours on average, requiring significant storage or alternative generation to meet demand. Pumped hydro and batteries are key technologies for long-duration, low-cost storage during cloudy or windless periods. High solar and wind penetration reshapes grid operations and pricing, with dispatchable generation and load shifting also playing crucial roles in meeting night-time electricity demand.

articles.title: More states look to virtual power plants to fight rising electric bills
articles.summary: As of last year, 34 US states have implemented programs that encourage utilities to utilize virtual power plants featuring smart thermostats, batteries, EV chargers, and energy management systems in businesses and factories to combat rising electric bills. Virtual power plants aim to optimize energy usage and provide grid stability by leveraging distributed energy resources. This trend is seen as a potential solution to tackle growing electricity costs nationwide.

articles.title: Aggreko Provides Hybrid Power Station With Solar, Gas for Australia Project
articles.summary: Aggreko is leading a hybrid power station project in Queensland, Australia to support the Surat Gas Project (SGP) North, which combines natural gas and renewable energy. The project aims to demonstrate how these two energy sources can work together in a power generation installation. Construction has begun on the project, showcasing an innovative approach to hybrid power generation.

articles.title: DESRI, Clearway move Texas BESS projects forward
articles.summary: D.E. Shaw Renewable Investments (DESRI) has signed a preferred equity investment in the 235MW/470MWh Duffy battery energy storage system, located in Matagorda County, Texas. The project is being developed by IPP Linea Energy. DESRI's investment will help move the project forward.

articles.title: US BESS deployments to increase to 70GWh this year, SEIA says in first sector-dedicated report
articles.summary: US battery energy storage system (BESS) deployments are expected to reach 70GWh this year. This marks a significant growth from previous years, with the Solar Energy Industries Association predicting an expansion of sector-dedicated deployments.

articles.title: Newfoundland and Labrador Pursues $34.5M in Unpaid Fees as Green Hydrogen Production Projects Stall
articles.summary: The Government of Newfoundland and Labrador is pursuing $34.5 million in unpaid fees from three green hydrogen production projects that have stalled due to non-renewal of Crown land reserves. The quarterly fee for each project is 3.5% of land market value, totaling around $54.6 million, with $20.1 million paid so far. Two projects are still up-to-date on their fees: Exploits Valley Renewable Energy Corporation and North Atlantic.

articles.title: ‘No project above 100MW is fully merchant’: Bankability in focus as Energy Storage Summit 2026 kicks off
articles.summary: The concept that no project above 100MW is fully merchantable, meaning it cannot generate revenue solely on its own without government support, dominated a key panel discussion at the Energy Storage Summit 2026. Bankability for large-scale energy storage projects was the main focus of this event. The discussion highlighted the challenges in enabling bankability for such projects.

articles.title: ACWA Power to build 2 GW of solar in Türkiye
articles.summary: ACWA Power has entered into an investment agreement with Türkiye's Ministry of Energy and Natural Resources to develop 5 GW of renewable energy projects in the country, including two 1 GW solar power plants. The company will develop, finance, construct, commission, and operate the projects, which are expected to meet the electricity needs of 2.1 million households. The solar projects have secured a fixed rate of €0.0235/kWh and €0.0199/kWh respectively, with rates starting at €0.0475/kWh for the first five years of operation.

articles.title: Solar curtailment rises in Chile as grid constraints persist
articles.summary: Renewable curtailment in Chile reached 6,084 GWh in 2025, up 7.8% year on year, as the country's power mix becomes increasingly renewable and faces mounting transmission congestion. The country has consolidated a predominantly renewable electricity mix, with renewables accounting for 63.3% of total output, but now faces structural constraints linked to grid bottlenecks. Installed capacity reached 38,613 MW, with solar remaining the largest renewable technology with 11,717 MW installed.

articles.title: Lightsource bp sells 800MWh of co-located battery storage in Australia to Aula Energy
articles.summary: Lightsource bp sold an 800MW co-located battery storage project in Australia to Aula Energy as part of the sale of its 1GW operational solar PV portfolio. The deal involves a potential 800MWh of energy storage capacity and was facilitated by Lightsource's partnership with bp.

articles.title: RES Australia joint venture bags EPBC Act approval for 3.6GWh solar-plus-storage project in Queensland
articles.summary: RES Australia's joint venture, Wooderson Solar Development Co, has secured approval from the EPBC Act for a 450MW solar PV project with 3,600MWh of co-located battery energy storage in Queensland, Australia. The project will generate approximately 3.6GWh of electricity per year.

articles.title: Solar and Wind Dominate California’s Energy Future, CEC Model Shows
articles.summary: Solar and wind resources could generate up to 85% of California's electricity by 2045, with a total system capacity increasing from 150 GW in 2025 to 310 GW in 2045. Most of the new resources will come from solar (97 GW), energy storage (45 GW), and wind (24 GW in-state, 27 GW out-of-state). Natural gas could provide as little as 3% of the state's energy.

articles.title: Texas is about to overtake California in battery storage
articles.summary: Texas is expected to surpass California as the top state for battery storage, driven by a 30% year-over-year increase in US energy storage installations. The US has reached a record 57.6 GWh of installed energy storage capacity in 2025. This growth marks a significant shift in the market, with Texas poised to lead California in terms of battery storage.

articles.title: SEIA: US installed 57.6 GWh of new energy storage capacity in 2025
articles.summary: The U.S. energy storage industry installed a record 57.6 GWh of new battery capacity in 2025, representing a 30% increase from the previous year's record and more than four times the amount installed just three years ago. This growth is part of a rapidly expanding market for energy storage installations. Energy storage capacity has been steadily increasing in recent years, with significant growth seen between 2023-2026.

articles.title: Why Prime Movers’ Reliability Is Critical to Power Uptime
articles.summary: The increasing reliance on artificial intelligence (AI) and data centers is expected to more than double electricity demand by 2030, with AI-optimized servers consuming up to 10 times the energy of traditional computing. Prime movers' reliability will be critical to maintaining power uptime as demand for electricity continues to rise, particularly in regions where data centers may account for a significant portion of overall consumption. The rapid growth of these technologies underscores the need for reliable and efficient power generation systems.

articles.title: European Union members make mixed progress in implementing energy storage strategies
articles.summary: European Union countries have made limited progress on energy storage deployment, and only made partial implementation of electricity network flexibility recommendations. The EU aims to increase its energy storage capacity by 2025 to meet its renewable energy targets. Progress towards achieving these goals remains slow.

articles.title: FRV set for 1.2GW/5GWh BESS rollout in Spain
articles.summary: Fotowatio Renewable Ventures plans to roll out a 1.2GW/5GWh portfolio of battery energy storage system (BESS) projects in Spain, marking a significant expansion of its renewable energy capabilities. The projects are expected to support the country's growing demand for clean energy and stabilize the grid. This rollout will help Fotowatio Renewable Ventures meet the increasing need for battery storage solutions in the region.

articles.title: ESS Tech acquires VoltStorage GmbH to expand long-duration energy storage
articles.summary: US-based ESS Tech has acquired the assets and intellectual property of VoltStorage GmbH, a German developer of iron-salt battery technology, to strengthen its long-duration energy storage portfolio with complementary technologies. The acquisition combines two iron-based flow battery technologies to deliver flexible and cost-effective solutions for long-duration energy storage applications. ESS Tech's iron flow battery systems offer 8-12 hours of discharge at rated power in commercially available configurations.

articles.title: Home batteries reshape Australia’s national electricity market
articles.summary: Small-scale behind-the-meter storage in Australia's National Electricity Market could supply up to half the peak output of Eraring coal-fired power station by the end of 2026, driven by a rapid growth in home battery energy storage systems. The Cheaper Home Batteries Program has seen its budget more than tripled from AUD 2.3 billion to AUD 7.2 billion due to enthusiastic uptake by households and businesses. This rapid scaling is transforming small-scale behind-the-meter storage into a significant force within Australia's energy system.

articles.title: Deloitte urges India to align renewables with AI data growth
articles.summary: Deloitte urges India to align renewables with AI-driven data center growth, emphasizing grid readiness, transmission upgrades and coordinated policy reform to support sustainable energy at scale. The report highlights that India's expanding renewable energy base can power the next phase of data center growth, while balancing economic value with reliable and sustainable power. Aligning these critical enablers is essential for positioning India as a major global data center hub amidst Asia Pacific's "tipping point" in AI, cloud, and digital connectivity.

articles.title: Can a big battery help Boston save billions on the power grid? Maybe.
articles.summary: A big battery project near Boston may be able to help alleviate the US power grid's capacity issues by storing excess energy during off-peak hours and releasing it when demand is high, potentially saving billions of dollars on transmission costs. The project aims to demonstrate the feasibility of this approach as a solution to the country's electricity grid challenges.

articles.title: World’s first: US Air Force deploys portable nuclear power station [video]
articles.summary: The US Air Force has deployed a 5 MW portable nuclear power station for the first time, airlifting it on a C-17 Globemaster III from California to Utah. The deployment marks a new era of deployable energy and logistical capabilities. This is the world's first such deployment by the US Air Force.

articles.title: Kairos, DOE enhance collaboration on advanced reactor design
articles.summary: The US Department of Energy's Oak Ridge National Laboratory has partnered with Kairos Power to develop a new generation of advanced nuclear reactors, with a USD27 million investment. The collaboration aims to speed up the deployment of these reactors. Advanced reactor design is a key focus area for the partnership.

articles.title: AI Data Centers Turn to High-Temperature Superconductors
articles.summary: AI data centers are experiencing a growing need for power capacity due to their rapid expansion, leading to increased energy consumption and transmission losses. Microsoft is investigating the use of high-temperature superconductors as an alternative to copper wiring, which could improve energy efficiency by reducing transmission losses and increasing grid resiliency. By using HTS, data centers can potentially reduce the space required for power distribution, making them more compact and environmentally friendly.

articles.title: New U.S. electric generating capacity expected to reach a record high in 2026
articles.summary: U.S. electric generating capacity is expected to reach a record high in 2026 with 86 gigawatts (GW) of new utility-scale capacity added. The majority of this growth will come from solar power (51%), followed by battery storage (28%) and wind energy (14%). This represents a significant shift towards renewable energy sources.

articles.title: Enable the next wave of applications and opportunity: Cubenergy’s FlexCombo 2.0 flexible energy storage AC block
articles.summary: Cubenergy's FlexCombo 2.0 is a next-generation flexible energy storage AC block developed after leveraging 12 years of energy storage expertise. It enables the creation of new applications and opportunities in the energy sector. The product represents the next wave of advancements in energy storage technology.

articles.title: Invenergy Inks Supply Deal for Three New Natural Gas-Fired Power Plants in Arizona
articles.summary: Invenergy has secured a supply deal for infrastructure associated with three new natural gas-fired power plants in Arizona, solidifying its position as North America's largest privately held independent power producer. The agreement is part of Invenergy's efforts to develop renewable energy and energy infrastructure projects across the country. No further details on the specific pipeline operator or project timeline have been disclosed.

articles.title: Supreme Court says Trump does not have authority to issue tariffs under IEEPA
articles.summary: The US Supreme Court has ruled that President Donald Trump's 2025 tariff policy is unconstitutional, striking down the administration's justification of the measure under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA). The court found that IEEPA does not authorize tariffs to address trade imbalances. The decision was made in a 6-3 vote.

articles.title: Consumers Energy Completes nearly 2,700 Low Voltage and High Voltage Distribution Reliability Projects Across Michigan in 2025
articles.summary: Consumers Energy completed nearly 2,700 distribution reliability projects across Michigan in 2025, reducing customer impacts by 130,000 outages. These projects improved the efficiency of their low voltage and high voltage distribution systems, enhancing overall power reliability for customers. The investments resulted from Consumers Energy's efforts to enhance grid resilience and reliability.

articles.title: Estonia advances 1.1 GWh heat storage, 250 MWh BESS and 800 MWh battery park
articles.summary: Estonia has delivered its largest heat storage facility, begun construction on a 250 MWh battery energy storage system and is preparing to break ground on an 800 MWh battery park in Valga County, set to become the largest in the Baltics. French investment fund Mirova and Estonian developer Evecon have secured a €85 million long-term financing package from Swedbank to support Estonia's energy transition efforts. The country has also executed its first flexibility power purchase agreement (FPPA) in the Baltics, enhancing the 77.5 MWp Kirikmäe solar PV plant with the addition of a battery storage system.

articles.title: Samsung HVAC unveils inverter-driven residential heat pumps for cold climates
articles.summary: Samsung HVAC's Hylex inverter-driven heat pump system offers 2-5 ton capacity, high efficiency with a SEER2 rating of up to 15.2, and reliable cold-climate performance down to -25°C, featuring Wi-Fi control and compact design suitable for zero-lot-line properties.

articles.title: New Zealand selects 32 farms for solar and battery trial
articles.summary: New Zealand's Energy Efficiency and Conservation Authority has selected 32 agricultural businesses to test solar and battery systems across key sectors, with a total installed solar capacity of 3,616 kW. The program aims to demonstrate the viability of technology and share insights to encourage further uptake among New Zealand farmers. Seven farms have installed smaller-scale solar systems ranging from 30-50 kW, while four farms are utilizing batteries only.

articles.title: EcoFlow DELTA Pro Ultra X power station hits new $6,499 exclusive low, Anker SOLIX 72-hour flash sale, Bluetti member deals, more
articles.summary: The EcoFlow DELTA Pro Ultra X Power Station is now available for $1,800, a new low of $6,499. Anker's SOLIX 72-hour flash sale offers up to $4,099 off power station bundles starting from $650. Bluetti's February Member Day Sale provides up to 53% off its power stations with bonus savings.

articles.title: Space Solar Power Will Inevitably Trump Trump’s War On Solar Power
articles.summary: Space solar power is becoming a reality, defying US energy policies favoring fossil fuels. The space solar field is emerging from science fiction to fact, offering a viable alternative to traditional solar power. This technology will inevitably outpace Trump's war on solar power and become a major player in the global clean energy market.

articles.title: Amazon grows van fleet, solar-powered semis, and BetterFleet stops by
articles.summary: Amazon is growing its van fleet, investing in solar-powered semis, and using BetterFleet to optimize charging schedules for energy efficiency. Amazon's solar-powered semi initiative aims to reduce the company's carbon footprint. CEO Daniel Hilson discusses BetterFleet's capabilities with Electrek Daily's Quick Charge podcast.

articles.title: More policy questions, new products appear at Intersolar 2026
articles.summary: Intersolar and Energy Storage North America wrapped up its show in San Diego after a week of rainy days, with a quieter convention hall than in years past. Exhibiting companies expressed optimism about new products appearing at the event, including more policy questions. The 2026 conference saw a mix of innovative and traditional products on display.

articles.title: CTC Global Launches GridVista for Real-Time Transmission Monitoring
articles.summary: CTC Global has launched GridVista, a real-time transmission monitoring platform that utilizes Google Cloud and Tapestry for analyzing high-resolution data, providing benefits such as predictive maintenance, improved fault detection, and enhanced grid planning.

articles.title: Battery Storage System Replaces Wastewater Facility Diesel Generator
articles.summary: A battery energy storage system has replaced a diesel backup generator at a wastewater facility in New York State, demonstrating the potential for energy storage to power essential infrastructure. This project showcases the versatility of energy storage beyond solar pairing, highlighting its applications in other sectors such as wastewater treatment. The switch reduces reliance on fossil fuels and promotes a cleaner alternative.

articles.title: Corporate PPA deals down 10% in 2025 as AI demand plugs gaps
articles.summary: Corporate clean energy procurement fell by 10% in 2025 to its lowest level in nine years due to negative pricing and policy uncertainty, despite being the second-highest year on record for corporate clean-energy power purchase agreements. The number of technology companies leading the market, such as Meta, Amazon, and Google, increased, accounting for 49% of global activity. Solar remained the top-generating technology for corporate clean energy projects in 2025.

articles.title: India: Energy storage tech scope widens with 100MWh flow battery, 100GW pumped hydro and grid-forming BESS prospects
articles.summary: India's energy storage sector is expanding with the adoption of various technologies, including a 100MWh flow battery, pumped hydro storage (PHS) systems up to 100GW, and grid-forming Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS). These developments indicate a widening scope for India in energy storage solutions. The country is now exploring diverse applications for energy storage technologies.

articles.title: ‘I had to work significantly harder to achieve the same level of credibility and recognition as my male peers’
articles.summary: Women's participation in the renewable energy sector enhances decision-making, resilience, and long-term success through gender diversity and inclusive leadership. Diverse teams bring different perspectives to risk assessment, stakeholder engagement, and decision-making, leading to better communication, assumption-challenging, and resilient solutions. Inclusive leadership also supports the development of a broader talent pool, strengthens leadership pipelines, and improves stakeholder trust.

articles.title: Panasonic debuts fuel cell cogeneration system for PV‑integrated homes
articles.summary: Panasonic has launched a new fuel cell cogeneration system for detached homes, designed to increase on-site solar self-consumption through smart scheduling and demand response. The system integrates with a home energy management system to optimize electricity generation and consumption from gas, supporting both heating and emergency power during outages. It achieves high efficiency ratings of 41.0% and 37.0%, generating 200-700 watts of power.

articles.title: Origis completes 500-MW Swift Air Solar project in Texas
articles.summary: Origis Energy has completed three solar facilities in Texas, supporting Occidental's operations in West Texas with a total capacity of 500 MW. The project was delivered in phases, with the final phase completed in late 2025. The energy infrastructure will support Occidental's STRATOS Direct Air Capture facility in West Texas.

articles.title: TerraPower's Natrium reactor enters UK GDA process
articles.summary: TerraPower's Natrium reactor, a 345 MWe sodium-cooled fast reactor with molten-salt-based energy storage, has entered the UK's Generic Design Assessment (GDA) process. This acceptance is significant as it allows TerraPower to further develop and commercialize its Natrium design in the UK market. The GDA process evaluates reactor designs for safety, performance, and other regulatory criteria.

articles.title: A US Sodium-Ion Battery Maker Challenges Powerwall For Home Energy Storage, And More
articles.summary: US firm Syntropic has launched three new sodium-ion battery products for residential, commercial, industrial, and utility-scale use, challenging popular energy storage solutions like Powerwall. The company's batteries are designed to provide cost-effective and sustainable home energy storage options. Syntropic aims to disrupt the power storage market with its innovative sodium-ion technology.

articles.title: The War Against Solar Power Is Doomed To Fail, Part Infinity
articles.summary: Talon PV is constructing a 4.8-gigawatt TOPCon solar manufacturing facility in Texas. The move towards increased solar power production suggests that the war against solar energy is doomed to fail, with more investments and developments in the field expected. This development is part of a larger trend of growing support for renewable energy sources like solar power.

articles.title: Solar Power Used To Charge An EV In The Sub-Arctic
articles.summary: A pilot project by Easee and Subaru successfully used portable solar panels to charge an electric Subaru in the sub-Arctic, demonstrating a viable off-grid charging solution for electric vehicles in remote areas. The use of a portable EV charger also enabled a full charge of the vehicle's battery in under 2 hours. This innovative technology has significant implications for widespread adoption of electric vehicles in regions with limited access to traditional charging infrastructure.

articles.title: Chart: Grid battery installations soared to a new high in 2025
articles.summary: Grid battery installations soared to a new high in 2025, with over 13 gigawatts of energy storage installed in the U.S. last year. This represents an increase from around 12 GW in previous years. The installation of grid batteries broke another record according to a report from the Business Council for Sustainable Energy and BloombergNEF.

articles.title: Data centers are becoming power plants – this NJ project proves it
articles.summary: Calibrant Energy has signed a definitive agreement with Iron Mountain to build, own, and operate a 23-megawatt-hour (MWh) battery at the latter's New Jersey data center, highlighting the growing trend of data centers becoming power plants. The project will utilize clean energy sources like solar and wind to provide backup power for critical IT infrastructure.

articles.title: Iowa House of Representatives set to vote on community solar bill
articles.summary: The Iowa House Commerce Committee has advanced the Local Generation Act (HSB 629) on a 19-4 vote, sending it to the full House for consideration. The bill aims to provide access to locally controlled community energy projects that reduce electricity bills and strengthen grid reliability. It will give families, farmers, and small businesses opportunities to participate in these energy initiatives.

articles.title: Green NGOs & Renewable Fuel Producers: Commission Must Resist Pressure to Reopen the Rules Governing Renewable Hydrogen
articles.summary: The European Union's 2025 hydrogen policy framework is crucial for achieving climate goals, grid stability, and sustainable investment in the renewable hydrogen market. Weakening the existing framework could threaten these objectives. Green NGOs and renewable fuel producers are urging the Commission to reconsider its rules governing renewable hydrogen, but it must resist pressure to reopen the regulations.

articles.title: When Air Gaps Are Not Enough—Managing File and Media Risk in Nuclear Facilities
articles.summary: Cybersecurity is a persistent challenge in nuclear facilities, directly impacting physical safety, system reliability, and regulatory compliance. Air gaps are often not enough to protect highly sensitive systems without disrupting operations, highlighting the need for more effective management of file and media risk. Nuclear facilities must address this risk to ensure safe and reliable operation.

articles.title: Japanese utility launches residential battery demand response pilot
articles.summary: Kyushu Electric Power Co., a Japanese utility, will launch a residential battery demand response pilot on March 1, 2026, using home storage batteries supplied by Sharp Energy Solutions Corporation. The project aims to ease solar curtailment in southern Japan by leveraging insights from charge and discharge control of residential storage systems. This demonstration will help develop new customer services and unlock additional value streams for the company.

articles.title: Poland Springs water bottling plant adds 13-MW solar array on site
articles.summary: Primo Brands, the bottled water company behind Poland Springs, has installed a 13-MW solar array at its facility in Hollis, Maine. The project is owned and operated by Onyx Renewables and was constructed by PowerFlex. This move aims to reduce the company's environmental footprint as part of their commitment to being good stewards of natural resources.

articles.title: The Energy Storage Report 2026 out now: grid-forming, fire safety, bankability and more
articles.summary: The 2026 edition of The Energy Storage Report outlines emerging trends in grid-forming technologies, fire safety measures, and bankability concerns, providing valuable insights for the energy storage industry.

articles.title: Ukraine’s strategic need for energy storage
articles.summary: Ukraine's government views energy storage as a crucial element in addressing its strategic energy needs amidst ongoing conflicts with Russia, aiming to ensure energy security for its nation. The focus on energy storage is also part of Ukraine's efforts to prepare for a more sustainable and independent energy future. This initiative underscores the country's growing recognition of the importance of energy storage solutions.

articles.title: Global utility-scale battery capacity rises 12-fold in 2020-24 period
articles.summary: Global utility-scale battery capacity increased from below 10 GW in 2019 to over 124 GW by 2024, rising 12-fold during that period. Average battery costs fell 58% from $511.2 per kWh in 2019 to just under $213 per kWh in 2024. The growth of utility-scale batteries was strongest in regions with increasing shares of solar and wind generation.

articles.title: ‘Each megawatt will be competing’: Wärtsilä on Australia’s evolving grid-scale BESS market
articles.summary: Australia's energy storage market is growing, with the country being a "multi-gigawatt proving ground" for utility-scale energy storage systems. Multiple manufacturers are competing to supply grid-scale batteries, with each megawatt attracting significant interest and investment. This competitive landscape is driving innovation in the sector.

articles.title: De-risking redox flow batteries for grid-scale storage
articles.summary: Redox flow batteries can offer safety, reliability, and scalability advantages for standalone large-scale applications, despite their high upfront costs and lower energy density compared to metal-ion alternatives. A new study suggests that the technology is well-suited for grid-scale stationary energy storage, rather than electric vehicles or small-scale devices. Redox flow batteries require significant initial capital investment but can demonstrate long-term energy efficiency with over 10,000 cycles of operation.

articles.title: ACME Solar signs 190 MW hybrid PPA with SECI in India
articles.summary: ACME Solar Holdings has signed a 25-year 190 MW wind-solar hybrid power purchase agreement (PPA) with Solar Energy Corp. of India (SECI), requiring 50% annual capacity utilization factor and 80% daily peak supply obligation, for an assured peak power supply project in India.

articles.title: Pay-as-you-go solar often underutilized in Sub-Saharan Africa
articles.summary: 77% of sub-Saharan African households with off-grid pay-as-you-go solar systems reduce their electricity use after the first year, leading to underutilized and often oversized systems. This decline is driven by behavioral changes as well as economic constraints, highlighting the need for solar designs and pricing that match household energy needs. Households' mean demand falls by approximately one-third by the end of year two, suggesting reduced long-term energy use is not solely driven by financial constraints.

articles.title: I let Duke Energy control my thermostat. I don’t regret it.
articles.summary: Duke Energy sent a mass email to its customers, including the author, asking them to lower their thermostats and possibly wear warm clothing to conserve energy due to expected high demand. The utility warned of potential blackouts if supplies were strained, but ultimately, the request was not enforced. In hindsight, the author does not regret complying with the request.

articles.title: Green NGOs & Renewable Fuel Producers: Commission Must Resist Pressure to Reopen the Rules Governing Renewable Hydrogen
articles.summary: The European Commission must resist pressure from green NGOs and renewable fuel producers to reopen the rules governing renewable hydrogen, as weakening the framework would threaten climate goals, grid stability, and investment certainty in a sustainable hydrogen market. The EU's Delegated Regulation (EU) 2025/2359 marked an important milestone for hydrogen policy in 2025, setting out key guidelines for the sector. Opening the rules could undermine this progress and jeopardize the development of a reliable and low-carbon hydrogen market.

articles.title: Lydian Energy secures US$689 million for three US BESS and solar projects
articles.summary: Lydian Energy has secured $689 million in funding to develop three projects, including two solar projects and a battery energy storage system project, across the US states of New Mexico, Texas, and Utah.

articles.title: Battery storage can help establish a new era of European energy resilience
articles.summary: European energy resilience is being bolstered by battery storage systems, which play a crucial role in stabilizing the grid and ensuring energy security. However, more efforts are needed to solidify this technology's importance in European energy strategy. Battery storage has the potential to help establish a new era of energy resilience in Europe.

articles.title: Adani to invest $100 billion in AI data centers in India
articles.summary: The Adani Group plans to invest $100 billion by 2035 in building 5 GW of renewable-powered data centers in India, potentially catalyzing an additional $150 billion in related industries and creating a $250 billion AI infrastructure ecosystem over the next decade. The project aims to establish hyperscale data centers across the country, significantly boosting India's technology sector.

articles.title: Investment rally coincides with renewables records in Australia’s NEM
articles.summary: A record five large-scale renewable energy generation projects totaling 1.2 GW reached financial close in Australia's National Electricity Market (NEM) in the last quarter, with AUD 3.5 billion ($2.48 billion) invested. This marks the second-highest investment total recorded in a single quarter, behind only the fourth quarter of 2022 when capital investment reached AUD 4.3 billion. Industry figures note that more needs to be done to ensure investment momentum continues despite "subdued" investment activity in the prior three quarters.

articles.title: New Zealand gentailer Contact Energy eyes US$316 million raise for renewables and energy storage expansion
articles.summary: Contact Energy plans to raise US$316 million from equity funding to accelerate its development of renewable energy and energy storage projects in New Zealand. The company's goal is to invest in a pipeline called Contact31+, which aims to increase the share of renewable energy sources in its generation mix.

articles.title: Quinbrook powers up 619MWh Supernode Stage One BESS in Queensland, Australia
articles.summary: Quinbrook Infrastructure Partners has started commercial operation of a 619MWh battery energy storage system at the South Pine substation in Queensland, Australia. The system is part of the Supernode Stage One project. It marks a milestone for the company's efforts to expand its energy storage capabilities.

articles.title: Australia commissions 4.9GWh of grid-scale batteries in 2025, matching entire 2017-2024 output
articles.summary: Australia's grid-scale battery installations reached a record 4.9GWh in 2025, matching the entire output of batteries installed between 2017-2024. This represents a significant increase in investment and growth for the country's energy storage sector. The milestone has been attributed to strong demand and support from regulatory bodies.

articles.title: California batteries sustain near 24-hour solar run
articles.summary: California's batteries sustained a 24-hour solar run on February 1, bridging the solar gap seamlessly and allowing the state to stay on grid with renewable energy well past midnight. The batteries spent daylight hours charging and exporting power during the day, then continued to supply the grid at night until sunrise. This achievement is notable because it represents a significant advancement in battery technology and its ability to support long-duration energy storage.

articles.title: New England’s biggest grid battery is up and running in Maine
articles.summary: A massive new battery has been installed in southern Maine as part of the Cross Town Energy Storage project, providing a significant boost to New England's efforts to expand clean and affordable energy. The battery is expected to play a crucial role in stabilizing the grid and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. It marks one of the largest grid batteries in operation in the Northeast.

articles.title: Electricity Prices Decreased In South Australia Because Of Clean Renewables
articles.summary: South Australia's electricity prices decreased due to the increasing share of clean renewables, a trend also seen in countries like British Columbia and Norway. The state is transitioning towards a cleaner energy mix, with renewable sources contributing significantly to its energy generation. This shift is expected to continue, supporting South Australia's goal of reducing emissions and improving energy sustainability.

articles.title: Balcony plug-in solar panels: Are we ready for this new era of accessible energy?
articles.summary: Balcony plug-in solar panels offer a new, more affordable option for households to generate clean energy, potentially reducing electricity bills and costs associated with traditional rooftop installations. These systems are becoming increasingly accessible, making it easier for homeowners to participate in the energy transition. As technology improves, balcony plug-in solar panels may become a game-changer for widespread adoption of renewable energy.

articles.title: ‘Greater diversity reshapes expectations’: Women in Energy Storage Network on strengthening and empowering an inclusive industry
articles.summary: The Women in Energy Storage Network (WinES) aims to foster collaboration and leadership among women in the energy storage industry, with a focus on creating an inclusive industry community. WinES strengthens its position by empowering more women leaders in the sector through training programs, networking opportunities, and partnerships. This initiative is part of a broader effort to reshaping the expectations for diversity and inclusion in the energy storage industry.

articles.title: World’s largest solar-plus-storage project completes initial grid synchronization
articles.summary: The MTerra solar project in the Philippines has achieved initial synchronization and energization to the Luzon grid, confirming system readiness and safe connection. The 2.5 GW solar phase is expected to be completed by the end of the month, with the entire 3.5 GW solar and 4.5 GWh battery energy storage system still to be built in phases. The project is set to become the world's largest integrated solar-plus-BESS facility once completed.

articles.title: Chinese Academy of Sciences unveils 101 MW compressor for compressed air energy storage
articles.summary: A 101 MW compressor has been unveiled by the Chinese Academy of Sciences as the world's most powerful single-unit compressed air energy storage system, capable of reaching a maximum discharge pressure of 10.1 MPa and achieving an efficiency of 88.1%. The new compressor more than doubles the single-unit power of existing CAES compressors while reducing unit costs, offering advantages such as high efficiency, high pressure, and a wide operating range. It has passed third-party testing and meets international standards, according to the Chinese Academy of Sciences.

articles.title: Why Xcel’s bid to reinvent the virtual power plant is so controversial
articles.summary: Minnesota utility Xcel Energy's proposed virtual power plant bid is controversial due to its novel approach to building such networks using rooftop solar systems, home batteries, and other energy equipment, which could potentially disrupt the market for traditional renewable energy solutions. The project has raised concerns about the role of private companies in managing public utilities. Xcel's plan also differs from industry norms by proposing a vertically integrated model, where the company would own and operate all components of the virtual power plant itself.

articles.title: A New Space Race—The U.S. Looks to Lunar Nuclear Power
articles.summary: The US is considering nuclear power as a key technology for sustained human presence on the moon, amidst a growing global competition to establish lunar infrastructure. Multiple countries and companies are announcing ambitious lunar programs, from space research to mineral development and even hotels, driving the need for reliable power supply. Nuclear energy could play a crucial role in enabling these initiatives and establishing a permanent human presence on the lunar surface.

articles.title: Wartsila Building Energy Storage in Support of Belgian Grid
articles.summary: Wärtsilä has been selected to deliver a 50-MW/100-MWh battery energy storage system in central-eastern Belgium. The project supports Belgium's transition toward the use of more renewable energy resources. The system will be built by Gramme Storage 1, with Wärtsilä as the primary equipment supplier.

articles.title: Taipingling 1 connected to the grid
articles.summary: Unit 1 of the Taipingling nuclear power plant in Guangdong province has begun supplying electricity to the grid, marking the first time it has connected with the national energy network. The Hualong One reactor is the first of six planned units at the site. China General Nuclear announced the successful commissioning of the unit.

articles.title: Silbat silicon batteries guarantee uninterrupted power supply for 14 days
articles.summary: Silbat silicon batteries can store electricity as latent heat in molten silicon, allowing for an uninterrupted power supply of 14 days, which is a significant advancement in long-duration energy storage technology. The Spanish startup's battery technology uses low-cost, widely available metallic-grade silicon to achieve this goal, making it a promising solution for critical military infrastructures. The ARMIC project aims to support resilient and self-sufficient energy supply for up to three years, with the goal of achieving competitive energy storage capabilities.

articles.title: Plus Power brings ‘largest BESS on ISO New England grid’ online, in Maine
articles.summary: Plus Power's 175MW/350MWh Cross Town Energy Storage facility has been brought online on the ISO New England grid in Maine, making it "the largest BESS" (battery energy storage system) on the regional grid. The facility will provide energy storage and stabilizing services to help manage renewable energy output.

articles.title: Methanol-to-Hydrogen Partnership Powers Off-Grid Data Centers in Taiwan
articles.summary: Oregon-based Element 1 Corp. and Taiwan's Aurosi Precision Co., Ltd. have partnered to deploy up to 2 MW of methanol-to-hydrogen driven PEM fuel cell solutions in an off-grid data center project in Taiwan, aiming to provide clean and reliable energy for high-demand server farms. The partnership leverages Element 1's compact reformers and Aurosi's manufacturing expertise to harness methanol into on-demand hydrogen, powering PEM fuel cells for zero-emission electricity. The project addresses the strain on Taiwan's data centers, sustainability deadlines, and grid limitations, offering a reliable and elegant solution for clean energy production.

articles.title: Hydrostor signs California offtake deal for 4 GWh compressed air storage
articles.summary: Hydrostor has signed a 50 MW/400 MWh offtake agreement with California Community Power for its Willow Rock Energy Storage Center, providing firm capacity to six community choice aggregator members. The project is an advanced compressed air energy storage facility designed to deliver eight hours of continuous discharge to the grid. It will support reliable long-duration energy storage in California using domestic content and minimal resources.

articles.title: Hallett battery project reaches financial close in Australia
articles.summary: EnergyAustralia's 50 MW/245 MWh Stage 1 Hallett battery energy storage system has reached financial close, is set to be completed by mid-2027, and will eventually expand in a Stage 2 phase. The project is co-located with a gas-fired power station 210 km north of Adelaide and utilizes existing infrastructure. The expansion will provide five hours of storage and support local jobs while strengthening South Australia's power system.

articles.title: Queensland’s Stanwell opens 600MWh battery storage system in Australia
articles.summary: Stanwell Corporation's 300MW/600MWh Tarong battery energy storage system began commercial operations in Queensland, providing a new level of grid stability and renewable energy support. The 300MW facility is one of the largest in Australia. Commercial operation marks the completion of a significant project for the state-owned energy company.

articles.title: New algorithm reduces solar module temperature during clipping, curtailment
articles.summary: UNSW researchers have developed a thermal-aware tracking algorithm that reduces solar module temperatures by up to 7.7°C during clipping and curtailment periods, slowing degradation without lowering AC output, while also reducing cumulative UV exposure. The strategy was tested in Chile's Atacama Desert and found to improve durability without compromising AC output.

articles.title: PowerBank posts $22.3 million in H2 2025 revenue amid space solar AI push
articles.summary: PowerBank Corp. reported $22.3 million in revenue for the second half of 2025, up from $19.2 million last year, with gross profit reaching $8.1 million and a narrowed net loss to $6.7 million. The company secured new credit facilities totaling $8 million to expand its project pipeline, including grid interconnection deposits and equipment procurement. This is part of a larger push into space solar AI computing initiatives.

articles.title: Vietnam’s BESS breakthrough: A turning point for energy storage across ASEAN
articles.summary: Vietnam has achieved a breakthrough with its Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) technology, marking a turning point for energy storage across the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN). The country is overcoming challenges to deploy BESS solutions, setting an example for other ASEAN countries to follow. This development is expected to have significant implications for the region's transition to renewable energy sources.

articles.title: New Jersey’s Balancing Act: Cut Utility Bills Without Derailing Clean Energy
articles.summary: Governor Mikie Sherrill is exploring ways to reduce utility bills for New Jersey residents without hindering the state's clean energy progress, potentially tapping into clean-energy funds to provide financial support. The goal is to balance the need for affordable electricity with the push for renewable energy sources. Sherrill signed two executive orders during her inaugural speech in January, including one related to this effort.

articles.title: India’s blueprint for sustainable solar success
articles.summary: India's renewable energy transition has progressed significantly, with its solar installed capacity growing from less than 3 GW in 2014 to over 130 GW in 2023. India is now focusing on long-term reliability and durability in its solar energy projects, adopting efficient and integrated approaches to deploy renewable energy. The country aims to make the most of its existing megawatts by implementing intelligent use cases, driven by advances in technology such as high-performance solar panels and artificial intelligence-based monitoring.

articles.title: Imagine if Tesla’s 100-GW solar factory gets built
articles.summary: A 100-GW solar cell factory in the US could stimulate demand for upstream components and serve as a hub for module assembly, potentially re-establishing the country as a technology leader. The factory's production capacity would be comparable to that of existing global giants like China, Japan, and South Korea. If built, such a facility would significantly impact the global solar industry landscape.

articles.title: Michigan Tries a New Legal Tactic Against Big Oil, Alleging Antitrust Violations Aimed at Hobbling EVs and Renewable Energy
articles.summary: Michigan has brought a lawsuit against major oil and gas companies alleging antitrust violations that aim to hobble the growth of electric vehicles and renewable energy, joining nearly a dozen other states in taking on ExxonMobil and its peers. The suit claims Big Oil is driving up energy costs by colluding to suppress competition from cleaner technologies. This approach differs from similar lawsuits brought by other states, which focus on deception or misrepresentation regarding climate change risks.

articles.title: New Energy Storage Solutions Are Killing Trump’s Coal Power Fantasy
articles.summary: The White House is leaning on coal power to support its plans, which is counteracted by new energy storage solutions. New energy storage technologies are effectively rendering Trump's reliance on coal power obsolete and unsustainable in the long term. This shift marks a significant blow to the administration's pro-coal agenda.

articles.title: VE Motion electric trailer axles cut truckers’ diesel fuel bills in HALF
articles.summary: VE Motion's electric trailer axles can cut truckers' diesel fuel bills in half, offering fleets a low-cost path to electrification. The battery-powered system allows for up to 50% reduction in fuel use, making it an attractive option for heavy trucks. This technology is available commercially and aims to facilitate the transition to more sustainable transportation methods.

articles.title: Feds greenlight $2B pumped storage project on Yakama Nation sacred site
articles.summary: The US federal government has approved a $2 billion pumped storage hydroelectric project on a 4,300-acre site within the Yakama Nation's traditional territory in Washington state. The project is located on a sacred site and faced ongoing legal challenges from the nation.

articles.title: Ameren Missouri Secures Approval to Develop Hybrid Energy Facility, Big Hollow Energy Center
articles.summary: Ameren Missouri has secured approval to build a hybrid energy facility, the Big Hollow Energy Center, which will combine an 800 MW simple-cycle natural gas power plant with a large-scale battery storage facility at a single site in Jefferson County, Missouri. The project's total capacity is not specified beyond its combined output.

articles.title: China Floating Turbine Passes Testing & Completes A Grid-Connected Flight
articles.summary: A Chinese airborne wind energy system called SAWES has completed a grid-connected test flight, marking an important milestone in the development of a floating turbine. The system, operated by Beijing Lanyi Yunchuan Energy Technology Co., successfully passed testing and confirmed its ability to connect to a power grid. This achievement follows previous tests conducted five months prior.

articles.title: Philippines to auction 25 GW of renewables by 2035
articles.summary: The Philippines plans to auction an additional 25 GW of renewable energy capacity by 2035 through its flagship green energy auction program. The country has also announced plans for four upcoming auctions, including one focused on rooftop solar in Visayas and Mindanao, another on solar on canals, agrisolar, and solar on stilts over fish ponds. This will be the fourth round of GEA-6, which was set to launch in the first quarter of this year.

articles.title: GENIUS: adding solar panels to semi trailers is an idea so obvious it hurts
articles.summary: Adding solar panels to semi-trailers is a simple solution to reduce emissions from refrigerated trailers, which currently rely on polluting diesel gensets. The idea involves mounting rooftop solar panels on the trailer's roof, allowing it to generate electricity and power its cooling systems while reducing reliance on fossil fuels. This concept could be a game-changer for the logistics industry in terms of environmental sustainability.

articles.title: EPA no longer considers greenhouse gases a pollutant
articles.summary: The Environmental Protection Agency has rescinded its 2009 ruling that established greenhouse gases as a threat to public health, citing them as "illegal." The decision reverses landmark environmental laws made by the Obama and Biden administrations aimed at reducing carbon emissions. Greenhouse gases are no longer considered pollutants under the Clean Air Act.

articles.title: Risen Energy adds full liquid cooling to 131 kW/261 kWh C&I storage unit
articles.summary: Risen Energy's new 131 kW/261 kWh C&I storage unit features silicon carbide and full liquid cooling, improving efficiency by 40% through the use of SiC MOSFETs. The unit also boasts a system round-trip efficiency of 90%. This upgrade positions the product as a higher-efficiency option for behind-the-meter applications in commercial and industrial settings.

articles.title: Google secures 1 GW solar deal as Texas data‑center load surges
articles.summary: Google secures 2 long-term power purchase agreements totaling 1 gigawatt of solar capacity, powering its expanding Texas data centers for approximately 15 years. The deal, worth about 28 terawatt-hours of electricity, is part of a surge in demand from the company's growing Texas presence. This massive solar deal is expected to reduce Google's carbon footprint in the region.

articles.title: Tesla announces Powerwall 3P with native three-phase inverter
articles.summary: Tesla has announced the Powerwall 3P, a single unit with native three-phase inverter for whole-home backup on European grids. The new product eliminates the need for separate units and allows homeowners to sign up now through Tesla's website. This innovation aims to simplify the setup process for customers in Germany and potentially other European markets.

articles.title: 175 MW Energy Storage Project Launched In Maine
articles.summary: A 175 MW energy storage project has been launched in Maine, marking a significant step towards reducing the country's reliance on aging coal power plants and addressing climate change concerns. The project aims to utilize renewable energy sources while minimizing environmental harm caused by traditional energy practices. This initiative is part of a growing trend towards clean energy solutions in the US.

articles.title: California power aggregators sign on for 50-MW slice of compressed-air long-duration energy storage
articles.summary: Hydrostor has signed a 50-MW offtake agreement with California Community Power (CC Power) for its Willow Rock Energy Storage Center, an advanced compressed air energy storage project that can store energy for eight hours. The 500-MW/4,000-MWh project will provide reliable capacity to the six community choice aggregators. This is part of a larger deal involving multiple community choice aggregators in California.

articles.title: Plus Power Adds Major Energy Storage Project to ISO New England Grid
articles.summary: Plus Power, a Texas-headquartered energy company with installations in over 20 states, has brought an 175-MW/350-MWh battery energy storage project online in Maine. The Cross Town Energy Storage facility is now the largest of its kind in New England, marking a significant addition to the ISO New England grid. This major energy storage project aims to enhance energy reliability and stability in the region.

articles.title: Treasury issues FEOC guidance for energy project developers and domestic manufacturers
articles.summary: The US Department of the Treasury and IRS have issued guidance to energy project developers and domestic manufacturers on determining whether components they use are receiving material assistance from a prohibited foreign entity, which could make them ineligible for certain tax credits. The guidance aims to help developers and manufacturers identify potential Foreign Entity of Concern (FEOC) clauses in contracts or agreements. This is part of the US government's efforts to prevent the exploitation of domestic industries by foreign entities through unfair trade practices.

articles.title: Data centers pursue on-site power as affordability tops utility concerns: BofA
articles.summary: Data centers are prioritizing on-site power generation due to increasing costs associated with utility bills, with analysts suggesting that securing a stable and affordable source of power is essential. Hyperscalers aim to generate energy from solar panels as the lowest-cost marginal energy option after initial infrastructure setup. This shift reflects growing concerns about affordability over relying solely on utilities for data center power needs.

articles.title: Xcel Energy Secures Approval for Mankato–Mississippi River Transmission Project from Minnesota Public Utilities Commission
articles.summary: Xcel Energy has secured approval for the Mankato–Mississippi River Transmission Project from the Minnesota Public Utilities Commission, which involves developing a 345 kV transmission line and an associated 161 kV system. The project aims to deliver reliable electricity to Minnesota residents and businesses. The development is a collaboration with Dairyland Power Cooperative, Rochester Public Utilities, and Southern Minnesota Municipal Power Agency.

articles.title: 300-MW Ameren fast-track project hits snag on DOE transmission funding uncertainty
articles.summary: Ameren Missouri's 300-MW fast-track energy project faces uncertainty due to transmission funding from the US Department of Energy, which has yet to confirm support. The projects in question are 345-kV lines in the Great Plains region. Ameren Missouri is struggling with interconnection costs as a result.

articles.title: TRISO-X Secures First-Ever NRC Category II License for Commercial Advanced Nuclear Fuel Fabrication
articles.summary: TRISO-X, a subsidiary of X-energy, has secured the first-ever NRC Category II license for commercial advanced nuclear fuel fabrication in the US. The license allows TRISO-X to fabricate high-assay low-enriched tristructural isotropic (TRISO) fuel. This approval marks a milestone for the US nuclear fuel cycle, with construction of TRISO-X's TX-1 fuel fabrication facility expected to begin later this year.

articles.title: Private 660 MWh solar-storage project closes financing in South Africa
articles.summary: SOLA Group has reached financial close on its 300 MW solar PV facility with 660 MWh of battery storage, the largest privately contracted hybrid renewable energy project in South Africa. The project will provide power to industrial customers through 25-year power purchase agreements with Sasol and Air Liquide. Commercial operation is targeted for the first half of 2028, after construction is currently underway.

articles.title: EnergyAustralia reaches financial close on 250MWh BESS in South Australia
articles.summary: EnergyAustralia has reached financial close on a 250MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) at the Hallett site in South Australia. This is one of the largest BESS projects to reach financial closure, with EnergyAustralia likely to deploy the facility in the near future. The project marks an important milestone for the energy company's plans for renewable energy integration.

articles.title: Colo. Bill Would Require Renewable Energy for New Data Centers
articles.summary: Colorado lawmakers have introduced a bill requiring new data centers to generate or buy 100% of their annual electricity consumption from renewable sources by 2031, with hourly matching requirements. The bill also bans utilities from offering economic development rates and requires upfront payments for connection fees. Backed by environmental groups, the bill aims to promote clean energy and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the state's data center sector.

articles.title: DOE Details 26 Genesis Mission AI Challenges, Targeting Nuclear Timelines, Grid Planning, and Energy Systems
articles.summary: The Department of Energy has released 26 AI challenges under the Genesis Mission, targeting nuclear plant deployment timelines, grid planning and energy systems. Several challenges directly address issues like data center load integration and fusion commercialization. These challenges aim to reshape how power plants are designed, licensed, built, and operated using artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Exclusive $1,500 off Gendome Home3000 power station at new $799 low, NIU KQi 300X all-terrain e-scooter $727 low, EcoFlow, more
articles.summary: The Gendome Home3000 Portable Power Station is available for $799 with a $1,500 discount, making it priced at $799. The NIU KQi 300X All-Terrain e-scooter is on sale for $727, while EcoFlow's DELTA 3 Classic power station and solar bundle are discounted during a 24-hour flash sale starting from $399.

articles.title: Cuba Sets Solar Power Record, Surpassing 900 MW of Photovoltaic Generation
articles.summary: Cuba generated over 800 MW of photovoltaic power during a midday period, surpassing the 900 MW mark, following the installation of over 1,000 MW of solar energy capacity in 2025. The achievement is attributed to the expansion of Cuba's renewable energy infrastructure. This milestone marks a significant step forward for the country in its transition to cleaner and more sustainable energy sources.

articles.title: Nuclear Power Group Alva Energy Launches with $33 Million in Funding
articles.summary: Alva Energy, a Massachusetts-based nuclear energy company, has received $33 million in funding to scale its technology and support new electric power generation capacity from the existing US reactor fleet. The company aims to launch with this funding round as it begins operations. Alva Energy launched on February 12.

articles.title: Commerce releases final AD/CVD amounts in battery anode case
articles.summary: The US Department of Commerce has finalized antidumping (AD) and countervailing duty (CVD) rates for active anode material imports from China, with final AD rates remaining the same as preliminary decisions. General CVD rates have increased, while specific exporters including Tesla and Panasonic will face higher tariffs. The final determinations aim to protect domestic producers of battery anode materials.

articles.title: World’s first 628 Ah grid-scale battery enters operation
articles.summary: A 200 MW/400 MWh battery energy storage project in China has entered operation, marking the world's first utility-scale deployment of 628 Ah lithium iron phosphate (LFP) cells. EVE Energy, a Chinese company, began mass-producing these large-capacity cells in December 2024 and is now the first manufacturer to exceed 600 Ah for stationary storage. The project features 80 Mr. Giant energy storage systems and 40 integrated converter cabins.

articles.title: IEC-based technical specifications needed for second-life PV module market
articles.summary: Second-life PV modules can reduce waste and extend solar asset value, but their market is underdeveloped due to lack of technical qualifications, scalable reuse infrastructure, and supportive policy frameworks. The industry needs harmonized qualification criteria, standardized testing protocols, and repair guidelines to scale up the market. IEC-based technical specifications are recommended to improve safety and requalification of reused modules.

articles.title: Monitoring made inverters more essential to solar project performance
articles.summary: Major solar inverter manufacturers now offer granular monitoring measures to detect even slight dips in energy production, making them an essential component of a solar project's performance. These advancements enable real-time tracking of energy loads, reducing the likelihood of unexpected power bills due to system malfunctions. Improved monitoring has made solar inverters more critical to ensuring optimal solar array performance.

articles.title: Plus Power brings online 350-MWh Cross Town BESS in Maine
articles.summary: Plus Power has brought online a two-hour 175-MW energy storage facility, the largest of its kind on the ISO New England grid, delivering cost savings and reliable power to Maine. The Cross Town Energy Storage facility is a battery energy storage system (BESS) with a capacity of 350 MWh. It is the largest energy storage project in New England.

articles.title: Potentia achieves financial close for ‘Canada’s largest BESS’
articles.summary: Potentia Renewables has achieved financial close for the Skyview 2 battery energy storage system (BESS) in Edwardsburgh Cardinal, Ontario, Canada, marking it as 'Canada's largest BESS'. Details of the transaction were not disclosed. The project is expected to support renewable energy grid stability and reliability.

articles.title: Yuma County, Arizona: BrightNight breaks ground on 1,200MWh solar-plus-storage project, LRE’s 450MWh BESS now operational
articles.summary: BrightNight has broken ground on a 1,200MWh solar-plus-storage project, while Leeward Renewable Energy's 450MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) in Yuma County, Arizona, is now operational. Both projects represent notable advancements in the state's renewable energy landscape. The total capacity of these two projects combined exceeds 1,650MWh.

articles.title: Hanwha and Morrison’s Chrysalis partner for 3.5GW of solar and storage in North America
articles.summary: A $30 billion US infrastructure company, Hanwha, and Morrison's Chrysalis have partnered for 3.5GW of solar and energy storage projects in North America. The partnership aims to support the growth of renewable energy sources in the region.

articles.title: Long-duration storage as an antidote to grid congestion, renewables curtailment
articles.summary: RenewaFLEXNL, a 3-year Dutch initiative, aims to accelerate long-duration energy storage (8-100h) to reduce grid congestion and better integrate renewable energy. The project includes testing and integrating storage solutions that can hold renewable energy for hours or days, with expected outcomes including a national deployment strategy and regulatory guidance. The goal is to support faster solar-plus-storage adoption in the Netherlands and serve as a model for other EU countries.

articles.title: Baltic BESS and TES: Estonia’s 1.1GWh district heating accumulator, Nidec PCS-transformer deal in Lithuania
articles.summary: Estonia is home to a 1.1GWh district heating accumulator called the Baltic BESS (battery energy storage system), while Lithuania has seen a deal between Nidec PCS and an unspecified partner involving a gigawatt-hour-scale thermal energy storage system and a transformer. These developments are part of the growing energy storage industry in the Baltic region, north-eastern Europe.

articles.title: High-voltage DC design targets AI data center costs
articles.summary: An 800V direct current architecture can cut capital costs by $5.8 million for a typical 10 MW AI data center, reduce copper use, and improve efficiency compared to conventional alternating current systems. The design eliminates expensive UPS and PDU systems, leading to annual operational expenses dropping by approximately $711,000. This new approach is necessary due to the rapid growth of artificial intelligence requiring up to 100 kW per rack in modern training clusters.

articles.title: A new Ohio bill could be a de facto statewide ban on solar and wind
articles.summary: A new Ohio bill could make it difficult for solar and wind energy projects to be approved if they can't demonstrate a "justifiable need" or meet certain environmental standards, effectively creating a de facto statewide ban on these renewable energy sources. The state already has stricter regulations than the federal government, but this proposed bill would further limit their development. This legislation is part of a trend of states imposing more stringent restrictions on solar and wind projects nationwide.

articles.title: The AI power crunch sparks a 1.5 GWh sodium-ion battery deal
articles.summary: Energy Vault and Peak Energy have signed an agreement to build a sodium-ion battery platform for "AI-first" data center operators, addressing the growing power crunch sparked by AI's increasing energy demands, with the project expected to utilize 1.5 GWh of batteries. The partnership aims to create a custom-designed battery system tailored to meet the specific needs of AI-focused data centers.

articles.title: Work begins on Georgia’s first utility-scale solar plant for on-site consumption
articles.summary: The First Light project in Georgia is the first industrial-scale solar power plant built entirely for self-consumption in the South Caucasus region. The 24 MW solar plant will produce over 38 GWh of energy annually, all of which will be directly consumed on-site by its client. Construction is expected to take less than five months and will provide stable long-term costs, reduced dependence on external supply, and Scope-2 emissions reduction for its client.

articles.title: NineDot Energy closes US$431 million for New York BESS, Ameresco completes multiple tax credit transfers
articles.summary: NineDot Energy has secured $431 million in construction financing for its New York Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) projects, while US company Ameresco completed various tax credit transfers and financing transactions for solar PV and BESS.

articles.title: Varta unveils residential battery with AI-driven energy management
articles.summary: Varta has unveiled a residential battery with AI-driven energy management capabilities, featuring its proprietary "Varta.iq" software that detects consumption anomalies and integrates dynamic electricity tariffs. The Varta.wall BM2 is a modular solution with scalable capacity from 9 kWh to 13.5 kWh, and charging power depends on the number of modules installed. The system also enables bidirectional charging applications in its "Pro" version.

articles.title: Ore Energy pilots 100-hour iron-air BESS at EDF lab in France
articles.summary: Ore Energy successfully piloted a 100-hour iron-air battery energy storage system (BESS) at the EDF lab in France, marking a significant milestone for the Netherlands-based startup. The pilot test demonstrated the feasibility of long-duration iron-air LDES systems for grid-scale applications. The project aims to further develop and commercialize Ore Energy's innovative technology.

articles.title: Energy Vault secures 1.5 GWh sodium-ion supply for AI
articles.summary: Energy Vault has secured 1.5 GWh of sodium-ion battery supply from Peak Energy to co-develop an integrated storage system for AI-focused data centers, with the aim of addressing the unique power demands of AI training and inference.
