The platform will utilize Peak Energy's sodium-ion batteries paired with Energy Vault's system design and Vault OS software.

articles.title: Australia grid constraints push data centers to regions
articles.summary: Grid capacity constraints in major Australian metropolitan hubs are prompting data center developers to consider regional locations with integrated on-site gas and solar generation. The growing demand for electricity from data centers is outpacing local networks' ability to accommodate it, leading to grid congestion and high connection lead times. As a result, 78 new data center projects are currently in development across the country, with 178 already operating.

articles.title: Clean energy’s next breakthrough is trust What the solar industry can learn from the aftermath of the Great Depression.
articles.summary: The solar industry's next breakthrough is building trust, which can be learned from the aftermath of the Great Depression where speculation and greed led to a market crash. A similar collapse in the renewable energy sector could occur if investors lose faith in clean energy technology. Establishing credibility and reliability is key to unlocking further growth and adoption in the industry.

articles.title: Planning for AI’s next wave: distributed inference and the future of grid reliability
articles.summary: AI-driven electricity demand is expected to increase, impacting grid reliability, and distributed inference will play a key role in addressing this challenge, potentially enhancing grid resilience. The future impact on the grid is not predetermined, but rather depends on how it's managed. The use of distributed inference could improve grid reliability.

articles.title: Rolls-Royce Launches Hydrogen-Ready Modular Gas Engine Power Plants
articles.summary: Rolls-Royce launches a new modular solution for gas engine power plants that are hydrogen-ready, aiming to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The company's modular design is expected to make it easier and more efficient to transition to hydrogen fuel in existing gas-fired power generation systems. This development is part of the company's efforts to support the UK's goal of net-zero carbon emissions by 2050.

articles.title: What Energy Secretary Wright gets wrong about the grid
articles.summary: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright stated that the power grid did not collapse during Winter Storm Fern, but some aspects of his claims are disputed by experts and data suggests otherwise. The US Energy Information Administration reported a peak demand of 77.3 GW on January 24, 2022, indicating widespread strain on the grid. Wright's assessment of the storm's impact on the grid is being questioned due to discrepancies between his statements and available information.

articles.title: Wanxiang A123 launches immersion-cooled semi-solid-state energy storage solutions
articles.summary: Wanxiang A123 Systems Corp. has launched semi-solid-state battery cells and energy storage solutions with robust thermal safety and strong economic performance, achieved through the integration of semi-solid-state battery technology with immersion cooling. The new products demonstrate fundamental stability in various tests, including a 10-needle puncture test where a 100Ah cell remained stable without fire or explosion. Immersion cooling maintains cell temperature variance within 2°C, providing dual-layer protection against thermal runaway and ensuring reliable operation in extreme environments.

articles.title: Samsung SDI partners with Korea East-West Power to develop ‘global’ BESS projects
articles.summary: Samsung SDI has partnered with Korea East-West Power to develop 'global' Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) projects, investing in both energy storage systems and renewable energy initiatives. The partnership is expected to drive growth in the energy storage sector globally. No specific details on investment or project scope are mentioned in the article.

articles.title: Battery Storage Comes of Age: From Grid Accessory to Essential Infrastructure
articles.summary: Battery storage is transforming grid design with plummeting costs, enabling utility-scale batteries to deliver solar power around the clock at competitive prices. The industry faces unprecedented challenges and policy upheaval, standing at a pivotal crossroads between accessibility and essential infrastructure status. Regulatory changes will determine whether battery storage is fully integrated into grid systems.

articles.title: Sunraycer to install 503 MWh of energy storage in Texas
articles.summary: Clean energy project developer Sunraycer has signed an agreement for two standalone battery energy storage projects totaling 503 MWh in Franklin County, Texas. The projects will use BESS from Canadian Solar business e-STORAGE and are expected to begin construction in Q1 2027.

articles.title: Shared Power: Building Data Centers That Serve Everyone
articles.summary: The explosion in AI services and cloud computing is driving economic growth, but it's also putting a strain on the power grid, with 92% of U.S. GDP growth attributed to this technological revolution as of 2025. Rising demand for data centers is creating a "shared power" problem, where multiple stakeholders - including tech companies, governments, and consumers - share the cost and burden of powering these facilities. This has led to mounting reliability concerns and a growing need for innovative solutions that balance competing interests.

articles.title: New Gas-Fired Plants Bring Needed Generation, Flexibility to the Power Sector
articles.summary: Several natural gas-fired units are being developed to support the industrial sector, including data centers, and to integrate more renewable energy into the grid. These new plants bring needed generation and flexibility to the power sector, addressing growing energy demands. They also provide a bridge between intermittent renewables and baseload electricity needs.

articles.title: Greece to auction up to 200 MW of solar plus storage
articles.summary: Greece's energy regulator has launched two auctions under the Apollo Program, covering up to 200 MW of solar plus storage and a separate 400 MW wind tender, marking the scheme's first operational rollout since becoming law in 2024. The government has set maximum bid prices for solar plus storage projects at €80/MWh and for wind projects at €75/MWh. Applications and bids must be submitted by March 16.

articles.title: Deye releases new off-grid inverter series
articles.summary: Deye's new off-grid inverter series, OG02, features IP-65-rated inverters with an AC output power of 3 kW to 6 kW, boasting maximum efficiencies of 97.6% and 96.5%. The new products allow for fast switching between grid and battery power within 4 ms, minimizing system interruptions. The OG02 series is designed to operate in a wide range of temperatures and altitudes, with a five-year factory warranty.

articles.title: FlexGen begins operating 700MWh total BESS in Wisconsin, Iowa for Alliant Energy
articles.summary: FlexGen has commissioned a total of 700MWh battery energy storage systems (BESS) in Wisconsin and Iowa for Alliant Energy. The projects mark the company's first utility-scale BESS deployments. FlexGen is a software-focused BESS integrator.

articles.title: Solar, wind PPA prices continue to fall in Europe
articles.summary: Solar and wind power purchase agreement (PPA) prices in Europe continued to fall in the fourth quarter of 2025, with Spain seeing the lowest PPA price at €30 ($35.65)/MWh, reflecting strong downward pressure due to an imbalance between renewable supply and electricity demand growth. The European solar PPA market saw a year-on-year decline of nearly 8%, while wind power prices also fell by 3%. The Grids Package initiative by the European Commission is driving this transition towards more mature projects and reinforcing trends in Germany, Italy, and the Nordic countries.

articles.title: The growing need for long-duration energy storage in the US
articles.summary: Long-duration energy storage (LDES) is becoming increasingly important for the US electrical grid due to growing demand, as traditional energy storage solutions are not sufficient to meet peak energy needs. The National Renewable Energy Laboratory predicts that LDES will play a critical role in enabling widespread adoption of renewable energy sources. Increasing investment and innovation are necessary to develop and deploy more efficient and cost-effective LDES technologies.

articles.title: Oregon awards $12 million to 24 projects in community renewable energy grant program
articles.summary: The Oregon Department of Energy has awarded nearly $12 million to 24 recipients through its Community Renewable Energy Grant Program, supporting the planning and construction of renewable energy projects for various organizations. The program received 76 applications requesting over $46 million in funding. This is the fourth round of the grant program, which aims to promote community-driven renewable energy projects.

articles.title: Canada adds only 57 MW of utility-scale solar in 2025
articles.summary: Canada's cumulative solar capacity is expected to surge from 5.4 GW to around 21 GW by 2035, driven by a healthy procurement pipeline across most provinces. In 2025, only 57 MW of utility-scale solar was deployed in Canada, according to the Canadian Renewable Energy Association. Behind-the-meter solar installations are expected to be a leading market segment for Canada's solar growth, with many commercial and industrial projects underway.

articles.title: Ore Energy completes 100-hour iron-air storage system for EDF in France
articles.summary: Ore Energy has successfully completed a 100-hour iron-air long-duration energy storage system for EDF in France, demonstrating the ability to deliver multi-day energy storage under real-world utility conditions. The pilot, funded by the European Union's StoRIES programme, tested the system's charge-discharge behavior, responsiveness, and compatibility with standard grid management practices over several months. The project is described as the first of its kind in Europe, showcasing the potential of iron-air LDES technology for addressing multi-day renewable energy balancing needs across Europe.

articles.title: Hoymiles releases all-in-one residential inverter and modular battery
articles.summary: Hoymiles' HiOne all-in-one residential inverter and modular battery system supports up to 64 kWh of storage, multiple PV inputs, and 0 ms backup switching for uninterrupted operation. The system combines an inverter, batteries, and energy management system in a single enclosure with advanced AI-based time-of-use functionality, maximizing self-consumption and bill savings. HiOne's maximum efficiency reaches 98.5% and the battery is rated for 8,000 cycles.

articles.title: France sees growing case for residential solar battery leasing
articles.summary: Residential solar battery leasing is gaining traction in Europe as a cost-effective alternative to buying storage systems, offering households with rooftop solar the ability to increase self-consumption without significant upfront costs. Home batteries remain an expensive investment, with prices ranging from €5,000 ($5,950) for a 5 kWh system. Leasing allows individuals to test and evaluate battery solutions over time before committing to a purchase.

articles.title: Revera Energy secures US$150 million to support 3.4GWh of battery storage across Australia and the UK
articles.summary: Revera Energy secures a $150 million credit facility to support the development and construction of its energy projects, including 3.4GWh of battery storage in Australia and the UK. The funding will accelerate the growth of its project pipeline in both countries. The company aims to expand its presence in the renewable energy sector with this investment.

articles.title: Australia: Victoria government accelerates 700MW of battery storage via Development Facilitation Program
articles.summary: The Victoria government has approved two large-scale battery energy storage system (BESS) projects, totaling 700MW, to accelerate the development of renewable energy in Australia. The projects were selected under the state's Development Facilitation Program (DFP), designed to support large-scale projects that contribute to the state's renewable energy goals.

articles.title: Tech Companies Need a Hedge Against Worrisome Grid Politics
articles.summary: Tech companies are investing heavily in generation assets to hedge against potential risks, including data center moratoriums and AI restrictions due to changing energy policy. Major companies like Microsoft, Google, and Amazon have announced significant investments in nuclear power projects. This move aims to ensure a stable energy supply for their operations amidst growing bipartisan political uncertainty.

articles.title: Powering Tomorrow: A Multi-Technology Roadmap for the Global Energy Transition
articles.summary: Global electricity demand is projected to surge 40% by 2035, driven by worsening warming projections, and the global energy landscape must undergo a significant transformation. A multi-technology roadmap is needed to advance nuclear, geothermal, gas, offshore wind, storage, and fusion, along with workforce development. Decarbonization of the energy sector is imperative to address climate change.

articles.title: Hithium completes open-door fire test of 6.25 MWh battery system
articles.summary: Hithium has completed a large-scale fire safety test of its 6.25 MWh battery energy storage system, with an open-door configuration supervised by UL Solutions to assess thermal runaway risk in 1175 Ah cells under maximum oxygen conditions. The testing was executed in compliance with upcoming requirements and aimed to create a higher combustion intensity than standard closed-enclosure tests. The results aim to provide valuable data for the company's long-duration energy storage system.

articles.title: TotalEnergies signs 1 GW of solar PPAs for Google’s Texas data centers
articles.summary: TotalEnergies has signed two 15-year power purchase agreements with Google, totaling 1 GW of new solar capacity for data centers in Texas. The agreements cover the 805 MW Wichita and 195 MW Mustang Creek projects, both set for construction this year. These deals will produce around 28 TWh of energy over their duration.

articles.title: The business case for C&I storage
articles.summary: European businesses installed 20 GW of commercial and industrial solar in 2024, but only 1 GW/2 GWh of C&I battery storage, highlighting a significant gap between the two technologies. Batteries offer lower energy bills, improved resilience, and decarbonization, but their active asset nature and dependence on tariff structures make it difficult for decision-makers to grasp their value proposition. The lack of effective communication about the benefits of batteries in terms that resonate with customers' challenges will persist until this gap is addressed.

articles.title: Australian state awards 12 GWh of long-duration storage contracts
articles.summary: New South Wales has awarded long-term energy service agreements to six battery energy storage projects totaling 1.17 GW and nearly 12 GWh, increasing the state's contracted storage capacity to 30 GWh, meeting its Minimum Objective of delivering 2 GW by 2030. The largest project is Neoen Australia's 330 MW/3,500 MWh Great Western Battery in Wallerawang, with a nominal storage duration of 10.6 hours.

articles.title: AI’s power surge: 5 ways AI could make the grid more reliable, efficient and flexible
articles.summary: AI has the potential to make the grid more reliable by optimizing energy distribution and predicting power outages. It can also improve efficiency by analyzing energy usage patterns and making data-driven decisions. Additionally, AI-powered systems can enhance flexibility by adapting to changes in energy demand and supply in real-time.

articles.title: EVE Energy to deploy 628Ah battery cells in solar-plus-storage system at Kuala Lumpur International Airport
articles.summary: EVE Energy is deploying a 36MWh solar-plus-storage system with 628Ah battery cells at Kuala Lumpur International Airport. The system will provide energy storage capabilities for the airport. EVE Energy has secured a contract from the Malaysian government to implement the project.

articles.title: KKR commits AU$603 million to HMC Capital’s 5.7GW Australian energy storage and wind pipeline
articles.summary: KKR commits up to AU$603 million to HMC Capital's Energy Transition Platform in support of Australia's growing renewable energy and wind pipeline, valued at 5.7GW, aimed at accelerating the country's energy storage and grid modernization efforts.

articles.title: Australia’s largest operational BESS: Synergy completes CATL-powered 2,400MWh Collie Battery
articles.summary: Synergy has completed a 500MW/2,400MWh battery energy storage system at its Collie site in Western Australia. The project is powered by Chinese technology firm CATL and makes the Collie Battery Australia's largest operational BESS. The facility will provide energy stability for the Australian grid.

articles.title: Italy Enacts EU RED III Green Hydrogen Mandates for Transport and Industry
articles.summary: Italy has enacted EU RED III green hydrogen mandates for transport and industry, requiring electrolytic hydrogen production from renewable sources, with minimum quotas set for buses, heavy trucks, trains, steel mills, refineries, and chemical plants by 2030. The law also sets a target for Renewable Fuels of Non-Biological Origin (RFNBOs) in transport to reach 1% by the same year. Green hydrogen is now expected to become a mainstream energy source in Italy's efforts towards net-zero emissions.

articles.title: ARENA Grants AUD 21 M to Pilbara Green Hydrogen Hub
articles.summary: The Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA) has awarded InterContinental Energy (ICE) AUD 21 million to support the development of a 26 GW renewable energy hub in Western Australia's Pilbara, with first power expected by 2030. The grant will be used for front-end engineering design, partner integration, and regulatory studies to reach a final investment decision (FID) by 2028. The project aims to create green hydrogen production and integrate large-scale renewable energy into the region, leveraging its ideal solar irradiance and coastal winds.

articles.title: Disconnected data is draining your solar portfolio
articles.summary: Manual reporting, scattered systems, and month-end chaos are eroding margins across clean energy portfolios due to the lack of automation and integration in data management. Incentives have receded, financing has tightened, and projects are taking longer to reach commissioning, making it crucial for asset managers and O&M providers to prioritize profitability. Automated, integrated reporting can help put profitability back where it belongs by streamlining data management processes.

articles.title: Conservative renewables group’s poll finds most Virginia voters support solar
articles.summary: Most Virginia voters support solar development in the state, with nearly 50% of respondents favoring it across multiple survey categories. Energy Right's poll of 861 likely voters found that 50% or more agreed on the topic of energy affordability and solutions to stabilizing prices through solar PV. The results show a significant level of support for solar among Virginia voters.

articles.title: REC Solar building 3.3-MW solar project on California cold storage facility
articles.summary: REC Solar has contracted Arctic Cold to install a 3.3-MW rooftop solar system at its new location in Santa Maria, California, to offset energy costs. The solar system will be ballasted-mounted and is part of the company's efforts to reduce its environmental impact. The project aims to power the facility that provides cold storage for fresh and frozen fruits distributed to regional food service providers and big-box retailers.

articles.title: SolarEdge inverters pair with Socomec BESS for streamlined C&I solar + storage solution
articles.summary: SolarEdge is partnering with Socomec to offer a streamlined solar plus storage solution, combining commercial-scale inverters and power optimizers with battery energy storage systems and the SolarEdge ONE energy management system. The partnership aims to help C&I entities in states like California maximize self-consumption of renewable energy. This bundled solution is designed to simplify the integration of solar and storage for commercial and industrial customers.

articles.title: Poll finds Republicans support utility-scale solar power, especially if it’s American-made
articles.summary: Republicans in a national poll show they favor utility-scale solar power, with support increasing if the panels are made in the United States. A majority of respondents approved of solar power, including Trump supporters and Republican-leaning Independents. The poll, commissioned by US solar panel manufacturer First Solar, polled 800 Republicans and found them to be in favor of the energy source.

articles.title: Voltage Energy opening new solar eBOS plant in North Carolina
articles.summary: Voltage Energy Group is establishing a new factory and progressing toward locating its global headquarters in Roxboro, North Carolina, with plans to acquire and upgrade a 72-acre site. The facility will be located on a 246,079-sq-ft site in Person County. Voltage Energy has stated that North Carolina has been the foundation of their company.

articles.title: Meta procures another 176 MW of solar to support data centers
articles.summary: Meta has signed a PPA with Zelestra for the entire output of the 176-MWDC Skull Creek Solar Plant in Texas, representing its seventh deal with the company and a significant increase to its total potential solar capacity. This deal brings Meta's total solar power capacity under long-term PPA agreements to 1.2 GWDC. The agreement supports Meta's growing data center operations.

articles.title: Clean Slate Solar completes two community solar projects in Maryland
articles.summary: Clean Slate Solar has completed two community solar projects in Landover, Maryland, delivering 1.7 MW of power to residents and expanding access to clean energy for low- and moderate-income households. The projects are located at the 3101 Pennsy site and provide electricity savings to LMI households. The total project size is 1,732 kW.

articles.title: Chemitek unveils drone-applied solar panel cleaning agent safe for agrivoltaic systems
articles.summary: Chomitek Solar has developed a drone-applied cleaning solution called the Drone AgroPV Cleaning Agent, which is safe for use in agrivoltaic systems. The agent will be officially launched at Intersolar Europe 2026 in June. It builds on Chemitek's previous releases of drone-based cleaning agents and solutions for agrivoltaic systems last year.

articles.title: Analysis: Clean energy drove more than a third of China’s GDP growth in 2025
articles.summary: China's clean-energy sectors contributed over a third (11.4%) of the country's GDP in 2025, with solar power, electric vehicles, and other technologies driving growth, and generating two-thirds of the value added. Clean energy investments reached 7.2 trillion yuan ($1.0 trillion) in 2025, four times the investment in fossil-fuel extraction.

articles.title: N.Y. PSC Changes DER Interconnection Rules to Meet Tax Credit Deadlines
articles.summary: The New York Public Service Commission has issued new interconnection rules for distributed energy resource developers and utilities, requiring them to develop schedules and plans for completing utility-side work to capture expiring Inflation Reduction Act tax credits, with deadlines set at July 5, 2026, for projects to have begun construction. The rules give utilities some discretion in scheduling the interconnection work, but also require them to offer first-scheduling opportunities for developers who opt in to an accelerated procedure. Utilities must supply preliminary work plans by May 1 and pay for their share of upgrades by June 1.

articles.title: US Energy Storage Startup Moves In On The Residential Market With Another $232 Million
articles.summary: Lunar Energy, a US startup, has raised an additional $232 million to pursue its goal of dominating the US home energy storage market. The funding move is seen as a challenge to Tesla's Powerwall in this segment. This investment aims to push Lunar Energy into a leading position in the residential energy storage market.

articles.title: PG&E will try out SPAN Edge customer meter upgrade device
articles.summary: Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E) has accepted the SPAN Edge device for customer use, enabling real-time load management that allows homes to add new electric appliances or EV charging without costly upgrades. This technology addresses one of the most significant barriers to residential electrification. The device enables an "at-the-meter" grid technology approach.

articles.title: Australia’s energy transition puts essential system services in focus
articles.summary: Grid-forming battery energy storage systems (BESS) are crucial for delivering a safe, secure, and affordable decarbonized power system in Australia's energy transition. Sam Markham of Fluence Australia emphasizes the importance of these systems. They play a key role in maintaining essential system services during grid-scale renewable energy integration.

articles.title: AI Startup That Does EV-Related Materials Science Discovery Raises $8M
articles.summary: Polaron, a UK-based AI startup focused on discovering EV-related materials science, has raised $8 million in funding led by Racine2 with co-investment from Speedinvest and Futurepresent. The investment aims to support the company's continued research and development in sustainable transportation technologies. Polaron's technology enables more efficient battery development for electric vehicles.

articles.title: Pennsylvania Governor Courts Data Centers While Seeking Consumer Protections
articles.summary: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro is courting data centers in an effort to balance economic growth with consumer protections. Critics argue that increased demand for natural gas and fracking-related pollution will result from the complexes' operations, which could worsen environmental issues. Shapiro's plan aims to mitigate these concerns while embracing the economic benefits of attracting data center companies.

articles.title: Revolution Wind Weeks Away from Generating Power — Maybe
articles.summary: Ørsted's Revolution Wind project is 87% complete, with the export cables, interlink cable and both offshore substations energized, and expected to reach commercial operation by the second half of 2026 if the Trump administration's interference is addressed. The project has already lost several weeks of work due to shutdowns caused by the administration's preservation of national security grounds, resulting in a $90 million impairment. Ørsted had previously indicated it would not pursue further projects in U.S. waters.

articles.title: PR firm launches Fieldwise Civic Engagement community network
articles.summary: A PR firm, KAOH Media, has launched a new division called Fieldwise Civic Engagement to support local initiatives for efficient land use and clean energy projects. The network will provide support for Tribal Nations on previously impacted lands and offer community engagement services. Fieldwise boasts a growing network of partners and stakeholders in the field of civic engagement and environmental development.

articles.title: MISO Members Push for Modernized Storage Rules
articles.summary: MISO members are pushing for modernized market rules to capture energy storage's multifaceted roles, including its potential as a market resource, transmission asset, and microgrid component. The group argues that existing rules need to be flexible enough to accommodate storage's capabilities and value it in the market. Commissioners agree that cost-effectiveness and compatibility with merchant services are key considerations for approving storage solutions.

articles.title: A Groundbreaking Geothermal Heating and Cooling Network Saves This Colorado College Money and Water
articles.summary: A former oil and gas developer partnered with Colorado Mesa University on geothermal energy, resulting in significant savings for the school. The university's new geothermal heating and cooling network not only reduced energy costs but also significantly lowered water consumption. This innovative project has set a new standard for energy-efficient buildings.

articles.title: New 1.2-GW Gas-Fired Plant Planned in WV; Three Solar Projects Also Announced
articles.summary: A new 1,200-MW natural gas-fired power plant is planned for West Virginia on land adjacent to the coal-fired Fort Martin Power Station. The project is part of two subsidiaries' expansion plans and complements three announced solar farm projects also being developed in the state. These solar farms will be built on reclaimed industrial and mining land.

articles.title: N.Y. Finalizes Regs to Speed Grid Upgrades, Reduce Costs
articles.summary: New York has finalized regulations to modernize its grid, aiming to reduce timelines and costs associated with clean energy development. The state is behind schedule meeting its 2030 renewable energy goal of 70%, currently at 23.6%, but efforts such as the RAPID Act are aimed at accelerating progress. A new office, ORES, will oversee large-scale renewable proposals and transmission projects to streamline the regulatory process.

articles.title: Texas to Study ‘Batch Zero’ of Data Centers by Late Summer
articles.summary: Texas plans to study its "Batch Zero" data centers by late summer, a group of large load projects waiting to connect to the grid. The reform aims to improve how ERCOT evaluates data center applications, but several unknowns remain. This process is expected to take at least four months to complete.

articles.title: Most Maritime Shipping Battery Propulsion Studies Are Already Obsolete
articles.summary: Most maritime battery propulsion studies are already obsolete due to advancements in battery costs and energy densities, rendering previous assumptions invalid. Researchers' work was initially grounded in outdated battery technology, making their studies no longer relevant. Newer studies must take into account improved battery capabilities to provide accurate and up-to-date assessments of the feasibility of maritime battery propulsion systems.

articles.title: AI is a ‘double-edged sword’ for utilities – weighing the risk against the benefits
articles.summary: Utilities are harnessing AI to modernize and clean their grids, weighing the risks of job displacement against the benefits of improved efficiency and sustainability. AI is being used for grid planning, but the industry faces challenges in balancing innovation with disruption. The use of AI in utilities has both positive and negative implications.

articles.title: AI = Artificial Intelligence or Always Incorrect?
articles.summary: This article discusses the author's experience with Tesla's Full Self Driving (FSD) system, which he purchased 6 years ago. The author questions whether AI and artificial intelligence are truly accurate terms in the context of technology like FSD, which is increasingly being marketed as "self-driving." He suggests that the term "AI" may be misleading or outdated given the limitations of current autonomous vehicle systems.

articles.title: Nuclear central in France's latest energy strategy
articles.summary: The French government has published its third Multiannual Energy Programme, outlining a strategy that prioritizes the development of nuclear energy to address energy consumption and production challenges from 2026-2035. The plan includes the construction of six new reactors and extended operation of existing nuclear facilities. This marks a significant shift in France's energy policy.

articles.title: TOPCon Solar Cells Are Killing A Key Anti-Solar Talking Point
articles.summary: Talon PV plans to launch high-efficiency TOPCon solar cells in the US market, despite a shift in federal energy policy. The new generation of solar cells aims to combat a key anti-solar talking point. This move suggests that TOPCon technology is gaining traction and becoming increasingly viable despite recent changes in government support for renewable energy.

articles.title: The “Super Bowl kick off for utilities” meets the era of data centers
articles.summary: Grid automation is evolving to meet the growing demand of data centers, with smart technologies such as grid-sensing systems being developed. Operational coordination between utilities and data centers is also increasing, marking a significant shift in the way energy is managed. This trend has been dubbed the "Super Bowl kick off for utilities" due to its potential impact on the industry.

articles.title: What does DTECH mean to the utility landscape?
articles.summary: DTECH 2026 highlighted utility innovations across the entire energy sector, showcasing advancements in various areas. The event featured numerous utility companies and startups presenting their latest technologies and solutions. This event marked an important milestone for the utility landscape, emphasizing the need for innovation to meet future energy demands.

articles.title: Lunar Energy raises US$232 million to scale VPP software globally
articles.summary: Lunar Energy, a home battery storage and virtual power plant (VPP) specialist, has secured US$232 million in funding through an oversubscribed Series D financing round led by B Capital and Prelude Ventures. This investment will enable the company to scale its VPP software globally. The raise follows on from previous investments from prominent firms.
key_takeaways: Lunar Energy has raised a total of US$232 million, including US$102 million in the latest Series D funding round.
The company plans to use this investment to expand its VPP software globally, indicating a significant growth strategy for the business.
This new funding will likely enhance Lunar Energy's ability to compete with other players in the home battery storage and VPP market.

articles.title: E-Storage, Sunraycer enter agreements for Texas BESS projects totalling 503MWh
articles.summary: E-Storage, a Canadian Solar subsidiary, has entered into agreements for the supply and long-term servicing of two battery energy storage systems (BESS) in Franklin County, Texas. The total capacity of the projects is 503 megawatt-hours (MWh), marking significant investments in the state's growing energy storage market. This collaboration demonstrates increasing interest in BESS solutions in Texas.
key_takeaways: E-Storage and Sunraycer Renewables have secured a total of 503MWh of battery energy storage systems in Franklin County, Texas.
The projects represent a substantial investment in the state's emerging energy storage market, which is gaining traction due to increasing demand for clean energy solutions.

The agreements highlight the growing collaboration between Canadian Solar's subsidiary and other players in the renewable energy sector, such as Sunraycer Renewables, in supporting the development of large-scale energy storage projects.

articles.title: The Hydrogen Stream: Verna completes first two hydrogen pilot wells in Canada
articles.summary: Vema Hydrogen has successfully completed two pilot hydrogen wells in Quebec, Canada, marking the world's first Engineered Mineral Hydrogen pilot wells. The wells are designed to gather data and evaluate fluid movement for commercial modeling purposes. This achievement aims to advance Vema's technology by documenting a proof of concept in a field environment.
key_takeaways: Vema Hydrogen has completed two pilot hydrogen wells in Quebec, Canada, marking the first Engineered Mineral Hydrogen pilot wells globally.
The wells are part of Vema's structured program to gather data on fluid movement and monitor hydrogen production for commercial modeling purposes.
This achievement is a step towards advancing Vema's technology by documenting a proof of concept in a field environment.

articles.title: Toyota & Daihatsu Roll Out Shared Electric Kei Vans for Japan’s Last-Mile Logistics
articles.summary: Toyota and Daihatsu are collaborating to roll out shared battery-electric kei commercial vans in Japan, targeting the country's last-mile logistics sector. The vans will use a shared platform and powertrain to accelerate electrification in this sector. This move aims to promote sustainable transportation solutions for Japan's urban delivery needs.
key_takeaways: Toyota and Daihatsu are launching battery-electric kei commercial vans as part of their efforts to accelerate electrification in Japan's last-mile logistics sector.
The vans will share a platform and powertrain, indicating a collaborative approach to reduce costs and increase efficiency.
This initiative aims to promote sustainable transportation solutions for Japan's urban delivery needs, contributing to the country's broader environmental goals.

articles.title: Xcel Energy pursuing large load tariffs in 4 states amid data center growth
articles.summary: Xcel Energy is expanding its large load tariffs in four states, driven by the growing demand for data centers. The company expects to sign contracts with data center developers, including NextEra Energy and GE Vernova, by the end of 2027. This expansion aims to support the development of new generation facilities.
key_takeaways: Xcel Energy is increasing its large load tariffs in four states, indicating a growing demand for electricity from data centers.
The company plans to sign contracts with data center developers, including NextEra Energy and GE Vernova, to accelerate the development of new generation facilities.
By the end of 2027, Xcel expects to secure 6 GW of data center capacity, underscoring the increasing importance of renewable energy in supporting data center growth.

articles.title: Score 2x Heybike ALPHA mid-drive e-bikes at $999 each, Bluetti Elite 400 power station exclusive $1,221 low, Segway, Anker SOLIX, more
articles.summary: The article announces various deals on power and energy systems, including e-bikes, power stations, scooters, and more. These deals are part of Green Deals and offer significant discounts on products from brands like Heybike, Bluetti, Segway, and Anker. The deals include exclusive prices on popular products, making it a great opportunity for customers to upgrade or purchase new gear.
key_takeaways: Two Heybike ALPHA All-Terrain Mid-Drive e-bikes are available at $999 each, making them an affordable option for those looking to upgrade their e-bike.
The Bluetti Elite 400 Portable Power Station is on sale for an exclusive $1,221 low, offering significant savings compared to its original price.
Anker's Super Bowl weekend flash sale offers up to $3,300 savings on various products, making it a great time to purchase high-end gear at discounted prices.

articles.title: EPA reconsiders Good Neighbor Plan that limited power plant emissions
articles.summary: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is reconsidering the Good Neighbor Plan, a Biden-era program aimed at reducing ozone-forming emissions from power plants and industrial facilities. This move could impact downwind states' ability to meet Clean Air Act requirements. The EPA's decision may have implications for environmental regulations and air quality.
key_takeaways: The EPA is rolling back the Good Neighbor Plan, which was established to cut nitrogen oxide emissions that contribute to ozone-forming pollution.
The plan's repeal could affect downwind states' ability to meet Clean Air Act standards, potentially worsening air quality in those areas.
The decision may have broader implications for environmental regulations and efforts to mitigate the impacts of power plant emissions on local communities.

articles.title: Trump may not like solar, but lots of his voters do
articles.summary: The article discusses how Donald Trump's stance on solar power may not align with the views of his Republican voters, who have shown a strong support for renewable energy. Despite the president and some GOP lawmakers opposing solar power, many Republicans seem to favor it. This disconnect highlights a potential divide within the Republican Party regarding climate change and energy policy.
key_takeaways: Many Trump supporters, including some Republicans, are actively promoting and supporting solar power, indicating a potential disconnect between the party's leadership and its base on this issue.
The article suggests that Trump's opposition to solar power may not be shared by his voters, who are more likely to support renewable energy sources as part of their climate change policies.

This divide within the Republican Party could lead to further polarization on issues related to energy policy and climate change, with potential implications for the party's overall strategy and messaging.
The article implies that there may be a need for Republicans to reevaluate their stance on solar power and other renewable energy sources in order to better align with the views of their voters.

articles.title: U.S. DOE Issues Emergency Orders to Support Florida’s Electric Grid During Extended Cold Weather
articles.summary: The US Department of Energy (DOE) has issued emergency orders to support Florida's electric grid during the extended cold weather, allowing utilities to dispatch generating units as needed to maintain reliability if necessary. The orders aim to ensure the continued supply of electricity to Floridian households and businesses. This move is likely in response to the anticipated increase in energy demand due to the prolonged winter weather.
key_takeaways: The US DOE has issued emergency orders to support Florida's electric grid during cold weather, allowing utilities to dispatch generating units as needed.
These orders aim to maintain reliability and ensure continued electricity supply to households and businesses in Florida.
The move is likely in response to anticipated increased energy demand due to prolonged winter weather conditions.

articles.title: Berkshire Hathaway Energy Montana energises 150MWh BESS
articles.summary: Berkshire Hathaway Energy's Glacier Battery System project in Montana has been successfully energized, marking a significant milestone for the company. The 75MW/150MWh battery system is part of BHE Renewables' efforts to integrate renewable energy sources into the grid. This project showcases the growing adoption of energy storage solutions in the US.
key_takeaways: Berkshire Hathaway Energy's Glacier Battery System project is a 75MW/150MWh battery system located in Montana, marking one of the largest BESS projects in the US.
The project's successful energization indicates a significant step forward for the company's efforts to integrate renewable energy sources into the grid.

The growing adoption of energy storage solutions like BESS suggests a shift towards more sustainable and resilient energy systems, particularly as the US continues to transition away from fossil fuels.

articles.title: Sensus Introduces Evolve Platform for Grid Intelligence at DistribuTECH 2026
articles.summary: Sensus, a leading provider of energy management solutions, has introduced its Evolve platform for grid intelligence at DistribuTECH 2026. The platform is designed to support private and cellular connectivity, offering high-resolution sampling and utility-specific analytics for operational decision-making and future grid planning. This new platform aims to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of grid operations.
key_takeaways: The Sensus Evolve platform supports both private and cellular connectivity options, catering to different utility needs and preferences.
The platform's features include high-resolution sampling and utility-specific analytics, which can provide critical insights for operational decision-making.
The Evolve platform is positioned as a vital tool for grid planning and management, enabling utilities to make data-driven decisions and optimize their grid operations.

articles.title: Serbia discusses new nuclear with French development agency
articles.summary: The article states that the Minister of Mining and Energy in Serbia, Dubravka Đedović Handanovic, has discussed potential cooperation with the French development agency Agence Française de Développement (AFD) for energy transition and nuclear energy development. The focus is on developing new nuclear energy applications in Serbia. No specific details about the proposed project or its scope are mentioned.
key_takeaways: Serbia's Minister of Mining and Energy, Dubravka Đedović Handanovic, has initiated talks with AFD to explore cooperation opportunities for energy transition and nuclear energy development.
The discussion is specifically focused on developing new nuclear energy applications in Serbia.
This move suggests that Serbia may be considering expanding its nuclear energy capabilities with French expertise.

articles.title: Our New Combo Washer/Heat Pump Dryer Uses Less Than 1 kWh of Electricity Per Load
articles.summary: The article discusses a new combination washer and heat pump dryer that uses less than 1 kWh of electricity per load, offering significant convenience and efficiency in doing laundry. The machine has been found to be impressive by the author, who is pleased with its performance. The eco-friendliness of this product is highlighted as it consumes low amounts of energy.
key_takeaways: The combination washer and heat pump dryer uses less than 1 kWh of electricity per load, making it an energy-efficient option for laundry.
This machine offers significant convenience as it can wash and dry clothes in just two hours, saving time for users.
Heat pump technology is being increasingly adopted in home appliances due to its ability to reduce energy consumption while maintaining efficiency.

articles.title: Western energy market incorporates, asks CAISO for financing help
articles.summary: The Regional Organization for Western Energy, a non-traditional energy market in the western US, is nearing launch and seeking financing assistance to cover $8 million in implementation costs. The organization aims to create an "à la carte" energy market that allows consumers to buy energy from various sources. CAISO (California Independent System Operator) has been approached for help with funding.
key_takeaways: The Regional Organization for Western Energy is a non-traditional energy market aiming to launch in the western US, which would allow consumers to buy energy from various sources.
The organization is seeking financing assistance to cover $8 million in implementation costs, highlighting the significant investment required for its launch.
CAISO has been approached for funding help, indicating that government or regulatory bodies may play a crucial role in supporting the project.

articles.title: Battery data analytics software specialist TWAICE nets European Investment Bank funding
articles.summary: TWAICE, a cloud-based battery data analytics provider, has secured €24 million (US$28 million) in funding from the European Investment Bank. This investment will support TWAICE's continued growth and expansion into the energy storage market. The funding highlights the increasing importance of data analytics in optimizing energy storage solutions.
key_takeaways: TWAICE has received significant funding from the European Investment Bank, indicating strong investor confidence in the company's technology.
The investment will likely enable TWAICE to further develop its cloud-based battery data analytics platform and expand its reach into the energy storage market.
Data analytics plays a critical role in optimizing energy storage solutions, suggesting that TWAICE's technology is poised to address a significant need in this sector.

articles.title: Entso-E outlines tools for spotting instability in renewables-heavy grids
articles.summary: The European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity (Entso-E) has released a report outlining tools and technologies to detect instability in power grids with high shares of renewable energy. The report highlights the need for real-time monitoring and data-driven decision-making to maintain grid reliability. With increasing installations of new wind and solar capacity, the power system is facing new challenges from integrating devices with power electronics interfaces.
key_takeaways: The power grid is evolving towards networks increasingly reliant on devices with power electronics interfaces, which can provide stability, robustness, and controllability but also introduce new challenges for stability and reliability.

Entso-E recommends various tools and technologies to detect instability in these systems, including measurement-based modal analysis, voltage and current monitoring, and wide-area monitoring systems (WAMS) using phase-sensitive methods.

The report highlights the need for stakeholder collaboration and research prioritization to advance real-time monitoring and data-driven decision-making in power system management, particularly in countries with high renewable energy shares.

articles.title: India wraps up 1.2 GW renewables-plus-storage tender at $0.069/kWh
articles.summary: The Solar Energy Corp. of India (SECI) has concluded a tender for 1.2 GW of renewable energy capacity paired with energy storage systems, with the lowest tariff discovered being INR 6.27 ($0.069)/kWh. This award covers 4.8 GWh of daily peak supply and is equivalent to 1,200 MW for four hours. The project aims to provide assured peak power.
key_takeaways: SECI has awarded 1.2 GW of renewables-plus-storage capacity at a tariff of $0.069/kWh.
This tender covers 4.8 GWh of daily peak supply, equivalent to 1,200 MW for four hours.
The award is part of the project's goal to provide assured peak power to meet the country's energy demands.

articles.title: RE+ Northeast 2026: Evolving solar and storage integration
articles.summary: The RE+ Northeast 2026 event, held in Boston from February 3 to 5, 2026, brought together industry leaders and companies to discuss grid modernization and accelerate renewable energy goals in the northeastern United States. The exhibition featured over 200 companies and approximately 4,000 attendees showcasing solar and storage technologies for residential and utility-scale applications. Educational sessions addressed regulatory and technical hurdles of grid integration.
key_takeaways: The event showcased a range of energy storage products designed for both residential and utility-scale applications, including high-voltage battery systems, scalable outdoor storage systems, and revenue-grade metering solutions.
Discussion themes centered on ratemaking for distributed energy resources and the development of new compensation structures to fairly value local power generation.
Educational sessions explored the intersection of land use and community engagement in grid integration, addressing key challenges and opportunities for accelerating renewable energy goals.

articles.title: What’s driving up Maine’s energy bills? Natural gas.
articles.summary: A new report by Maine's energy department has found that natural gas is the primary driver behind increasing power prices in the state, with Mainers paying some of the highest electricity rates in the country. The study reveals a stark contrast to the popularity of renewable energy sources such as solar panels and wind turbines. This finding suggests that other factors beyond green energy are at play when it comes to Maine's soaring power bills.
key_takeaways: Natural gas is identified as the primary driver behind increasing power prices in Maine, contradicting the notion that renewable energy sources are to blame for high electricity rates.
Maine has some of the highest residential electricity prices in the country, with only five states having higher prices in November according to the report.
The study highlights a shift away from conventional wisdom that renewable energy is the primary driver behind high power bills, instead pointing to other factors such as natural gas.

articles.title: ‘We’re not stopping here’: Reactions as Australia’s New South Wales smashes long-duration storage targets with 12GWh tender
articles.summary: Australia's New South Wales has successfully concluded its largest long-duration energy storage (LDES) tender, awarding six battery projects a total capacity of 12GWh. This achievement marks a significant milestone in the country's efforts to improve grid reliability and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The industry is hailing this as a "game-changer" for the sector.
key_takeaways: Australia's New South Wales has set a new benchmark in long-duration energy storage (LDES) with its 12GWh tender, demonstrating the country's commitment to renewable energy integration.
The successful completion of this largest LDES tender is expected to have a significant impact on grid reliability, enabling the state to better manage variable renewable energy sources.
Industry experts are viewing this achievement as a "game-changer" for the sector, highlighting the potential for widespread adoption of long-duration energy storage solutions in Australia.

articles.title: CAISO Examines ‘Pulsating’ Data Center Loads
articles.summary: CAISO is examining the impact of "pulsating" data center loads on grid reliability. These pulsating loads occur when AI training data centers complete large computations, resulting in an 80-90% reduction in load within seconds. CAISO aims to ensure grid stability and is considering policy changes to address potential issues.
key_takeaways: Pulsating loads from AI training data centers can cause significant fluctuations in system frequency and voltage, potentially leading to resonance issues with nearby rotating machines.
Current policies do not have a clear threshold for defining large loads, which CAISO plans to address through stakeholder initiatives.
Utilities are responsible for large load interconnections, but CAISO is monitoring developments at the federal level regarding RTOs' potential involvement in addressing these issues.

articles.title: Pilot Project will Site Small Data Centers Near Stranded Power
articles.summary: A collaboration between EPRI, InfraPartners, NVIDIA, and Prologis aims to develop models for faster setup of smaller-scale, real-time data processing centers near utility substations. The goal is to make better use of underused infrastructure to speed deployment and reduce response times for inference data processing, which supports artificial intelligence in various sectors. At least five pilot sites are expected to be developed nationwide by the end of 2026.
key_takeaways: The project focuses on deploying smaller-scale, real-time data processing centers (5-20 MW) near utility substations with available capacity to speed up deployment and reduce response times for inference data processing.

This approach is particularly beneficial for AI inference, which provides real-time responses and can work from smaller facilities closer to end-users, reducing transmission congestion and improving system flexibility.
The collaboration aims to develop a replicable and scalable model for wider use, with the goal of having at least five pilot sites in development nationwide by the end of 2026.

articles.title: Utilities face cost-recovery risk as infrastructure costs, demand rise: Morningstar
articles.summary: Utilities are facing a cost-recovery risk due to rising metal costs, which will lead to increased expenses for essential grid components such as transmission lines and transformers. This surge in material costs is attributed to the current market conditions. As a result, utilities will need to reassess their pricing strategies to maintain profitability.
key_takeaways: Rising metal costs are expected to significantly impact utilities' bottom line, particularly for key grid parts like transmission lines and distribution feeders.
The increasing cost of materials such as metals is affecting the overall infrastructure costs faced by utilities, posing a challenge to their ability to recover costs from ratepayers.
Utilities will need to adapt their pricing strategies to mitigate the effects of rising metal costs, ensuring they can maintain profitability in the face of increased expenses.

articles.title: First Solar releases poll showing support for solar among GOP voters
articles.summary: A recent survey conducted by First Solar found that a significant majority of GOP-aligned voters (79%) support allowing all forms of electricity generation to compete fairly in the marketplace without political interference. This indicates a strong backing for a level playing field for different energy sources. The poll results may have implications for the future of energy policy and market competition.
key_takeaways: 79% of GOP-aligned voters surveyed agree that all forms of electricity generation should be allowed to compete fairly in the marketplace without political interference.
This suggests that there is significant support among Republican-leaning voters for a level playing field for different energy sources, including utility-scale solar.
The poll results may indicate a shift in energy policy, with Republican voters increasingly embracing market competition over partisan influence.

articles.title: IEA: Electricity demand is rising fast, and grids can’t keep up
articles.summary: The International Energy Agency (IEA) reports that global electricity demand is rapidly increasing, posing a significant challenge to the grid's ability to keep up with the growing energy needs. This surge in demand is attributed to various factors, including technological advancements and shifting consumer behavior. As a result, grid operators are facing increased pressure to maintain reliability and efficiency.
key_takeaways: Global electricity demand is surging at an unprecedented rate, putting a strain on existing grid infrastructure.
The IEA attributes the rapid growth in demand to technological advancements and changes in consumer behavior, highlighting the need for sustainable energy solutions.
Grid operators are struggling to keep up with the increased energy needs, raising concerns about reliability and efficiency.

articles.title: Michigan Sues Big Oil For Antitrust Violations
articles.summary: The state of Michigan has filed a lawsuit against several major oil companies, alleging that they have conspired to artificially inflate the prices of electric vehicles (EVs) and renewable energy. This move is aimed at combating the alleged antitrust violations, which are believed to be detrimental to consumers. The lawsuit seeks to hold the oil companies accountable for their actions.
key_takeaways: The state of Michigan has sued multiple oil companies, including Big Oil, for allegedly conspiring to keep EV and renewable energy prices high.
The lawsuit aims to combat antitrust violations that are believed to harm consumers by artificially inflating the costs of EVs and renewable energy.
This move is part of a growing trend of government actions against large corporations for price-fixing and other unfair practices.

articles.title: Global BESS capacity tops 250 GW, overtaking pumped hydro for first time
articles.summary: The global battery energy storage system (BESS) capacity has surpassed 250 GW, overtaking pumped hydro for the first time, according to Rystad Energy. This marks a historic inflection point for BESS, with annual additions exceeding 100 GW/280 GWh in 2025, reflecting a compound annual growth rate of over 100% between 2020 and 2025. The rapid expansion is expected to continue, with global BESS additions projected to exceed 130 GW/350 GWh in 2026.
key_takeaways: Global BESS capacity has surpassed 250 GW, overtaking pumped hydro for the first time, according to Rystad Energy.
The growth rate of BESS has been extremely rapid, with a compound annual growth rate of over 100% between 2020 and 2025.

Established markets such as China, the United States, the UK, Australia, and Germany will continue to lead in BESS deployment, while emerging markets are gaining prominence due to aligning policy frameworks, grid needs, and project pipelines.

articles.title: PSE&G Energy Efficiency Programs Deliver More Than $900 Million in Annual Utility Bill Savings for New Jersey Customers
articles.summary: PSE&G Energy Efficiency Programs have successfully delivered significant annual utility bill savings to New Jersey customers, achieving approximately 3.1 million MWh of electric savings each year. This translates to enough energy to power around 453,000 homes annually. The programs have contributed substantially to the state's energy efficiency efforts.
key_takeaways: PSE&G Energy Efficiency Programs have delivered an estimated $900 million in annual utility bill savings for New Jersey customers.
The programs have achieved approximately 3.1 million MWh of electric savings annually, equivalent to powering around 453,000 homes each year.
The success of these programs demonstrates a significant impact on energy efficiency efforts in the state, contributing to reduced energy consumption and costs for customers.

articles.title: Europe Is Finally Admitting Electricity Is Overtaxed
articles.summary: The article discusses a leaked European Commission recommendation that Electricity is still taxed and loaded with levies as if it were a polluting end product, despite being a clean energy carrier that Europe increasingly depends on. This highlights the need for a re-evaluation of electricity taxation policies in Europe. The current tax system may be discouraging the adoption of renewable energy sources.
key_takeaways: Electricity is currently taxed and loaded with levies as if it were a polluting end product, despite being a clean energy carrier.
This outdated approach may be discouraging the adoption of renewable energy sources in Europe, which increasingly relies on electricity from clean energy carriers.
The European Commission's leaked recommendation suggests that the tax system needs to be re-evaluated to better reflect the true nature of electricity as a clean energy source.
The article implies that this re-evaluation is necessary to promote the adoption of renewable energy sources and support Europe's transition towards a low-carbon economy.

articles.title: UAV Trajectory Optimization via Improved Noisy Deep Q-Network
articles.summary: This article proposes an Improved Noisy Deep Q-Network (Noisy DQN) to enhance the exploration and stability of Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) in simulated environments. The proposed method combines a residual NoisyLinear layer with an adaptive noise scheduling mechanism to improve exploration, while also improving training stability through smooth loss and soft target network updates. Experiments show promising results, including faster convergence and higher rewards compared to standard DQN.
key_takeaways: The Improved Noisy Deep Q-Network (Noisy DQN) combines a residual NoisyLinear layer with an adaptive noise scheduling mechanism to enhance exploration in UAV trajectory optimization.
The proposed method improves training stability through smooth loss and soft target network updates, contributing to enhanced efficiency and reliability of deep Q-learning.
Experiments show that Noisy DQN achieves faster convergence and up to $+40$ higher rewards compared to standard DQN in simulated environments.

articles.title: Xcel Energy Inks Dual Alliances with GE Vernova, NextEra to Support 6-GW Data Center Outlook, Generation Expansion
articles.summary: Xcel Energy has signed two strategic alliances with GE Vernova and NextEra Energy to support the development of a potential 6-GW data center in the United States. The agreements aim to secure supply and development capacity, reserving five F-class gas turbines and multiple gigawatts of wind capacity to meet the data center's energy needs. This partnership will also facilitate joint development resources for generation expansion.
key_takeaways: Xcel Energy has formed alliances with GE Vernova and NextEra Energy to support a potential 6-GW data center project, securing supply and development capacity.

The partnerships reserve five F-class gas turbines and multiple gigawatts of wind capacity to meet the data center's energy needs, highlighting the importance of renewable energy sources in meeting growing demand.

This agreement demonstrates Xcel Energy's commitment to expanding its generation capacity to support growing industries such as data centers, which are expected to require significant amounts of electricity.

articles.title: Natura, NGL Move to Pair Nuclear Molten Salt Reactors with Large-Scale Produced-Water Treatment in Permian
articles.summary: Natura Resources, a company that recently received the first federal construction permit for a liquid-fueled molten-salt reactor, is partnering with NGL Water Solutions Permian to deploy its nuclear reactor design alongside large-scale produced-water treatment systems. This collaboration aims to transform briny drilling waste into usable water while powering data centers and other industrial loads. The project's unique approach involves separating the core, heat removal, and secondary systems, enabling flexible integration of industrial thermal processes.
key_takeaways: Natura Resources is partnering with NGL Water Solutions Permian to deploy its 100-MWe nuclear molten salt reactor design alongside large-scale produced-water treatment systems.
The partnership aims to transform briny drilling waste into usable water while powering data centers and other industrial loads in the Permian region.
The project's innovative approach involves separating the core, heat removal, and secondary systems, allowing for flexible integration of industrial thermal processes.

articles.title: China sets ‘capacity price’ floor for grid-scale storage, tying payments to coal benchmarks
articles.summary: China's National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC) and National Energy Administration (NEA) have introduced a "capacity price" floor for grid-scale storage, allowing standalone energy storage projects to earn fixed-cost payments based on their availability rather than the energy delivered. This policy aims to stabilize cash flows for storage assets with high system value during peak periods. The distinction between capacity payments and energy delivery remuneration is intended to provide clearer investment incentives.
key_takeaways: China has introduced a "capacity price" floor for grid-scale storage, tying payments to coal benchmarks, allowing standalone energy storage projects to earn fixed-cost payments based on their availability.

This policy distinguishes between capacity payments (for available capacity) and energy delivery remuneration (for actual energy discharged), aiming to stabilize cash flows for high-system-value storage assets during peak periods.

The new mechanism is intended to provide clearer investment incentives for qualified standalone storage projects that support system reliability and do not require mandatory co-located storage for renewables.

articles.title: Photovoltaics for salmon farms
articles.summary: A hybrid solar and storage system has been commissioned at the Quintupeu salmon farming center in Hornopirén, Chile. The 48 kW photovoltaic plant paired with a 109 kWh battery storage system enables the facility to reduce its reliance on diesel generators. This project aims to provide a constant power supply for critical systems in isolated aquaculture operations.
key_takeaways: A hybrid solar and storage system has been implemented at a salmon farm in Chile, reducing reliance on diesel generators and providing a more stable power supply.

The system features a 48 kW photovoltaic plant paired with a 109 kWh battery energy storage system, allowing for energy storage during peak sunlight hours and backup during periods of low solar generation or operational contingencies.

This project addresses the challenges of isolated aquaculture operations, which often require constant power supplies for critical systems such as photoperiod control, oxygenation, feeding, and monitoring.

articles.title: Solar Power Provides Benefits To Northern Cheyenne & Kenyan Communities
articles.summary: The article discusses the benefits of solar power for two specific communities, Northern Cheyenne and Kenyan communities, highlighting the cost competitiveness and environmental advantages of clean renewable energy over fossil fuels.
key_takeaways: Clean renewable energy is cost competitive with fossil fuels in some cases, making it a more sensible choice despite higher upfront costs.
The article suggests that factoring in climate change impacts and harm to human health from fossil fuels further supports the adoption of clean renewables.
Solar power provides benefits not only for the environment but also for remote communities that require self-sufficient energy generation.

articles.title: ‘Most TSOs are sitting on their hands’ when it comes to energy storage, says Nordic developer
articles.summary: The article quotes Søren Juel Hansen, energy storage director at Nordic Solar, stating that most transmission system operators (TSOs) are not actively utilizing energy storage solutions. This suggests a lack of adoption or investment in energy storage technology by TSOs, which could be limiting their ability to optimize grid performance and resilience.
key_takeaways: Most TSOs are reportedly not utilizing energy storage solutions effectively, indicating a need for increased adoption and investment.
Energy storage director Søren Juel Hansen highlights the potential benefits of leveraging energy storage technology for improved grid performance and resilience.
The article suggests that TSOs' inaction on energy storage may be hindering their ability to optimize grid operations and respond to changing energy demand patterns.

articles.title: Great River Energy, ITC Midwest and Xcel Energy File Certificate of Need Application for Proposed Transmission Project
articles.summary: Great River Energy, ITC Midwest, and Xcel Energy have filed a Certificate of Need Application for a proposed transmission project. The project aims to build a new 765-kilovolt backbone transmission line, along with related upgrades, to support electricity delivery and connect new sources of power to the regional grid. The project's goal is to enhance grid resilience and reliability.
key_takeaways: The proposed transmission project includes a new 765-kilovolt backbone transmission line, indicating a significant upgrade in the existing infrastructure.
The project's objective is to support electricity delivery and connect new sources of power to the regional grid, suggesting an emphasis on renewable energy integration.

The involvement of multiple companies (Great River Energy, ITC Midwest, and Xcel Energy) suggests a collaborative effort to deliver the transmission project, which could indicate a complex and potentially large-scale implementation.

articles.title: Serving New Load Without Raising Rates: A Utility Perspective
articles.summary: The article discusses the challenges faced by utilities in Georgia and the US, as electricity demand rapidly increases due to data center development and economic growth. Utilities are exploring ways to meet this growing demand without raising rates for customers. The conversation highlights the importance of innovative solutions to ensure reliable and affordable energy supply.
key_takeaways: The rapid increase in electricity demand is driven primarily by the growth of data centers, which require significant amounts of power.
Utilities are under pressure to balance the need to meet increasing demand with the need to keep rates stable for customers, making it a challenging task.
Innovations and investments in grid infrastructure, energy storage, and demand management strategies will be crucial in helping utilities serve the growing load without raising rates.

articles.title: Leidos to Acquire ENTRUST Solutions Group in $2.4 Billion Deal
articles.summary: Leidos is acquiring ENTRUST Solutions Group in a $2.4 billion deal, expanding its capabilities in electric and gas infrastructure to support utility clients in grid modernization efforts. The acquisition will enhance Leidos' capabilities in reliability and resilience, helping clients navigate increasing investments in power delivery systems. This move aims to improve the overall performance of the power industry.
key_takeaways: Leidos is acquiring ENTRUST Solutions Group in a $2.4 billion deal, expanding its presence in electric and gas infrastructure.
The acquisition will enhance Leidos' capabilities in grid modernization, reliability, and resilience efforts for utility clients.
The move aims to support the power industry's increasing investments in power delivery systems and improve overall performance.

articles.title: ‘Reversible solid oxide fuel cells’: Noon Energy’s approach to 100+ hour energy storage
articles.summary: Noon Energy, a company co-founded by Chris Graves, is working on "reversible solid oxide fuel cells" that aim to achieve long-duration energy storage of over 100 hours. These innovative fuel cells have the potential to revolutionize the way we store energy for extended periods. The company's approach is focused on developing scalable and efficient solutions.
key_takeaways: Noon Energy's reversible solid oxide fuel cells are designed for long-duration energy storage, potentially surpassing current limitations of 1-2 hours with other battery technologies.
The company's approach leverages the benefits of solid oxide fuel cells, which can operate at high temperatures, allowing for more efficient energy conversion and storage.

By using reversible technology, Noon Energy aims to enable the widespread adoption of renewable energy sources by providing a reliable means of storing excess energy generated during periods of low demand.

articles.title: Aypa Power closes US$1.5 billion credit facility for US BESS projects
articles.summary: Aypa Power, an energy storage developer-operator, has secured a US$1.5 billion credit facility to support the development of battery energy storage systems (BESS) projects across the United States. This funding will enable the company to advance its projects and contribute to the growth of the US energy storage market. The facility is a construction warehouse revolving credit, which allows Aypa Power to access capital on an as-needed basis.
key_takeaways: Aypa Power has secured a significant investment of US$1.5 billion to support its BESS projects in the United States.
This funding will likely play a crucial role in advancing the development and deployment of energy storage systems across the country.
The facility is structured as a construction warehouse revolving credit, which provides Aypa Power with access to capital on an as-needed basis during project construction.

articles.title: National Grid Launches New Digital Twin and Data Visualization Tool, Triton, to Support Network Planning
articles.summary: National Grid has launched Triton, a digital twin and data visualization tool to support network planning. The platform provides a visual representation of electricity demand projections across the network, enabling grid operators to make informed decisions about infrastructure development and resource allocation. By mapping expected growth at grid supply points and transmission substations, Triton aims to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of network planning.
key_takeaways: Triton provides a visual platform for displaying projected electricity demand across the network, enabling grid operators to identify areas of high demand and plan accordingly.
The tool uses data visualization to help grid operators make informed decisions about infrastructure development and resource allocation, ultimately improving network efficiency and effectiveness.
By mapping expected growth at specific points on the grid, Triton allows operators to anticipate and prepare for changes in electricity demand, reducing the risk of capacity shortages or overloads.

articles.title: CPS Energy Plans to Deploy 900 MHz Private Wireless Broadband
articles.summary: CPS Energy is partnering with Anterix to deploy a 900 MHz private wireless broadband network, aiming to advance grid automation, accelerate outage response, and enhance operational resilience. The deployment will utilize a dedicated frequency band to provide secure and reliable communication for the utility's operations. This partnership seeks to improve the efficiency and reliability of CPS Energy's energy infrastructure.
key_takeaways: CPS Energy is partnering with Anterix to deploy a 900 MHz private wireless broadband network as part of its grid automation efforts.
The deployment aims to accelerate outage response times, improving the overall reliability and resilience of CPS Energy's energy infrastructure.
Utilizing a dedicated frequency band provides a secure and reliable communication platform for CPS Energy's operations, enabling more efficient management of its grid assets.

articles.title: India extends existing tax waivers for nuclear to 2035
articles.summary: The Indian government has proposed extending the tax waivers for nuclear power projects until 2035, allowing for exemptions on customs duties on imports of goods required for these projects. This move aims to support the growth and development of India's nuclear energy sector. The extension applies to all nuclear plants, regardless of their capacity.
key_takeaways: The Indian government plans to extend tax waivers for nuclear power projects until 2035.
The exemptions will apply to customs duties on imports of goods required for these projects, supporting the growth and development of India's nuclear energy sector.
All nuclear plants in India will be eligible for the extended tax waiver, regardless of their capacity.

articles.title: World’s largest AI-powered battery storage cluster comes online in China
articles.summary: The world's largest AI-powered battery storage cluster has come online in China, with the 4GWh Envision Jingyi Chagan Hada Energy Storage Power Station marking a significant milestone. The facility is part of an 12.8GWh energy storage cluster that includes multiple projects located across Inner Mongolia. The project demonstrates Envision's capabilities in large-scale energy storage and grid integration.
key_takeaways: The world's largest single-site electrochemical energy storage power station, the 4GWh Envision Jingyi Chagan Hada Energy Storage Power Station, has been successfully connected to the grid.
The 12.8GWh energy storage cluster is part of a larger project that includes multiple sites across Inner Mongolia, bringing Envision's total capacity in the region to over 14GWh.
The facility marks a significant achievement for Envision, demonstrating its capabilities in large-scale energy storage and grid integration, particularly through the use of AI technology.

articles.title: Latvia’s largest single-site solar plant begins operating
articles.summary: The article reports on the launch of Latvia's largest single-site solar plant, a 120.8 MW project developed by Green Genius.
