articles.summary: Schneider Electric has introduced new software solutions to help utilities manage grid disruptions caused by severe weather and wildfires. The company's new grid and transmission solutions aim to maintain power supply during extreme events. This development is part of Schneider Electric's efforts to support the energy sector in addressing growing concerns about grid resilience.
key_takeaways: Schneider Electric has developed new software solutions to help utilities manage grid disruptions from severe weather and wildfires.
The company's focus on this area reflects the increasing need for grid resilience and power supply maintenance during extreme events.
The new solutions are part of Schneider Electric's broader efforts to support the energy sector in addressing growing concerns about grid reliability.

articles.title: S&C Electric, SEL Collaborate on Interoperable Control Solution for Distribution Grid Modernization
articles.summary: S&C Electric Company and Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories (SEL) have collaborated to develop an interoperable control solution for distribution grid modernization, enabling utilities to automate overhead distribution systems. This partnership aims to address growing utility demand for modernization of their grid infrastructure. The new solution combines S&C's IntelliRupter PulseCloser Fault Interrupter with SEL's Advanced Digital Control.
key_takeaways: S&C Electric and SEL have developed an interoperable control solution for distribution grid modernization, allowing utilities to automate overhead distribution systems.
The partnership addresses the growing demand from utilities for modernizing their grid infrastructure and provides a new option for interoperability.

The combined solution uses S&C's IntelliRupter PulseCloser Fault Interrupter with SEL's Advanced Digital Control, offering utilities a more efficient and reliable way to manage their distribution grids.

articles.title: New Nuclear Power Generation Proposed at Closed Wisconsin Site
articles.summary: A nuclear power services company plans to submit an application to build new generation capacity at the closed Kewaunee Nuclear Power Plant in Wisconsin, marking a potential revival of nuclear energy in the state.
key_takeaways: An international nuclear power services company is planning to develop a new generation capacity project at the Kewaunee Nuclear Power Plant in Wisconsin.
The project would involve building new reactors at the plant, which was shut down in 2013 due to rising fuel costs and declining electricity demand.
The proposed development could mark a significant shift towards reviving nuclear energy in Wisconsin, potentially providing additional power generation capacity to the state.

articles.title: U.S. Renewables Outlook 2026: Key Risks and Strategies for Sustainable Growth
articles.summary: The U.S. renewable energy market has demonstrated resilience in 2025 despite various setbacks, with 92% of new power capacity added to the grid coming from renewables. The article discusses the challenges and strategies for sustainable growth in the sector. The outlook for 2026 is also examined.
key_takeaways: The U.S. renewable energy market was able to withstand significant challenges in 2025, including weather disasters, global trade tensions, and tax credit eligibility termination.
Despite these obstacles, 92% of new power capacity added to the grid came from renewables, indicating a strong commitment to sustainable energy sources.
Smart adaptation strategies are crucial for maintaining growth and success in the renewable energy sector, according to the article.

articles.title: Utility Broadband Alliance Marks Five-Year Milestone at DTECH 2026
articles.summary: The Utility Broadband Alliance is celebrating a five-year milestone, marking significant progress in accelerating private broadband adoption to support power grid modernization. This initiative aims to enable the integration of advanced technologies such as IoT and analytics into power generation and distribution systems. By enabling faster data exchange and processing, the alliance seeks to improve the efficiency and reliability of critical infrastructure.
key_takeaways: The Utility Broadband Alliance is dedicated to supporting private broadband networks for critical infrastructure, including the power generation sector.
Private broadband adoption is crucial for power grid modernization, enabling the integration of advanced technologies such as IoT and analytics into power systems.
The alliance's efforts are aimed at accelerating data exchange and processing, leading to improved efficiency and reliability in power generation and distribution.

articles.title: Spain deploys 1.13 GW of solar for self-consumption in 2025
articles.summary: Spain's solar self-consumption capacity reached 9.3 GW in 2025, with a cumulative growth of 1.14 GW. The market experienced a slowdown, with the residential segment declining by 17% and commercial installations down 15%. This marks a phase of market stabilization after several years of rapid growth.
key_takeaways: Spain's solar self-consumption capacity grew by 3.7% in 2025, reaching a cumulative 9.3 GW.
The residential segment saw a decline of 17% in new installations, primarily due to the phase-out of tax incentives and reduced surplus electricity compensation.
The commercial segment also declined by 15%, while industrial and off-grid segments showed greater resilience, indicating potential opportunities for growth in these sectors.

articles.title: Data center survey reveals majority believe renewables and BESS are the ideal energy mix, power issues start in 2027
articles.summary: The 2026 Data Center Development Survey conducted by Foley & Lardner LLP reveals that the majority of respondents believe renewables and Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) are the ideal energy mix for data centers. The single greatest obstacle to successful data center development between now and 2030 is cited as "energy availability and redundancy". The survey highlights the growing demand for sustainable and reliable infrastructure to power the rapidly expanding data center sector.
key_takeaways: 54% of respondents consider "energy availability and redundancy" as the single greatest obstacle to successful data center development between now and 2030, indicating a significant focus on ensuring reliable energy supply.

The ideal energy mix for data centers is largely renewables (41%), followed by natural gas (17%), nuclear (16%), and BESS (14%), with 55% of respondents agreeing that renewables are the most suitable option.

The survey suggests that there is a growing recognition of the importance of matching renewable energy sources with data center demand, highlighting the need for sustainable and reliable infrastructure to support the rapidly expanding data center sector.

articles.title: Brazil curtails 20% of solar and wind output in 2025, with losses at $1.2 billion
articles.summary: Brazil experienced a significant curtailment of its solar and wind output in 2025, wasting an estimated $1.23 billion due to grid constraints and demand mismatches. The power system was pushed close to operational safety limits on 16 days, marking an unprecedented period of renewable oversupply. This structural shift in system risk dynamics highlights the need for improved grid management and flexibility.
key_takeaways: Brazil curtailed approximately 20% of its solar and wind generation in 2025, resulting in estimated losses of BRL 6.5 billion ($1.23 billion).

The power system approached operational safety limits on 16 days in 2025 due to excess electricity supply rather than scarcity, indicating a shift from scarcity-driven curtailments to oversupply-related ones.

Peak losses were attributed to a combination of operational limitations, grid congestion, and insufficient flexibility to absorb surplus power, particularly during weekends when reduced economic activity coincides with high solar output and transmission constraints.

articles.title: Europe contracts nearly 24 GWh of BESS under flexibility purchase agreements in 2025
articles.summary: The European energy market saw a significant surge in flexibility purchases and battery energy storage systems (BESS) contracts in 2025, with nearly 24 GWh of BESS capacity contracted under flexibility purchase agreements and optimization structures. This represents a tripling of the volume recorded in 2024. The growth is driven by the emergence of new buyer profiles, including traders, insurers, and hedge funds, and innovative financial structures such as tolls and day-ahead swaps.
key_takeaways: Nearly 24 GWh of BESS capacity was contracted under flexibility purchase agreements and optimization structures in 2025, tripling the volume recorded in 2024.
Flexibility purchases have become a backbone for BESS bankability, unlocking infrastructure-style capital and enabling rapid expansion into new markets beyond Great Britain.
The growth is driven by innovative financial structures such as tolls and day-ahead swaps, which have become mainstream, and new buyer profiles entering the flexibility market.

articles.title: The AI boom needs power. Tariffs can make it fair.
articles.summary: The article discusses how large load tariffs can be used to deliver community benefits, promote clean and reliable power, and enhance energy resilience. This approach is seen as a way to make the AI boom more sustainable. The use of tariffs in this context allows for more equitable distribution of costs.
key_takeaways: Large load tariffs can be used to deliver community benefits, such as investing in renewable energy projects or providing low-income households with affordable electricity.
These tariffs can help lock in clean and reliable power by incentivizing utilities to prioritize renewable energy sources over fossil fuels.
By strengthening energy resilience through large load tariffs, communities can better weather extreme weather events and ensure a stable energy supply.

articles.title: Xylem Advances Grid Intelligence with Sensus Evolve Platform
articles.summary: Xylem Inc. has launched its new intelligent grid platform, Sensus Evolve, designed to help electric utilities gain deeper insights, act faster, and adapt to a rapidly changing energy landscape.
key_takeaways: The Sensus Evolve platform aims to provide electric utilities with enhanced grid intelligence.
The platform is designed to enable utilities to respond more quickly to changes in the energy landscape.
Xylem Inc. offers its water solutions expertise alongside the launch of the Sensus Evolve platform, suggesting an expansion of their product offerings into energy management solutions.

articles.title: New 1 MW Ammonia-to-Power System Leverages Hydrogen Fuel Cells for Zero-Emission Shipping
articles.summary: A joint project by Vinssen, Samsung Heavy Industries (SHI), and Amogy aims to install a 1 MW-class ammonia-to-power system on commercial vessels, leveraging hydrogen fuel cells for zero-emission shipping. The system utilizes clean ammonia and proton exchange membrane fuel cells to produce electricity without direct combustion. This innovation targets industrial decarbonization, offering a drop-in replacement for marine diesel generators.
key_takeaways: A 1 MW-class ammonia-to-power system is being installed on commercial vessels, utilizing hydrogen fuel cells for zero-emission shipping.
The system uses clean ammonia and proton exchange membrane fuel cells to produce electricity without direct combustion, offering a potential solution for industrial decarbonization.

The project's modularity and ability to plug into existing fuel bunkering setups make it an attractive option for ship operators, potentially reducing the complexity and cost associated with hydrogen-based solutions.

articles.title: China added 66.43 GW of new-type energy storage in 2025
articles.summary: China's energy storage capacity reached a significant milestone in 2025, with a total of 213.3 GW of power-sector energy storage installed. The majority of new installations were non-pumped storage technologies, accounting for 67.9% of the total. This growth is attributed to a shift toward longer-duration configurations and standalone energy storage applications.
key_takeaways: China added 66.43 GW of new-type energy storage in 2025, bringing the country's cumulative power-sector energy storage capacity to 213.3 GW.
Non-pumped storage technologies accounted for 67.9% of the total installed capacity, while "new-type" energy storage made up around 144.7 GW.
The shift towards longer-duration configurations is evident, with the average duration of energy storage systems increasing to 2.58 hours in 2025 (from 2.11 hours in 2021).

Standalone energy storage applications have become the leading scenario, accounting for 58% of new installations, while user-side storage and thermal-plus-storage frequency regulation accounted for significantly lower percentages.

articles.title: IBM Advances Quantum Computing with Nighthawk for Clean Energy Transformations
articles.summary: IBM has made significant advancements in quantum computing with the development of Nighthawk, a system designed to transform clean energy technologies. The company's Quantum Technology labs have witnessed firsthand the potential of quantum computing in addressing real-world problems. This breakthrough aims to contribute to the growth of clean energy.
key_takeaways: IBM has developed a quantum computing system called Nighthawk, which is intended to support advancements in clean energy technologies.
The development of Nighthawk marks an important step forward for IBM's Quantum Technology labs, which are exploring the potential applications of quantum computing.
The goal of Nighthawk is to transform clean energy systems through the use of quantum computing, indicating a focus on sustainability and environmental impact.

articles.title: US Governors in PJM territory move to unlock renewable energy, energy storage investment
articles.summary: The Governors of Maryland and New Jersey have passed legislation to increase the deployment of clean energy technologies, aiming to address concerns over energy costs and supply. This move is part of a larger trend in the US to invest in renewable energy and energy storage. The legislation aims to accelerate the transition towards a more sustainable energy mix.
key_takeaways: The passage of legislation by Governors of Maryland and New Jersey indicates a growing commitment to clean energy technologies, with both states looking to address energy cost and supply concerns.
Accelerating renewable energy deployment is likely to involve investments in various clean energy sources, such as solar, wind, and geothermal power.
Energy storage, which was mentioned in the article, is also expected to play a crucial role in the transition towards a more sustainable energy mix.

articles.title: Solar-plus-storage for data centers: not a simple switch
articles.summary: The article discusses the integration of solar-plus-storage systems in data centers, highlighting that it's not a simple switch and requires careful planning, active grids, and a holistic approach. Gerhard Salge, Hitachi Energy's CTO, emphasizes the importance of flexibility and coordination between renewable energy generation and data center demand. He stresses that successful implementation requires addressing grid dynamics, changing demand patterns, and leveraging various storage options.
key_takeaways: Active grids are crucial for integrating solar-plus-storage systems in data centers, as they enable real-time management and optimization of power generation and consumption.
A holistic approach is necessary to ensure technical feasibility, economic viability, and energy system resilience when powering data centers with renewable energy and storage solutions.
Flexibility is key to addressing the changing demand patterns and grid dynamics associated with increased adoption of solar-plus-storage systems in data centers.

articles.title: Tesla, Chint Power lead new long-duration storage leaderboard
articles.summary: The article reports on a new long-duration energy storage (LDES) leaderboard by Sightline Climate, which ranks the top providers of lithium-ion battery-based long-duration energy storage. Tesla and Chint Power are currently at the top of the leaderboard, followed by mechanical storage providers such as Energy Dome. This leaderboard aims to provide a snapshot of the LDES market's key players.
key_takeaways: Lithium-ion battery makers Tesla and Chint Power lead the new long-duration energy storage (LDES) leaderboard globally, indicating their dominance in this technology.

Mechanical storage providers like Italy's Energy Dome are also prominently featured on the leaderboard, highlighting their growing presence in the post-finals investment decision (FID) projects that are reshaping the competitive landscape.

The LDES leaderboard, developed by Sightline Climate over 15 months, focuses on key factors such as technology performance, financial profile, deployment track record, and economics and cost to accurately rank players.

articles.title: Tesla energy storage deployments jumped in ‘crucial AI transformation year’; company expects margin compression in 2026
articles.summary: Tesla reported a significant increase in energy storage deployments and revenue growth in 2025, driven by the increasing demand for its products. However, the company expects challenges from low-cost competition and policy factors to impact its margins in 2026. Despite these challenges, Tesla's energy storage business is expected to continue growing.
key_takeaways: Tesla achieved a record number of energy storage deployments in 2025, indicating strong demand for its products.
The company's revenue growth was also significant, suggesting that its energy storage business is becoming increasingly profitable.
However, Tesla expects margins to compress in 2026 due to increased competition from low-cost suppliers and policy factors.

articles.title: India renewables seek policy clarity, storage incentives in Union Budget 2026
articles.summary: The renewable energy industry in India is seeking policy clarity and incentives from the government to unlock stalled projects, lower financing costs, and accelerate domestic manufacturing. The upcoming Union Budget 2026 must prioritize in-house technology development, provide clarity on delayed power purchase agreements (PPAs) and power sale agreements (PSAs), and introduce production-linked incentives for battery energy storage system (BESS) manufacturing. This will help India achieve self-reliance in solar technologies and position itself as a globally competitive market.
key_takeaways: The government should prioritize in-house technology development to enable India to achieve self-reliance in solar technologies and indigenize next-generation technologies.

Clarity on delayed power purchase agreements (PPAs) and power sale agreements (PSAs) is crucial to accelerate the signing of renewable energy projects, with over 45 GW of capacity facing large delays.

The Union Budget 2026 should introduce production-linked incentives for battery energy storage system (BESS) manufacturing, establish an Approved List of BESS Integrators (ALBI), and lower the cost of capital through priority sector lending.

articles.title: Australian renewables exceed 50% of power supply in Q4
articles.summary: Renewable energy has reached a significant milestone in Australia, accounting for more than half of the country's power supply in Q4 2025. This shift has led to lower wholesale power prices by nearly 50% and coincided with record battery output. The Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO) reports that coal-fired generation and gas-fired output have decreased significantly during this period.
key_takeaways: Renewable energy has surpassed 50% of Australia's power supply, contributing to reduced wholesale power prices and improved grid resilience.
Coal-fired generation and gas-fired output have declined sharply, with coal-fired generation falling 4.6% year on year and gas-fired output dropping 27% to its lowest level in 25 years.
Battery discharge has increased significantly, nearly tripling in the fourth quarter, highlighting the growing importance of energy storage in maintaining reliable and stable power supply.

articles.title: Uncertainty looms as U.S. solar PPA prices climb for second straight quarter
articles.summary: Solar power purchase agreement (PPA) prices in North America rose 3.2% in Q4 2025, marking a nearly 9% year-over-year increase, as developers and buyers navigate a complex regulatory environment. The "post-OBBBA" regulatory landscape has led to a shift in pricing dynamics, with some developers removing risk premiums due to the increased clarity around tax credit retention. Despite these challenges, over 75% of projects slated for online deployment before 2029 expect to successfully retain access to tax credits.
key_takeaways: Solar PPA prices rose 3.2% in Q4 2025, with a nearly 9% year-over-year increase, driven by policy headwinds and a shifting tax credit landscape.
The "post-OBBBA" regulatory environment has led to increased pricing uncertainty, but developers are adapting by removing risk premiums and dialing in pricing.
Despite the challenges, over 75% of projects slated for online deployment before 2029 expect to successfully retain access to tax credits, providing some clarity on the future of PPA prices.

articles.title: Unleashing a solar plus storage tidal wave
articles.summary: The article discusses the potential of solar plus storage systems to unlock latent distribution grid capacity, enabling a larger share of renewable energy in the grid. Solar plus storage can stabilize the grid and provide backup power during outages. This approach has the potential to transform the way we manage energy distribution.
key_takeaways: Solar plus storage systems can help stabilize the distribution grid by providing a buffer against variability in solar energy output.
By leveraging energy storage, solar plus storage systems can ensure a stable supply of electricity and provide backup power during outages.
The use of solar plus storage can enable a larger share of renewable energy sources in the grid, reducing dependence on fossil fuels and mitigating climate change.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence in energy markets: The case for AI-ready data and human expertise
articles.summary: The article discusses the importance of combining artificial intelligence (AI) with human expertise in energy markets. As power markets continue to evolve rapidly, AI can help analyze and process large amounts of data more efficiently, while human expertise provides critical judgment and decision-making capabilities. This synergy between AI and human expertise is crucial for utilities and other market participants to stay ahead.
key_takeaways: Combining AI with human expertise can help utilities better analyze and respond to changes in power markets.
AI can process large amounts of data more efficiently, allowing for faster decision-making and improved forecasting.
Human expertise is essential for providing critical judgment and decision-making capabilities that AI systems may not be able to replicate alone.

articles.title: New Pumped Hydro Energy Storage System Needs No Mountains
articles.summary: A new, compact pumped hydro energy storage system has been developed that can operate without the need for mountains, potentially reducing costs and environmental impacts associated with traditional mountain-based systems.
key_takeaways: The new pumped hydro energy storage system uses lower elevations and sloping hills to store energy, avoiding the high costs of building on mountains.
This innovation could lead to more widespread adoption of pumped hydro energy storage, making it a more viable option for renewable energy integration.
By reducing the need for mountainous terrain, this technology has the potential to minimize environmental impacts and increase efficiency in energy production.

articles.title: BW ESS proposes 1.6GWh battery energy storage facility for the Hunter Valley in Australia
articles.summary: BW ESS has proposed a 1,600MWh battery energy storage system in the Hunter Valley region of New South Wales, Australia. The facility aims to provide energy storage services for renewable energy sources and improve grid resilience. The project is subject to approval under the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act.
key_takeaways: BW ESS plans to deploy a 1,600MWh battery energy storage system in the Hunter Valley region of New South Wales, Australia.
The facility aims to provide energy storage services for renewable energy sources and enhance grid resilience.

The project is subject to approval under the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act, which suggests that environmental impact assessments will be conducted as part of the application process.

articles.title: Origin Energy begins generating revenue from two utility-scale battery storage sites in Australia
articles.summary: Origin Energy has started generating revenue from two utility-scale battery storage projects, Supernode and Eraring Stage 1, located in Queensland and New South Wales, Australia. The company's investment in these projects is expected to provide a steady stream of income through the sale of electricity. This marks an important milestone for Origin Energy as it transitions towards a more renewable energy-focused business model.
key_takeaways: Origin Energy has successfully begun generating revenue from its utility-scale battery storage projects, demonstrating the feasibility of large-scale energy storage in Australia.
The company's investment in these projects is part of its strategy to diversify into clean energy sources and reduce its reliance on fossil fuels.
The commencement of revenue generation at Supernode and Eraring Stage 1 marks an important step towards Origin Energy's goal of becoming a more sustainable energy provider.

articles.title: Energy Management Strategies for Electric Aircraft Charging Leveraging Active Landside Vehicle-to-Grid
articles.summary: The article discusses energy management strategies for electric aircraft charging, leveraging active landside vehicle-to-grid (V2G) capabilities to alleviate pressure on grid connections at airports. The authors propose a cost-optimal apron and landside V2G charge scheduling framework, which shows potential cost savings of up to 32% compared to a baseline scenario without V2G. This approach also has beneficial effects on the local power grid.
key_takeaways: The study formulates an optimal energy management problem as a linear program to coordinate joint aircraft charging and landside V2G dynamics, using partial differential equations to model electric vehicle fleet charging.
Deploying V2G at even a single airport can reduce energy costs for charging the aircraft fleet by up to 32%, depending on the schedule and amount of participating vehicles.
The proposed concept also has other benefits, including reducing potential power peaks in the local grid and contributing to a more sustainable air mobility solution.

articles.title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Co-Design and Operation of Chiller and Thermal Energy Storage for Cost-Optimal HVAC Systems
articles.summary: The article explores the use of reinforcement learning to optimize the co-design and operation of chiller and thermal energy storage systems for commercial HVAC systems, aiming to minimize life-cycle cost over a 30-year horizon. The study formulates a finite-horizon Markov Decision Process (MDP) to model the chiller operation problem and uses a Deep Q Network (DQN) with a constrained action space to learn an optimal policy. This approach enables the identification of the optimal chiller and thermal energy storage capacities.
key_takeaways: The study addresses the non-trivial co-design problem of balancing the costs of increasing chiller capacity versus thermal energy storage capacity, which is driven by strong asymmetry in capital costs.
A reinforcement learning-based approach using a finite-horizon Markov Decision Process (MDP) and a Deep Q Network (DQN) is used to optimize the chiller operation policy.

The optimal chiller and thermal energy storage capacities are determined to be 700 and 1500, respectively, through a life-cycle cost minimization over feasible configurations that satisfy the cooling demand.

articles.title: Degradation-Aware Frequency Regulation of a Heterogeneous Battery Fleet via Reinforcement Learning
articles.summary: This article discusses the challenges of managing a heterogeneous battery fleet for frequency regulation and grid balancing, with a focus on minimizing long-term cycling degradation. The authors propose a reinforcement learning approach using Extreme Learning Machines (ELMs) to optimize the scheduling of the battery fleet. The proposed method is designed to address the path-dependent nature of cycling degradation.
key_takeaways: The study addresses the challenge of managing a heterogeneous battery fleet, which are increasingly deployed for grid balancing and frequency regulation.

The authors propose a reinforcement learning approach using Extreme Learning Machines (ELMs) to optimize the scheduling of the battery fleet, addressing the path-dependent nature of cycling degradation.
The proposed method demonstrates consistent reductions in cycle-depth occurrence and degradation metrics compared to baseline scheduling policies.

articles.title: EPRI Suggests Path to Limit Grid Costs of Data Center Surge
articles.summary: The Energy Policy Institute (EPRI) suggests that the rapid addition of large loads to the grid, such as data centers, does not necessarily have to raise electricity rates. In fact, if the incremental costs of serving these new loads are below the current average costs, they can actually lower the average retail rates for all customers on the grid, provided there is excess grid capacity or a relatively cheap source of new electrons.
key_takeaways: If the incremental costs of serving new loads, such as data centers, are below the current average costs, they can potentially lower the average retail rates for all customers on the grid.

However, if expensive grid investments are needed to serve these new loads or if the demand from these loads reduces before those investments are paid for, prices could rise for other customers on the grid.
The key to achieving a "win-win" scenario is to have planning, pricing structures, and flexible demand in place to manage the growing electricity needs of data centers and other large loads.
The study suggests that understanding how load growth interacts with system costs is crucial in shaping the future energy landscape.

articles.title: SpaceX Proposes One Million Solar Powered Data Centers In Earth Orbit
articles.summary: SpaceX has proposed a plan to place one million solar-powered data centers in Earth orbit, aiming to power the next generation of artificial intelligence (AI). The idea is to utilize space-based solar power to provide clean and renewable energy. This initiative suggests a potential breakthrough in energy storage and transmission.
key_takeaways: SpaceX plans to deploy one million solar-powered data centers in Earth orbit to power AI systems.
The proposal aims to harness the benefits of space-based solar power for clean and renewable energy generation.
The initiative could potentially address global energy demands and provide a solution for sustainable energy storage and transmission.

articles.title: N.Y. Reports Minimal Increase in Renewable Power
articles.summary:
Here is the requested analysis:


New York has made a small increase in renewable power, with renewables providing 23.6% of electricity in 2024, up from 23.2% in 2023. However, the state's grid remains heavily reliant on carbon-based fuels, and progress towards a cleaner grid has been slow. The report also notes that hydroelectric output decreased significantly between 2014 and 2024.
key_takeaways: New York has made a small increase in renewable power, with solar output increasing by 898.2% from 2014 to 2024, but still only accounting for 4.5% of the system mix.
The state's grid remains heavily reliant on carbon-based fuels, with natural gas providing 50.5% of electricity in 2024 and combustion remaining indispensable to New York's grids.

Progress towards a cleaner grid has been slow, with hydroelectric output decreasing by 28.6% between 2014 and 2024, and the largest source of carbon-free electricity being commercial nuclear reactors rather than renewables.

articles.title: RWE starting construction on 400MW/800MWh Germany BESS
articles.summary: RWE is starting construction on a 400MW/800MWh Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) project in Germany, one of the largest projects to reach the construction stage. This project aims to contribute to the country's increasing demand for renewable energy storage. The announcement comes as another large BESS project, from Kyon Energy, has connected to the grid, marking a significant milestone.
key_takeaways: RWE's 400MW/800MWh BESS project in Germany is one of the largest projects to reach the construction stage, highlighting increasing investment in renewable energy storage.
The announcement coincides with another large BESS project, from Kyon Energy, having connected to the grid, possibly marking the largest milestone for a single project in Germany.
This development indicates a growing trend towards integrating more energy storage solutions to support the integration of intermittent renewable energy sources and meet increasing energy demand.
The projects' focus on contributing to Germany's renewable energy goals suggests that energy storage is becoming an increasingly important aspect of the country's energy strategy.

articles.title: How Norway Accomplished a Near-Total EV Transition
articles.summary: Norway has made significant progress in its electric vehicle (EV) transition, with over 97% of new car registrations being electric as of November 2025. The country's government implemented various incentives to encourage the adoption of EVs, including tax exemptions and reduced fares for ferry travel. As a result, Norway is now re-evaluating some of these incentives due to the high level of EV adoption.
key_takeaways: Norway's government implemented several incentives to promote the adoption of electric vehicles, including tax exemptions, reduced ferry fares, free parking, and access to bus lanes.
The country's efforts have been successful, with over 97% of new car registrations being electric as of November 2025, indicating a high level of EV adoption.

Despite the success, policymakers are now re-evaluating some incentives due to the high level of EV adoption, suggesting that Norway may need to adapt its policies to ensure continued growth in this area.

articles.title: Mott MacDonald to advise UK government on Sizewell C
articles.summary: Mott MacDonald has been awarded a contract by the UK government to provide technical advisory services for the Sizewell C nuclear power plant project, supporting government oversight of the project. The company will deliver expert advice on technical matters related to the project. This contract highlights Mott MacDonald's expertise in the energy sector.
key_takeaways: Mott MacDonald has been awarded a contract by the UK Department for Energy Security and Net Zero to provide technical advisory services for the Sizewell C nuclear power plant project.
The company will deliver expert advice on technical matters related to the project, supporting government oversight of the development.
This contract demonstrates Mott MacDonald's expertise in the energy sector, particularly in nuclear power plant projects.

articles.title: IESO Seeks Input on RFP for 3rd Toronto Transmission Line
articles.summary: The Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO) of Ontario is seeking input on its Request for Proposal (RFP) for the construction of a third transmission line, known as the Toronto Third Line (TTL), which will be a high-voltage direct current (HVDC) line under Lake Ontario. The line aims to meet a potential doubling of Toronto's electricity demand by 2050 and was approved by Ontario's Minister of Energy and Mines in January 2025. The IESO is planning to close the competitive procurement process in 2027, with an expected completion date of 2037.
key_takeaways: The Toronto Third Line (TTL) is a $1.5 billion HVDC line that will become the third major supply line for Toronto and aim to meet a potential doubling of electricity demand by 2050.

The IESO has already opened enrollment in its Transmitter Selection Framework (TSF) Registry, which prequalifies transmission companies for competitive procurements, with two companies, Fortis and Emera, currently approved for listing.

The competitive procurement process is expected to close in 2027, with proposals due in the third quarter of that year and an award likely to be made by the end of the year; the projected completion date is 2037.

articles.title: Aquifer Thermal Energy System Comes To Minnesota
articles.summary: A new aquifer thermal energy system has been implemented in St. Paul, Minnesota, promising to significantly reduce utility bills for residents by lowering them by 50 percent or more. This innovative technology utilizes the natural heat of the earth to provide renewable energy. The implementation is a significant step towards promoting clean and sustainable energy solutions in the region.
key_takeaways: An aquifer thermal energy system has been successfully implemented in St. Paul, Minnesota, aiming to reduce utility bills for residents.

articles.title: Learning to Dial-a-Ride: A Deep Graph Reinforcement Learning Approach to the Electric Dial-a-Ride Problem
articles.summary: The article proposes a deep graph reinforcement learning approach to address the Electric Dial-a-Ride Problem, which incorporates limited battery capacity and nonlinear charging dynamics. The method operates on edge attributes such as travel time and energy consumption to capture non-Euclidean routing costs in real road networks. By jointly optimizing routing, charging, and service quality, the approach achieves solutions within 0.4% of best-known results while reducing computation times.
key_takeaways: The proposed deep reinforcement learning approach uses a graph neural network encoder and an attention-driven route construction policy to capture non-Euclidean and energy-dependent routing costs in real road networks.
The method jointly optimizes routing, charging, and service quality without relying on Euclidean assumptions or handcrafted heuristics, achieving solutions within 0.4% of best-known results.

The approach outperforms Adaptive Large Neighborhood Search (ALNS) by 9.5% in solution quality while achieving 100% service completion, even on large-scale instances with realistic energy models and nonlinear charging dynamics.

articles.title: Physics Informed Reconstruction of Four-Dimensional Atmospheric Wind Fields Using Multi-UAS Swarm Observations in a Synthetic Turbulent Environment
articles.summary: The article presents a framework for reconstructing four-dimensional atmospheric wind fields using measurements from a coordinated Unmanned Aircraft System (UAS) swarm. A synthetic turbulence environment and high-fidelity multirotor simulation are used to generate training and evaluation data, which is then processed by a physics-informed neural network (PINN) to estimate local wind components and reconstruct a continuous wind field in space and time. The results show that coordinated UAS measurements can accurately recover the dominant spatial and temporal structure of the wind field up to 1000 m altitude.
key_takeaways: Accurate reconstruction of atmospheric wind fields is crucial for applications like weather forecasting, hazard prediction, and wind energy assessment, but conventional instruments have spatio-temporal gaps in the lower atmospheric boundary layer.
A coordinated UAS swarm can provide flexible in situ measurements, but individual platforms sample wind only along their flight trajectories, limiting full wind-field recovery.

The proposed framework uses a bidirectional long short-term memory network (Bi-LSTM) to estimate local wind components and assimilate them into a physics-informed neural network (PINN) to reconstruct a continuous wind field in space and time.

The method starts by reducing simulations to regress voltage versus current curves of a thermo-resistor and then applies it to building energy consumption, aiming to minimize energy waste and financial advantages. By using this approach, the total time spent to map all possible consumption scenarios is reduced by around 7 times.
key_takeaways: The article proposes an active learning approach to reduce computational effort in simulating building energy efficiency.
A surrogate model of energy consumption is implemented to learn the consumption pattern based on a limited number of simulations.
By using this approach, the total time spent to map all possible consumption scenarios is reduced by around 7 times.

articles.title: SmartMeterFM: Unifying Smart Meter Data Generative Tasks Using Flow Matching Models
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel approach to unifying diverse smart meter data generative tasks using flow matching models, eliminating the need for re-training by injecting different tasks into the generation process. This allows for consistent and realistic data generation with better performance against interpolation and machine learning-based baselines. The approach aims to address issues such as missing data imputation, super-resolution, and synthetic data generation.
key_takeaways: Flow matching models are proposed to unify diverse smart meter data generative tasks into a single model trained for conditional generation.
By injecting different tasks into the generation process, the need for re-training is eliminated, allowing for consistent and realistic data generation.
The approach has shown better performance against interpolation and machine learning-based baselines dedicated to specific tasks such as imputation and super-resolution.

articles.title: A Thermal-Electrical Co-Optimization Framework for Active Distribution Grids with Electric Vehicles and Heat Pumps
articles.summary: The article proposes a unified co-optimization framework for Active Distribution Networks (ADNs) that integrates thermal comfort, Distributed Energy Resource (DER) limits, and power flow physics to optimize the operation of Electric Vehicles (EVs), Heat Pumps (HPs), and photovoltaic systems. The framework uses Second-Order Cone Programming (SOCP) relaxations to maintain computational tractability while maintaining exactness in practice. Simulation results show significant reductions in transformer aging, losses, and voltage violations.
key_takeaways: The proposed co-optimization framework can effectively integrate thermal-electrical coordination in future smart grids, achieving near-optimal performance even at high DER penetration levels.
Convex DistFlow formulation achieves sub-second runtimes while maintaining near-optimal performance, making it a suitable option for real-time optimization of ADNs.
Coordinated scheduling using the proposed framework results in significant reductions in transformer aging (41%), losses (54%), and complete elimination of voltage violations.

articles.title: Decentralized Analysis Approach for Oscillation Damping in Grid-Forming and Grid-Following Heterogeneous Power Systems
articles.summary: The article proposes a decentralized local gain condition (LGC) to achieve oscillation damping in power systems dominated by inverter-based resources. The LGC constrains the dynamic gain between each inverter and the network, allowing for system-wide damping without requiring global information. This approach is suitable for heterogeneous systems with different inverter dynamics.
key_takeaways: The proposed decentralized local gain condition (LGC) can guarantee oscillation damping in power systems dominated by inverter-based resources.
The LGC constrains the dynamic gain between each inverter and the network, allowing for system-wide damping without requiring global information.
The approach is agnostic to different inverter dynamics, making it suitable for heterogeneous systems, and flexible to various damping requirements.

articles.title: Comparative Assessment of Look-Ahead Economic Dispatch and Ramp Products for Grid Flexibility
articles.summary: The article compares look-ahead economic dispatch (LAED) and ramp products (RPs) for grid flexibility in high renewable penetration systems. It finds that an enhanced RP formulation can match LAED's dispatch feasible region at a single time step with additional intertemporal deliverability constraints, but this equivalence does not persist under rolling-window operation due to different optimization objectives. The study highlights the limitations of current ramp product implementations and suggests enhancements.
key_takeaways: An enhanced RP formulation can match LAED's dispatch feasible region at a single time step when certain constraints are enforced, suggesting potential operational equivalence between the two methods.
However, this equivalence does not generally persist under rolling-window operation due to differences in optimization objectives between LAED and RPs.
LAED achieves similar or lower load shedding than RP implementations with the same look-ahead horizon, particularly under high-load, ramp-limited conditions.

articles.title: Reformulating Energy Storage Capacity Accreditation Problem with Marginal Reliability Impact
articles.summary: The article reformulates the energy storage capacity accreditation problem using Marginal Reliability Impact (MRI) to enhance the efficiency of capacity markets. It provides new insights into energy storage capacity accreditation and explores the influence of qualified capacity, storage dispatch rules, and other key factors on storage accreditation. The analysis demonstrates that the EUE is a piecewise linear function and highlights the importance of MRI in evaluating energy storage capacity.
key_takeaways: The article reformulates the reliability-based storage dispatch model as an optimization problem, enabling direct calculation of Marginal Reliability Impact (MRI) from Lagrange multipliers.
Storage accreditation retains a non-negative property across various system scenarios, providing valuable guidance for policymakers in setting future standards.
Numerical results from a modified California system validate the findings and highlight several important phenomena associated with the MRI-based accreditation scheme.

articles.title: Volt/VAR Optimization in Transmission Networks with Discrete-Control Devices
articles.summary: The article presents a framework for optimizing voltage and reactive power control in transmission networks, specifically focusing on the co-optimization of discrete control devices such as OLTCs and capacitor banks. The framework aims to improve voltage stability and minimize VAR generation while maintaining economic operation and compatibility with real-time transmission operations. The results show consistent improvements in voltage and VAR quality metrics.
key_takeaways: The proposed VVO framework combines relaxation, rounding, and solving stages to co-optimize discrete control devices for improved voltage stability and reduced VAR generation.
Extensive experiments on various systems (IEEE, PEGASE, and RTE) demonstrate the effectiveness of the framework in achieving consistent improvements in voltage and VAR quality metrics.
The framework's approach enables modest generator redispatch while preserving economic operation, making it a viable solution for real-time transmission operations.

articles.title: Spatiotemporal Continual Learning for Mobile Edge UAV Networks: Mitigating Catastrophic Forgetting
articles.summary: The article proposes a Spatiotemporal Continual Learning (STCL) framework for mitigating catastrophic forgetting in mobile edge UAV networks. The proposed G-MAPPO algorithm integrates dynamic $z$-score normalization to balance heterogeneous objectives and leverages the 3D mobility of UAVs as a spatial compensation layer. This approach enables the swarm to adapt to changing environments without requiring offline retraining or computationally expensive model resets.
key_takeaways: The conventional Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) approaches suffer from catastrophic forgetting when transitioning between distinct task scenarios, leading to service interruptions.
The proposed G-MAPPO algorithm integrates a novel Group-Decoupled Policy Optimization (GDPO) mechanism that utilizes dynamic $z$-score normalization to autonomously balance heterogeneous objectives.

The STCL framework achieves superior resilience and delivers an effective capacity gain of 20% under extreme traffic loads, validating its potential as a scalable solution for edge-enabled aerial swarms.

articles.title: NERC Warns Long-Term Grid Reliability Risks Mounting from Surging Demand, Lagging Resources
articles.summary: The North American electric grid faces significant reliability risks over the next decade due to growing demand driven by data centers and artificial intelligence, which threatens to outpace resource additions. A recent assessment by NERC warns that 13 of 23 regions will face elevated or high resource adequacy risks, with some regions already meeting baseline criteria but facing potential shortfalls under extreme weather conditions. This poses a significant challenge for grid operators to ensure reliable energy supply.
key_takeaways: 13 out of 23 North American assessment areas are expected to face elevated or high resource adequacy risks over the next five years due to growing demand and lagging resources.
Planned resources in regions such as MISO, PJM, Texas RE-ERCOT, WECC-Northwest, WECC-Basin, and SERC-Central would result in energy shortfalls exceeding adequacy targets.
Regions facing elevated-risk areas meet baseline criteria but may face potential shortfalls under extreme weather conditions, highlighting the need for grid operators to develop contingency plans.

articles.title: SEIA elects new board chair, board members to spearhead American solar + storage progress
articles.summary: The Solar Energy Industries Association (SEIA) has elected Scott Moskowitz of Qcells as its new board chair, with Dr. Ingmar Ritzenhofen serving as vice chair. This leadership change aims to advance American solar and storage progress in the industry. The new board members will focus on driving innovation and growth in the sector.
key_takeaways: Scott Moskowitz's election as SEIA board chair indicates a commitment to advancing American solar energy and storage capabilities.
The selection of Dr. Ingmar Ritzenhofen as vice chair suggests a focus on strategic leadership and policy guidance for the industry.
With these new leaders, the SEIA is likely to prioritize initiatives that promote innovation, growth, and job creation in the solar and storage sectors.

articles.title: Sungrow brings grid-forming PowerTitan 3.0 storage system to Europe
articles.summary: Sungrow is introducing its PowerTitan 3.0 energy storage system to the European market, featuring grid-forming capability, next-generation battery cells, and DC coupling for co-located solar projects. The system offers a range of options for developers, from standard container formats to larger AC blocks that can be formed by connecting multiple units. Sungrow's PowerTitan 3.0 aims to address growing demand for energy storage solutions in Europe.
key_takeaways: The PowerTitan 3.0 storage system features grid-forming capability and DC coupling, which is key to meeting the increasing demand for co-located solar-storage projects in Europe.
The system offers flexible deployment options, including standard container formats (10- and 20-foot) and larger AC blocks that can be formed by connecting multiple units.

New battery cells with a high volumetric energy density of over 440 Wh/L enable four hours of storage in a single 20-foot container, reducing the system's own energy consumption by around 10% compared to previous models.

articles.title: Does solar really need subsidies? How successful renewable energy projects are adapting in 2026
articles.summary: The renewable energy microgrid market is facing challenges related to funding and interconnection, according to experts. Despite these hurdles, successful projects are adapting and finding ways to overcome them. The article highlights the evolving landscape of renewable energy projects in 2026.
key_takeaways: The renewable energy microgrid market is evolving due to funding and interconnection challenges, which may impact its growth and development.
Successful renewable energy projects are finding innovative ways to address these challenges and adapt to the changing market landscape.
The success of renewable energy projects in overcoming funding and interconnection hurdles suggests that they have the potential to thrive despite existing obstacles.

articles.title: NextEra considering new nuclear capacity
articles.summary: NextEra Energy, a US utility, is considering expanding its nuclear power capacity by up to 6 GWe through small modular reactors (SMRs) at existing sites or new locations, primarily to meet growing demand from data centers.
key_takeaways: NextEra Energy plans to add up to 6 GWe of SMR generating capacity to support the increasing energy needs of data centers.
The expansion is expected to occur at either existing nuclear power plant sites or potential new sites.
This move aims to address the growing demand for clean and reliable energy sources in the US, particularly among data center operators.

articles.title: DOE nixes $1.8B loan to Arizona Public Service for transmission, renewables and storage
articles.summary: The US Department of Energy (DOE) has cancelled a $1.8 billion loan to Arizona Public Service (APS) for transmission, renewable energy projects, and storage facilities. The loan was part of the Advanced Technology Vehicles Manufacturing Loan Program (ATVM). Olivia Tinari, deputy press secretary for DOE's Office of Public Affairs, stated that additional de-obligations are in process but cannot be publicly disclosed until finalized.
key_takeaways: The US Department of Energy has cancelled a $1.8 billion loan to Arizona Public Service (APS) for various energy projects.
The loan was part of the Advanced Technology Vehicles Manufacturing Loan Program (ATVM), which supports the development of advanced technologies in the US automotive industry.
Details about additional de-obligations, which are still in process, cannot be publicly disclosed until they are finalized.

articles.title: How energy storage can help data centres reduce their grid impact
articles.summary: The article discusses how energy storage can help data centers reduce their impact on the grid, with industry experts viewing it as an opportunity for data centers to manage their energy consumption. Patrick Hughes from NEMA highlights the potential of energy storage in this context. No specific details are provided about the benefits or implementation strategies of energy storage for data centers.
key_takeaways: Energy storage is seen as a solution for data centers to reduce their impact on the grid, indicating a growing recognition of the importance of sustainability in the industry.

The article does not provide specific details on how energy storage can be implemented, suggesting that further information would be necessary to understand the implementation strategies and benefits.
Patrick Hughes' statement suggests that there is a shift towards exploring alternative solutions for data centers to manage their energy consumption and reduce their environmental footprint.

articles.title: Testing fault at 100 MW battery disrupts Estonia-Finland power link
articles.summary: A testing fault at Estonia's 100 MW Kiisa battery park caused a significant disturbance to the regional power grid, disrupting the EstLink interconnections between Estonia and Finland. The incident resulted in a loss of nearly 1 GW of capacity, equivalent to about 20% of the Baltic region's winter electricity load. The park's owner has publicly pointed to the battery manufacturer as the cause of the issue.
key_takeaways: A testing fault at the Kiisa battery park caused a severe disturbance to the regional power grid, resulting in a significant loss of capacity.
The incident occurred during final grid connection testing and was attributed to a tripped DC cable, which disrupted both EstLink 1 and EstLink 2 interconnections between Estonia and Finland.

The battery energy storage system, supplied by Nidec Conversion, is one of the largest in the Baltics, with a €100 million facility developed by Estonian company Evecon in partnership with French firms Corsica Sole and Mirova.

articles.title: FERC in 2026: Rising costs cloud regulators’ options on data centers, transmission and more
articles.summary: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) will face significant challenges in 2026, with rising energy costs clouding their ability to make decisions on data centers, transmission projects, and other energy-related matters. The Department of Energy's colocation proposal and transmission planning reforms will likely set the agenda for FERC this year. These developments come against a backdrop of growing concerns over affordability.
key_takeaways: Rising energy costs are expected to impact FERC's decision-making process, making it challenging for them to prioritize projects and make regulatory decisions.

The Department of Energy's colocation proposal and transmission planning reforms will likely shape FERC's agenda in 2026, potentially leading to new rules and regulations governing the energy industry.
Affordability concerns are growing, suggesting that FERC will need to balance economic growth with environmental and social responsibilities when making regulatory decisions.

articles.title: SolarEdge, Helioplant build 6.3 MW ‘cross-shaped’ bifacial PV system for Alpine regions
articles.summary: The article reports on a collaboration between SolarEdge and Helioplant to develop a 6.3 MW 'cross-shaped' bifacial PV system designed specifically for snowy Alpine regions with high elevation. The system, which combines Helioplant's unique cross design with SolarEdge's inverter and power optimization technology, is expected to address shading issues caused by the cross-structure. The first large-scale installation will power three ski resorts in Sölden, Austria.
key_takeaways: The cross-shaped bifacial PV system is designed to mitigate shading issues and optimize energy yields in snowy Alpine regions with high elevation.
Helioplant's unique design features air turbulence that prevents snow build-up from accumulating, while the albedo effect reflects light to the underside of the modules to boost energy yields.
SolarEdge's technology will power three ski resorts in Sölden, Austria, reducing reliance on grid electricity and addressing challenges posed by conventional PV installations in these regions.

articles.title: Tesla top, Energy Dome the highest non-lithium firm in new LDES supplier ranking
articles.summary: The latest long-duration energy storage (LDES) leaderboard ranks lithium-ion companies as the top suppliers, with Energy Dome, a CO2 Battery company, standing out as the highest non-lithium firm. This ranking suggests that lithium-ion batteries remain the dominant technology in LDES, while other alternatives are gaining traction. The leaderboard provides insights into the evolving energy storage landscape.
key_takeaways: Lithium-ion companies dominate the top spots on the LDES leaderboard, reinforcing their position as the leading technology in long-duration energy storage.
Energy Dome, a CO2 Battery company, achieves the highest ranking among non-lithium firms, indicating growing interest in alternative battery chemistries and technologies.
The leaderboard suggests that the energy storage industry is shifting towards more sustainable and environmentally friendly options, such as CO2 Battery technology.

articles.title: Petroleum electricity generation surpassed natural gas in New England during winter storm
articles.summary: During a recent winter storm in New England, petroleum electricity generation surpassed natural gas for the first time, highlighting the region's reliance on oil-fired units during periods of high demand. This was due to cold weather creating increased energy requirements. The shift towards petroleum as the primary energy source is a notable trend in the region.
key_takeaways: Petroleum electricity generation surpassed natural gas in New England during Winter Storm Fern, indicating a significant shift in energy sources during periods of high demand.
The reliance on oil-fired units in regions like New England suggests that cold weather can drive changes in energy composition and market dynamics.
The fluctuation between petroleum and natural gas as primary energy sources post-storm highlights the complexity and adaptability of energy markets.

articles.title: After Trump’s clean-energy clawback, tribes ‘turn and face the storm’
articles.summary: The article discusses how the Trump administration's policies have negatively impacted Native American tribes, who are struggling to pay their utility bills due to increased energy costs. Despite efforts by individuals like Donica Brady to help bring clean energy solutions to these communities, many still face significant challenges in accessing affordable and sustainable energy sources. The article highlights the difficulties faced by tribal communities in navigating the complex and often unforgiving energy system.
key_takeaways: Native American tribes are facing increased energy costs under Trump's policies, making it difficult for them to access affordable and sustainable energy sources.
Individuals like Donica Brady are working to bring clean energy solutions to these communities, but their efforts are often hindered by the complexity of the energy system.
Tribal communities may turn to unconventional or unregulated energy sources as a means of survival, highlighting the need for more supportive policies and infrastructure.

articles.title: The Maryland 2026 Midterms Energy Trilemma Blues
articles.summary: Maryland Delegate Lorig Charkoudian is advocating for her state to explore alternatives to PJM, a regional transmission organization that Maryland is currently a part of. She believes that working with neighboring states and PJM's fixed resource requirement could provide more cost-effective and efficient solutions for energy procurement and capacity planning. Charkoudian's proposed bills aim to study the costs and benefits of these alternatives.
key_takeaways: Maryland Delegate Lorig Charkoudian is pushing for her state to explore alternatives to PJM, citing its slow pace of change and continued reliance on fossil fuels as a significant cost to ratepayers.

The proposed bills would allow Maryland to work with neighboring states (Delaware, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and possibly Virginia) to study the feasibility of starting their own RTO or using PJM's fixed resource requirement to reduce costs.
Charkoudian proposes exploring capacity procurement through bilateral contracts as a primary solution, with PJM's capacity auctions serving as a backup option.

articles.title: Oregon PUC Probes PGE on Data Center Cost-sharing Proposals
articles.summary: The Oregon Public Utility Commission (PUC) is investigating Portland General Electric's proposals for data center cost-sharing, expressing concerns that the utility may be prioritizing data centers over other customers. The PUC aims to implement the POWER Act, which would require large energy users like data centers to pay a proportionate share of their infrastructure and energy costs. The hearing focused on PGE's written testimony submitted in December 2023.
key_takeaways: The Oregon Public Utility Commission (PUC) is scrutinizing Portland General Electric's proposals for data center cost-sharing, with concerns that the utility may be favoring large energy users over other customers.

The POWER Act aims to create a separate customer category for large energy users like data centers and require them to pay a proportionate share of their infrastructure and energy costs, which would apply only to Oregon's investor-owned utilities.

The PUC is questioning PGE's voluntary flexibility approach for data centers, instead seeking mandatory requirements to address potential "scarcity events" that can impact the system and other customers.

articles.title: Moonwatt brings DC-coupled, passively cooled sodium-ion tech to solar projects
articles.summary: Moonwatt, a Dutch start-up co-founded by former Tesla leaders, has developed a novel sodium-ion battery technology optimized for integration with solar power plants. The company's DC-coupled, passively cooled system will be deployed in a Dutch solar-plus-storage project later this year. This innovative solution aims to improve the efficiency of solar hybridization.
key_takeaways: Moonwatt has developed a new type of battery storage system based on sodium-ion NFPP chemistry for seamless solar hybridization.
The company's DC-coupled, passively cooled system integrates battery enclosures with hybrid string inverters, enabling efficient integration with solar power plants.
Moonwatt operates as an energy storage system integrator, sourcing sodium-ion cells globally and aiming to add American and European cell sourcing options in the future.

articles.title: Envision claims AI-enabled storage systems can detect battery safety risks days in advance
articles.summary:

 Envision Energy has launched a fully integrated energy storage solution that combines hardware, software, and market-facing capabilities to optimize performance, safety, and trading. The platform, called "Physical AI," embeds intelligence across cells, systems, and operations, enabling predictive maintenance and real-time market participation. This approach allows for a more comprehensive end-to-end platform that goes beyond selling battery systems.
key_takeaways: Envision Energy has developed a fully integrated energy storage solution that combines hardware, software, and market-facing capabilities to optimize performance, safety, and trading.
The "Physical AI" platform embeds intelligence directly into the physical operation of storage assets, enabling predictive maintenance and real-time market participation.
Envision's approach is centered around a comprehensive end-to-end platform that spans cell innovation, power conversion, system controls, artificial intelligence, and electricity trading.

articles.title: Iberdrola commissions Spain’s largest utility-scale battery systems
articles.summary: Iberdrola has commissioned Spain's first utility-scale battery systems, located adjacent to two photovoltaic plants in Alarcón, Cuenca. The batteries have a power output of nearly 30 MW and storage capacity of 60 MWh each. This development follows the expansion of energy storage projects by major utilities like Naturgy.
key_takeaways: Iberdrola has commissioned two utility-scale battery systems with a combined power output of nearly 60 MW, marking Spain's first such installations.
The construction of these batteries created over 100 jobs and involved several national suppliers, demonstrating the growing importance of energy storage in Spain's energy sector.
Other major utilities like Naturgy are also developing new battery energy storage projects, particularly in the Canary Islands, highlighting a growing pipeline for energy storage developments.

articles.title: Nissan wheels out solar-powered vehicle
articles.summary: The article reports on Nissan's collaboration with Lightyear, a Dutch startup, to integrate solar-powered charging technology into a demonstration vehicle called the Ariya. The Ariya features 3.8m² of custom solar panels that generate up to 0.5 kWh of energy during a 2-hour, 80-kilometer trip, providing up to 3 kilometers of range without additional charging time. This collaboration marks an important step for Lightyear in bringing its solar charging technology to market.
key_takeaways: Lightyear has partnered with Nissan to integrate its solar-powered charging technology into the Ariya concept vehicle, featuring 3.8m² of custom solar panels across the hood, roof, and tailgate.

The integrated solar panels use high-efficiency photovoltaic cells that convert sunlight directly into DC electric power, managed through an optimized power controller to increase energy availability.
Testing showed that the Ariya can generate up to 0.5 kWh of energy during a 2-hour, 80-kilometer trip, providing up to 3 kilometers of range without additional charging time.

articles.title: Sungrow PowerTitan 3.0 BESS debuts in Europe, offering 4-8 hour duration
articles.summary: Sungrow PowerTitan 3.0 BESS, a battery energy storage system, has been launched in the European market by PV inverter and BESS firm Sungrow. The system offers a duration range of 4-8 hours, indicating its potential for various applications. This launch signifies Sungrow's expansion into the European renewable energy sector.
key_takeaways: Sungrow PowerTitan 3.0 BESS is designed to operate within a 4-8 hour duration, suggesting its suitability for applications requiring backup power or load shifting.
The system's launch in the European market marks Sungrow's entry into this region, indicating growing demand for renewable energy solutions.
As a battery energy storage system, PowerTitan 3.0 BESS likely aims to complement solar photovoltaic (PV) inverters and other energy management systems in European households and businesses.

articles.title: European Union battery storage market entered ‘new phase of scale and maturity’ in 2025, but ‘still has a long way to go’
articles.summary: The European Union's battery storage market reached a new phase of scale and maturity in 2025, with record-breaking deployment of capacity for the 12th consecutive year. However, despite this progress, the EU still needs to accelerate deployment further to meet its clean energy goals. The report highlights the ongoing growth and development of the sector.
key_takeaways: The European Union achieved a record-breaking deployment of battery storage capacity in 2025, marking the 12th consecutive year of growth.
Despite this progress, the EU still needs to accelerate deployment of battery storage further to meet its clean energy goals and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
The report from SolarPower Europe suggests that the market is entering a new phase of scale and maturity, indicating a shift towards increased investment and adoption in the sector.

articles.title: From Peak Load to Public Health: What Batteries Are Already Doing for Power Grids
articles.summary: The article discusses how batteries are being used to manage peak grid load and their positive impact on public health. Batteries can help stabilize the power grid, reduce strain during peak demand periods, and provide a cleaner alternative to fossil fuels. This analysis extends from a discussion on the topic of peak grid load.
key_takeaways: Batteries are being used to manage peak grid load by storing excess energy generated during off-peak hours and releasing it during peak hours, reducing strain on the grid.

The use of batteries in power grids can help improve public health by reducing air pollution from fossil fuels, which is particularly beneficial for vulnerable populations such as children and the elderly.
Batteries are also providing a cleaner alternative to traditional energy storage methods, helping to decrease reliance on fossil fuels and mitigate climate change.

articles.title: SPP Waits on FERC Order to Refund Z2 Credits
articles.summary: The Southwestern Power Pool (SPP) is waiting for a FERC order to refund millions of dollars in compensation to transmission upgrade sponsors from its Attachment Z2 process. SPP owes approximately $147 million in refunds, plus interest, and must also unwind and recalculate billions of dollars in market settlements dating back to 2015. The grid operator expects the process to have a significant impact on network and point-to-point activities.
key_takeaways: SPP owes around $147 million in refunds, plus an additional $46 million or so in interest, to transmission users who made payments under the Z2 process as far back as 18 years ago.
The grid operator must also unwind and recalculate more than $20 billion in market settlements dating back to 2015, with only about 1-2% of these related to the Z2 process.
SPP's settlement manager expects the process to have a significant impact on network and point-to-point activities for transmission customers and owners.

articles.title: The DER Dilemma: Aligning Utility Planning Models with a Decentralized Energy Future
articles.summary: The North American energy sector is undergoing a significant shift due to the rapid growth of distributed energy resources (DERs), which are challenging traditional utility planning models. To ensure grid reliability and efficiency, real-time, adaptive management strategies are needed. This shift requires utilities to rethink their approach to planning and managing the grid.
key_takeaways: The growth of DERs is redefining the utility planning landscape, forcing companies to adapt their traditional planning models to accommodate decentralized energy sources.
Real-time monitoring and control systems are essential for optimizing DER performance and ensuring grid stability in a decentralized energy system.
Utilities must develop new strategies for managing the variability and uncertainty associated with DERs, which can impact grid reliability and efficiency if not properly managed.

articles.title: Survey: Flexible Load Management Moves From Emergency Tool to Core Operational Strategy
articles.summary: The increasing demand for data centers, AI, and electrification has shifted the focus of load flexibility and demand response programs from being used as emergency tools to becoming a core operational strategy. The survey highlights the importance of these strategies in managing growing energy demands. Industry stakeholders are embracing flexible load management as an essential tool despite existing challenges.
key_takeaways: Load flexibility and demand response programs are becoming increasingly important for managing growing energy demands from data centers, AI, and electrification.
The industry is transitioning from using these tools primarily as emergency measures to adopting them as core operational strategies.
Despite existing challenges, the survey suggests that flexible load management is being recognized as an essential tool in ensuring reliable and efficient energy supply.

articles.title: European Smart Grid Software Firm Adds AI-Powered Tool for Long-Term Distribution Planning
articles.summary: A European smart grid software firm has introduced an AI-powered tool called the Strategic Grid Planner, which is designed to support long-term distribution planning for distribution networks. The tool extends the company's Intelligent Grid Platform (IGP) and enables loadflow-based multi-year system planning. This innovation aims to improve the efficiency and reliability of distribution networks in Europe.
key_takeaways: The Strategic Grid Planner is an AI-powered tool that supports long-term distribution planning, focusing on enabling loadflow-based, multi-year system planning for distribution networks.
The tool extends the company's Intelligent Grid Platform (IGP), indicating a seamless integration with existing infrastructure and capabilities.
The primary goal of the Strategic Grid Planner is to improve the efficiency and reliability of distribution networks in Europe, suggesting a focus on enhancing grid management and operation.

articles.title: Australian rooftop solar reaches record 4,407 MW output in Q4 2025
articles.summary: Rooftop solar generation in Australia reached a record high of 4,407 MW in Q4 2025, contributing to a peak renewable supply of 78.6% and reducing daytime operational demand. This milestone is part of a growing trend in Australia's renewable energy sector. The increase in rooftop solar output is attributed to various factors, including policy support and technological advancements.
key_takeaways: Rooftop solar generation in Australia increased by 8.7% compared to the same period in 2024, reaching an all-time high of 4,407 MW in Q4 2025.
The record output contributed to a peak renewable supply of 78.6%, reducing daytime operational demand and supporting battery charging.

Distributed solar production reached exceptional peaks, with a record-high output of 16,319 MW during the half-hour ending December 3, 2025, an increase of 8.9% compared to the previous quarter's record.

articles.title: 4 of the 5 Wind Power Projects Stopped by Trump in December Have Resumed Work
articles.summary: A US District Court judge has granted a preliminary injunction, allowing the Vineyard Wind project to continue construction after it was previously halted by Donald Trump's executive order in December. This decision comes as four out of five wind power projects that were stopped by Trump have since resumed work. The ruling provides relief for the wind industry and is seen as a positive step towards the development of renewable energy.
key_takeaways: Four out of five wind power projects that were halted by Donald Trump's executive order in December have resumed construction.

The Vineyard Wind project, which was also affected by Trump's executive order, has been granted a preliminary injunction to continue work on its 13-megawatt offshore wind project off the coast of Massachusetts.
This ruling provides significant relief for the wind industry and is seen as a positive step towards the development of renewable energy.

articles.title: Parametric and Generative Forecasts of Day-Ahead Market Curves for Storage Optimization
articles.summary: The article presents two machine learning frameworks for forecasting day-ahead market curves and optimizing storage in the EPEX SPOT market. A parametric model forecasts hourly demand and supply curves with low error and clear interpretability, while a generative model generates synthetic daily scenarios of individual buy and sell orders to optimize storage strategy and revenue distributions.
key_takeaways: The article proposes two machine learning frameworks for forecasting day-ahead market curves: a fast parametric model and a generative model.
The generative model learns the joint distribution of 24-hour order-level submissions, generating synthetic daily scenarios that yield hourly supply and demand curves.

The models aim to optimize storage strategy, quantify revenue distributions, and highlight the price-compression effect with lower peaks, higher off-peak levels, and diminishing returns as capacity expands.

articles.title: OptAgent: an Agentic AI framework for Intelligent Building Operations
articles.summary: The article introduces OptAgent, an agentic AI framework for intelligent building operations, aiming to decarbonize the energy sector through autonomous building management.
