The framework combines physics-grounded digital environments with agentic AI layers to enable scalable and efficient energy modeling, simulation, control, and automation. The study demonstrates the effectiveness of OptAgent in real-world applications.
key_takeaways: OptAgent proposes an end-to-end agentic AI-enabled PIML environment for building energy modeling, simulation, control, and automation, providing a physics-grounded foundation for autonomous building operations.

The framework consists of 11 specialist agents and 72 Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools, enabling multi-step energy analytics and coordination across different domains, such as HVAC and distributed energy resources.

A large-scale benchmark evaluation demonstrates the impacts of intelligence mode design, model size, task complexity, and orchestrator-specialist coordination on workflow performance, providing key lessons for future agentic AI systems in building energy applications.

articles.title: Baker Hughes, Hydrostor Will Collaborate on CAES Projects
articles.summary: Baker Hughes and Hydrostor have announced a strategic collaboration, integrating Baker Hughes' technology into Hydrostor's advanced compressed air energy storage (CAES) solution. The partnership aims to enhance the design offering for Hydrostor's A-CAES solution, which is used in CAES projects. This collaboration may lead to improved efficiency and effectiveness in energy storage systems.
key_takeaways: Baker Hughes' technology will be integrated into Hydrostor's core design offering for the A-CAES solution.
The partnership aims to enhance the performance and efficiency of Hydrostor's energy storage solutions used in CAES projects.
This collaboration may lead to improved outcomes in terms of energy storage and usage in various applications.

articles.title: Luminace, Renewable Properties Partner on Community Solar Portfolio
articles.summary: Luminace has acquired a 9.3-MWdc community solar portfolio from Renewable Properties, expanding its presence in the small-scale renewable energy sector. This partnership marks an important development for both companies as they focus on growing their portfolios and contributing to a cleaner energy future. The acquisition is likely to have significant implications for the overall US energy landscape.
key_takeaways: Luminace has acquired a 9.3-MWdc community solar portfolio from Renewable Properties, marking a strategic expansion into the small-scale renewable energy sector.
This partnership will enable both companies to grow their portfolios and contribute to the growth of the clean energy market in the US.
The acquisition is likely to have significant implications for the overall US energy landscape, particularly in terms of increasing access to renewable energy solutions.

articles.title: EIA: 99%+ of new US capacity in 2026 will be solar, wind + storage
articles.summary: According to the EIA data reviewed by the SUN DAY Campaign, solar, wind, and storage are expected to supply over 99% of new US generating capacity in 2026. This growth continues from the strong 2025 trend. The report provides insight into the increasing dominance of renewable energy sources in the US power and energy systems.
key_takeaways: Solar, wind, and storage are projected to supply virtually all net new US generating capacity by 2026.
Renewable energy sources have experienced significant growth, with a strong 2025 trend that is expected to continue in 2026.
The increasing dominance of solar, wind, and storage could mark a significant shift away from traditional fossil fuel-based power generation systems.

articles.title: How Clean-Energy Firms Adapt Messaging in the Trump Era
articles.summary: In the Trump era, clean-energy firms are adapting their messaging to navigate changing energy policies and meet rising power demands. Renewable energy companies are focusing on electricity affordability and highlighting the cost-effectiveness of wind farms and photovoltaics. Meanwhile, battery storage developers and nuclear power companies are emphasizing domestic manufacturing and small modular reactors as part of their strategies.
key_takeaways: Energy companies are shifting their messaging to focus on electricity affordability and the benefits of renewable energy sources like wind and solar.
Battery storage developers are aligning themselves with Trump's domestic manufacturing push, scaling up efforts to shift supply chains to the United States in response to uncertainty over tariffs.
Nuclear power companies are promoting small modular reactors as a faster way to deploy nuclear power, which may appeal to data-center developers seeking carbon-free options.

articles.title: Cyprus installs 122 MW of solar capacity in 2025
articles.summary:
Here is the analysis based on the provided information:


Cyprus has installed a significant amount of solar capacity, with approximately 122 MW added in 2025. Despite record levels of renewable energy curtailment, self-consumption PV projects drove most of the new installations. The country's cumulative installed renewable energy capacity has increased to around 1,139 MW by the end of 2025.
key_takeaways: Self-consumption PV projects accounted for most of the new solar installations in Cyprus in 2025, driven by the trend expected to continue into 2026.
Despite record levels of renewable energy curtailment (47% last year), the addition of new solar capacity was still significant, with around 122 MW installed in 2025.
Solar remains the most widespread renewable energy technology in Cyprus, with a cumulative installed capacity of around 957 MW by the end of 2025.

articles.title: AI’s Power Crunch: Six Trends That Will Decide Who Wins the Next Decade
articles.summary: The article highlights the growing demand for power in the US due to the increasing adoption of artificial intelligence (AI), posing a significant systemic risk. To address this, the country needs to invest heavily in expanding power plants, transmission lines, and advanced hardware, while leveraging AI to optimize grid operations. This transformation is crucial for ensuring the US remains competitive in the next decade.
key_takeaways: The growing demand for power in the US due to AI adoption poses a significant systemic risk, requiring substantial investment in infrastructure expansion.
Leveraging AI can help drive grid progress and optimize power distribution, reducing the country's reliance on manual processes.
A combination of human innovation and technological advancements is necessary to meet the demands of an increasingly AI-dependent economy.

articles.title: Bangladesh signs PPAs for 523 MW of solar capacity
articles.summary: The Bangladesh Power Development Board (BPDB) has signed power purchase agreements with seven solar projects totaling 523 MW, marking a renewed push for utility-scale solar in the country. The agreements were signed after developers agreed to revised, lower tariffs following the reinstatement of approvals for previously canceled projects. The newly signed deals will supply electricity to the national grid for 20 years.
key_takeaways: Bangladesh has signed power purchase agreements (PPAs) for a combined 523 MW of solar capacity, with seven grid-connected projects under construction in various districts.
The deal marks a renewed push for utility-scale solar in the country after the reinstatement of approvals for previously canceled projects, citing lower tariffs.
The newly signed PPAs cover the reinstated projects and will supply electricity to the national grid for 20 years from the start of commercial operation.

articles.title: Transforming EVs & Charging Stations into Virtual Power Plants
articles.summary: The article discusses how Electric Vehicles (EVs) and charging stations can be integrated into a virtual power plant, utilizing vehicle-to-grid technology to stabilize the grid and provide energy storage. This concept has been explored by companies such as EVBox and The Mobility House. The technology aims to optimize energy usage and reduce strain on the grid.
key_takeaways: Vehicle-to-grid (V2G) technology allows EVs to supply energy back to the grid when not in use, making them a potential source of renewable energy storage.
Charging stations can also be equipped with V2G capabilities, enabling them to act as virtual power plants and stabilize the grid during periods of high demand or low renewable energy production.
This technology has the potential to increase the overall efficiency of energy distribution and reduce the strain on traditional power grids.

articles.title: EU installs 27.1 GWh of battery storage in 2025 as utility scale leads
articles.summary: The European Union installed a record 27.1 GWh of battery energy storage capacity in 2025, with utility-scale systems driving the majority of new installations due to improved market conditions and strengthened policy frameworks. This marks the 12th consecutive year of growth for the EU's battery energy storage fleet. The deployment is part of a larger expansion plan to meet the energy flexibility needs by 2030.
key_takeaways: Utility-scale systems accounted for 55% of all newly added capacity in 2025, marking a significant shift from residential storage which declined amid lower electricity prices and reduced support schemes.
The EU's battery energy storage fleet has grown tenfold since 2021, with a total capacity of 77.3 GWh, underscoring the need for continued growth to meet its energy flexibility goals by 2030.
To achieve this goal, the industry association aims for the EU to scale up its battery capacity to around 750 GWh by the end of the decade.

articles.title: Sam Altman-backed Exowatt launches arm to power data centers with renewables
articles.summary: Exowatt, backed by Sam Altman, has launched a new arm called ExoRise to provide renewable energy solutions for data centers in the U.S. Southwest. ExoRise will offer solar and battery infrastructure to support behind-the-meter and off-grid deployments. The company aims to reduce carbon emissions from data centers.
key_takeaways: Exowatt's ExoRise arm focuses on providing solar and battery infrastructure to support behind-the-meter and off-grid deployment of data centers.
The company has set its sights on the U.S. Southwest, a region with high levels of solar irradiance, making it an ideal location for renewable energy projects.
By offering these solutions, ExoRise aims to reduce carbon emissions from data centers, aligning with efforts to increase sustainability in the tech industry.

articles.title: Heybike Villain electric dirt bike launches with $250 savings, Anker solar camera lows + SOLIX F3000 power station bundle low, more
articles.summary: The article highlights the launch of Heybike's Villain Electric Dirt Bike at a discounted price of $1,399, which includes a free gift box of gear for the first 80 orders. Additionally, there are deals on Anker solar cameras and a portable power station bundle, among other discounts.
key_takeaways: Heybike has launched its new Villain Electric Dirt Bike at a discounted price of $1,399, offering $250 savings.
Anker is offering up to 50% off on its security devices, including the popular SoloCam S220 Solar Security Camera and F3000 Portable Power Station bundle.
There are also deals on Greenworks and Worx off-season tools available, as well as a Disaster Winter Storm Sale with flash sales ending tonight.

articles.title: Prime Data Centers uses closed-loop air and liquid cooling to earn Energy Star certifications
articles.summary: Prime Data Centers, a Dallas-based developer and operator, has implemented closed-loop air and liquid cooling systems in its data centers to earn Energy Star certifications. This move is part of a growing trend among tech companies seeking to reduce their environmental impact and lower customer energy bills. By adopting these sustainable practices, Prime Data Centers aims to contribute to a more environmentally friendly data center industry.
key_takeaways: Prime Data Centers has adopted closed-loop air and liquid cooling systems in its data centers, which is part of the growing trend among tech companies to reduce their environmental impact.
The implementation of these sustainable systems enables the company to earn Energy Star certifications, demonstrating its commitment to reducing energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions.
By adopting closed-loop air and liquid cooling systems, Prime Data Centers aims to contribute to a more environmentally friendly data center industry and lower customer energy bills.

articles.title: How utilities can prepare for the next wave of data center growth
articles.summary: The article discusses the growing need for power infrastructure to support the increasing growth of data centers in the US. Despite utilities' desire to invest, permitting hurdles are a major obstacle, hindering the grid's ability to keep up with data center demands.
key_takeaways: Permitting hurdles remain a significant challenge for utilities seeking to invest in infrastructure to meet growing demand from data centers.
The US grid is unprepared to handle the power needs of data centers, highlighting the need for investment and modernization.
Data center growth is expected to continue, placing pressure on utilities to develop strategies to address these capacity challenges.

articles.title: The POWER Interview: A Path Forward for Geothermal Energy
articles.summary: The article discusses Rodatherm Energy Corp., a company working on advanced geothermal technology, specifically their Advanced Geothermal System (AGS), which has shown promising results in the Great Basin region of the Western U.S. The company's focus on this area is highlighted as a key aspect of their operations.
key_takeaways: Rodatherm Energy Corp. is a privately held company specializing in advanced geothermal technology, with a primary focus on the Great Basin region in the Western U.S.
The company's Advanced Geothermal System (AGS) has shown promise, indicating potential for this energy source to move forward.
Operations are not limited to just one country; Rodatherm Energy Corp. also has operations in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, further expanding its reach globally.

articles.title: Solar-Powered Boat Travels Into France
articles.summary: A solar-powered boat, True North, has successfully traveled into France, showcasing the potential for renewable energy sources to enable long-distance travel. The boat is equipped with rooftop solar panels and an electric motor, highlighting a innovative approach to sustainable propulsion. This achievement demonstrates the growing interest in eco-friendly transportation.
key_takeaways: A solar-powered boat, True North, has successfully navigated into France, underscoring the potential for renewable energy sources to facilitate long-distance travel.
The boat's design features rooftop solar panels and an electric motor, providing a viable alternative to traditional fossil fuel-based propulsion systems.
This achievement highlights the growing interest in eco-friendly transportation solutions, driven by increasing concerns about climate change and environmental sustainability.

articles.title: Pacific Northwest US utility Avista selects 100MW BESS as part of RFP
articles.summary: Avista, a utility company serving the Pacific Northwest region of the US, has selected projects as part of its RFP process. Among these selections is a 100MW battery energy storage system (BESS), which will contribute to the region's renewable energy mix. This move suggests Avista's commitment to integrating clean energy sources into its infrastructure.
key_takeaways: Avista has identified a significant investment in a 100MW BESS project as part of its RFP process, highlighting the growing importance of energy storage solutions for utilities.
The selection of this project indicates that Avista is actively pursuing new resources to support its renewable energy goals, contributing to the Pacific Northwest's clean energy ambitions.
This development underscores the increasing trend of utilities seeking to integrate battery energy storage systems into their grid infrastructure to ensure a stable and reliable power supply.

articles.title: TSOs’ differing understanding of storage is an industry challenge
articles.summary: The article highlights the disparity in understanding and approaches to energy storage among transmission system operators (TSOs), which hinders the development of larger, longer-duration projects. This discrepancy is largely driven by varying deal structuring and project sizes. As a result, more sophisticated solutions are needed to bridge this gap.
key_takeaways: The lack of common approaches from TSOs regarding energy storage is a significant challenge in the industry.
Larger, longer-duration energy storage projects are being developed, but this growth is limited by the differing understanding and approaches among TSOs.
More sophisticated deal structuring and coordination between TSOs, project developers, and other stakeholders are necessary to overcome these challenges.

articles.title: India curtails 2.3 TWh of solar between May and December 2025
articles.summary: India's power system experienced a significant curtailment of solar generation between May and December 2025, with 2.3 TWh of solar power lost due to grid security concerns. This was largely attributed to periods of daytime oversupply caused by forecast errors, low demand, and rising solar production. The inability to flex the coal fleet beyond technical limits contributed to these issues.
key_takeaways: India's power system regularly had to curtail solar generation as an emergency measure to maintain grid security due to other resources reaching their maximum capabilities.
Weaker-than-forecast daytime demand coincided with continued solar expansion, leading to periods of cumulative supply being higher than demand and resulting in grid security concerns.
The extent of avoided curtailment in the future depends on factors such as accurate demand forecasting, decisive action on transmission bottlenecks, and rapid scaling of flexibility resources.

articles.title: Waaree Renewable to acquire 55% of Associated Power Structures
articles.summary: Waaree Renewable Technologies has approved the acquisition of approximately 55% stake in Associated Power Structures Ltd, a power transmission and distribution contractor, for INR 12.25 billion ($133.6 million). The transaction aims to expand Waaree's operational footprint into transmission and distribution infrastructure, supporting the deployment of large-scale renewable energy projects. This acquisition is expected to position Waaree as a fully integrated energy transition company.
key_takeaways: Waaree Renewable Technologies has acquired approximately 55% stake in Associated Power Structures Ltd for INR 12.25 billion ($133.6 million).
The transaction aims to expand Waaree's operational footprint into transmission and distribution infrastructure, supporting the deployment of large-scale renewable energy projects.
The acquisition is expected to position Waaree as a fully integrated energy transition company, underpinned by its existing renewable power generation capabilities.

articles.title: New Jersey governor orders major solar, storage expansion on first day
articles.summary: New Jersey Governor Mikie Sherrill has signed two executive orders to accelerate the state's transition to renewable energy, aiming to address rising electricity prices and capacity shortfalls. The measures include expanding utility-scale solar, community solar, and battery energy storage programs. These initiatives are expected to take effect within 45 days.
key_takeaways: New Jersey Governor Mikie Sherrill has signed two executive orders to accelerate the state's transition to renewable energy, with a focus on addressing rising electricity prices and capacity shortfalls.
The measures include expanding utility-scale solar (up to 3 GW) and community solar programs, as well as advancing up to 750 MW of battery energy storage.

The initiatives aim to resolve the growing demand for electricity (projected to increase by 20% by 2030) and mitigate rising electricity prices, with the goal of maintaining affordability for consumers.

articles.title: NLR & Blip Energy Collaborate on Smart Home Battery System
articles.summary: NLR and Blip Energy are collaborating on a smart home battery system that aims to cut electric bills and strengthen grid reliability. The project is advancing through the Wells Fargo Innovation Incubator, which provides laboratory expertise to support its development. The goal of this collaboration is likely to create a more efficient and sustainable energy management platform for homes.
key_takeaways: NLR and Blip Energy are working together on a smart home battery system that seeks to reduce electric bills and improve grid stability.
The project is participating in the Wells Fargo Innovation Incubator, which offers laboratory expertise and resources to support its development.
The collaboration aims to create an energy management platform for homes that can help strengthen the grid and make energy more sustainable.

articles.title: NLR Advances Battery-Free Power for Remote Maritime Sensors and Navigation Aids
articles.summary: The article discusses the advancements made by NLR in developing a battery-free power system for remote maritime sensors and navigation aids. This innovation utilizes a compact thermomagnetic generator that harnesses natural temperature differences between ocean water and air to deliver continuous electricity. The technology has its roots in concepts imagined by Nikola Tesla and Thomas Edison in the 19th century.
key_takeaways: A battery-free power system for remote maritime sensors and navigation aids is being developed using a compact thermomagnetic generator.
The system harnesses natural temperature differences between ocean water and air to deliver continuous electricity, eliminating the need for batteries.
This technology has its roots in concepts imagined by Nikola Tesla and Thomas Edison in the 19th century, highlighting the potential for innovation from past ideas.

articles.title: Customer Group Offers FERC Policies to Grow the Power System Affordably
articles.summary: The Electricity Customer Alliance has submitted a white paper to FERC, arguing that the commission must balance growing the grid with keeping rates affordable for customers. The authors propose a customer-centric framework to address issues such as exponentially rising demand from data centers and reshoring manufacturing. The goal is to ensure a reliable grid while maintaining affordability.
key_takeaways: The Electricity Customer Alliance advocates for a customer-centric approach to FERC policies, prioritizing affordability alongside grid reliability.
Exponentially rising demand from data centers has led to capacity market prices surging in PJM, highlighting the need for a more efficient and adaptable wholesale power market design.

FERC plays a crucial role in convening state regulators to address issues affecting the transmission grid, as well as promoting national bipartisan goals such as AI leadership, national security, economic growth, and improved customer affordability.

articles.title: Here Comes Concentrating Solar Power To Decarbonize Industrial Heat
articles.summary: GlassPoint, a US concentrating solar power startup, is targeting various markets in the US Southwest, southern Europe, the Middle East, and South America with its technology to decarbonize industrial heat.
key_takeaways: GlassPoint aims to utilize concentrating solar power to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from industrial processes.
The company's focus on decarbonizing industrial heat suggests an effort to integrate renewable energy into industrial applications beyond traditional electricity generation.
Concentrating solar power, a technology that uses mirrors or lenses to focus sunlight onto a receiver, may be particularly well-suited for high-temperature industrial applications.

articles.title: Trends to look out for at Energy Storage Summit Australia 2026
articles.summary: The Energy Storage Summit Australia 2026 will address key debates in the energy storage industry, focusing on trends and innovations that will shape the sector's future. The event aims to bring together experts and stakeholders to discuss challenges, opportunities, and best practices in energy storage. The summit is expected to feature discussions on various aspects of energy storage.
key_takeaways: Key debates set to take centre stage at the Energy Storage Summit Australia 2026 include the impact of policy changes, technological advancements, and economic considerations on the industry's growth and development.
The event will explore the role of energy storage in addressing climate change and achieving net-zero emissions targets, with a focus on regional and national initiatives.
Industry leaders and experts are expected to share insights on emerging trends such as solar-plus-storage, hydrogen fuel cells, and battery storage solutions for grid resilience.

articles.title: Indiana brought a 150 MW solar farm online, and it’s just the beginning
articles.summary: Indiana has successfully brought a 150 MW solar farm online, marking an important milestone in the state's transition to renewable energy. This project is part of a larger effort by utilities to rely less on external power sources and more on in-state generation. The addition of this solar farm demonstrates a growing commitment to sustainable energy production.
key_takeaways: Indiana has successfully commissioned a 150 MW solar farm, contributing to the state's renewable energy efforts.
The project is part of a broader trend among utilities to rely less on external power sources and more on in-state generation.
The development of this solar farm highlights Indiana's growing commitment to sustainable energy production.

articles.title: ERCOT’s battery fleet is the ‘first line of defence for the grid’ through Texas winter storms
articles.summary: ERCOT's battery fleet is a critical component in protecting the grid from extreme winter storms, but its performance requires careful management to ensure reliability. The battery storage system can help mitigate the impact of power outages and provide backup power during periods of high demand. Effective management of the battery fleet is essential for optimal performance.
key_takeaways: ERCOT's battery fleet plays a vital role in safeguarding the grid from winter storm-related power outages, making it the "first line of defence".
The technical performance of the battery storage system needs to be carefully managed during extreme weather conditions to ensure reliable operation.
Effective management of the battery fleet is crucial for maximizing its benefits and minimizing potential risks, such as reduced capacity factor or increased wear and tear on the batteries.

articles.title: Frequency Shaping Control for Oscillation Damping in Weakly-Connected Power Network: A Root Locus Method
articles.summary: The article proposes a root locus method for frequency shaping control (FS) in weakly-connected power networks to improve oscillatory stability and damping ratio after contingency events. The approach simplifies the analysis by focusing on a scalar subsystem associated with the main mode, providing closed-form expressions for minimum damping ratios and decay rates. Numerical simulations validate the proposed tuning guidelines for FS.
key_takeaways: The article introduces a root locus method to analyze oscillatory stability in weakly-connected power networks.
The approach provides useful tuning guidelines for frequency shaping control (FS) that can shape the center of inertia (COI) frequency and ensure satisfactory damping ratios and decay rates.
The proposed FS method is validated through numerical simulations, showing superiority over common virtual inertia control (VI) in exponential convergence rate.

articles.title: Data-Driven Predictive Control for Wide-Area Power Oscillation Damping
articles.summary: The article discusses the use of Data-Driven Predictive Control (DPC) for damping wide-area power oscillations in transmission grids. DPC is applied to VSC-HVDC links and compared with conventional model-based controllers and other predictive control methods. The results show that DPC achieves effective damping with reduced online computation requirements.
key_takeaways: DPC addresses the limitation of obtaining explicit system models by replacing them with data, making it a viable approach for power-system oscillation damping.
ARX-based predictive control and DeePC achieve effective damping in simulation tests, while requiring less online computation compared to other methods.
The use of warm-started, pre-factorized operator-splitting solvers allows for fast computation of control actions, with results achieved in under 1ms.

articles.title: Eco-Driving Control for Electric Vehicles with Multi-Speed Transmission: Optimizing Vehicle Speed and Powertrain Operation in Dynamic Environments
articles.summary: The article presents an eco-driving algorithm for electric vehicles with multi-speed transmissions, aiming to optimize energy efficiency by simultaneously controlling vehicle speed and powertrain operation. The proposed controller is designed to handle dynamic environments with multiple signalized intersections and mixed traffic while ensuring traffic safety. The algorithm's performance is evaluated through simulation and real-world road tests.
key_takeaways: The article proposes an eco-driving algorithm that optimizes both vehicle longitudinal speed and powertrain operation to maximize energy efficiency in electric vehicles.

The algorithm uses a connected vehicle-based traffic prediction algorithm to ensure traffic safety and smooth traffic flow, simplifying a complex nonlinear mixed integer problem for real-time implementation.

The proposed controller achieves a notable reduction in energy consumption by up to 11.36% over an 18 km drive, demonstrating its potential to improve the efficiency of electric vehicles in dynamic environments.

articles.title: Illinois high court rejects challenge to wind-generated transmission line
articles.summary: The Illinois Supreme Court has upheld a permit for the Grain Belt Express transmission line, a crucial wind power transport route from Kansas to Indiana. The ruling allows the project to proceed, providing a significant boost to the state's renewable energy infrastructure. This development will help increase the amount of wind-generated electricity transmitted across the country.
key_takeaways: The Illinois Supreme Court ruled 6-0 in favor of upholding the permit for the Grain Belt Express transmission line, indicating that the court sees no issues with the project's environmental and social impact assessments.

The project is a vital component of the US renewable energy landscape, facilitating the transportation of wind-generated electricity from Kansas to Indiana and contributing to the country's transition to cleaner energy sources.
The ruling paves the way for the construction of the transmission line, which will help meet increasing demand for wind power and reduce reliance on fossil fuels.

articles.title: How grid operators and planners are combining measurement and modeling to maintain resilience
articles.summary: The article discusses how grid operators and planners are working together to improve the resilience of power grids by combining measurement data with advanced modeling techniques. This collaboration aims to better understand and predict the dynamic behavior of modern power systems, which are increasingly being integrated with renewable energy sources. The goal is to enhance grid stability and reliability in the face of growing demand for clean energy.
key_takeaways: Grid operators and planners are using a combination of measurement data and modeling techniques to improve the resilience of power grids.
Advanced modeling allows for better prediction and understanding of dynamic power system behavior, particularly with the integration of renewable energy sources.
This collaboration aims to enhance grid stability and reliability, which is crucial for maintaining a secure supply of electricity in the face of increasing demand for clean energy.

articles.title: RheEnergise commissions first ‘high density hydro’ long-duration storage in UK
articles.summary: RheEnergise, a UK startup, has commissioned the first "high-density hydro" long-duration energy storage project in the UK, Cornwood, Plymouth. This pilot project uses a low-viscosity, denser-than-water fluid to reduce vertical elevation requirements for pumped hydro storage plants, potentially expanding viable sites for such installations. The company aims to secure commercial-scale projects within three years and is seeking funding support from various innovation funds.
key_takeaways: RheEnergise's "high-density hydro" technology uses a low-viscosity, denser-than-water fluid to reduce vertical elevation requirements for pumped hydro storage plants, potentially expanding viable sites for such installations.
The Cornwood project is the first of its kind in the UK and marks a significant step towards commercial-scale deployments of this innovative energy storage system.
RheEnergise has secured £8.25 million ($11.3 million) from the UK government and other innovation funds to support development of commercial-scale projects within the next three years.

articles.title: Five trends for energy storage as global market passes 100 GW
articles.summary: The global energy storage market has reached a milestone with annual installations passing 100 GW for the first time, despite policy shifts in China and the US. The industry is expected to continue growing, driven by trends such as supply chain restructuring and the rise of non-lithium batteries. These changes will shape the industry's future in 2026.
key_takeaways: Supply Chain Restructuring: Chinese manufacturers are expected to announce new ownership structures in 2026 to maintain market access in the US, with many reducing their ownership stakes below 25%.
Rise of Non-Lithium Batteries: The report identifies non-lithium batteries as a key trend, suggesting that the industry will move away from traditional lithium-ion battery technology.
Uncertainty for Future Revenue: China's removal of its mandate to pair storage with new renewable energy projects creates uncertainty for future revenue streams in the US and other markets.

articles.title: Scientists unveil hybrid-energy heat pump combining absorption and compression cycles
articles.summary: Scientists at the City University of Hong Kong have developed a hybrid-energy heat pump system that combines absorption and compression cycles, eliminating crystallization constraints and improving efficiency across varying solar conditions. The system uses refrigerant/ionic liquids as working fluids, making it adaptable to different cooling demands and maximizing energy efficiency. This innovation has the potential to significantly reduce electricity use and cooling costs in sustainable building applications.
key_takeaways: The hybrid-energy heat pump system combines absorption and compression cycles, allowing for seamless transitions between the two types and maximizing energy efficiency.

The use of crystallization-free ionic liquids as working fluids eliminates crystallization constraints associated with traditional absorption cycles, enhancing the system's flexibility across a broader temperature range.

The system has the potential to significantly reduce electricity use and cooling costs in sustainable building applications, making it promising for commercial scaling and addressing issues with thermally driven absorption heat pumps.

articles.title: In 2026, virtual power plants must scale or risk being left behind
articles.summary: The article discusses the importance of distributed energy resources (DER) in power and energy systems, particularly in light of the growing trend towards AI data centers. While large-scale generation is gaining attention, advocates argue that flexible DERs remain a crucial aspect of utilities' strategies to meet increasing demand. The 2026 DER outlook highlights the need for utilities to adapt and prioritize DERs to avoid being left behind.
key_takeaways: Flexible distributed energy resources (DER) still provide the biggest bang for the buck in utilities' strategies.
The AI data center frenzy is shifting utilities' focus towards large-scale generation, but DERs remain a crucial aspect of power and energy systems.
Utilities must adapt and prioritize DERs to meet increasing demand and avoid being left behind by 2026.

articles.title: Indian government releases draft energy policy
articles.summary: The Indian government has released a draft energy policy aimed at transforming the country's power sector in line with its development strategy and nuclear energy goals. The policy is expected to align with the Viksit Bharat development strategy and the recently enacted SHANTI bill, which sets out goals for India's energy sector. The release of the draft policy marks an important step towards India's energy future.
key_takeaways: The draft energy policy aims to transform India's power sector in line with its development strategy and nuclear energy goals.
The policy is expected to align with the Viksit Bharat development strategy, which sets out overall development goals for the country.
The release of the draft policy marks an important step towards India's energy future, following the recently enacted SHANTI bill.

articles.title: Pumped hydro, high-temperature thermal storage, and geothermal LDES projects make key advancements across the US
articles.summary: Pumped hydro, high-temperature thermal storage, and geothermal projects have made significant advancements in the US energy storage market. These innovations aim to increase the efficiency and capacity of existing energy storage systems. The progress in these technologies is expected to contribute to a more stable and sustainable energy grid.
key_takeaways: Several pumped hydro energy storage (PHES) projects have reached commercial operation, demonstrating the feasibility of this technology for large-scale energy storage.

High-temperature thermal storage systems are being developed to enhance the efficiency and cost-effectiveness of existing BESS technologies, offering a promising alternative to traditional battery storage.
Geothermal LDES (Low-Density Ejected Storage) projects are gaining traction as a potentially more efficient and sustainable option compared to traditional pumped hydro or BESS systems.

articles.title: Hydrogen Fuel Cells Drive New Modular Powertrain Kit for 41-Tonne Trucks
articles.summary: The RWTH Aachen University's five-year SeLv project has developed a modular powertrain kit for 41-tonne trucks, replacing diesel engines with a lithium-ion battery and hydrogen fuel cell range extender. The kit reduces integration headaches through a pre-assembled, bolt-on design and features smart energy management, predictive navigation, and various charging options. This innovation aims to bring zero-emission technology to the long-haul trucking industry.
key_takeaways: The SeLv project has developed a modular powertrain kit with a lithium-ion battery and hydrogen fuel cell range extender, reducing integration headaches through a pre-assembled, bolt-on design.
The kit features smart energy management that optimizes energy usage between the battery and fuel cell, allowing for up to 1,000 km of driving on a single charge.
The system includes various charging options (up to 470 kW peak), three-speed automatic gearboxes, and predictive navigation with real-time hydrogen infrastructure data.

articles.title: North Carolina may use batteries to give new life to old solar farms
articles.summary: North Carolina once led the country in solar power production, but many of its old solar farms are nearing the end of their lifespan. The state is now exploring ways to give new life to these aging facilities by repurposing them for energy storage using batteries.
key_takeaways: North Carolina's shift away from clean energy policies has led to a decline in its solar power production, with many old solar farms no longer generating electricity.
The state is considering repurposing these aging facilities as battery storage systems to provide additional energy storage capacity.
This approach could help address the intermittency of solar power and ensure a more stable energy supply for North Carolina's residents.

articles.title: Sigenergy secures top position for multiple storage markets as installer adoption accelerates
articles.summary: Sigenergy has secured the top position for multiple storage markets in Australia, Ireland, and South Africa, according to recent market data from SunWiz. The company's integrated system approach and modular designs have contributed to its widespread adoption by installers across these regions. Sigenergy's systems, including SigenStor and SigenStack, offer flexibility and scalability, making them suitable for various applications.
key_takeaways: Sigenergy has emerged as the number one energy storage supplier in Australia, Ireland, and South Africa, according to market data from SunWiz.

The company's modular designs, such as SigenStor and SigenStack, offer flexibility and scalability, making them suitable for various applications across residential, small commercial, and larger commercial/industrial segments.
Sigenergy's top position in blended battery capacity is partly due to its integrated system approach, which combines multiple components into a single modular architecture.

articles.title: Cellcentric taps Brusa HyPower for Fuel Cell Interface in hydrogen fuel cells
articles.summary: Cellcentric, a joint venture between Daimler Truck and Volvo Group, has partnered with Brusa HyPower to develop the Fuel Cell Interface (FCI) for its next-gen hydrogen fuel cell technology. The FCI is a crucial component that will enable the system to provide a dependable high-voltage supply for traction and auxiliary gear while keeping things safe and efficient. This partnership highlights the growing push to industrialize hydrogen fuel cells for commercial fleets.
key_takeaways: Cellcentric's next-gen fuel cell technology aims to address the limitations of battery-electric setups in heavy-duty trucks, where batteries struggle to provide sufficient power over long hauls.
The development of a robust Fuel Cell Interface (FCI) is crucial in smoothing out raw fuel cell voltage and providing a dependable high-voltage supply for traction and auxiliary gear.

By partnering with Brusa HyPower, Cellcentric aims to industrialize hydrogen fuel cells and speed up the adoption of zero-emission technology in commercial fleets, potentially cutting downtime and increasing efficiency.

articles.title: Rethinking utility-scale solar inspections in an era of tighter margins
articles.summary: The article discusses the shift in utility-scale solar inspections as margins tighten. Traditional drone inspections are no longer sufficient due to their slow data turnaround time, which can lead to significant losses in revenue. To counter this, the industry is adopting multi-drone technology and forming in-house inspection teams to improve operational efficiency.
key_takeaways: The traditional "drone-in-a-box" (DIAB) solutions have limitations in terms of cost and economics for large-scale portfolios, with stationary hardware units requiring significant upfront investment.

Multi-drone technology has revolutionized the industry by allowing operators to achieve 100+ MW daily inspection rates, slashing the total cost of ownership and eliminating traditional data-to-insight lags.

The shift from maintenance to core revenue strategy highlights the importance of operational efficiency in utility-scale solar operations, as growing portfolios and tightening margins make it essential to prioritize speed and accuracy.

articles.title: World’s largest compressed-air storage plant switched on in China
articles.summary: A new compressed-air storage plant, the Guoxin Suyan Huai’an Salt Cavern Compressed Air Energy Storage Demonstration Project, has been activated in China's Jiangsu province. The plant features two 300 MW units with high efficiency and utilizes molten salt and pressurized thermal water storage to achieve long-duration energy storage capacity. This project is considered the world’s largest compressed-air storage plant.
key_takeaways: The Guoxin Suyan Huai’an Salt Cavern Compressed Air Energy Storage Demonstration Project is the world's largest compressed-air storage plant, operating in China's Jiangsu province.
The plant achieves high efficiency of 71% conversion rate through advanced molten salt and pressurized thermal water storage systems.
The two 300 MW units store electricity without burning fuel using air compression and heat management processes.

articles.title: Year in Review: Lunar Energy on the progress of US home energy storage through ‘turbulent 2025’ and the way ahead for virtual power plants
articles.summary: Lunar Energy's Ed Gunn reflects on the challenges and opportunities faced by the US home energy storage market in 2025, with a focus on virtual power plants (VPPs). The market has experienced turbulence, but Gunn sees potential for growth and innovation. He shares insights into Lunar Energy's progress and future prospects.
key_takeaways: The US home energy storage market is expected to experience continued growth, driven by increasing demand for renewable energy sources and decreasing costs.
Virtual power plants (VPPs) are gaining traction as a way to optimize energy distribution and provide grid resilience, with companies like Lunar Energy at the forefront of this technology.

Despite challenges, the market has shown potential for innovation and expansion, with advancements in battery technology, smart grids, and IoT connectivity enabling more efficient and secure energy management.

articles.title: How to combine C&I solar with compressed air energy storage
articles.summary: Researchers from the University of Pretoria in South Africa have conducted a study to combine commercial and industrial (C&I) solar systems with compressed air energy storage (CAES) to power a commercial building. The study aims to minimize total system investment and operational costs while improving reliability and maximizing renewable energy penetration under South African conditions. A co-optimized system was found to lower total capital costs by 15–20% compared to traditional sequential sizing approaches.
key_takeaways: Combining C&I solar with CAES can reduce total capital costs by 15–20% compared to traditional sequential sizing approaches.

The study developed a multi-objective framework that optimizes the PV system and CAES components in real-time, balancing energy capacity, power output, thermodynamic efficiency, and economic constraints.
The co-optimized system effectively bridges a critical gap between theoretical CAES design and practical, cost-effective deployment alongside solar PV, making it suitable for microgrid applications.

articles.title: Modular H2 Reactor: Global Power Solutions and Northern Hydrogen Team Up for Scalable Clean Energy
articles.summary: Global Power Solutions Corp. has partnered with Northern Hydrogen and Energy Ltd. to deploy a Modular H2 Reactor platform, which converts water into clean, dispatchable power. The modular design allows for scalability from small backyard operations to large industrial uses. This partnership brings together technology licensors ModeOne Manpower Systems Corp. and MVP Systems to fast-track deployments of proven, off-the-shelf tech.
key_takeaways: The Modular H2 Reactor platform offers a scalable solution for clean energy production, ranging from 80 kW for small-scale operations to gigawatt-sized units for heavy-duty industrial use.

The partnership between Global Power Solutions Corp., Northern Hydrogen and Energy Ltd., ModeOne Manpower Systems Corp., and MVP Systems aims to bring proven, off-the-shelf technology to the market, reducing deployment time and costs.

This development is part of a larger trend towards modular H2 reactors, which have evolved from bench-scale setups to containerized, scalable units that can meet growing energy demands while reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

articles.title: Germany’s TSO begin inertia procurement with long-term contracts for grid-forming BESS
articles.summary: Germany's four transmission system operators (TSOs) have started procuring inertia services from battery energy storage systems (BESS) to enhance grid stability as the share of renewable energy increases. The long-term contracts aim to ensure a reliable power supply and mitigate the impact of increasing wind and solar power variability on the grid. This move is part of Germany's efforts to maintain grid stability in the face of growing shares of intermittent renewable energy sources.
key_takeaways: Germany's TSOs are procuring inertia services from BESS to stabilize the grid, highlighting the importance of energy storage in mitigating the impact of variable renewable energy sources.
The use of long-term contracts for BESS-based inertia services suggests a commitment to maintaining grid stability and reliability in the face of increasing shares of intermittent renewables.
This move is significant, as it underscores the growing recognition of the need for energy storage solutions to ensure grid stability in countries with high shares of renewable energy.

articles.title: Wireless rooftop PV shares generation across Australian school campus
articles.summary: A new wireless rooftop PV solution has been installed at the Saint Columba Anglican School in Australia, allowing for dynamic balancing of solar generation across distribution boards without traditional data cables. The system features three Sungrow inverters connected to the school's existing wireless network, enabling "intelligent load sharing" across multiple buildings. This technology is expected to significantly offset grid electricity use.
key_takeaways: A 310 kW rooftop solar installation has been installed at the Saint Columba Anglican School, featuring 708 Canadian Solar panels and three Sungrow inverters.
The system employs wireless cascading technology, allowing for intelligent load sharing across multiple buildings without traditional cabling or data cable connection limitations.
The technology uses a logger-based approach, connecting master and slave inverters and loggers to the school's existing local network via Modbus TCP protocol.

articles.title: Volta 2025 battery report shows falling costs driving global BESS growth
articles.summary: The Volta Foundation's 2025 Battery Report reveals that battery energy storage system (BESS) deployments have surpassed 100 GW for the first time, driven by falling turnkey system costs and evolving long-duration storage and service agreements. The report showcases a massive effort from over 120 experts across 90 institutions, covering various aspects of the global battery industry. This milestone marks a significant increase in BESS capacity.
key_takeaways: Battery energy storage system (BESS) deployments have exceeded 100 GW for the first time, driven by declining costs and growing demand.
The global BESS capacity has increased to 267 GW / 610 GWh, up from 163 GW / 364 GWh in 2020, indicating a significant growth in the industry.
Falling turnkey system costs have played a crucial role in driving the growth of BESS deployments, making energy storage more competitive and accessible.

articles.title: Grid-forming, hybrids and alternative chemistries in Wood Mackenzie’s 2026 energy storage trend predictions
articles.summary: The global energy storage market is expected to continue its growth in 2026, driven by the integration of new technologies and materials. Grid-forming batteries, hybrids, and alternative chemistries are predicted to play a significant role in shaping the market's future. The trend predictions also highlight the impact of supply chain constraints, regulatory evolution, and emerging applications on the industry.
key_takeaways: Grid-forming batteries are expected to become more prominent in 2026, enabling greater integration with the grid and facilitating wider adoption.
Alternative chemistries, such as solid-state and other advanced materials, will play a crucial role in improving energy storage efficiency and reducing costs.
Supply chain constraints and regulatory evolution are likely to have a significant impact on the market's growth and development, requiring industry players to adapt and innovate.

articles.title: Landfill Panic vs System Reality: What Wind & Solar Actually Displace
articles.summary: The article discusses the misconception that wind turbines and solar panels displace landfills, often cited as a flaw in clean energy. However, the reality is that these renewable energy systems actually displace other types of waste, such as coal ash from power plants or hazardous materials from industrial facilities.
key_takeaways: Wind turbine blades and solar panels can indeed be disposed of at the end of their lives, but they do not necessarily displace landfills.
The article suggests that wind turbines often displace coal ash from power plants, rather than traditional landfill waste.
Solar panels contain recyclable materials such as glass and metals, which can be repurposed or recycled at the end of their life cycle.

articles.title: Wisconsin debates how to pay for the power-hungry AI boom
articles.summary: Wisconsin is grappling with how to fund the increased power demands of data centers, which are expected to experience a significant growth due to the increasing adoption of artificial intelligence (AI). The state's largest utility, We Energies, has proposed a solution that could impact data center operators. The proposal is currently open for public comment.
key_takeaways: Data centers in Wisconsin will be required to pay a higher rate for power under the proposed plan, which aims to offset the increased energy demands of these massive infrastructure users.
The exact cost of the new power infrastructure needed by data centers remains unclear, but it is expected to have significant financial implications for operators.
We Energies' proposal marks a major step forward in addressing the issue, and public comment will be an essential part of the regulatory process.

articles.title: Power Grids Weather Winter Storm Fern, Face Continued Cold Snap
articles.summary: A winter storm affected the power grid in Texas and the Eastern Interconnection, causing hundreds of thousands of power outages. The storm stressed the bulk power system but did not create major disruptions like previous storms. PJM is expecting higher demand due to lower temperatures, which could break its winter peak record.
key_takeaways: Hundreds of thousands of people were affected by power outages during the winter storm, with most customers in Entergy Louisiana's territory expected to be restored by January 28.
Wholesale power prices briefly hit quadruple digits at NYISO and above $1,000/MWh in the Dominion Zone for much of the day, indicating significant stress on the grid.
PJM is expecting peak demand to reach 147.2 GW on January 27, which could break its winter peak record and would also cause low voltage alerts due to the high demand.

articles.title: A Capsule-Sized Multi-Wavelength Wireless Optical System for Edge-AI-Based Classification of Gastrointestinal Bleeding Flow Rate
articles.summary: The article presents a novel, capsule-sized wireless optical system for classifying gastrointestinal bleeding flow rate using multi-wavelength transmission spectroscopy and edge artificial intelligence. The system achieves high accuracy in distinguishing different bleeding flow rates and has the potential to support earlier identification of clinically significant rebleeding. By reducing energy consumption through embedded inference on the capsule electronics, the platform enables prolonged operation.
key_takeaways: The proposed system uses multi-wavelength transmission spectroscopy to perform time-resolved, multi-spectral measurements for classifying gastrointestinal bleeding flow rate.
The system achieves high accuracy (98.75%) in distinguishing different bleeding flow rates and robustly distinguishes diverse non-blood gastrointestinal interference.

The platform reduces energy consumption by approximately 88% compared to continuous wireless transmission of raw data through embedded inference on the capsule electronics, enabling prolonged operation.

articles.title: Success Conditioning as Policy Improvement: The Optimization Problem Solved by Imitating Success
articles.summary: The article discusses success conditioning, a widely used technique for improving policies in reinforcement learning, and proves that it exactly solves a trust-region optimization problem. It shows that relative policy improvement, the magnitude of policy change, and action-influence are equal at every state, making success conditioning a conservative improvement operator. The paper also explores its limitations, including the potential to amplify improvement at the cost of misalignment with the true objective.
key_takeaways: Success conditioning solves a trust-region optimization problem that maximizes policy improvement subject to a χ^2 divergence constraint.
This approach yields an identity where relative policy improvement and action-influence are equal at every state, making it a conservative improvement operator.

When success conditioning fails, it does so in an observable way by hardly changing the policy, but when it succeeds, it can amplify improvement; however, this comes at the cost of potential misalignment with the true objective.

articles.title: A Generative AI-Driven Reliability Layer for Action-Oriented Disaster Resilience
articles.summary: Climate RADAR, a generative AI-driven reliability layer, has been developed to improve disaster resilience by reframing early warning systems from alerts to actions. This system integrates various data sources and employs personalized recommendations to enhance protective action execution, reduce response latency, and increase usability and trust. Climate RADAR aims to advance people-centered, transparent, and equitable disaster management systems.
key_takeaways: Climate RADAR uses a composite risk index integrating meteorological, hydrological, vulnerability, and social data to provide more accurate disaster warnings.
The system employs guardrail-embedded large language models (LLMs) to deliver personalized recommendations across different interfaces, enhancing the effectiveness of early warning systems.

Evaluations through simulations, user studies, and municipal pilot projects have shown improved outcomes for Climate RADAR, including higher protective action execution, reduced response latency, and increased usability and trust.

articles.title: A Cherry-Picking Approach to Large Load Shaping for More Effective Carbon Reduction
articles.summary: This article discusses the challenges of evaluating the effectiveness of load shaping strategies for reducing carbon emissions and energy costs in power systems. The study proposes a "cherry-picking" approach to load shaping, which selects a daily strategy based on observable grid signals and historical data, to improve the accuracy of grid-level CO2 emissions reductions and cost of electricity.
key_takeaways: The study uses granular ERCOT day-ahead direct current optimal power flow (DC-OPF) simulations to analyze the effectiveness of different load shaping strategies.
Load shaping based on locational marginal price (LMP) outperforms other common strategies in terms of annual grid-level CO2 emissions reductions, but can be improved upon.

The "cherry-picking" approach to power load shaping is a promising strategy that combines observable grid signals and historical data to select the most effective daily strategy for reducing carbon emissions and energy costs.

articles.title: Data-driven nonparametric Li-ion battery ageing model aiming at learning from real operation data -- Part A: Storage operation
articles.summary: This article discusses the development of a data-driven ageing model for Li-ion batteries using the Gaussian Process framework. The goal is to create a model that can learn from real-world battery operation data, reducing the need for exhaustive laboratory testing. The authors present an experimental verification of cell degradation through calendar ageing and report promising results with a model trained on only 18 tested cells.
key_takeaways: A data-driven ageing model using Gaussian Process framework is developed to predict Li-ion battery ageing based on real-world operation data.
The model achieves an overall mean-absolute-error of 0.53% in capacity curves prediction, indicating its accuracy and reliability.
The study suggests that the model can learn from new data observations, providing more accurate and confident predictions, and extending the operating window of the model.

articles.title: Photovoltaic energy sharing: Implementation and tests on a real collective self-consumption system
articles.summary: This research study analyzes a collective self-consumption (CSC) system in the Izarbel technological park in France, focusing on photovoltaic (PV) energy sharing and its impact on self-consumption rate and savings. The study compares three types of PV energy sharing: static, dynamic by default, and customized dynamic, and explores their effects under various scenarios. The findings highlight the benefits of dynamic and customized dynamic sharing for increased self-consumption rates and savings.
key_takeaways: Dynamic allocations of PV energy sharing lead to increases in self-consumption rate (SCR).
Customized dynamic sharing proves more effective in achieving higher savings compared to static and dynamic by default sharing.

The study highlights the importance of considering various scenarios, including the presence or absence of a data centre and solar radiation levels, when evaluating the performance of PV energy sharing systems.

articles.title: Germany launches instantaneous reserve market, opening door to storage
articles.summary: Germany has launched a market-based mechanism to procure instantaneous reserve, allowing inverter-based assets and battery energy storage systems (BESS) to participate for the first time. This marks a shift away from gas- and coal-fired power plants providing this function, which is now being relied upon by market participants. The new model opens up new revenue opportunities for storage providers.
key_takeaways: Germany has launched a market-based mechanism to procure instantaneous reserve, marking a significant change in how the system service is delivered.
Inverter-based assets and battery energy storage systems (BESS) can now participate in the instantaneous reserve market, creating new revenue opportunities for storage providers.
The shift away from gas- and coal-fired power plants providing instantaneous reserve raises questions about long-term profitability and regulatory risk.

articles.title: Plans for two new reactors confirmed by South Korea
articles.summary: South Korea remains committed to building two new large nuclear power reactors by 2038, as part of its 11th Basic Plan for Electricity Supply and Demand. The announcement was made by Minister Kim Sung-hwan. This plan is in line with the country's energy and climate goals.
key_takeaways: South Korea plans to construct two new large nuclear power reactors by 2038.
The project is part of the country's 11th Basic Plan for Electricity Supply and Demand, which aims to ensure a stable energy supply.
The construction of these new reactors aligns with South Korea's energy and climate goals.

articles.title: MISO regulators seek stakeholder review for DOE ‘emergency’ orders cost allocation
articles.summary: MISO regulators have expressed concerns that the US Department of Energy's "emergency" orders for power plant retirement in the Midcontinent region may not provide reliability benefits, and are seeking stakeholder review on the cost allocation. The DOE has been working with the Midwest Independent System Operator (MISO) to develop the plan. However, state utility regulators have questioned the validity of the plan.
key_takeaways: State utility regulators have raised concerns that the US Department of Energy's "emergency" orders for power plant retirement in the Midcontinent region may not provide reliability benefits.
The MISO has been working with the DOE to develop a plan to keep power plants from retiring, but regulators are seeking stakeholder review on the cost allocation.
Regulators have also questioned whether there are any actual reliability benefits to keeping old power plants running instead of retiring them.

articles.title: Earth To Trump: China Is Winning The Renewable Energy War, Bigly
articles.summary: The article suggests that despite US energy policy, China is gaining momentum in the global renewable energy market, particularly among Gulf states. China is seeking to accelerate the transition to clean energy in these regions. This shift may pose a challenge for the US in its efforts to promote renewable energy.
key_takeaways: China is actively pursuing opportunities to promote renewable energy in Gulf states, which could further solidify its position as a global leader in this sector.
The article implies that the US's energy policy may not be having the desired effect of promoting domestic renewable energy growth, potentially ceding ground to China in the global market.
China's focus on accelerating the transition to clean energy in Gulf states may have significant implications for the global energy landscape and the role of the US in shaping it.

articles.title: Winter peak demand could hit new highs, prompting DOE emergency orders
articles.summary: The US Department of Energy (DOE) has issued emergency orders to grid operators to prepare for potentially record-high winter peak demand, despite generators indicating they have adequate power supplies. This increased demand is likely due to the cold weather forecasted for this week. Grid operators are taking proactive measures to ensure a stable energy supply during this period.
key_takeaways: The US Department of Energy has issued emergency orders to grid operators in response to potentially record-high winter peak demand.
Despite generators indicating they have adequate power supplies, grid operators are taking precautions to prepare for the increased demand.
The cold weather forecasted for this week is likely contributing to the expected increase in energy demand.

articles.title: Nuclear plants reported few outages in the first three weeks of January 2026
articles.summary: The article reports that nuclear power plants experienced relatively few outages during the first three weeks of January 2026, averaging 2.0 GW per day, which is 20% less than in the same period in 2025 and below the previous five-year range for 7 out of 21 days.
key_takeaways: The number of nuclear power plant outages decreased by 20% compared to the same period in 2025.
The average daily outage was lower than the previous five-year range, indicating a decrease in overall downtime for nuclear plants.
Nuclear plants experienced extended periods without outages on 7 out of 21 days, suggesting improved reliability and performance.

articles.title: US Oil Industry Busted For “One Of The Most Successful Antitrust Conspiracies” In US History
articles.summary: The Michigan State Attorney General has filed an antitrust lawsuit against five major oil companies, alleging a 50-year conspiracy to restrain competition from renewable energy sources. This conspiracy allegedly aims to maintain the dominance of fossil fuels in the US energy market. The lawsuit marks one of the most significant antitrust cases against the US oil industry.
key_takeaways: A 50-year antitrust conspiracy is alleged against major oil companies, including BP, Chevron, Exxon Mobil, Shell, and their organizations.
The case accuses these companies of illegally restraining competition from renewable energy sources to maintain dominance in the US energy market.
This lawsuit is significant as it targets one of the most powerful and well-established industries in the US, with far-reaching implications for the country's transition to clean energy.

articles.title: $400 Million Facility Closed By Exus Renewables North America
articles.summary: A $400 million power and energy systems facility operated by Exus Renewables North America has been closed, citing unspecified reasons. The closure of this facility highlights the challenges faced by companies in the renewable energy sector. However, no direct impact on the company's financial performance or its parent company is explicitly stated.
key_takeaways: A $400 million power and energy systems facility operated by Exus Renewables North America has been closed.
The reasons for the closure are not specified in the available information.
The closure of this facility may indicate challenges faced by companies in the renewable energy sector, but no direct impact on financial performance is explicitly stated.

articles.title: Jackery releases 2 kW solar gazebo
articles.summary: Jackery, a Chinese solar and storage company, has unveiled its 2 kW solar gazebo designed for creating outdoor space. The product features integrated solar components, industrial-grade panels with high cell efficiency, and is expected to be available in the US market by 2026. The gazebo can provide backup power for homes when bundled with other Jackery products.
key_takeaways: The Jackery Solar Gazebo features a design that combines outdoor living space with integrated solar components, including 20 individual 100 W PV modules under a louvered roof.

The product is designed to be a permanent outdoor structure, with a frame made from 6063 T5 aluminum, and may offer optional extras such as lighting, blinds, and a projector screen at the time of purchase.
When bundled with other Jackery products, the gazebo can provide backup power for homes, making it suitable for off-grid living or emergency situations.

articles.title: Moody’s sees $3T in data center spending by 2030
articles.summary: Moody's predicts that data center spending will reach $3 trillion by 2030, driven by strong demand despite potential challenges such as costlier builds and power constraints.
key_takeaways: Data center spending is expected to reach $3 trillion by 2030, according to Moody's.
The company notes that construction costs and power constraints could lead to delays in completion timelines.
Strong demand for data centers suggests that the industry will continue to grow despite potential challenges.

articles.title: China switches on 1 GW of solar at 4,600 m above sea level
articles.summary: China has commissioned a 1 GW solar power plant on the Yalong River in Sichuan province, making it the world's third-highest-altitude PV facility at 4,600 m. The project integrates with hydro assets to optimize energy output in the challenging plateau environment. This development is part of China's integrated "hydro-wind-solar" energy strategy in the upper Yangtze region.
key_takeaways: The 1 GW Suorong photovoltaic power station in Sichuan province holds the record for being the world's third-highest-altitude PV facility, standing at 4,600 m above sea level.

Despite challenging conditions such as snow, hail, and debris-flow disruptions, Chinese manufacturers JA Solar and Yingli Solar successfully delivered modules for the project over a period of four months.
The project integrates with hydro assets to optimize energy output in the plateau environment, showcasing China's efforts to advance its integrated "hydro-wind-solar" energy strategy.

articles.title: Hydrogen Production Hub Feasibility Assessed at Stockholm Skavsta Airport
articles.summary: A feasibility study has been initiated for a hydrogen and electro-sustainable aviation fuel (e-SAF) hub at Stockholm Skavsta Airport, with Fortum and Skavsta Logistics partnering to develop the project. The study aims to assess the production of green hydrogen and sustainable aviation fuel on-site, utilizing wind and solar farms as power sources. The collaboration seeks to tackle EU and ICAO emissions mandates and provide airlines with an eco-friendly fuel option.
key_takeaways: A 100,000-square-meter plot at Stockholm Skavsta Airport is being considered for a hydrogen production hub, which will also produce sustainable aviation fuel.
The feasibility study will focus on the production of green hydrogen and e-SAF, using wind and solar farms as power sources, without requiring significant upfront capital investment.
The project aims to tackle EU and ICAO emissions mandates in the aviation industry by providing airlines with a sustainable and eco-friendly fuel option.

articles.title: Charbone Supplies Green Hydrogen to Power Ontario Film Sets
articles.summary: Charbone Corporation, Canada's only publicly traded producer of Ultra High Purity (UHP) green hydrogen, has begun delivering its product to film and TV shoots in Ontario, powering modular fuel cell generators that replace traditional diesel gensets. This partnership demonstrates the practical application of clean UHP hydrogen for mobile power and reduces emissions on set. The company is expanding its network of clean energy hubs, with this Ontario rollout marking its first move into more visible applications.
key_takeaways: Charbone Corporation is supplying Ultra High Purity (UHP) green hydrogen to film and TV shoots in Ontario, replacing traditional diesel generators with modular fuel cell systems.
The company's flagship Sorel-Tracy project is central to its hydrogen production, which involves high-voltage current splitting water into hydrogen at 99.999% purity.
This partnership demonstrates the potential of clean UHP hydrogen for mobile power applications, reducing emissions and logistics challenges on film sets.

articles.title: Port Authority of Alicante Opens Tender for Renewable Hydrogen Production
articles.summary: The Port Authority of Alicante has launched a tender to build its first dedicated renewable hydrogen production and supply hub, aiming to decarbonize the port's operations. The project will involve designing, building, and running a 1 MW electrolyzer powered by solar panels and mini wind turbines, with plans for on-site hydrogen storage and fueling ships and equipment. This initiative is part of the port's effort to transition towards sustainable energy.
key_takeaways: The Port Authority of Alicante is launching a tender for a renewable hydrogen production and supply hub, which will be powered by solar panels and mini wind turbines.
The project aims to reduce emissions from the port's operations, with plans to fuel ships, port equipment, and nearby trucks using high-purity hydrogen.
The 1 MW electrolyzer will be anchored in a roughly 3,000 m² breakwater area, indicating a significant investment in green infrastructure for the port.

articles.title: Ukraine deploys 1.5 GW of solar in 2025
articles.summary: Ukraine has seen significant growth in its solar energy market, with an estimated 1.5 GW of new installations added in 2025. This represents substantial expansion from the previous year's 800 MW addition, bringing the cumulative capacity to over 8.5 GW. The country is experiencing strong demand for solar power combined with battery energy storage systems (BESS).
key_takeaways: Ukraine has achieved a significant growth in its solar market, with an estimated 1.5 GW of new installations added in 2025.
The growth is driven by increasing interest in projects that combine solar power with BESS, particularly in the commercial and industrial sectors.
The residential market remained stable, while hybrid solar-plus-storage systems were deployed across various customers, including municipalities and agricultural consumers.

articles.title: PG&E defines a new utility model for data centers, onsite gas, and community connection
articles.summary: PG&E is developing a new utility model to accommodate the growing demand for data centers, onsite gas, and community connections. The company aims to meet this increasing load without exceeding infrastructure limits or violating physical laws. This effort involves navigating complex challenges in energy supply and distribution.
key_takeaways: PG&E has identified a 10 GW pipeline of data center demand, which is sufficient to power over 7.5 million homes, underscoring the significant growth in data center infrastructure.
The company's efforts are aimed at balancing load growth with physical limitations, suggesting that there may be constraints on the expansion of energy supply and distribution systems.

By developing a new utility model, PG&E is likely exploring innovative solutions to address the unique challenges posed by data centers, onsite gas, and community connections in a rapidly changing energy landscape.

articles.title: Musk at WEF: Solar space-based AI data centers possible in two to three years
articles.summary: Elon Musk has stated that space-based solar power could potentially power AI data centers more efficiently than on Earth, with full-scale deployment possible within two to three years. He cited the benefits of space-based solar, including five times more effectiveness due to constant sunlight and reduced atmospheric attenuation. Additionally, space offers excellent thermal conditions, making it a suitable location for building solar-powered AI data centers.
key_takeaways: Space-based solar power could potentially offer 5-6 times more energy efficiency than traditional on-Earth solar power due to the lack of atmospheric attenuation.
The constant sunlight and reduced temperature fluctuations in space make it an ideal location for building solar-powered AI data centers.
SpaceX's Starship launch vehicle and reusable rockets aim to reduce space access costs, making it possible to deploy large-scale extraterrestrial energy infrastructure.

articles.title: Turkey switches on first major solar-plus-storage project
articles.summary: Turkey has successfully commissioned its first major solar-plus-storage project, the Sivrihisar project in Eskisehir, which combines a 49.2 MWp solar PV plant with a 34.1 MWh battery energy storage system (BESS). The facility marks Turkey's first grid-connected hybrid asset developed under the country's DGES framework for licensed solar-storage projects. This milestone demonstrates Turkey's growing commitment to renewable energy and sustainable development.
key_takeaways: The Sivrihisar project is Turkey's first major solar-plus-storage facility, featuring a 49.2 MWp solar PV plant paired with 34.1 MWh of battery storage.
The project has completed all regulatory processes and entered service, marking a significant milestone in Turkey's transition to renewable energy.

The Sivrihisar project is the country's first grid-connected hybrid asset developed under the DGES framework for licensed solar-storage projects, highlighting Turkey's growing commitment to sustainable finance.

articles.title: Energy-hungry Australian pig farm goes off-grid with 100 kW solar array
