articles.summary: A large-scale pig farm in South Australia has installed a 100 kW solar array and 256 kWh battery energy storage system to power its operations, marking an ambitious move towards becoming off-grid. The project required careful engineering and technical planning due to the extreme surge demands of the site's equipment. MyEnergy Engineering, the firm behind the installation, designed and delivered a fully containerized power station to address these challenges.
key_takeaways: The pig farm's extreme surge demands created significant phase imbalance and voltage stability challenges, requiring precise control to maintain supply stability.
MyEnergy Engineering designed and delivered a fully containerized, climate-controlled power station to overcome these issues, using 99.44 kW JA Solar panels and a S-Rack system.

The installation required integration with the existing Fronius AC infrastructure and a large backup diesel generator, highlighting the complexity of powering large-scale agricultural operations off-grid.

articles.title: A new utility-recognized approach to grid-integrated electrification in the “messy middle”
articles.summary: The article discusses Flair's Bridge Pro, a utility-recognized approach to grid-integrated electrification in the "messy middle" of heating and cooling systems. This approach enables control of ductless and hybrid systems, which is significant for utilities as it allows them to manage and optimize energy distribution more efficiently. The technology has been recognized by leading utilities.
key_takeaways: Flair's Bridge Pro is a utility-recognized approach that controls ductless and hybrid systems.
This technology is part of the "messy middle" of heating and cooling systems, where grid-integrated electrification is needed.
By enabling control of these systems, Flair's Bridge Pro allows utilities to optimize energy distribution and management.

articles.title: A rare step forward for a US pumped hydro project
articles.summary: A rare step forward for a US pumped hydro project has been taken, with Rye Development securing a federal license to build a massive new energy storage facility in Washington state. This marks the first grid megaproject of its kind in the U.S. since 1995, paving the way for utilities to store electricity through this traditional method. The project aims to provide a reliable and sustainable source of power.
key_takeaways: Rye Development is becoming the first company to construct a pumped hydro energy storage facility in the US since 1995.

Pumped hydro energy storage is an older technology that stores electricity by pumping water from a lower reservoir to an upper reservoir during off-peak hours, and then releasing it back down to generate power during peak demand periods.
The project in Washington state aims to provide a reliable and sustainable source of power, marking a shift towards more traditional methods of energy storage after the rise of lithium-ion batteries.

articles.title: How Utilities Can Prepare for the AI-Driven Energy Surge
articles.summary: The US electricity demand is expected to increase by 25% by 2030 and over 75% by 2050, driven largely by the growing need for power in data centers supporting the AI boom. This surge in energy demand poses a significant challenge for utilities to prepare for, especially as new technologies emerge. To address this, utilities must invest in infrastructure and develop strategies to meet the growing energy needs.
key_takeaways: The US electricity demand is expected to increase significantly by 2030 and 2050 due to the growing need for power in data centers supporting the AI boom.
Utilities will face significant challenges in meeting the growing energy demands, which may require investments in infrastructure and new technologies.
Preparing for this AI-driven energy surge is crucial for utilities to ensure a reliable and efficient energy supply in the future.

articles.title: Robust Grid-Forming Control Based on Virtual Flux Observer
articles.summary: The article discusses a novel grid-forming control method for grid-connected converters (GCCs) that utilizes a virtual flux observer-based synchronization and load angle control. The proposed method regulates the terminal voltage to provide voltage-source behavior, exhibiting strong robustness in stability and dynamical performance across varying and uncertain grid strengths. This method is demonstrated through small-signal analysis and experiments on a 20 kVA power conversion system.
key_takeaways: The proposed grid-forming control method uses a virtual flux observer-based synchronization and load angle control to regulate the terminal voltage of the converter.
The method exhibits strong robustness in stability and dynamical performance across varying and uncertain grid strengths, making it suitable for uncertain grid environments.
The robust control performance of the proposed method is demonstrated through small-signal analysis and validated by experiments on a 20 kVA power conversion system.

articles.title: Performance of Differential Protection Applied to Collector Cables of Offshore Wind Farms with MMC-HVDC Transmission
articles.summary: The article investigates the performance of differential protection on collector cables of offshore wind farms with MMC-HVDC transmission. It highlights the limitations of conventional differential protection schemes under conditions where Inverter-Based Resources modify fault currents, and compares them with enhanced strategies that account for sequence components. The study uses electromagnetic transient simulations to assess internal and external fault scenarios.
key_takeaways: Conventional differential protection schemes are limited in their ability to accurately detect faults on collector cables of offshore wind farms due to the modification of fault currents by Inverter-Based Resources.

Enhanced strategies that consider sequence components can improve the sensitivity and selectivity of differential protection, enabling more accurate detection of faults under MMC-HVDC transmission conditions.
The study suggests that a deeper conceptual understanding of evolving protection challenges in converter-dominated grids is essential for developing effective power system protection schemes.

articles.title: Noise Resilience and Robust Convergence Guarantees for the Variational Quantum Eigensolver
articles.summary: The article discusses the impact of noise on the Variational Quantum Eigensolver (VQE), a hybrid quantum-classical algorithm used to find the ground state of a Hamiltonian. Researchers investigated how different types of coherent and incoherent noise processes affect the optimal parameters and cost of VQE, shedding light on its convergence guarantees. The study aims to provide novel theoretical insight into parameterized quantum circuits.
key_takeaways: The article characterizes the effect of different noise processes on the optimal parameters and cost of VQE, which is essential for understanding the algorithm's convergence guarantees.
Researchers aimed to bridge the gap between global convergence guarantees under suitable local surjectivity and smoothness hypotheses and the study of convergence in noisy environments.
The study is complemented by numerical simulations using Pennylane, providing a practical application of the theoretical findings.

articles.title: Agentic AI-RAN Empowering Synergetic Sensing, Communication, Computing, and Control
articles.summary: This article proposes a new paradigm for low-altitude wireless networks, called Agentic AI-RAN, which enables autonomous decision-making at the network edge. The proposed architecture integrates sensing, communication, computing, and control processes within a single edge node, tackling the challenge of coordinating heterogeneous workloads in resource-constrained environments. A prototype system based on a GPU platform demonstrates the feasibility of this approach for mission-critical low-altitude wireless networks.
key_takeaways: Agentic AI-RAN architecture enables autonomous decision-making at the network edge, integrating sensing, communication, computing, and control processes within a single edge node.

The proposed system leverages Multi-Instance GPU (MIG) partitioning and containerized deployment to achieve physical resource isolation while supporting tightly coupled coordination between real-time communication and multimodal inference.

Experimental results demonstrate low closed-loop latency, robust bidirectional communication, and stable performance under dynamic runtime conditions, highlighting the viability of Agentic AI-RAN for mission-critical low-altitude wireless networks.

articles.title: Sequential Operating Simulation of Solid State Transformer-Driven Next-Generation 800 VDC Data Center
articles.summary: The article presents a novel power-delivery system for next-generation AI data centers using solid-state transformers (SSTs) and an 800 VDC distribution architecture. The proposed system, which combines a three-phase H-bridge AC/DC stage with a dual-active-bridge DC/DC stage, aims to improve efficiency and reduce energy consumption compared to conventional uninterruptible power supply (UPS) systems. The simulation results demonstrate tight regulation of the DC-bus voltage and reduced input-side energy consumption.
key_takeaways: The proposed system uses an SST-driven 800 VDC architecture that converts 10 kV MVAC to an 800V LVDC bus, offering a more efficient and robust solution for AI data centers.
The coordinated closed-loop control scheme ensures DC-bus voltage stability, while the simulation results show reduced input-side energy consumption compared to UPS systems.

Numerical studies demonstrate tight regulation of the DC-bus voltage and satisfactory power-quality performance, with a practical capacitance range for design that balances tradeoffs between DC-bus ripple and low-frequency input-power oscillations.

articles.title: Optimal County-Level Siting of Data Centers in the United States
articles.summary: The article discusses a study that uses a comprehensive modeling approach to determine the optimal locations for constructing data centers in the United States, taking into account factors such as power grid capacity, telecommunications, climate, water use, and renewable energy potential. The model aims to minimize costs while considering the environmental impact of these resource-intensive facilities. The results suggest that sites with higher renewable potential are preferred.
key_takeaways: The study uses an interdisciplinary modeling approach to evaluate optimal locations for data centers, incorporating factors such as power grid capacity, climate, and water use.

Capital costs are the primary driver in choosing a location, but having a longer future outlook with more variable generation collocation can influence the model to select sites with higher renewable potential.
The results indicate that optimal locations may prioritize regions with high renewable energy potential to minimize environmental impact while reducing costs.

articles.title: Identification of Port-Hamiltonian Differential-Algebraic Equations from Input-Output Data
articles.summary: The article introduces a data-driven identification method for port-Hamiltonian differential-algebraic equations (pH-DAEs) using port-Hamiltonian neural networks (pHNNs) and a differential-algebraic solver. The approach is demonstrated on a DC power network, showing that it accurately captures system behavior while preserving interconnection structure and passivity properties. The proposed method is robust to noise in the input-output data.
key_takeaways: The article presents a novel identification method for pH-DAEs using pHNNs and a differential-algebraic solver.
The approach preserves the passivity and interconnection structure of port-Hamiltonian systems, making it suitable for modeling complex physical systems.
The method is demonstrated to be robust to noise in the input-output data, with parameter estimates that maintain errors proportional to the noise amplitude.

articles.title: Challenges in the Proper Metrological Verification of Smart Energy Meters
articles.summary: The article discusses challenges in the metrological verification of smart energy meters, highlighting that current methods often fail to recreate actual power grid conditions and verify signal chain properties. Existing requirements and research directions are presented, but also reveal imperfections in selected meters despite meeting normative and legal standards. The study aims to identify further research directions for improving the validation of smart energy meters.
key_takeaways: Current metrological verification methods for smart energy meters often do not accurately reflect real-world conditions.
Despite passing legal and normative requirements, smart energy meters may have significant imperfections in their signal chains.
Research into smart energy meters is needed to improve the validation process and ensure accurate measurements of active/reactive energy and power quality indicators.

articles.title: EVs Outrank Data Centers in California Electricity Demand Forecast
articles.summary: The California Energy Commission has approved a forecast showing that the state's electricity consumption could surge by up to 61% over the next 20 years, with electric vehicles (EVs) being the biggest driver of peak load growth at 8,234 MW. New data centers are expected to contribute 4,721 MW to peak load growth, followed by fuel substitution and climate change impacts. The forecast is part of the agency's 2025 Integrated Energy Policy Report, which informs the state's resource adequacy requirements and transmission planning.
key_takeaways: Electric vehicles are projected to be the largest contributor to peak load growth in California, with a predicted increase of 8,234 MW by 2045.
New data centers are expected to drive significant electricity demand growth, with a forecasted contribution of 4,721 MW by 2045.
Climate change impacts and fuel substitution from electrification will also contribute to increased peak load growth, although to a lesser extent (1,811 MW and 4,464 MW, respectively).

articles.title: FERC Dismisses Rehearing Ask for SPP’s ERAS Process
articles.summary: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) has rejected a rehearing request from clean energy groups and public interest organizations regarding SPP's Expedited Resource Adequacy Study (ERAS) process. The organizations argued that the commission's decision was arbitrary and capricious, citing implausible assumptions about capacity availability to meet near-term resource adequacy needs. FERC upheld its original 2025 decision approving SPP's ERAS process.
key_takeaways: Clean energy groups and public interest organizations opposed SPP's ERAS process, arguing it amounts to queue jumping and violates FERC's principle of nondiscriminatory access to the grid.

The organizations claimed that FERC's assumptions about capacity availability were "implausible" and failed to account for historical rates of load growth or the potential contribution of energy storage projects in the queue.
FERC disagreed with these concerns, upholding its original 2025 decision approving SPP's ERAS process despite the objections from clean energy groups and public interest organizations.

articles.title: When Europe’s Economic Institutions Step Away From Hydrogen
articles.summary: The European Council of Economic Experts and France's Conseil d'analyse économique have jointly stepped away from hydrogen as a broad energy carrier, highlighting the challenges in supporting its development. This decision is particularly concerning given Germany's existing hydrogen infrastructure with no suppliers or customers for the 400 km pressurized segment. The move underscores the difficulties in scaling up hydrogen production and distribution.
key_takeaways: The European Council of Economic Experts and France's Conseil d'analyse économique have jointly abandoned hydrogen as a primary energy carrier, raising concerns about its feasibility.
Germany's existing hydrogen infrastructure is being left without suppliers or customers for a 400 km pressurized segment, highlighting the challenges in supporting large-scale hydrogen production.
The decision to step away from hydrogen highlights the difficulties in scaling up hydrogen production and distribution, which are crucial for its widespread adoption as a clean energy source.

articles.title: FERC Approves License for Goldendale Hydro Project in Wash. State
articles.summary: FERC has approved a 40-year license for the Goldendale Hydro Project, a 1.2-GW pumped hydroelectric storage facility in Washington State. The project will include two reservoirs and a powerhouse with three pump-turbine units, generating power to be sold to utilities in the Pacific Northwest and California. The expected commercial operation date is 2032, with an estimated cost of over $2 billion.
key_takeaways: The Goldendale Hydro Project is a significant investment for the Pacific Northwest, aiming to provide more reliable grid and affordable energy prices to the region.
The project will utilize closed-loop technology, where water from the Columbia River is used in both reservoirs, reducing environmental impact and minimizing water loss through evaporation.

The power generation capacity of the Goldendale Hydro Project is expected to be 1.2 GW, with a transmission line connecting it to the Bonneville Power Administration's system and generating electricity for up to 12 hours on a typical day.

articles.title: Gogoro’s Reset: From Electric Scooter Brand to Energy Infrastructure Company
articles.summary: Gogoro, a well-known electric scooter brand, is undergoing a significant transformation to shift its focus from manufacturing to energy infrastructure. The company is trying to "reset" and stop losing money after years of struggles. Although details are limited due to confidentiality agreements, CleanTechnica has managed to gather some information.
key_takeaways: Gogoro is attempting to transition away from its traditional electric scooter business and explore new opportunities in the energy sector.
The company's goal is to address its financial struggles by diversifying into a different industry, although specifics are not publicly disclosed due to confidentiality agreements.
Gogoro's shift towards energy infrastructure suggests that the company aims to expand its product offerings beyond electric scooters and tap into emerging markets.

articles.title: China TOPCon solar module prices climb over 30% since mid-December
articles.summary: China's TOPCon solar module prices have risen for the third consecutive week, with a significant increase in forward curve prices, reflecting market participants' concerns over export rebates removal and higher cell prices. The OPIS Global Solar Markets Report shows that TOPCon module prices rose by 12.75% to $0.115/W Free-On-Board (FOB) China, while forward prices for later quarters also increased. This trend suggests that the impact of policy shifts is being felt in the market.
key_takeaways: TOPCon solar module prices have risen by 12.75% to $0.115/W FOB China, marking a third consecutive week of increases.
Forward curve prices are also higher, with Q2 2026 loading cargoes assessed at $0.120/W and Q3 2026 loading cargoes rising to $0.121/W.
The impact of export rebates removal and higher cell prices is being felt in the market, with silver prices remaining a key variable for module pricing.
Expectations suggest that policy shifts could feed through to forward pricing, indicating a potential increase in prices for later quarters.

articles.title: Chart: Trump cratered the clean-energy manufacturing boom
articles.summary: The article discusses how the first year of President Trump's second term saw a significant downturn in clean energy manufacturing in the US, reversing years of increasing investment and growth. This decline was unexpected despite rising investments prompted by inflation concerns. The decrease has led to renewed scrutiny on the administration's stance on environmental policies.
key_takeaways: Clean energy manufacturing experienced a surge in investment before President Trump's second term due to inflation concerns.
However, this surge was followed by a significant downturn in the first year of Trump 2.0, with no clear explanation for the decline.
The reversal highlights the uncertainty and unpredictability of environmental policies under the current administration.
The decrease in clean energy manufacturing could have long-term consequences on the US's transition to renewable energy sources and its commitment to reducing carbon emissions.

articles.title: N.Y. Extends ZEC Nuclear Subsidies to 2049
articles.summary: New York is extending its nuclear power subsidies, known as the Zero-Emissions Credit (ZEC) program, until 2049 at a cost of up to $33.4 billion to ratepayers. The program was created in 2016 to support the state's decarbonization strategy and ensure the continued operation of four nuclear reactors that are expensive to operate but not economical at market power prices. The extension is seen as necessary to prevent the closure of these reactors, which could impact reliability and achievement of clean-energy goals.
key_takeaways: The ZEC program will be extended until 2049, providing financial support for New York's four operating nuclear reactors that are expensive to operate but not economical at market power prices.
The extension is seen as crucial to prevent the closure of these reactors, which could have significant impacts on reliability, resource adequacy, and achievement of statewide clean-energy goals.
Constellation Energy, which operates all four reactors, has sought financial certainty as it plans for the future of its oldest operating reactors, which are licensed to operate only until 2029.

articles.title: The 641hp Hyundai IONIQ 6 N launches in the UK with a new virtual gear shift and fun extras
articles.summary: The Hyundai IONIQ 6 N has launched in the UK, offering a sporty electric vehicle experience with up to 641 horsepower and a 0-62 mph time of just 3.2 seconds. In addition to its impressive performance capabilities, the IONIQ 6 N also features virtual gear shifts and fun extras. This new model is Hyundai's second performance EV.
key_takeaways: The Hyundai IONIQ 6 N boasts up to 641 horsepower, making it a high-performance electric vehicle.
The car achieves an impressive 0-62 mph time in just 3.2 seconds, showcasing its rapid acceleration capabilities.
Virtual gear shifts are among the fun extras available on the IONIQ 6 N, indicating that this model is designed for driving enthusiasts who value unique features and a sporty experience.

articles.title: EnergySolutions sets date for Kewaunee licence application
articles.summary: EnergySolutions, a Utah-based nuclear services company, has set a June 2028 deadline to submit an application for a major licensing action for new nuclear generation at the Kewaunee site in Wisconsin.
key_takeaways: EnergySolutions plans to submit an application for a new nuclear generation project at the Kewaunee site by June 2028.
The company is based in Utah, indicating that it has the necessary expertise and resources to undertake a major nuclear licensing action.
The Kewaunee site has previously been associated with nuclear power generation, suggesting that EnergySolutions' proposal may involve reviving or repurposing existing infrastructure.

articles.title: EIA forecasts near-term U.S. crude oil production will remain near 2025 record
articles.summary: The EIA forecasts that U.S. crude oil production will remain near the record high of 13.6 million barrels per day in 2026, before decreasing by 2% to 13.3 million b/d in 2027. This would mark the first decline in annual U.S. crude oil production since 2021. The forecast suggests a stable production level for the near term.
key_takeaways: U.S. crude oil production is expected to remain near the record high of 13.6 million barrels per day in 2026.
A 2% decline in annual U.S. crude oil production is forecasted for 2027, marking the first such decline since 2021.
This forecast suggests a stable production level for the near term, with no significant changes anticipated until 2027.

articles.title: America’s offshore wind farms get back to work after court victories
articles.summary: Offshore wind developers in the US have resumed construction on three major projects after federal judges lifted a pause order issued by the Trump administration. The resumption of work comes nearly a month after the court victories, which cleared the way for Ørsted, Equinor, and Dominion Energy to proceed with their multibillion-dollar wind farms. This development marks a significant step forward for the US offshore wind industry.
key_takeaways: Three major US offshore wind projects (Ørsted, Equinor, and Dominion Energy) have resumed construction after being cleared by federal judges.
The resumption of work comes nearly a month after the court victories, which lifted a pause order issued by the Trump administration.
This development marks a significant step forward for the US offshore wind industry, which has been facing challenges during the Trump administration.

articles.title: KHNP takes stake in TerraPower
articles.summary: KHNP, a South Korean nuclear power company, has acquired a stake in TerraPower, a US-based developer of small modular reactors. This investment marks an expansion of KHNP's nuclear energy portfolio and positions the company for potential growth in the emerging small modular reactor market. The partnership aims to promote the commercialization of TerraPower's technology.
key_takeaways: South Korea's Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power (KHNP) has taken a stake in US-based TerraPower, a developer of small modular reactors.
This investment marks an expansion of KHNP's nuclear energy portfolio and positions the company for potential growth in the emerging small modular reactor market.
The partnership aims to promote the commercialization of TerraPower's technology, highlighting the growing interest in small modular reactors globally.

articles.title: Honda’s new 50 MPH commuter ‘electric motorcycle’ rolls out with interesting battery choice
articles.summary: Honda has released its new electric motorcycle, the UC3, which is set to be launched in Vietnam and Thailand. The bike features integrated batteries, a departure from Honda's usual removable-battery standard. This unique design choice may offer potential benefits for the motorcycle.
key_takeaways: Honda is using integrated batteries in its latest electric motorcycle model, the UC3.
This decision deviates from the company's typical use of removable batteries, which may provide new advantages or challenges for the bike.
The launch of the UC3 marks another significant release from Honda's expanding electric two-wheeler lineup.

articles.title: Egypt Picks Up Solar Power Banner Dropped By US President Donald Trump
articles.summary: The article reports that the US has lost its interest in promoting solar power, with President Donald Trump dropping the initiative. In response, Egypt and other countries are stepping up their efforts to develop and invest in solar power projects.
key_takeaways: Elite Solar, a Singapore-based solar manufacturer, is among the companies rushing to fill the demand for solar power in both Egypt and the US.
The loss of interest from the US government may create opportunities for other countries like Egypt to become prominent players in the global solar energy market.
This shift could lead to an increase in international investment and collaboration in the development and implementation of solar power projects.

articles.title: Advocates Challenge Georgia Power’s Overbuilt, Flawed Data Center Plan
articles.summary: Environmental groups are challenging Georgia Power's plan to build expensive gas plants, specifically highlighting the issue with the company's data center plan which has been deemed "overbuilt" and "flawed." The groups have filed a response to Georgia Power and the Georgia Public Service Commission's defense of their plan. This challenges the legitimacy of Georgia Power's energy infrastructure.
key_takeaways: Environmental groups are pushing back against Georgia Power's plans, specifically targeting the company's data center infrastructure.
The groups claim that Georgia Power's data center plan is "overbuilt" and has "flawed" data, suggesting potential issues with the plan's feasibility.
This development indicates a challenge to Georgia Power's energy strategy and highlights concerns over the company's reliability and sustainability.

articles.title: Energy Affordability & Clean Air on the Line in Washington State
articles.summary: The Washington State Supreme Court is hearing oral arguments regarding the legality of Initiative 2066, which allegedly misled voters by altering existing climate and clean air laws without explicit mention in the ballot title. The initiative's impact on energy affordability and clean air is at stake. The court's decision will determine the effectiveness of the measure.
key_takeaways: Initiative 2066 may have improperly amended existing climate and clean air laws, potentially misleading voters about its content.
The measure's effects on energy affordability are also being scrutinized, highlighting the importance of transparency in policy decisions.
The Washington State Supreme Court is playing a crucial role in determining the initiative's legality and impact on the state's environmental policies.

articles.title: International safety assessments of Finnish, French SMRs
articles.summary: International safety authorities from several countries are conducting a joint review to assess the safety of Steady Energy's LDR-50 reactor for district heating. This review is part of an ongoing effort to evaluate the safety of Small Modular Reactors (SMRs) in Europe. The review aims to provide insights into the safety features and design of these reactors.
key_takeaways: Multiple European nuclear regulators are collaborating on a joint review to assess the safety of SMRs, including Steady Energy's LDR-50 reactor.
This review is part of an ongoing effort to evaluate the safety of SMRs in Europe, which is expected to provide valuable insights into their design and features.
The assessment of SMRs for district heating applications highlights the potential benefits of these reactors in providing clean and efficient energy.

articles.title: Solving Problems, Not Chasing Technology
articles.summary: The article discusses the overemphasis on artificial intelligence (AI) technology and its use cases, suggesting that the focus should be on solving real-world problems rather than chasing after new technologies. This shift is necessary to ensure that AI solutions are practical and effective in addressing industry challenges. By taking a more problem-focused approach, professionals can avoid getting caught up in the hype surrounding AI.
key_takeaways: The article highlights the need for a more focused approach to artificial intelligence (AI), moving away from a catalog of "use cases" that don't necessarily address real-world problems.
Chasing after new technologies without a clear understanding of industry challenges can lead to frustration and wasted resources, according to the article.

A problem-focused approach to AI solutions prioritizes practicality and effectiveness over hype and flashy technology, ensuring that professionals are solving actual issues rather than just pursuing trendy tools.

articles.title: Joint study validates SMR use for chemical plants
articles.summary: A joint study by Oak Ridge National Laboratory and NuScale Power has validated the use of Small Modular Reactors (SMR) in conjunction with a heat augmentation system to provide nuclear-generated steam and electric power, demonstrating both profitability and reliability for coupling SMRs with chemical facilities.
key_takeaways: The study shows that pairing SMRs with a heat augmentation system can be a profitable and reliable option for providing nuclear-generated steam and electric power to chemical facilities.
NuScale Power's modular design and the Oak Ridge National Laboratory's research capabilities likely contributed to the success of the joint study, highlighting their expertise in this area.
The use of SMRs could offer an alternative energy source for chemical plants, potentially reducing reliance on fossil fuels and mitigating greenhouse gas emissions.

articles.title: Tepco delays restart of Kashiwazaki-Kariwa reactor
articles.summary: Tokyo Electric Power Company has delayed the restart of unit 6 at its Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear power plant due to a safety alarm failure during pre-reactor start-up checks, pushing back the scheduled restart from January 20.
key_takeaways: A safety alarm failed to sound during pre-reactor start-up checks at the Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear power plant.
The delayed restart of unit 6 has pushed back the scheduled date for the reactor's return to service.
The incident is a setback for Tokyo Electric Power Company, which was aiming to resume operations at the facility after a prolonged shutdown.

articles.title: Arkansas PSC Opens Door For Higher Electricity Bills
articles.summary: The Arkansas Public Service Commission (PSC) has approved a 23% rate increase for electricity bills in Northwest Arkansas, allowing SWEPCO to raise customers' costs. This decision comes at a time when the region is preparing for an impending winter storm. The PSC commissioners, who were appointed by the governor, made this ruling.
key_takeaways: The Arkansas Public Service Commission (PSC) has given the green light for SWEPCO to increase electricity rates by 23% in Northwest Arkansas.
This rate hike will likely affect customers' bills and could be particularly challenging during the impending winter storm.
The PSC commissioners, who were appointed by the governor, have made this decision without much public discussion or controversy.

articles.title: VinFast Introduces Battery Subscription Program in the Philippines
articles.summary: VinFast Philippines has introduced a battery subscription program to make electric vehicle ownership more affordable in the Philippine market, as part of its strategy to promote EV adoption. This move aims to reduce the cost barrier for consumers. The company is updating its pricing accordingly.
key_takeaways: VinFast is introducing a battery subscription program in the Philippines to lower the cost barrier to EV ownership.

This program suggests that the company is willing to take on the risk of battery degradation and maintenance, making it more accessible to customers who may not be able to afford or maintain an entire battery pack themselves.
Battery subscription programs are becoming increasingly popular among electric vehicle manufacturers as a way to increase adoption rates in markets where high upfront costs remain a barrier to entry.

articles.title: US Presidents Come And Go, But Energy Efficiency Is Forever
articles.summary: The US Department of Energy is launching a new effort to focus on energy efficiency in key industrial sectors, highlighting its importance as a competitive advantage over time. This initiative aims to improve the sector's competitiveness and sustainability. The emphasis on energy efficiency underscores its enduring significance beyond fleeting presidential terms.
key_takeaways: The US Department of Energy is prioritizing energy efficiency as a crucial factor in improving competitiveness in key industrial sectors.
Energy efficiency is seen as a long-term strategy, distinguishing it from presidential terms that come and go.
This initiative aims to promote sectoral sustainability through improved energy efficiency.

articles.title: Data and the DSO transition: How distribution utilities are using human-guided intelligence to make faster, more complex decisions
articles.summary: Distribution system operators (DSOs) are facing challenges in transitioning to a more efficient and complex system, with data fragmentation and AI integration being major hurdles. To overcome these challenges, DSOs are utilizing human-guided intelligence to make faster and more informed decisions. By leveraging this approach, utilities aim to improve the overall performance of their distribution systems.
key_takeaways: Data fragmentation is a significant challenge in the DSO transition, making it difficult for utilities to access and analyze comprehensive data sets.
Human-guided intelligence plays a crucial role in bridging the gap between data availability and decision-making capabilities, enabling faster and more informed decision-making.
The integration of AI technologies into DSO operations is essential for optimizing distribution system performance and reducing energy waste.

articles.title: The Hydrogen Stream: EU Commission invites offtakers under Hydrogen Mechanism
articles.summary: The European Commission has invited offtakers to express interest in supply offers under the Hydrogen Mechanism, aiming to advance market matching for renewable and low-carbon hydrogen. Meanwhile, Germany's electrolysis rollout is progressing at a slower pace than planned, with currently only 181 MW of installed capacity, despite new EU-backed funding schemes.
key_takeaways: The European Commission has launched an invitation for offtakers to signal supply interest under the Hydrogen Mechanism, which will run until March 20, 2026.

Germany's electrolysis rollout is facing challenges, with only 181 MW of installed capacity as of now, despite receiving new EU-backed funding schemes to support its production and use of renewable hydrogen.
The European Commission has approved a €200 million plan to support the construction of up to 300 MW of electrolysis capacity in Canada.

articles.title: Green Hydrogen Corridor: Nordic-Baltic Pipeline Opens Market Call
articles.summary: The Nordic-Baltic Hydrogen Corridor (NBHC) is a new green hydrogen pipeline project aiming to transform the transportation of renewable hydrogen in Northern Europe. The call for interest, open until March 2026, invites key stakeholders to provide forecast volumes, storage needs, and tariff hopes, marking a significant market signal for the plan. This project could potentially reshape the movement of green hydrogen across the region.
key_takeaways: A 2,500 km pipeline will be constructed, connecting Southern Finland's wind-rich areas with Northern Europe, aiming to link up regions that are well-suited for renewable energy production.
The project has already received significant funding, including €6.8M EU CEF grant and €51.4 M from Gasgrid Finland, indicating substantial investment in its feasibility.

The Nordic-Baltic Hydrogen Corridor is expected to achieve emission reductions of up to 37 Mt CO₂ annually by 2050, contributing significantly to Europe's renewable energy goals and mitigating the carbon footprint associated with hydrogen production.

articles.title: FERC upholds MISO, SPP fast-track generator reviews
articles.summary: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) has upheld the fast-track reviews for MISO and SPP, allowing these grid operators to quickly assess new generator projects. This decision is expected to streamline the process for integrating additional power generation capacity into the US energy system. FERC's approval also covers a 1.2-GW pumped storage project planned by Rye Development in Washington.
key_takeaways: The FERC's fast-track review process enables MISO and SPP to rapidly assess new generator projects, reducing the time and effort required for integration into the US energy system.
This streamlined process is expected to contribute to a more efficient allocation of power generation capacity, supporting the grid operators' ability to meet growing energy demand.
The approval also covers a 1.2-GW pumped storage project, which is likely to play a role in the overall energy mix and helping to balance supply and demand.

articles.title: Australia to fund national solar panel recycling pilot
articles.summary: The Australian federal government has announced an investment of AUD 24.7 million over three years to fund a national pilot program for recycling end-of-life solar panels. The program aims to reduce landfill disposal and recover valuable materials from the country's growing rooftop solar fleet, which includes over 4.2 million installed systems. The goal is to establish up to 100 collection sites across the country and support the development of a circular economy.
key_takeaways: Australia has an estimated 4 million decommissioned solar panels each year, with only 17% currently being recycled, highlighting the need for improved waste management practices.

The national pilot program will aim to establish up to 100 collection sites across the country to improve the management of end-of-life PV modules and recover valuable materials like copper, silver, silicon, and aluminium.

The government believes that recycling solar panels can support the clean energy transition and reduce landfill waste, with Federal Environment Minister Murray Watt stating that these materials can be repurposed to help achieve this goal.

articles.title: Time-Optimal Switching Surfaces for Triple Integrator under Full Box Constraints
articles.summary: The article discusses a novel approach to solving the problem of time-optimal control for a triple integrator under full box constraints. The researchers provide a complete characterization of time-optimal switching surfaces, derive an active condition for position constraints that was previously absent in literature, and propose an efficient algorithm with a 5-order-of-magnitude reduction in computational time compared to optimization-based baselines.
key_takeaways: The study provides a complete characterization of time-optimal switching surfaces for the triple integrator problem under full box constraints.

A novel active condition for position constraints is derived, which was previously absent from the literature, contributing a new insight into the geometric and algebraic structure of optimal control.
An efficient algorithm with a 100% success rate is proposed, achieving significant computational time reductions (approximately 10μs per trajectory) compared to optimization-based baselines.

articles.title: Home solar in rural America: how much battery do you need in a winter storm?
articles.summary: The article discusses the importance of home battery systems in rural America, particularly during winter storms when traditional power sources may be unreliable. It highlights that rural homes face unique challenges due to limited access to city services and outages that can last for days. A home battery system is crucial in these situations to ensure continued access to essential amenities like well pumps.
key_takeaways: Rural homes in America require different approach when sizing home solar and battery systems, especially during winter storms.
The article emphasizes the importance of damage control in rural areas where outages can last for days due to severe weather conditions.
Home battery systems are no longer just a convenience but a necessity in rural areas to ensure continued access to essential amenities.

articles.title: Harbinger launches standalone battery business with new Airstream deal
articles.summary: Harbinger, a commercial truck brand, is launching a standalone battery business to supply US-made energy storage solutions at tariff-free prices. This move will enable the company to supply dependable batteries to other manufacturers while also establishing new partnerships. Harbinger's battery technology will be used in iconic RV brand Airstream's first foray into electric vehicles.
key_takeaways: Harbinger is spinning its battery technology into a standalone business, marking a significant expansion of its capabilities.
The company aims to supply US-made energy storage solutions at tariff-free prices, potentially reducing costs and increasing competitiveness in the market.
Airstream has partnered with Harbinger for its first electric vehicle venture, indicating a growing trend towards electrification in the RV industry.

articles.title: From Optimistic Models To Empty Pipelines: The Intellectual History Of Germany’s Hydrogen Backbone
articles.summary: The article discusses the intellectual history of Germany's hydrogen backbone, highlighting how studies, models, and policy analyses created a perception that large-scale hydrogen energy was feasible before actual infrastructure was built. This "steel in the ground" approach has led to empty pipelines, indicating a disconnect between idealized plans and practical execution. The article suggests that the intellectual efforts were crucial but ultimately insufficient for driving forward a viable hydrogen economy.
key_takeaways: Germany's hydrogen backbone was initially conceived through intellectual models, studies, and policy analyses rather than actual infrastructure development.
These intellectual efforts created a perception of large-scale hydrogen energy feasibility, which may have driven investments and planning.
The disconnect between idealized plans and practical execution has resulted in empty pipelines, highlighting the challenges of turning ambitious ideas into reality.

articles.title: CATL Wins World Economic Forum’s MINDS Award for AI-Driven Next-Generation Battery Design
articles.summary: CATL has won the World Economic Forum's MINDS Award for its AI-driven next-generation battery design project, which is recognized as a global benchmark for industrial application. The project aims to revolutionize lithium-ion battery research and development. This award marks a significant achievement for CATL in the field of energy storage.
key_takeaways: CATL has developed an AI-driven next-generation battery design project that has been acclaimed as a global benchmark for industrial application.
The project is recognized for its potential to revolutionize lithium-ion battery R&D and has won the World Economic Forum's MINDS Award.
This award marks a significant achievement for CATL in the field of energy storage, highlighting the company's commitment to innovation and sustainability.

articles.title: Wind & Solar Surpassed Fossil Fuels In EU In 2025
articles.summary: According to a report by Ember, solar and wind power surpassed fossil fuel generation in the European Union (EU) for the first time ever in 2025. This milestone marks a significant shift towards renewable energy sources. The EU's transition to cleaner energy has been gaining momentum in recent years.
key_takeaways: Solar and wind power outperformed fossil fuels in the EU for the first time in 2025, according to Ember's report.
This achievement signifies a major breakthrough in the EU's efforts to reduce its reliance on fossil fuels and transition to cleaner energy sources.
The shift towards renewable energy is expected to have positive impacts on the environment, air quality, and public health.

articles.title: Austria’s Andritz to supply South Korean 500 MW pumped storage power plant
articles.summary: Austrian engineering group Andritz has signed a deal to supply pump turbine units for South Korea's first new pumped storage project in over a decade, the 500 MW Yeongdong pumped storage plant. The project is a collaboration between Doosan Enerbility and Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power (KHNP). Andritz will provide design, installation supervision, and commission services for the pump turbine units.
key_takeaways: Austria's Andritz has secured a major contract to supply 500 MW of pumped storage power plant equipment in South Korea.

This project marks the first large-scale pumped storage project initiated by Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power (KHNP) since 2011, indicating a renewed focus on renewable energy and energy storage in South Korea.

The Yeongdong pumped storage plant will be built on a 1.18 million square meter site with costs exceeding $343 million, highlighting the significant investment required for large-scale energy projects.

articles.title: Massachusetts can make ‘bottom-up’ distribution reforms for a better grid
articles.summary: The article suggests that Massachusetts can adopt a "bottom-up" distribution system operator (DSO) structure to improve the grid. This approach would make the grid cleaner, more flexible, and more affordable. By adopting DSO, the state could create a more decentralized and resilient energy system.
key_takeaways: Adopting a DSO structure could lead to a cleaner grid by reducing transmission losses, promoting local energy generation, and encouraging the use of renewable energy sources.
A DSO would also make the grid more flexible, allowing for easier integration of variable renewable energy sources and reducing reliance on centralized power plants.
Implementing DSO in Massachusetts could be cost-effective, as it would reduce infrastructure costs associated with maintaining a traditional transmission-based system.

articles.title: Green Hydrogen-Powered e-Gasoline Fuels Antarctic Tourism
articles.summary: Green Hydrogen-Powered e-Gasoline Fuels Antarctic Tourism is an article that explores the use of green hydrogen-based e-fuels in Antarctica for tourism. The article explains how wind power generates electricity, which drives electrolysis to produce hydrogen from seawater, and then combines it with recycled CO2 to create e-Gasoline. This innovation aims to slash net CO2 emissions in a region where every carbon molecule counts.
key_takeaways: A green hydrogen-based e-fuel has been successfully implemented for Antarctic tourism, replacing traditional fossil fuels.
The production of e-Gasoline involves the electrolysis of seawater and the combination of hydrogen with recycled CO2 using a Fischer-Tropsch reactor.
This innovation aims to reduce net CO2 emissions in Antarctica, which is critical due to its fragile ecosystem and limited carbon sinks.

articles.title: Protecting Critical Power Infrastructure: An Engineering Approach to Network Resilience
articles.summary: The article discusses the importance of protecting critical power infrastructure and presents an engineering approach to network resilience. It highlights the need for proactive measures to ensure the reliability and availability of power systems in the face of increasing threats such as cyberattacks, natural disasters, and aging infrastructure. The article aims to provide a comprehensive framework for engineers to design and implement resilient power networks.
key_takeaways: The article emphasizes the critical nature of power infrastructure and the need for proactive measures to prevent disruptions and ensure reliability.

A key aspect of network resilience is identified as the use of advanced technologies such as smart grids, automation, and cybersecurity solutions to detect and respond to potential threats in real-time.

The importance of designing and implementing robust physical and cyber defense systems is highlighted as a crucial component of network resilience, with a focus on protecting against both internal and external threats.

articles.title: Amazon buys ready-to-build Oregon solar-plus-storage project from bankrupt developer Pine Gate
articles.summary: Amazon has acquired a 1.2GW solar-plus-storage project in Oregon, known as Sunstone, from Pine Gate, a bankrupt developer. This deal marks one of the largest solar PV projects in the US. The transaction demonstrates Amazon's growing interest in renewable energy and its efforts to reduce its carbon footprint.
key_takeaways: Amazon has acquired a 1.2GW solar-plus-storage project in Oregon, showcasing the company's expanding commitment to renewable energy.
The Sunstone project is one of the largest solar PV projects in the US, highlighting the growing demand for clean energy in the country.

The acquisition by Amazon from Pine Gate underscores the challenges faced by struggling developers and highlights the opportunities available to investors looking to capitalize on the renewable energy market.

articles.title: Trump’s FAA Makes It Practically Impossible To Legally Fly Drones
articles.summary: The article discusses how the Trump administration's Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has implemented regulations that make it extremely difficult to legally fly drones. Electric and hybrid-electric aircraft are already being used in various applications, and it seems that drone flying is becoming increasingly restricted. This suggests a shift towards more regulated and restrictive policies for recreational drone use.
key_takeaways: The Trump administration's FAA has introduced rules that effectively prohibit the legal flying of drones.
These regulations may stifle innovation and accessibility in the recreational drone industry.
Electric aircraft are being used in various applications, such as aerial photography, surveying, and search and rescue operations.

articles.title: Lectric offers extremely rare $100 price cuts across all e-bikes from $799 lows, Anker SOLIX 72-hour flash sale, Autel, BougeRV, more
articles.summary: Lectric is offering extremely rare $100 price cuts across all its e-bikes, starting from a low of $799. Additionally, Anker SOLIX has launched a 72-hour flash sale with new and existing products at discounted prices. Other deals include Autel's AC Pro 80A Level 2 EV Charger and various camping equipment at discounted prices.

Anker SOLIX has launched a 72-hour flash sale with new products like the C1000 Gen 1 Portable Power Station at discounted prices (now $729).
Deals on Autel's AC Pro 80A Level 2 EV Charger and various camping equipment are also available, in addition to other products from brands such as BougeRV and Worx.

articles.title: Civil construction of replacement Trino waste store completed
articles.summary: The temporary storage facility for low-level radioactive waste at Italy's Trino nuclear power plant has been demolished and reconstructed, marking a significant step in the decommissioning process of the Trino nuclear power plant.
key_takeaways: The reconstruction of the waste store marks an important milestone in the decommissioning process of the Trino nuclear power plant.
The completion of this project indicates that Italy is taking steps to safely manage its low-level radioactive waste, aligning with international best practices.
Decommissioning projects like Trino's focus on ensuring the safe removal and storage of hazardous materials, prioritizing environmental protection and public safety.

articles.title: Severe winter weather across large portions of the country, natural gas prices increasing
articles.summary: Severe winter weather across the US has led to an increase in natural gas prices, with the Henry Hub benchmark price rising sharply over the past week. This surge in natural gas prices is expected to contribute to higher wholesale electricity prices due to increased demand for space heating during colder months. As a result, consumers can expect to pay more for energy.
key_takeaways: Natural gas daily spot prices at the Henry Hub have reached nearly $8.15 per million British thermal units (BTU) as of January 22.
The increase in natural gas prices is attributed to higher demand for space heating across the country due to severe winter weather.
Higher wholesale natural gas prices are expected to contribute to higher wholesale electricity prices, impacting consumers' energy costs.

articles.title: EDF seeking maximum use of existing UK reactors
articles.summary: EDF, a UK nuclear operator, reported that its reactors met 12% of total UK electricity consumption in 2025, with good fleet performance. The company plans to operate two Advanced Gas-cooled Reactors until at least 2030 and is seeking a licence extension for the Sizewell B reactor. This suggests EDF's commitment to utilizing its existing nuclear infrastructure.
key_takeaways: EDF plans to continue operating its last two Advanced Gas-cooled Reactors until at least 2030.
The company is seeking a 20-year licence extension for the Sizewell B pressurised water reactor, indicating a desire to maximize the use of its existing reactors.
In 2025, EDF's UK nuclear fleet met 12% of total UK electricity consumption, highlighting the importance of its contribution to the country's energy mix.

articles.title: Solar & Storage: The Key for Energy Affordability in Virginia
articles.summary: The article discusses the increasing electricity demand in Virginia, leading to higher utility bills. It highlights that solar and energy storage technologies can provide an immediate and cost-effective solution for addressing this issue.
key_takeaways: Solar and energy storage offer the fastest and cheapest new sources of electricity to build.
These technologies can help alleviate rising electricity demands in Virginia, reducing the impact on families and businesses.
The use of solar and storage solutions can be a key factor in achieving energy affordability in the state.

articles.title: FERC Rebuffs Clean Energy Orgs’ Arguments Against MISO Fast Lane
articles.summary: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) has ruled that the Midwest Independent System Operator (MISO) can continue using its temporary expedited queue process for generation projects deemed necessary by states to address near-term resource adequacy needs. Several clean energy organizations, including the Clean Grid Alliance and Sierra Club, had requested rehearing of FERC's decision, arguing that MISO's "fast lane" process was not effective in addressing the region's resource adequacy crisis. The ruling effectively shuts down those requests.
key_takeaways: FERC has upheld its previous ruling allowing MISO to continue using its temporary expedited queue process for generation projects deemed necessary by states.

Clean energy organizations had argued that MISO's "fast lane" process was not effective in addressing the region's resource adequacy crisis, citing a surplus of capacity ranging from 1.4 to 6.1 GW by 2031.

FERC has stated that regulators are not obligated to comb through existing queues to find projects to meet resource adequacy needs and that MISO's queue process falls outside of state regulators' jurisdiction.

articles.title: SEIA Elects New Board Chair, Board Members to Guide Organizational and Industrial Priorities in 2026
articles.summary: The Solar Energy Industries Association (SEIA) has elected a new Board Chair, Scott Moskowitz of Qcells, and a slate of newly elected board members to guide the organization's priorities in 2026. This election marks an important shift in leadership for SEIA, with a focus on representing the full breadth of the US solar and storage industry. The new board will likely shape the organization's strategic direction and advocacy efforts.
key_takeaways: Scott Moskowitz, chair of Qcells, has been elected as the new Board Chair of the Solar Energy Industries Association (SEIA), representing a major player in the solar industry.
The election of new board members aims to represent the full breadth of the US solar and storage industry, indicating a broadening scope for SEIA's advocacy efforts.
With Moskowitz at the helm, Qcells brings significant expertise in the solar sector, potentially influencing SEIA's priorities and strategic direction in 2026.

articles.title: UK’s Gore Street closes European battery storage fund, sees ‘improved economics of LDES’
articles.summary: Gore Street Capital, a UK-based energy company, has closed its first funding round for the GS EU Fund SCSp, which will focus on battery storage investments in the European Union. The fund aims to take advantage of improved economics for Long Duration Energy Storage (LDES) projects. Gore Street sees this as an opportunity to capitalize on growing demand for renewable energy storage solutions.
key_takeaways: Gore Street Capital has raised funding for its GS EU Fund SCSp, a battery storage investment vehicle targeting the European Union market.
The fund aims to benefit from improved economics of Long Duration Energy Storage (LDES) projects, suggesting a positive outlook for the sector.
By focusing on LDES investments, Gore Street is well-positioned to capitalize on growing demand for renewable energy storage solutions in Europe.

articles.title: Engie fully acquires Australia’s first large-scale BESS built on a decommissioned coal plant
articles.summary: Engie has acquired a 30% equity stake in the Hazelwood battery energy storage system (BESS) in Victoria, Australia, marking a significant investment in the country's first large-scale BESS. The acquisition is part of Engie's efforts to expand its energy storage capabilities and support the transition to renewable energy sources. This move demonstrates Engie's commitment to sustainable energy solutions.
key_takeaways: Engie's acquisition of the Hazelwood BESS will help support the transition to renewable energy sources in Australia, contributing to a more sustainable energy mix.
The investment highlights the growing importance of energy storage systems (BESS) in enabling greater integration of intermittent renewable energy sources into the grid.
This move also underscores Engie's strategy to expand its presence and capabilities in the energy storage market, positioning the company for future growth and opportunities.

articles.title: U.S. government cuts $83 billion in loans, reversing energy transition funding
articles.summary: The US Department of Energy has announced a significant shift in its energy funding priorities, cutting $83.6 billion in loans and subsidies for renewable energy projects and redirecting them towards natural gas, nuclear power, and coal-fired facilities. This move is seen as a reversal of the Biden administration's efforts to support the transition to clean energy sources. The department has also renamed its loan program office to prioritize "energy dominance" over renewable energy.
key_takeaways: The US Department of Energy has cut $83.6 billion in loans and subsidies for renewable energy projects, including wind and solar, with approximately $9.5 billion in subsidies eliminated.

The funding shift is intended to prioritize grid reliability and lower electricity costs for consumers, but critics argue it will hinder the transition to clean energy sources and increase greenhouse gas emissions.
The department has identified six sectors for funding, excluding renewable energy and battery energy storage, with natural gas, nuclear power, and coal-fired facilities receiving priority attention.

articles.title: Kairos secures HALEU for Hermes' first fuel load
articles.summary: Kairos Power has secured a contract with the US Department of Energy to receive high-assay low-enriched uranium for its Hermes demonstration reactor. This fuel will be used for the startup and operation of the low-power reactor. The partnership marks an important step forward for Kairos Power's project.
key_takeaways: Kairos Power has secured a contract with the US Department of Energy to receive high-assay low-enriched uranium for its Hermes demonstration reactor.
This fuel will be used for the startup and operation of the low-power reactor, highlighting the progress of the Hermes project.
The partnership demonstrates the growing interest in nuclear power as a clean energy source, particularly among companies like Kairos Power.

articles.title: Bureau Veritas to aid Dutch deployment of Rolls-Royce SMR
articles.summary: Bureau Veritas, a testing and inspection services provider, has signed an agreement with ULC-Energy BV to collaborate on the deployment of Rolls-Royce SMR nuclear reactors in the Netherlands. The collaboration aims to support the large-scale deployment of small modular reactors (SMRs) in the country. This partnership will likely play a crucial role in ensuring the safe and efficient operation of the SMRs.
key_takeaways: Bureau Veritas has partnered with ULC-Energy BV to aid in the deployment of Rolls-Royce SMR nuclear reactors in the Netherlands, indicating a focus on safety and regulatory compliance.
The collaboration suggests that the Dutch government is actively pursuing small modular reactor technology as part of its nuclear energy development strategy.

The partnership between Bureau Veritas and ULC-Energy BV may help to establish a framework for testing, inspection, and certification of SMRs in the Netherlands, supporting the country's industrial-scale deployment plans.

articles.title: Scientists build tin lead perovskite solar cell with 24.07% efficiency
articles.summary: A Chinese-Swedish research team has developed a new approach to improve the efficiency and stability of tin-lead perovskite solar cells by modifying additives and post-treatment processes. The device achieved a record-breaking efficiency of 24.07% and demonstrated improved stability, retaining 60% of its initial efficiency after 550 hours at high temperatures. This breakthrough could potentially lead to more efficient and durable perovskite solar cells.
key_takeaways: Researchers have developed an alternative passivation method for tin-lead perovskite solar cells that improves both efficiency and stability by avoiding the use of tin fluoride (SnF₂).
The new approach combines a lead fluoride (PbF₂) post-treatment with lead powder in the precursor, which helps to reduce "photo-thermal instability" and degradation of functional device layers.

The study identifies SnF₂ as the primary cause of perovskite decomposition and degradation, and proposes an effective alternative by replacing it with lead powders that have antioxidant and crystallization-regulating effects.

articles.title: Wright Ready to Use Emergency Powers to Dispatch Backup Generation During Winter Storm
articles.summary: U.S. Energy Secretary Chris Wright has sent a letter to reliability coordinators and balancing authorities stating that the Department of Energy is ready to use its authority under Section 202(c) of the Federal Power Act to dispatch backup generation from large customers ahead of a major winter storm expected to impact the Eastern Interconnection. The Department estimates about 35 GW of backup generation are available nationwide, which could mitigate blackouts and cut costs during the storm. Wright's letter aims to ensure that if needed, the generation will be made available to prevent American lives from being put at risk.
key_takeaways: The Department of Energy has identified over 35 GW of unused backup generation across the country, which can potentially be dispatched in emergency situations.
Using this backup generation could mitigate blackouts and reduce energy costs during the upcoming winter storm expected to impact the Eastern Interconnection.

The U.S. Energy Secretary has expressed commitment to using its authority under Section 202(c) of the Federal Power Act to ensure that the nation's energy needs are met, particularly in emergency situations.

articles.title: FERC Directs ISO-NE to Cap Pay-for-Performance Balancing Ratio at 1.0
articles.summary: FERC has partially granted a complaint by the New England Power Generators Association (NEPGA) regarding the design of ISO-NE's Pay-for-Performance mechanism. The commission directed ISO-NE to cap the Pay-for-Performance balancing ratio at 1.0, but rejected NEPGA's complaint about the RTO's method of allocating stopped losses. This decision aims to prevent resources from being required to supply more than their capacity supply obligations during scarcity events.
key_takeaways: FERC has set a cap on the Pay-for-Performance balancing ratio at 1.0, which will prevent resources from being required to supply more than their capacity supply obligations during scarcity events.
The decision is a result of NEPGA's complaint about "flawed rules" that caused $51 million in "improper charges" to capacity resources during a June 2025 scarcity event.
FERC rejected NEPGA's request for changes to ISO-NE's rules spreading the costs of under-collected PFP penalties across all capacity resources.

articles.title: Battery trading performance: Demystifying normalised revenue and percent of perfect foresight
articles.summary: The article discusses the performance evaluation of battery storage trading, focusing on two key metrics: normalised revenue and percent of perfect capture rate. Sahand Karimi and Henry Swisher of OptiGrid examine these metrics to provide insight into how they can be used to evaluate battery storage trading. By demystifying these metrics, the authors aim to help industry professionals better understand battery storage trading performance.
key_takeaways: Normalised revenue is a key metric for evaluating battery storage trading performance, as it allows for comparison across different markets and locations.
The percent of perfect capture rate is another important metric, indicating the percentage of available energy that can be captured by the battery storage system.

Optimizing these metrics is crucial for maximizing the economic benefits of battery storage trading, but also requires careful consideration of factors such as market volatility and forecasting accuracy.

articles.title: Solar PV will have a major role in marshalling our productivity to create a sustainable civilization
articles.summary: The article discusses the potential role of solar PV in creating a sustainable civilization by marshalling productivity to address climate change and environmental destruction. The concept is inspired by historical monumental projects, such as the Pyramids or Apollo programme, which required substantial resources and labour. Reaching a global net-zero emission energy system can be considered a monumental project that requires significant investments.
key_takeaways: Solar PV has the potential to become a central pillar in creating a sustainable civilization, similar to monumental projects throughout history.

The transition to a global net-zero emission energy system may require significant annual expenditures, depending on the source, ranging from various estimates of McKinsey, BNEF, and the International Energy Agency.

This monumental project will be driven by excess productivity, as societies have historically invested between 0.5% to 10% of their available productivity in such projects, with lasting impacts that can last for centuries.

articles.title: Hydrogen infrastructure expansion in Australia powered by relocatable refuelling stations by Hydrexia
articles.summary: Hydrexia Pty Ltd, in partnership with Toyota Motor Corporation Australia Ltd, is expanding its hydrogen infrastructure across Australia by deploying relocatable refuelling stations. This initiative aims to support the growing number of hydrogen fuel cell vehicles on Australian roads and tackle the challenge of providing reliable access to clean energy. The company has previously successfully deployed stationary refuelling stations in Malaysia and the Philippines.
key_takeaways: Hydrexia is expanding its hydrogen infrastructure across Australia with relocatable refuelling stations, backed by a partnership with Toyota Motor Corporation Australia Ltd.
This initiative aims to support the growing number of hydrogen fuel cell vehicles on Australian roads and provide reliable access to clean energy.
The company has previously gained experience and lessons from deploying stationary refuelling stations in Malaysia and the Philippines before scaling up its operations.

articles.title: Semantics in Actuation Systems: From Age of Actuation to Age of Actuated Information
articles.summary: The article introduces a new metric, Age of Actuated Information (AoAI), which measures the timeliness of actions in communication systems by accounting for the age of data packets at the moment they are actuated. It builds upon the existing Age of Actuation (AoA) metric and analyzes its behavior in discrete-time systems with data storage capabilities under various actuation scenarios. The study reveals counterintuitive regimes where increasing update or actuation rates degrade action timeliness.
key_takeaways: The article introduces a new metric, AoAI, which captures the end-to-end timeliness of actions by explicitly accounting for the age of data packets at the moment they are actuated.
In systems with data storage capabilities, increasing update or actuation rates can lead to degraded action timeliness, contrary to intuitive expectations.
The study provides closed-form expressions for the average AoA and AoAI in discrete-time systems, revealing structural differences between these metrics when data buffering is present.

articles.title: Duke Energy brings $100M, 50 MW battery project online
articles.summary: Duke Energy has successfully powered up a 50 MW grid battery project at its former Allen coal plant site in the Carolinas. The $100 million investment aims to stabilize the grid and reduce energy costs across the region, particularly during extreme weather conditions. This upgrade is part of Duke Energy's efforts to expand its energy storage infrastructure.
key_takeaways: Duke Energy has invested $100 million in a 50 MW grid battery project at its former Allen coal plant site, which will help stabilize the grid and reduce energy costs.
The project's timing coincides with the potential for severe weather this weekend, highlighting the need for advanced grid management systems like this one.
This upgrade is part of Duke Energy's efforts to expand its energy storage infrastructure, a key strategy in addressing climate change and ensuring grid resilience.

articles.title: Key takeaways from Solar Energy Expo in Poland
articles.summary: The Solar Energy Expo in Poland, held in January 2026, attracted a record number of industry visitors despite having a smaller show-floor footprint. The event focused on flexibility and market reform, as well as storage, inverter, and grid-forming technologies, highlighting Poland's transition towards more efficient energy systems. The expo marked an important milestone for Poland's solar market, which has been expanding rapidly.
key_takeaways: Poland's solar market continues to grow at a rapid pace, with the country surpassing 20 GW of cumulative PV capacity by the end of 2024.
The Solar Energy Expo in Poland emphasized flexibility and market reform, as well as storage, inverter, and grid-forming technologies, indicating a shift towards more efficient energy systems.
The event attracted a record number of industry visitors, with 20,176 attendees from across Central and Eastern Europe, up 11% year-on-year.

articles.title: India commissions first merchant battery energy storage system
articles.summary: India has commissioned its first merchant battery energy storage system, a 100 MWh project in western India, marking a significant milestone in the country's renewable energy landscape. The project, developed by Juniper Green Energy, has completed trial operations and received approval to start commercial operations. This is one of the largest operating BESS projects in India, positioned to generate merchant revenues through various market opportunities.
key_takeaways: India has successfully commissioned its first merchant battery energy storage system, a 100 MWh project in western India.

The project, developed by Juniper Green Energy, has completed trial operations and received approval from the Northern Regional Load Despatch Centre to start commercial operations on January 23, 2026.
The facility is among the largest operating BESS projects in India and will generate merchant revenues through peak arbitrage, grid balancing services, and participation in ancillary markets.

articles.title: DOE funding bill ignores some of Trump’s requested cuts
articles.summary: The US Department of Energy (DOE) funding bill has ignored some of President Trump's requested cuts, specifically maintaining funding for the solar and wind energy programs under the Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy. Despite this, the bill still reflects many of Trump's budget reductions. The disparity highlights the ongoing tension between Trump's administration and Congress over energy policy.
key_takeaways: The White House had asked Congress to zero out funding for the solar and wind energy programs, but instead, $320 million was allocated to these programs.
This discrepancy suggests that some of Trump's requested cuts were not implemented in the final bill, despite his efforts to reduce funding for renewable energy initiatives.
The outcome indicates that Congress has maintained a level of support for clean energy programs, potentially limiting the impact of Trump's budget reductions on these areas.

articles.title: FERC commissioners see progress in PJM data center, power supply plans

key_takeaways: A 1.2-GW pumped storage hydro power plant is being built at a former smelter site in Washington state, marking a significant renewable energy project.

The project aims to generate clean energy for the region, contributing to the transition away from fossil fuels and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

articles.title: It’s time to start recommending some Tesla Powerwall alternatives [update]

The author is updating their recommendations to include alternative solutions that can provide a reliable energy storage system for homeowners.

articles.title: EU opens probe into Bulgaria compensation award to foreign investor
articles.summary: The European Commission has launched an investigation into a €61 million arbitration award to Malta-based ACF Renewable Energy, which invested in a Bulgarian solar plant under a renewable energy support scheme. The commission is assessing whether the award is compatible with EU State aid rules and whether it breaches EU treaty provisions. Bulgaria notified the commission but has not paid the sum.
key_takeaways: The European Commission has opened an investigation into the €61 million arbitration award, which ordered Bulgaria to pay ACF Renewable Energy in favor of Malta-based investor.
The probe considers whether implementing the award would constitute state aid under EU law and potentially breach EU treaty provisions on investor-state arbitration.

EU law generally prohibits intra-EU investor-state arbitration under bilateral investment treaties or the Energy Charter Treaty, although national courts and EU law still provide legal protections for investors.

articles.title: Denmark begins study on potential use of nuclear energy
articles.summary: Denmark's Ministry of Climate, Energy and Utilities has announced the establishment of a framework for studying the potential use of nuclear energy, including small modular reactors. This move comes after lifting a moratorium on nuclear power in Denmark. The study aims to investigate both the benefits and risks associated with new nuclear technologies.
key_takeaways: Denmark is exploring the possibility of using nuclear energy as part of its energy mix.
The country has lifted a moratorium on nuclear power, paving the way for potential future development.
Small modular reactors are among the new nuclear technologies that will be examined in the study.

articles.title: Hydrogen Infrastructure: BKW’s Pivot from Coal to H2-Ready Gas Power in Germany
articles.summary: BKW, a Swiss energy giant, is pivoting from coal to hydrogen infrastructure in Germany. The company has written down its stake in the Wilhelmshaven coal plant and is instead investing in a hydrogen-capable gas-fired plant at Hamm in North Rhine-Westphalia.
