This move marks a bold shift towards sustainable energy as coal's role declines under Germany's Energiewende (energy transition) policy.
key_takeaways: BKW is downsizing its stake in the Wilhelmshaven coal plant, writing down CHF 110 million on its 33% share, due to reduced output forecasts and lower price swings.
The company is investing in a hydrogen-capable gas-fired plant at Hamm in North Rhine-Westphalia, partnering with German utility Trianel, as part of a broader shift towards sustainable energy.
The Hamm site offers an attractive location for BKW's transition, with existing industrial infrastructure, grid and gas connections, and potential for hydrogen pipelines or carbon capture.

articles.title: Dispatch Energy Brings 4MW Hydrogen Fuel Cell Plant Online in Bridgeport
articles.summary: Dispatch Energy has brought a 4MW hydrogen fuel cell plant online in Bridgeport, Connecticut, providing clean baseload power to the local grid. The plant, which produces enough electricity for approximately 3,393 homes, replaces an old setup and significantly reduces emissions by about 50%. This project marks an example of urban renewal as Dispatch Energy transforms a former manufacturing site into a hub of sustainable energy.
key_takeaways: The 4MW hydrogen fuel cell plant in Bridgeport is a significant addition to the local grid, providing reliable and clean baseload power.
By utilizing hydrogen fuel cells, the plant reduces emissions by approximately 50% compared to its previous setup, aligning with Connecticut's climate targets.
This project represents an example of urban renewal as Dispatch Energy transforms a former manufacturing site into a hub of sustainable energy, providing a strategic grid asset for the community.

articles.title: Startup Jetson raises $50M to deploy affordable heat pumps
articles.summary: Home-electrification startup Jetson has raised $50 million to reduce the cost of installing heat pumps in the US and Canada, aiming to install them at 30% to 50% less than competitors. The company, founded in 2024, has also developed its own smart heat pump technology. This investment will help fuel Jetson's ambitious effort to make affordable heat pumps more accessible.
key_takeaways: Jetson aims to slash the cost of installing heat pumps by 30% to 50% compared to competitors.
The company has developed its own smart heat pump technology, which is expected to play a crucial role in its mission.
With $50 million in funding, Jetson plans to deploy affordable heat pumps in the US and Canada, making sustainable heating solutions more accessible.

articles.title: Musk says remote parts of Spain and Sicily could generate Europe’s electricity
articles.summary: Elon Musk discussed potential energy sources and their impact on artificial intelligence (AI) production at the World Economic Forum in Davos. He suggested that sparsely populated areas of Spain and Sicily could serve as Europe's "power plants" to generate electricity, citing solar power and battery storage as key technologies. Additionally, Musk mentioned the possibility of transmitting solar energy generated in space to Earth, which he expects to achieve within two to three years.
key_takeaways: Elon Musk proposes that sparsely populated areas of Spain and Sicily could be utilized as "power plants" to generate electricity for Europe, leveraging solar power and battery storage.
Solar energy and batteries have the potential to supply half of the energy consumed in the US annually, and Musk suggests a similar approach can be implemented in Europe.
Musk is optimistic about the future of AI production, but notes that electricity growth is limited, with only 4% annual increase, whereas AI production is growing exponentially.

articles.title: Ikea, Svea Solar launch dynamic electricity tariff in Germany
articles.summary: Ikea is launching a dynamic electricity tariff in Germany, called Svea Strom, which changes every 15 minutes based on day-ahead market prices. The tariff is available to customers without owning solar or storage systems and supplies electricity from TÜV-certified renewable sources. This is the first time Ikea has introduced such a tariff worldwide.
key_takeaways: Ikea is partnering with Svea Solar to offer a dynamic electricity tariff in Germany, which adjusts every 15 minutes based on market prices.
The tariff is available to customers without owning solar or storage systems and supplies electricity from TÜV-certified renewable sources.
Key benefits of the tariff include a monthly basic fee starting at €6.99, with discounts for Ikea Family and Business Network members, as well as loyalty rewards after six months of subscription.

articles.title: Hybrid inverters set to drive next phase of Indian rooftop solar
articles.summary:
Here is the analysis of the power and energy systems article:


The article highlights the growing need for hybrid inverter systems to drive the next phase of Indian rooftop solar growth, as traditional on-grid systems struggle to keep up with the increasing amount of solar generation. Energy storage, intelligence, and integration are key components that will lead this growth, addressing issues such as voltage fluctuations, reverse power flows, and localized grid stress. This shift is necessary for India's energy independence goal by 2047.
key_takeaways: Hybrid inverter systems will be crucial in driving the next phase of Indian rooftop solar growth due to their ability to address energy storage, intelligence, and integration issues.
The current power grid system in India faces challenges such as reverse power flows, voltage fluctuations, and localized grid stress, which hybrid inverters can help mitigate.
Traditional on-grid systems are not equipped to handle the increasing amount of solar generation, making hybrid inverter systems a necessary upgrade for India's energy independence goal.

articles.title: UAE’s massive solar-plus-storage project set to redefine baseload power, says Wood Mackenzie
articles.summary: A groundbreaking solar-plus-storage project in the UAE, developed by Masdar and Emirates Water and Electricity Company, is expected to redefine baseload power with its ability to deliver 1 GW of continuous energy. The project, currently under construction, will be the world's first gigawatt-scale renewable project designed for around-the-clock baseload power. This development signals a potential shift in renewable energy deployment despite high costs.
key_takeaways: A 5.2 GW solar-plus-storage project in the UAE is being developed to deliver 1 GW of continuous, around-the-clock baseload power, marking a significant milestone in hybrid project development.

The project's cost is currently too expensive for widespread replication, with an estimated six times the cost of a new gas-fired combined-cycle gas turbine plant, but successful execution and continued cost declines could change this.
This project represents one of three key predictions made by Wood Mackenzie in its "Global solar: Key things to look for in 2026" report, which forecasts strong global solar growth through 2030.

articles.title: Solar generates record 13% of EU electricity in 2025
articles.summary: The European Union's solar energy generation reached a record high in 2025, accounting for 13% of the bloc's electricity production. This growth is attributed to an increase of 65.1 GW of solar installations in the EU last year, leading to a significant rise in solar-generated energy. Solar energy now surpasses coal and hydroelectric power as a source of energy in the EU.
key_takeaways: The European Union's solar energy generation increased by over 20% in 2025, with a record 369 TWh of energy generated across the bloc.
This growth is unprecedented, with solar energy now accounting for more than coal and hydroelectric power as a source of energy in the EU.
Solar energy has seen an average annual growth rate of 21% over the past five years, surpassing any other energy source in terms of growth trajectory.

articles.title: Third utility-scale battery storage project proposed for Western Australia’s Collie
articles.summary: Palmer Renewable Energy has proposed a 200MW solar-plus-storage project near Collie, Western Australia, which is the third utility-scale battery storage project in the region. The project aims to utilize renewable energy and provide grid stability. No specific details on the technology or timeline for completion are provided.
key_takeaways: A 200MW solar-plus-storage project has been proposed by Palmer Renewable Energy near Collie, Western Australia.
This is the third utility-scale battery storage project in the region, indicating increasing investment in energy storage infrastructure.
The project's focus on renewable energy and grid stability suggests a potential shift towards a more sustainable energy mix.

articles.title: Rye On A Roll: US Developer Greenlit For Massive Pumped Hydro Energy Storage Project On Brownfield
articles.summary: A US developer has been greenlit for a massive pumped hydro energy storage project in Washington State, set to add 1.2 gigawatts of renewable energy to the nation's grid.
key_takeaways: The Goldendale Energy Storage Project will feature 1.2 gigawatts of pumped hydropower storage, contributing to the US renewable energy profile.
The project is being developed on a brownfield site, suggesting potential environmental benefits from repurposing an existing industrial or agricultural area.
The successful greenlighting of this project suggests growing demand for large-scale renewable energy storage solutions in the US.

articles.title: The Future of Power Delivery in 2026: Challenges and Technological Solutions
articles.summary: The power delivery landscape is expected to face significant challenges in the near future, including rising electricity prices and aging infrastructure. Grid modernization and advanced transmission technologies are seen as key solutions to address these challenges and meet increasing demand from data centers. A focus on rapid deployment and efficiency improvements will be crucial for successful grid modernization.
key_takeaways: Rising electricity prices and increased demand from data centers pose significant challenges to the power delivery landscape.
Grid modernization and advanced transmission technologies are critical for addressing these challenges and ensuring efficient energy distribution.
Rapid deployment and efficiency improvements will be essential for implementing effective solutions in the short term, particularly as grid infrastructure ages.

articles.title: Scientists design low-cost sodium-ion battery with cheap electrode materials
articles.summary: A team of scientists has designed a low-cost sodium-ion battery with cheap electrode materials, including a P2-type cathode material and hard carbon anode made from lavender flowers. The proposed system aims to provide scalable and environmentally sustainable energy storage for stationary applications. Initial electrochemical testing reveals promising results, with capacities of up to 360 mAh/g and capacity retentions of over 60%.
key_takeaways: The design features a P2-type cathode material (Na0.67Mn0.33Ni0.33Fe0.33O2) and an anode made from hard carbon derived from lavender flowers, which are considered sustainable and economical precursors.
The use of plant-derived materials is expected to reduce the environmental impact of sodium-ion battery production and make them more accessible for commercialization.
Initial electrochemical testing shows promising results, with capacities of up to 360 mAh/g and capacity retentions of over 60% after 100 cycles, indicating potential for full-cell performance.

articles.title: Agrivoltaics for tea plantations
articles.summary: A Chinese company, CHN Energy, has launched an agrivoltaic project that integrates solar panels with a tea plantation in southwestern China. The first 32 MW of the project is now connected to the grid, spanning over 666,000 m2 of area across the tea plantation. The integrated model aims to improve tea quality and provide energy.
key_takeaways: Agrivoltaic projects like this one can help improve agricultural productivity by providing moderate shade to crops while generating electricity.
The project demonstrates a positive micro-cycle system where solar panels benefit both agriculture and power generation, creating a win-win situation.
This type of integrated model has the potential to significantly reduce energy consumption in agricultural settings, leading to cost savings and reduced environmental impact.

articles.title: Chinese battery makers scale up from 314 Ah to 500 Ah-plus LFP cells
articles.summary: Chinese battery makers are accelerating the rollout of larger lithium iron phosphate (LFP) cells, aiming to reduce system complexity and increase energy density in stationary storage containers. The bigger formats are being promoted by top manufacturers such as CATL and EVE Energy, which claim to offer improved performance and efficiency. This trend is expected to gain traction as these companies expand their production capacity and installations.
key_takeaways: Chinese battery makers are scaling up LFP cell sizes from 314 Ah to 500 Ah-plus, targeting reduced system complexity and increased energy density in stationary storage containers.

Companies like CATL and EVE Energy are promoting larger format cells, citing improved performance and efficiency, with CATL's 587Ah cell offering a volumetric energy density of 434 Wh/L and cycle life exceeding 10,000 cycles.
The rollout of bigger LFP cells is seen as a near-term solution to address challenges in safety, yield, and standardization in the stationary storage battery market.

articles.title: Fortescue claims ‘record-low pricing’ for large-scale battery storage in Australia
articles.summary: Fortescue, an Australian mining giant, has claimed to have secured large-scale battery storage at "record-low pricing" in Australia. CEO Dino Otranto made this announcement, indicating a significant reduction in costs for the technology. This development could potentially lead to increased adoption of energy storage solutions in the country.
key_takeaways: Fortescue's achievement suggests that the cost of large-scale battery storage has decreased significantly in Australia.
The "record-low pricing" claimed by Fortescue may make energy storage more accessible and attractive for various industries, including mining and renewable energy.
This development could also have broader implications for the overall energy landscape in Australia, potentially leading to increased adoption of sustainable energy solutions.

articles.title: 16.6 Million People Work In Renewable Energy?
articles.summary: The International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA) has released a report stating that approximately 16.6 million people worldwide worked in renewable energy jobs in 2025, highlighting the significant growth and job creation in the renewable energy sector.
key_takeaways: The number of people working in renewable energy jobs has reached 16.6 million globally, indicating a substantial increase in employment opportunities within this industry.
This growth suggests that the transition to renewable energy is creating new economic opportunities and contributing to job stability in various sectors.
The report's findings underscore the importance of continued investment and support for renewable energy development to sustain this trend and achieve a low-carbon economy.

articles.title: US startup Noon Energy unveils ‘multi-day baseload’ energy storage tech demonstration
articles.summary: Noon Energy, a US startup, has unveiled its first operational demonstration project for a new energy storage technology capable of providing baseload power for multiple days. The company had previously teased the capabilities of this technology at trade shows. This achievement marks an important milestone in Noon Energy's development of sustainable energy solutions.
key_takeaways: Noon Energy has developed an energy storage technology that can provide baseload power for extended periods, exceeding 100 hours.
The technology is a significant step forward in the company's goal to create sustainable energy solutions and contribute to the transition towards renewable energy sources.
This operational demonstration project showcases Noon Energy's commitment to innovation and its efforts to address the challenges of energy storage and grid stability.

articles.title: Stability Analysis of Power-Electronics-Dominated Grids Using Scaled Relative Graphs
articles.summary: The article presents a novel approach to stability analysis for grid-connected converters using Scaled Relative Graphs (SRG), which effectively decouples grid and converter dynamics, making it possible to evaluate closed-loop stability comprehensively and efficiently. The method can handle both linear and non-linear loads, and is robust against angular variations resulting from dq-frame transformations. Simulation case studies validate the effectiveness of this approach in modern power systems.
key_takeaways: The article introduces a new method for stability analysis that decouples grid and converter dynamics using Scaled Relative Graphs (SRG), allowing for efficient evaluation of closed-loop stability.
The SRG approach can handle both linear and non-linear loads, making it more practical for real-world applications.
The method is robust against angular variations resulting from dq-frame transformations, increasing its versatility and reliability.

articles.title: Microsoft Commits to Full Electricity Cost Recovery in Data Center Communities
articles.summary: Microsoft has committed to ensuring that its data centers will not contribute to increased residential utility rates by implementing a comprehensive framework for cost-recovery. The company's pledge also includes advancing utility coordination and funding grid infrastructure, marking a significant step in the industry. This commitment follows the growing concerns of hyperscalers' impact on the energy grid.
key_takeaways: Microsoft has become the first major hyperscaler to publicly commit to a comprehensive framework for cost-recovery in its data centers.
The company's pledge includes advancing utility coordination, directly funding grid infrastructure, and ensuring that its data centers will not contribute to increased residential utility rates.

This commitment highlights the growing recognition of the need for industry-wide responsibility and sustainability measures among hyperscalers, particularly with regards to their impact on the energy grid.

articles.title: How utilities are making the grid more reliable with condition-based transformer monitoring
articles.summary: The article discusses how utilities are adopting condition-based transformer monitoring to improve the reliability of power grids. This approach allows for proactive maintenance, reducing downtime and increasing the lifespan of critical equipment. By leveraging advanced technologies, utilities can optimize their grid operations and enhance overall system performance.
key_takeaways: Utilities are transitioning from traditional scheduled maintenance to condition-based transformer monitoring to reduce downtime and increase equipment lifespan.
Condition-based monitoring enables real-time data analysis, allowing for prompt identification of potential issues and targeted interventions, thereby improving grid reliability.
The adoption of this approach is expected to result in increased performance and life expectancy for critical power equipment, ultimately leading to improved overall system efficiency.

articles.title: Former Smelter Site Now Home to 1.2-GW Pumped Storage Hydro Project
articles.summary: A 50-year operating license has been granted by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) for a 1.2-GW pumped storage hydro project located on a former smelter site in Washington state. The project is being developed by Rye Development and Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners, with operations set to commence soon. This project represents a significant investment in renewable energy infrastructure.
key_takeaways: A 1.2-GW pumped storage hydro project has been granted a 50-year operating license by FERC, indicating approval for its commercial operation.
The project is being developed on a former smelter site in Washington state, highlighting the reuse and repurposing of existing industrial sites for renewable energy generation.
This investment marks an important step forward for renewable energy infrastructure development in the region.

articles.title: Trump administration scraps multimillion-dollar solar projects in Puerto Rico as grid crumbles
articles.summary: The Trump administration has cancelled multimillion-dollar solar projects in Puerto Rico, exacerbating the island's ongoing power outages and affecting low-income families. This decision comes at a time when the grid is still struggling to recover from previous events. The cancellation will likely have a significant impact on the energy landscape in Puerto Rico.
key_takeaways: The Trump administration's decision to cancel solar projects in Puerto Rico will exacerbate the island's power crisis, which has already left many low-income families without access to reliable electricity.

The cancellation of these multimillion-dollar projects is seen as a misguided attempt by the administration to prioritize fossil fuels over renewable energy sources, despite the growing importance of climate action.

This decision highlights the lack of attention given to Puerto Rico's energy needs under the Trump administration, particularly in light of the ongoing power outages and the island's vulnerability to natural disasters.

articles.title: Oak Ridge Lab, Type One Energy Partnering on Nuclear Fusion Project
articles.summary: The Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Type One Energy, and the University of Tennessee in Knoxville are partnering to establish a world-class facility for nuclear fusion energy research. The facility will evaluate how materials react under extreme conditions in a fusion device at the Bull Run Energy Complex in East Tennessee. This collaboration aims to drive American innovation in fusion energy.
key_takeaways: A new high-heat flux (HHF) facility is being established at the Bull Run Energy Complex in East Tennessee to research nuclear fusion energy.
The facility will study how materials react under extreme conditions in a fusion device, which could contribute to advancing the field of fusion energy.
This partnership is part of efforts to drive American innovation and move fusion energy closer to reality.

articles.title: The POWER Interview: Grid Integration of DERs
articles.summary: The article discusses the importance of integrating distributed energy resources (DERs) into the power grid, highlighting the need for modernizing infrastructure, using advanced controls, and developing new market rules to manage two-way power flow. This integration is crucial for utilities and transmission system operators as it provides flexibility in power generation and delivery. It also enables the efficient use of renewable energy sources.
key_takeaways: Integrating DERs into the grid requires modernizing infrastructure and using advanced controls to manage power flow.
Developing new market rules is necessary to effectively manage two-way power flow and optimize energy distribution.

The integration of DERs is crucial for utilities and transmission system operators to provide flexibility in power generation and delivery, particularly with the increasing adoption of renewable energy sources.

articles.title: Can rising power demand boost renewables above policy obstacles in 2026?
articles.summary: The power industry is facing new challenges with the implementation of FEOC rules and the end of IRA credits, but rising electricity demand and bills also present opportunities for renewable energy growth.
key_takeaways: Rising power demand and increasing electricity bills can help drive adoption of renewables despite policy obstacles.
New FEOC (Federal Energy Oversight Committee) rules may create uncertainty and challenges for the industry, but also provide an opportunity to improve efficiency and reduce costs.
The end of IRA (Inflation Reduction Act) credits in 2026 will likely lead to a shift in market dynamics, potentially favoring renewables as consumers seek more affordable energy options.

articles.title: EV slowdown creates potential lifeline for US energy storage amid FEOC, tariffs
articles.summary: The US energy storage market is facing challenges due to Foreign Entity of Concern (FEOC) restrictions and a 25% tariff increase on Chinese-origin battery energy storage systems. However, the slowdown in EV adoption caused by these restrictions may create opportunities for domestic energy storage providers to expand their market share. This could lead to increased demand for US-based energy storage solutions.
key_takeaways: The FEOC restrictions and tariff increase are expected to limit the supply of Chinese-origin battery energy storage systems (BESS), potentially disrupting the US energy storage market.

The slowdown in EV adoption caused by these restrictions may create opportunities for domestic energy storage providers to expand their market share and capture a larger share of the US energy storage market.

US energy storage companies may need to invest in research and development to improve the efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and scalability of their products to remain competitive in the domestic market.

articles.title: Sungrow releases new inverters, storage system for utility and C&I solar
articles.summary: Sungrow has released new power and energy systems products, including a utility string inverter, a three-phase hybrid inverter for commercial and industrial applications, and a liquid-cooled energy storage system. These products aim to address real-world challenges related to grid stability, system deployment, and long-term operation in global energy markets. The new products reflect Sungrow's focus on system-level innovation and enhanced grid compatibility.
key_takeaways: The SG465HX utility string inverter delivers 465 kW of AC output power with a maximum efficiency of 99%, making it suitable for large-scale solar power plants.
Sungrow has developed a three-phase hybrid inverter, the SH125CX, which is designed for commercial and industrial applications, supporting up to six maximum power point tracking units (MPPTs).

The company also released a liquid-cooled energy storage system, the PowerStack ST255CS, with long-duration storage capability, addressing real-world challenges related to grid stability and operation.

articles.title: Real-Time Grid Automation Vs. Power Interruptions
articles.summary: The article discusses the shift in utilities' approach from a reactive to proactive method to improve distribution system resilience, highlighting the benefits of real-time grid automation. This proactive approach aims to minimize power interruptions and enhance overall grid efficiency. By leveraging advanced technologies, utilities can better manage their distribution systems.
key_takeaways: Real-time grid automation allows for more efficient management of energy supply and demand, reducing the likelihood of power interruptions.
Proactive measures enabled by real-time grid automation enable utilities to quickly respond to grid instability and minimize the impact of outages.
The shift towards proactive grid management can lead to improved overall grid resilience, reliability, and efficiency.

articles.title: Proposed Expansion of Upper Midwest Transmission Line Seeks to Address Growing Electricity Demand
articles.summary: A proposed expansion of a transmission line in the Upper Midwest aims to address growing electricity demand in the region. The project, led by energy providers Great River Energy and Xcel Energy, seeks to increase transmission capacity to support increased energy usage from renewable sources like wind and solar. This expansion is part of efforts to modernize the region's power grid.
key_takeaways: The proposed expansion aims to address growing electricity demand in the Upper Midwest, which is driven by increasing adoption of renewable energy sources.
Energy providers involved in the project include Great River Energy, Minnesota Power, Missouri River Energy Services, Otter Tail Power Company, and Xcel Energy.
The transmission line expansion will support the integration of more wind and solar power into the grid, promoting a cleaner and more efficient energy mix.

articles.title: Photovoltaics and jobs: The solar PV sector is the largest employer in the renewable energy industry
articles.summary: The International Renewable Energy Agency's (IRENA) report on renewable energy and jobs has found that the solar photovoltaic sector is the largest employer in the renewable energy industry, accounting for over 7.2 million jobs worldwide. The report also highlights the need for stronger public action to build domestic supply chains and ensure a more inclusive workforce. With global renewable energy jobs reaching 16.6 million in 2024, growth slowed compared to previous years.
key_takeaways: The solar photovoltaic sector is the largest employer in the renewable energy industry, accounting for over 43% of total renewable energy sector employment by technology.
Global renewable energy jobs reached 16.6 million in 2024, with a nominal annual growth rate of 2.5%, compared to previous years which saw higher growth rates.

The report emphasizes the need for inclusive policies and expanded training opportunities to ensure that workers, particularly those from underrepresented groups, are able to benefit from the energy transition.

articles.title: Spanish electricity grid reaches 85.7% saturation after 2.8 GW loss
articles.summary: Spain's electricity grid has reached a saturation level of 85.7% after losing nearly 2.8 GW of available capacity in two months, leaving over 5,200 facilities without spare capacity. This strain is primarily due to rising electricity demand from electrification and new industrial projects. The Basque Country and other regions have recorded the highest levels of structural saturation.
key_takeaways: Spain's electricity grid has lost nearly 2.8 GW of available capacity in two months, pushing overall saturation to 85.7%.
More than 5,200 facilities are fully saturated, with the Basque Country recording the highest level at 99.8%, followed by Navarre and La Rioja.

The strain on the grid is primarily due to rising electricity demand from electrification and new industrial projects, with only six provinces retaining more than 50% of available substation capacity.

articles.title: ‘Agrivoltaics is not just a land-sharing concept, but a systems-level solution to some of the world’s most pressing challenges’
articles.summary: The article discusses a study on agrivoltaics, a systems-level approach to combining agriculture and solar power production. Researchers analyzed six interconnected spheres of impact, including sustainability, soil-crop productivity, socioeconomic resilience, solar power generation, spatial efficiency, and species. The study found that agrivoltaics has the potential to generate over $1 trillion in added global agricultural income and increase crop yields by over 1,800 million tonnes annually.
key_takeaways: Agrivoltaics may generate over $1 trillion in added global agricultural income under optimal terms, making it a potentially lucrative solution for sustainable food production.
The system-level approach of agrivoltaics can address multiple pressing challenges, including food insecurity, climate stress, land-use conflicts, and economic vulnerability simultaneously.
Agrivoltaics has the potential to increase crop yields by over 1,800 million tonnes annually, contributing significantly to global food security and sustainability efforts.

articles.title: Long-duration energy storage costs declining, European policymakers urged to make ‘strategic choice’
articles.summary: The costs of long-duration energy storage (LDES) technologies are expected to decline by around 37% on average by 2030, according to a new study published by the Electric Power Research Institute (EPRI). This decline is attributed to advancements in technology and economies of scale. As a result, European policymakers are being urged to make a "strategic choice" regarding LDES adoption.
key_takeaways: The costs of long-duration energy storage technologies are expected to decrease significantly over the next decade, making them more competitive with traditional energy sources.
This decline in cost is driven by advancements in technology and economies of scale, which will likely have a positive impact on the adoption of LDES solutions.
European policymakers are being urged to make informed decisions about LDES adoption, as they play a crucial role in shaping the future of energy storage and grid resilience.
The study highlights the importance of strategic planning and investment in LDES technologies to ensure a secure and sustainable energy future.

articles.title: Fujiyama Power commissions 1 GW solar cell plant in India
articles.summary: Fujiyama Power Systems has commissioned a 1 GW solar cell manufacturing facility in Dadri, India, which will produce mono passivated emitter and rear contact solar cells for internal use. The move aims to strengthen supply-chain security, reduce dependence on imported cells, and achieve cost control. Production was completed six months ahead of schedule with significant cost savings.
key_takeaways: Fujiyama Power Systems has started production at its 1 GW solar cell manufacturing facility in Dadri, Uttar Pradesh, India, marking a major step towards strengthening the company's manufacturing integration.
The new facility will cater entirely to the company's internal consumption, reducing dependence on imported cells and improving supply reliability for its solar panel operations.
By bringing solar cell production in-house, Fujiyama Power Systems aims to achieve greater cost control, reduce reliance on imported cells, and improve visibility and control across the value chain.

articles.title: Institute of Science Tokyo Unveils Solid Electrolyte for Low-Temperature Hydrogen Storage
articles.summary: The Institute of Science Tokyo has developed a breakthrough solid electrolyte that enables low-temperature hydrogen storage in magnesium hydride, overcoming traditional metal hydrides' temperature limitations. This innovation allows for reversible hydrogen storage at a surprisingly mild 90°C and demonstrates potential for real-world zero-emission technology. The research, led by Professor Ryoji Kanno, offers a promising solution for sustainable energy applications.
key_takeaways: A solid electrolyte has been developed that enables low-temperature reversible hydrogen storage in magnesium hydride at 90°C, surpassing traditional metal hydrides' temperature requirements.

The breakthrough is attributed to the novel crystal lattice of the solid electrolyte, which provides a 3D maze of tetrahedral and octahedral pockets for hydride ions to zip through, enhancing ionic conductivity.
The achievement demonstrates potential for real-world zero-emission technology, with the research team demonstrating stable operation over ten full charge-discharge cycles at the low temperature.

articles.title: Solar met 61% of US electricity demand growth in 2025
articles.summary: Solar energy has become a primary source for meeting the US's surging power needs, accounting for nearly two-thirds of the growth in electricity demand in 2025. Solar generation increased by 83 TWh, a 27% increase over 2024, and now generates 8.5% of all US electricity. The rise of battery storage is enabling solar to provide dispatchable electricity throughout the day.
key_takeaways: Solar energy met nearly two-thirds (61%) of the growth in US electricity demand in 2025, with a record-breaking increase in solar generation and a surge in battery capacity.
The growth in solar energy was most pronounced in regions where demand rose the fastest, such as Texas and the Midwest, which saw solar meet 81% of the increase in electricity demand.

The integration of battery storage is transforming the US energy landscape, enabling solar to provide dispatchable electricity throughout the day and reducing reliance on fossil fuels, as seen in Florida where solar growth exceeded demand growth.

articles.title: MGM Resorts achieves 100% daytime solar power on Las Vegas strip
articles.summary: MGM Resorts International has achieved 100% daytime solar power on the Las Vegas strip through a new 25-year power purchase agreement with Estuary Power's Escape Solar and Storage project. The facility, which includes a 115 MW solar array and 400 MWh energy storage, provides power to MGM's hotels, as well as Caesars Entertainment and Wynn Las Vegas under long-term agreements. This milestone marks a significant step towards MGM's goal of using 100% renewable electricity domestically by 2030.
key_takeaways: MGM Resorts International has secured 100% daytime solar power on the Las Vegas strip through its new partnership with Estuary Power, which is expected to significantly reduce the company's carbon footprint.

The Escape Solar and Storage project, which includes a 115 MW solar array and energy storage, will provide power to MGM's hotels, as well as Caesars Entertainment and Wynn Las Vegas under long-term agreements.

This milestone marks an important step towards MGM's goal of using 100% renewable electricity domestically by 2030, demonstrating the company's commitment to sustainability and reducing its environmental impact.

articles.title: US Startup Brings Diesel-Killing Energy Storage Down To Earth, From Mars
articles.summary: A US startup has developed a compact, containerized energy storage system that can store solar power and deliver it for over 100 hours at a time, day or night. This technology is said to be "diesel-killing," implying it's highly efficient and effective in reducing the need for diesel generators. The system's compact design allows it to be easily deployed on Mars, suggesting its potential for use in space exploration.
key_takeaways: A new compact energy storage system can store solar power and deliver it for over 100 hours at a time.
This technology is considered "diesel-killing," indicating high efficiency and effectiveness in reducing diesel generator usage.
The system's design makes it suitable for deployment on Mars, highlighting its potential applications in space exploration.

articles.title: A Texas data center will open sooner thanks to an offline grid battery
articles.summary: A partnership between a data center developer and Eolian, the owner of the Chisholm Grid battery in Texas, aims to accelerate the growth of AI infrastructure by providing a reliable energy storage solution. The battery will enable a data center to operate independently from the grid, reducing reliance on power outages. This innovative approach models a new way for energy storage to support the growing demand for AI services.
key_takeaways: A data center developer has partnered with Eolian to utilize their 100 megawatts/125 megawatt-hours of grid battery capacity, Chisholm Grid, in Texas.
The partnership aims to provide a reliable energy storage solution, enabling the data center to operate independently from the grid and reduce reliance on power outages.
This innovative approach models a new way for energy storage to support the growing demand for AI services by accelerating the build-out of AI infrastructure.

articles.title: Sage Geosystems Raises Over $97 Million To Deploy World’s First Commercial Pressure Geothermal Power Generation Facility
articles.summary: Sage Geosystems has raised over $97 million in Series B funding to deploy the world's first commercial pressure geothermal power generation facility, a pioneering project that will advance the company's geothermal power generation and energy storage solutions.
key_takeaways: Sage Geosystems is co-leading its Series B financing with Ormat Technologies and Carbon Direct Capital, indicating strategic partnerships for the project.

The funding will support the development of the company's next-generation geothermal power generation project, marking a significant milestone in the commercialization of pressure geothermal technology.

This investment suggests that Sage Geosystems is taking a major step forward in its mission to provide sustainable and innovative energy solutions through its geothermal power generation capabilities.

articles.title: Report Quantifies Climate, Health Benefits of Clean Energy for Data Centers
articles.summary: A new report by the Union of Concerned Scientists (UCS) estimates that powering US data centers with clean energy could avoid trillions of dollars in health and environmental costs. The report finds that while decarbonizing the power sector would increase wholesale electricity costs, it would still deliver significant climate and health benefits. Restoring federal clean energy tax credits could lower electricity costs by $248 billion.
key_takeaways: Powering US data centers with clean energy could avoid trillions of dollars in health and environmental costs.
Decarbonizing the power sector to meet rising electricity demand from data centers would increase wholesale electricity costs, but still deliver significant climate and health benefits.
Restoring federal clean energy tax credits could lower electricity costs by $248 billion and shift the cost off ratepayers.

articles.title: Wind and solar overtook fossil fuels across Europe in 2025
articles.summary: In 2025, Europe's power mix shifted in favor of wind and solar energy, with these renewable sources generating more electricity than fossil fuels for the first time. Wind and solar supplied a record 30% of EU power, surpassing fossil fuels at 29%. This milestone marks a significant turning point in Europe's transition to cleaner energy.
key_takeaways: Wind and solar energy overtook fossil fuels as the primary source of electricity generation in Europe in 2025.
The share of wind and solar power in Europe's power mix reached a record high of 30%, surpassing the 29% supplied by fossil fuels.
This milestone marks a significant shift towards cleaner energy sources, indicating a major breakthrough in Europe's transition to renewable energy.

articles.title: Electrical Design of a Clean Offshore Heat and Power (CleanOFF) Hub
articles.summary: The article presents an innovative offshore solution for powering oil & gas platform clusters using a wind farm and hydrogen hub. The study aims to design a feasible off-grid system alternative to conventional electrification solutions. The results show promising potential for this alternative energy approach, but also highlight challenges that need to be addressed.
key_takeaways: A power system model was developed to evaluate the design and operation of the CleanOFF hub, taking into account factors such as wind farm fluctuations and equipment sizing.

The study found that reducing battery energy storage system (BESS) size can significantly decrease costs, with ramp rates of seconds versus minutes resulting in a 60-70% reduction and synchronized control of electrolyzers leading to an additional 15-20% reduction.
The simulations revealed challenges in achieving self-sufficiency for hydrogen production, highlighting the need for design improvements to overcome these obstacles.

articles.title: Ramping-aware Enhanced Flexibility Aggregation of Distributed Generation with Energy Storage in Power Distribution Networks
articles.summary: The article proposes a ramping-aware flexibility aggregation scheme for distributed energy resources (DERs) in power distribution networks, which accounts for DER ramp limits and yields provably disaggregable flexibility envelopes. The proposed method also introduces a pre-ramping strategy to enhance the attainable flexibility region while preserving network feasibility and disaggregation guarantees. The results demonstrate a significant improvement in flexibility compared to a baseline model.
key_takeaways: The proposed scheme explicitly accounts for DER ramp limits, which is crucial for real deployments as existing aggregation schemes often ignore these constraints.
The introduction of a pre-ramping strategy can further enhance the attainable flexibility region while preserving network feasibility and disaggregation guarantees.

The proposed method has been validated on an IEEE-33 bus distribution system and demonstrates a significant improvement in flexibility (5.2% to 19.2%) compared to a baseline model, depending on system conditions.

articles.title: Efficient reformulations of ReLU deep neural networks for surrogate modelling in power system optimisation
articles.summary: This article proposes a linear programming reformulation for ReLU deep neural networks to enable tight and tractable embedding of learned surrogate models in power system optimization. The proposed method is evaluated on a case study involving aggregator bidding problems and benchmarked against state-of-the-art alternatives, demonstrating comparable solution quality while improving computational performance and preserving model fidelity.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a linear programming reformulation for ReLU deep neural networks with non-negative weight matrices beyond the first layer to enable integration of learned surrogate models in power system optimization.

The proposed convexified ReLU DNN achieves solution quality comparable to piecewise linearization (PWL) and MIP-based reformulations, while significantly improving computational performance and preserving model fidelity.
The method offers a scalable and reliable approach for integrating learned surrogate models in optimisation, with applicability to emerging power system applications.

articles.title: A Two-Stage Risk-Averse DRO-MILP Methodological Framework for Managing AI/Data Center Demand Shocks
articles.summary: The article proposes a two-stage risk-aware distributionally robust optimization (DRO)-Mixed-Integer Linear Programming (MILP) framework to manage AI-driven data center demand shocks in power systems. The framework coordinates the pre-allocation and post-event dispatch of Flexible Capacity Modules to stabilize the grid and minimize penalties. It is designed for scalability and can be applied on smaller IEEE test feeders or expanded to larger systems.
key_takeaways: The proposed DRO-MILP framework addresses emerging digital-era disturbances, such as AI-driven data center load surges, which challenge traditional resilience frameworks.

The framework consists of two stages: Stage-I optimizes Flexible Capacity Module (FCM) allocation using DRO with CVaR to hedge against uncertain load surges, and Stage-II models real-time stabilization following stochastic demand-shock scenarios.
The framework is designed to be scalable, allowing it to be applied on smaller IEEE test feeders or expanded to larger systems capable of representing AI-scale loads.

articles.title: Stochastic EMS for Optimal 24/7 Carbon-Free Energy Operations
articles.summary: The article proposes a two-stage stochastic optimization formulation for achieving 24/7 carbon-free energy (CFE) compliance in Thailand's power system, incorporating primary energy technologies such as solar power, battery storage, and renewable energy procurement. The study addresses near real-time operations using a 15-minute resolution and incorporates deep learning-based forecasting to account for uncertainties in load and solar generation. The proposed system aims to provide a feasible pathway for transitioning to carbon-free operations.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a novel two-stage stochastic optimization formulation for optimal 24/7 CFE operations, incorporating primary energy technologies such as solar power, battery storage, and renewable energy procurement.
The study addresses near real-time operations using a 15-minute resolution, providing a more dynamic approach to managing the energy system compared to traditional long-term planning methods.

The proposed system explicitly treats CFE compliance as a model parameter, enabling flexible targets and accounting for uncertainties in load and solar generation through deep learning-based forecasting.

articles.title: Instantaneous Frequency in Power Systems using the Teager-Kaiser Energy Operator
articles.summary: The article discusses a novel instantaneous-frequency (IF) local estimator based on the complex Teager-Kaiser energy operator and dynamic-signal identity, which aims to correct the bias in conventional IF estimators used in power systems. The proposed approach aligns with complex-frequency kinematics and provides a geometric interpretation of curvature and torsion without phase unwrapping. The estimator's accuracy is demonstrated through simulations and data-driven examples.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a new instantaneous-frequency (IF) local estimator using the complex Teager-Kaiser energy operator, which corrects the bias in conventional estimators.
The proposed approach aligns with complex-frequency kinematics and provides a geometric interpretation of curvature and torsion without phase unwrapping.
Simulations and data-driven examples demonstrate the accuracy of the proposed IF estimator, making it a potential solution for power systems applications.

articles.title: Noon Energy proves 100+ hour battery for clean energy storage
articles.summary: Noon Energy has successfully operated a scaled-up, ultra-long-duration energy storage system for thousands of hours, capable of delivering clean power continuously for over 100 hours at a time. This milestone marks a significant achievement in the development of long-duration energy storage systems. The company's technology is poised to address the growing demand for clean energy storage, particularly in data centers.
key_takeaways: Noon Energy has developed an ultra-long-duration energy storage system capable of delivering clean power continuously for over 100 hours at a time.
This milestone comes as data centers are projected to consume up to 12% of total US electricity by 2028, highlighting the need for reliable and efficient energy storage solutions.
The development of such long-duration energy storage systems is crucial for addressing the growing demand for clean energy and reducing dependence on traditional fossil fuels.

articles.title: FERC: US utility-scale solar capacity overtook wind in 2025 – a first
articles.summary: The US utility-scale solar capacity has surpassed wind capacity for the first time, according to data from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC). Solar energy has dominated new capacity additions for 26 consecutive months. This milestone marks a significant shift in the US energy landscape.
key_takeaways: Utility-scale solar capacity has overtaken wind capacity, marking a significant milestone in the adoption of renewable energy sources.
Solar energy has held the lead among all energy sources for an unprecedented 26 consecutive months, indicating its growing dominance in the market.
This achievement is a result of the increasing competitiveness and affordability of solar energy, leading to more investment in utility-scale solar projects.

articles.title: Noon Energy demonstrates 100+ hour ultra-long-duration energy storage system
articles.summary: Noon Energy has successfully demonstrated a 100+ hour ultra-long-duration energy storage system, showcasing a reversible solid oxide fuel cell battery that achieves more than 200 hours of energy storage capacity. This pilot represents the first fully containerized, modular ultra-LDES system to be operated for thousands of hours. The system's high energy density and compact footprint make it suitable for space-constrained locations.
key_takeaways: Noon Energy has developed a novel battery designed to deliver multi-day to seasonal energy storage with each containerized unit providing 100 kW of power and over 100 hours of uninterrupted energy delivery.

The company's system occupies a significantly smaller footprint than other long-duration storage technologies, making it well suited for space-constrained locations, with its footprint being 20-200 times smaller than flow batteries and pumped-hydro gravity storage systems.

The reversible solid oxide fuel cell battery technology enables the system to achieve more than 200 hours of energy storage capacity, representing a significant milestone in ultra-long-duration energy storage.

articles.title: Virginia proposes 20.78GW storage mandate as Trump, governors call for emergency PJM grid measures
articles.summary: Virginia has proposed a significant increase in energy storage requirements, which coincides with growing electricity demand due to data centers. This proposal is part of the state's efforts to address its energy needs and ensure grid resilience. The proposal aims to boost energy storage by 20.78GW.
key_takeaways: Virginia's energy storage requirement is a significant response to the state's growing electricity demand, driven largely by the expansion of data centers.

The proposal suggests that energy storage will play a crucial role in addressing this demand growth and ensuring grid resilience, particularly as the grid faces increasing pressure from peak demand and renewable energy sources.
The proposed mandate could have far-reaching implications for the state's energy infrastructure and policy decisions, potentially influencing other states to adopt similar measures.

articles.title: Energy demand curves and bridge power for data centers define connections and conversations at POWERGEN 2026
articles.summary: The article discusses the importance of energy demand curves and bridge power in defining connections and conversations at POWERGEN 2026. It highlights the growing interest in data centers as a key driver for bridging traditional and renewable power generation technologies. The event is expected to focus on innovative solutions and opportunities within both conventional and clean energy sectors.
key_takeaways: Energy demand curves are becoming increasingly important in understanding the shifting patterns of power consumption, particularly with the rise of data centers.

Bridge power, which refers to the role of traditional power plants in complementing renewable energy sources, is a key conversation point at POWERGEN 2026, as the industry seeks to balance grid stability and sustainability.
The event aims to explore innovative solutions that can connect traditional and renewable power generation technologies, ultimately driving growth and development within both sectors.

articles.title: New Jersey governor orders state to accelerate solar, storage and virtual power plants
articles.summary: New Jersey Governor Mikie Sherrill has ordered the state to accelerate its development of solar, storage, and virtual power plants. This move aims to modernize the traditional electric utility business model by reducing capital spending dependency. The governor also instructed regulators to study how to make utility profits less dependent on capital spending.
key_takeaways: New Jersey is taking steps to increase its renewable energy capacity through the development of solar, storage, and virtual power plants.
The state aims to modernize its traditional electric utility business model by reducing its reliance on capital spending for profits.
The governor's orders also include a study on how to make utility profits less dependent on capital spending, indicating a shift towards more sustainable and efficient energy practices.

articles.title: ERMCO Expands Transformer Manufacturing West with New Arizona Facility
articles.summary: ERMCO, a distribution transformer manufacturer, is expanding its operations to the West with a new facility in Arizona. The 566,121-square-foot plant will add three-phase production capacity to address ongoing supply constraints. This expansion marks ERMCO's first venture west of the Mississippi River.
key_takeaways: ERMCO is opening its first manufacturing facility west of the Mississippi River in Maricopa County, Arizona.
The new 566,121-square-foot plant will increase three-phase production capacity to address supply constraints.
This expansion indicates a growing need for transformer manufacturing in the Western United States.

articles.title: UK to spend $20 billion on home energy upgrades, mandatory PV for new homes
articles.summary: The UK government has announced a $20 billion investment program to upgrade home energy systems, with a focus on solar and battery storage installations. The plan aims to triple the number of homes with rooftop solar by 2030 and make solar panels mandatory for new build homes in England starting from 2026. Funding will be allocated to support low-income households, with grants and loans available for various energy efficiency measures.
key_takeaways: The UK government has committed $20 billion (£15 billion) to a home energy efficiency investment program, including cash grants and state-backed loans to support solar and battery storage installations.
The plan projects that up to 3 million homes could have rooftop solar by 2030, tripling the number of UK homes with rooftop solar compared to the past 15 years.
Solar panels will become mandatory for new build homes in England starting from 2026, as part of the Future Homes and Buildings Standard regulations.

articles.title: EGbatt releases 15 kWh storage solution for residential use
articles.summary: EGbatt, a Chinese energy storage manufacturer, has released a new residential energy storage solution called the ENERpro-LFP48300. The system offers 15 kWh of storage and is powered by a 48V, 300 Ah lithium battery. The product features a compact wall-mounted design, a built-in Battery Management System (BMS), and a touchscreen interface for easy monitoring and configuration.
key_takeaways: The ENERpro-LFP48300 has a capacity of 15 kWh and is powered by a 48V, 300 Ah lithium battery.
The system features a compact wall-mounted design that maximizes space efficiency and operates in temperatures ranging from -20°C to 50°C.
The EGbatt battery boasts a lifespan of over 9,500 cycles at a high 95% depth of discharge (DoD), providing exceptional long-term value for users.

articles.title: Air power: Tallying electricity generating potential from retired military aircraft
articles.summary: The US Air Force's Davis-Monthan Air Force Base in Arizona, known as the Boneyard, is home to retired military aircraft that can be repurposed for electricity generation. The base has a high concentration of retired aircraft, providing a potential source of renewable energy. This concept aims to give new life to retired military aircraft.
key_takeaways: The US Air Force's Davis-Monthan Air Force Base in Arizona is a significant repository of retired military aircraft, with over 4,000 planes stored on site.
These retired aircraft can be repurposed as wind turbines or electricity generators, providing a potential source of renewable energy and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
The concept of using retired aircraft for electricity generation has been explored by the US Air Force, with some studies suggesting that it could provide up to 30% of the base's electricity needs.

articles.title: Germany’s Hydrogen Strategy Delayed Electrification by Pulling the Workforce the Wrong Way
articles.summary: Germany's hydrogen strategy has been criticized for delaying electrification by pulling the workforce in a misguided direction. The country's energy and other demand flows are not materializing, leaving its hydrogen backbone with no customers and no suppliers. This has led to an examination of the pipeline from nowhere to nowhere itself.
key_takeaways: Germany's hydrogen strategy is hindering the transition to electrification due to misallocated workforce efforts.
The country's energy demand flows are not translating into tangible outcomes, leaving it without a clear customer base for its hydrogen production.
This misguided approach may have long-term consequences for the development of renewable energy and sustainable infrastructure in Germany.

articles.title: ‘We could have a problem’ POWERGEN 2026’s second Keynote takes stock of the grid
articles.summary: The article discusses the challenges faced by energy executives and regions in responding to grid issues, highlighting concerns over renewable energy integration, grid resilience, and infrastructure updates. The keynote address at POWERGEN 2026, hosted in San Antonio, Texas, provides insights into the measures being taken to address these challenges. The event sheds light on the complexities of managing power and energy systems.
key_takeaways: Renewable energy sources are becoming increasingly integrated into grids, but their variability poses a challenge to grid stability and reliability.
Grid resilience is a growing concern as regions seek to balance the benefits of renewable energy with the need for reliable and efficient energy supply.
The shift towards a low-carbon future requires significant investments in infrastructure upgrades, including smart grid technologies and grid modernization efforts.

articles.title: Massachusetts tries a market for distributed energy to tame grid costs
articles.summary: Massachusetts is exploring a new approach to manage its energy grid and costs, with National Grid launching a marketplace that allows residents and businesses to sell excess energy generated from renewable sources. This move aims to reduce the strain on the grid while also promoting the use of distributed energy systems. By tapping into this market, Massachusetts hopes to alleviate its energy-affordability crisis.
key_takeaways: Massachusetts is experimenting with a new market-based approach to manage its energy grid and costs.
National Grid has launched a marketplace that enables residents and businesses to sell excess energy generated from renewable sources.
The goal of this initiative is to reduce strain on the grid while promoting distributed energy systems and addressing the state's energy-affordability crisis.

articles.title: Japan’s solar industry targets vertical bifacial PV with new guide
articles.summary: The Japan Photovoltaic Energy Association (JPEA) has released a voluntary reference guide to support the adoption of vertical bifacial PV in Japan, outlining design, performance, and compliance considerations for projects in challenging conditions. The guide aims to promote vertical bifacial PV as a viable segment for the Japanese solar market, particularly in snow-prone, high-latitude, and space-constrained areas. This move reflects JPEA's strategic push for the technology.
key_takeaways: The JPEA has released a voluntary reference guide to support the adoption of vertical bifacial PV in Japan, providing practical guidance on design, performance, and compliance considerations.
The guide aims to promote vertical bifacial PV as a viable segment for the Japanese solar market, particularly in challenging conditions such as snow-prone areas and space-constrained locations.
The technology offers advantages in these regions, including preserving farmland productivity through vertical agrivoltaics installations.

articles.title: Ideal Energy commissions AI-enabled flexible HJT pilot line for space
articles.summary: Ideal Energy has completed an AI-enabled pilot line for ultra-thin, flexible heterojunction (HJT) solar cells, targeting lightweight power systems for space and near-space applications. The company's new platform integrates its existing mass-production toolset with AI-based process control to optimize critical steps in manufacturing thin, flexible cells. This marks a move beyond conventional photovoltaic manufacturing into advanced energy systems.
key_takeaways: Ideal Energy has developed an AI-enabled demonstration line for ultra-thin, flexible HJT solar cells designed for space and near-space applications, which builds on its existing mass-production toolset.

The company's new platform uses integrated PVD, PECVD, and precision wet-processing modules to handle and coat ultra-thin silicon substrates with optimized critical steps such as low-damage film deposition and uniformity management.

The initial output of the pilot line retains the typical advantages of HJT technology, including high open-circuit voltage and low degradation, but specific conversion efficiency figures and production capacity have not been disclosed.

articles.title: Guyana plans three utility-scale solar parks
articles.summary: Guyana plans to develop three utility-scale solar parks in region ten, with a combined capacity of 15 MW, as part of its larger goal to deploy 33 MW of large-scale solar power with energy storage across four regions. The projects are valued at $22.6 million and will be built by a joint venture between Chinese companies SUMEC Complete Equipment and Engineering Co., Ltd. and XJ Group Corporation. The construction is expected to take 18 months, with integration into the power system anticipated by mid-2027.
key_takeaways: Guyana aims to deploy 33 MW of large-scale solar power with energy storage across four regions, as part of its renewable energy strategy.
The three new utility-scale solar parks in region ten have a combined capacity of 15 MW and will be supported by at least 22 MWh of battery energy storage.

The projects are valued at $22.6 million and will be built by a joint venture between Chinese companies, with construction expected to take 18 months and integration into the power system anticipated by mid-2027.

articles.title: Battery storage in Spain could become unviable beyond 32 GWh
articles.summary: Scientists from the University of Seville have developed a real-time optimization model that suggests battery storage in Spain may become economically unviable beyond 32 GWh cumulative capacity. This is due to decreasing prices and reduced profitability as storage capacities increase. The study proposes an alternative methodology for evaluating storage planning, which uses actual market clearing curves to estimate expected revenues.
key_takeaways: Battery storage in Spain may reach its economic limit at a cumulative capacity of around 32 GWh, making it unviable beyond this point.
Traditional storage planning methods, such as production cost models and capacity expansion models, have limitations in representing the real interaction between storage and market prices.
The new real-time optimization model proposed by the University of Seville aims to improve the evaluation of storage planning by using actual market clearing curves to estimate expected revenues.

articles.title: Rio Tinto Expands Solar Power Capacity at Kennecott
articles.summary: Rio Tinto has expanded its solar power capacity at its Kennecott copper operations in Utah, adding a new 25-megawatt solar plant to its existing 5MW facility. The expansion demonstrates a circular critical-minerals supply chain, where tellurium produced at the site is used to manufacture the panels powering the facility. This development highlights Rio Tinto's efforts to reduce its carbon footprint and increase its use of renewable energy.
key_takeaways: Rio Tinto has expanded its solar power capacity by adding a 25-megawatt solar plant to its Kennecott copper operations in Utah.
The new solar plant is part of a circular critical-minerals supply chain, where tellurium produced at the site is used to manufacture the panels powering the facility.
This development demonstrates Rio Tinto's efforts to reduce its carbon footprint and increase its use of renewable energy.

articles.title: Year in Review: BESS industry maturing through ‘growing pains’ says Wärtsilä software VP
articles.summary: The BESS (Battery Energy Storage System) industry experienced a "growing pains" phase in 2025, according to Wärtsilä software VP Luke Witmer. Despite the challenges, the industry saw significant growth and advancements. The maturation of the industry is marked by increased adoption and technological improvements.
key_takeaways: The BESS industry faced challenges in 2025, but still achieved significant growth, indicating a positive trajectory for the sector.
The increasing complexity of BESS projects led to a need for more advanced software solutions, underscoring the importance of technology in driving industry development.
Despite difficulties, the industry continued to advance, with Witmer noting that it has "grew taller than ever," suggesting a strong upward trend despite some setbacks.

articles.title: GoodEnough Energy starts production at 7 GWh BESS factory in India
articles.summary: GoodEnough Energy has commissioned a 7 GWh battery energy storage system (BESS) factory in Noida, India, with plans to expand its capacity to over 25 GWh within the next three years. The company aims to develop energy storage solutions for global markets, addressing the growing need for energy storage to support India's transition to renewable energy. This move is seen as a transformative leap for India's clean energy future.
key_takeaways: GoodEnough Energy has established the largest BESS factory in India with an investment of over INR 450 crore (approximately $60 million USD).
The company plans to expand its facility's capacity from 7 GWh to more than 25 GWh within the next three years, addressing India's growing need for energy storage.
With the government of India aiming for 500 GW of non-fossil power capacity by 2030, there is an urgent need for up to 230 GWh of energy storage to keep its green grid stable and reliable.

articles.title: Scaling Solar Smarter: Innovation, Supply Chains, & the Future of Clean Energy
articles.summary: The article discusses the future of solar energy and what it takes to build a stronger, smarter clean energy future. It explores the forces shaping the next era of solar energy and highlights innovations and supply chain developments that will drive growth in the industry. Decades of experience from leading companies will be crucial in achieving this vision.
key_takeaways: The article emphasizes the importance of innovation in the solar energy sector to scale up production and reduce costs.
Supply chains are a critical aspect of the future of clean energy, as they will play a key role in delivering the necessary materials and equipment for large-scale solar installations.
Companies with decades of experience leading in the global energy space, such as ABB and Schneider Electric, are expected to be crucial in shaping the next era of solar energy.

articles.title: New design specifications for sodium-ion batteries
articles.summary: Researchers from Brown University have made significant progress in understanding the behavior of sodium ions in nanoporous carbon anodes for sodium-ion batteries. They used density functional theory to reveal dual ionic and metallic storage mechanisms, providing practical design guidelines to improve battery voltage, safety, and commercial viability. The findings aim to pave the way for the future commercial use of sodium-ion batteries.
key_takeaways: Researchers have identified dual ionic and metallic storage mechanisms in nanoporous carbon anodes for sodium-ion batteries using density functional theory.
The study provides practical design guidelines to improve battery voltage, safety, and commercial viability for stationary energy storage applications.
Hard carbon is a promising anode material for sodium-ion batteries due to its unique structure, chemistry, and transport properties, but the sodiation mechanism remains poorly understood.

articles.title: UK battery storage development market moves from speculation to execution
articles.summary: The UK battery storage development market has shifted from speculation to execution, with strong interest and activity in 2025 giving way to a more concrete focus on project implementation. This change is driven by various factors, including increasing demand for renewable energy sources and government support. The market is now poised for significant growth as developers bring their projects to fruition.
key_takeaways: The UK battery storage development market has transitioned from speculative planning to actual project execution, indicating a shift towards tangible progress.
Government support and increasing demand for renewable energy sources have likely contributed to this change in the market's focus.
As developers move forward with project implementation, the UK battery storage market is poised for significant growth and expansion.

articles.title: Maxell Develops All-Solid-State Battery Power Module Compatible with ER Battery Size
articles.summary: Maxell has developed an all-solid-state battery power module that matches the size and output voltage of a lithium thionyl chloride (ER) battery. This development aims to improve maintainability and reduce environmental impact by reducing battery replacement frequency. The new power module is compatible with ER batteries, which are widely used in industrial equipment and IoT applications.
key_takeaways: Maxell's all-solid-state battery power module reduces battery replacement frequency, contributing to improved maintainability.
The new power module matches the size and output voltage of ER batteries, making it compatible for use in existing industrial equipment and IoT systems.
By using an all-solid-state design, the power module aims to minimize environmental impact through reduced battery disposal needs.

articles.title: Base Station Sleeping Strategy Based on Load Sharing in Ultra-Dense Networks
articles.summary: The article proposes a base station sleeping strategy based on load sharing in ultra-dense networks to address high operational costs and low energy efficiency. The proposed solution combines UE-BS initial connection optimization with load-sharing based BS sleeping, achieving efficient matching between UEs and optimal BSs, and accurate dormancy of redundant BSs. Simulation results demonstrate significant advantages over traditional baseline schemes.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a multi-objective mathematical optimization model to maximize energy efficiency (EE) while minimizing the number of active base stations in ultra-dense networks.
A novel integrated solution is presented, combining UE-BS initial connection optimization and load-sharing based BS sleeping, which achieves efficient matching between UEs and optimal BSs.
The proposed solution improves convergence speed, optimizes the number of active BSs, and enhances energy efficiency compared to traditional baseline schemes.

articles.title: Resilient Hierarchical Power Control for Hybrid GFL/GFM Microgrids Under Mixed Cyber-Attacks and Physical Constraints
articles.summary: The article proposes a Resilient Hierarchical Power Control (RHPC) strategy to address the complex control challenges of hybrid microgrids integrating Grid-Following and Grid-Forming inverters. The proposed framework aims to unify conflicting requirements, ensure stability, and improve power sharing accuracy in the presence of cyber uncertainties and physical constraints. The RHPC strategy has been rigorously analyzed and shown to achieve Uniformly Ultimately Bounded (UUB) convergence.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a standardized power increment mechanism to bridge the tertiary and secondary layers of the hybrid microgrid, ensuring that real-time load fluctuations are compensated according to optimal economic ratios.

A dynamic activation scheme coupled with projection operators is introduced to address strict active power saturation constraints of Grid-Following units, preventing integrator wind-up and preserving stability.
The proposed framework incorporates a multi-scale attention mechanism and LSTM-based predictors to enhance robustness against False Data Injection (FDI) attacks and packet losses.

articles.title: Outage Identification from Electricity Market Data: Quickest Change Detection Approach
articles.summary: The article proposes a method for identifying power system outages from public market signals using the parametric quickest change detection (QCD) theory. The approach distinguishes pre- and post-outage regimes by analyzing the ratio of probability density functions, allowing for rapid line outage identification. This method is tested on a stylized PJM testbed with promising results.
key_takeaways: The proposed method uses parametric QCD to detect changes in market signals, leveraging stochastic data streams to distinguish pre- and post-outage regimes.
By exploiting multi-parametric programming, the approach can decompose complex market signals into parametric random variables with a known density, enabling more accurate outage identification.

Numerical experiments demonstrate the effectiveness of this method in identifying line outages from public electricity demand and price data, offering a promising solution for power system risk management.

articles.title: Small Models, Big Impact: Tool-Augmented AI Agents for Wireless Network Planning
articles.summary: The article introduces MAINTAINED, an autonomous AI agent designed for wireless network deployment, which outperforms large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT in real-world case studies by up to 100-fold while requiring less computational resources. This approach eliminates hallucination in technical specifications and enables edge-deployable AI for wireless communications. By externalizing domain knowledge into verifiable computational tools, MAINTAINED addresses the limitations of LLMs.
key_takeaways: MAINTAINED outperforms state-of-the-art LLMs by up to 100-fold in verified performance metrics, indicating its superiority in wireless network planning.
The approach eliminates hallucination in technical specifications by leveraging specialized computational tools for geographic analysis, signal propagation modeling, and network optimization.
By externalizing domain knowledge into verifiable computational tools, MAINTAINED enables edge-deployable AI for wireless communications, addressing deployment barriers faced by large LLMs.

articles.title: A Blockchain-Oriented Software Engineering Architecture for Carbon Credit Certification Systems
articles.summary: The article introduces a blockchain-based carbon-credit certification architecture that integrates real-time IoT data collection, edge-level aggregation, and secure on-chain storage to support small and medium-scale renewable installations. This system aligns with European legislation and voluntary carbon-market standards, providing a structured pathway for generating verifiable carbon-credit records. The proposed architecture demonstrates the feasibility of blockchain technology in carbon credit certification.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a blockchain-based solution for carbon credit certification, addressing the need for reliable and secure mechanisms to connect actual renewable energy production to emission-reduction records.
The system integrates IoT data collection, edge-level aggregation, and smart contracts on a permissioned blockchain, providing real-time verification of carbon-credit records.
The proposed architecture aligns with European legislation and voluntary carbon-market standards, offering a structured pathway for photovoltaic operators to generate verifiable carbon-credits.

articles.title: Research on Adaptive Inertial Control in Synchronization Systems: Based on Variational Optimization Methods and Their Applications in the Stability of Complex Networks
