articles.title: Leveraging Digital Twin Technologies: All-Photonics Networks-as-a-Service for Data Center Xchange in the Era of AI [Invited Tutorial]
articles.summary: The article presents a data center exchange architecture for all-photonics networks-as-a-service, enabling the creation of a virtual large-scale data center by connecting distributed data centers in metropolitan areas. The proposed technology uses digital twin operations to manage and control optical networks, with a focus on low-latency operations, scalability, reliability, and flexibility. This approach is demonstrated through field validations.
key_takeaways: The proposed architecture aims to create a virtual large-scale data center by connecting distributed data centers in metropolitan areas using all-photonics networks-as-a-service.
Digital twin technologies are used to manage and control optical networks, enabling low-latency operations, scalability, reliability, and flexibility within a single network architecture.

The technology includes features such as remote transponder control, fast end-to-end optical path provisioning, and optical line system calibration, which demonstrate its feasibility through field validations.

articles.title: Online identification of nonlinear time-varying systems with uncertain information
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel framework called Bayesian Regression-based Symbolic Learning (BRSL) for online identification of nonlinear time-varying systems with uncertain information. The framework addresses the limitations of existing methods by incorporating sparse horseshoe priors to enable simultaneous system identification and uncertainty quantification. It also establishes an online recursive algorithm that guarantees the well-posedness of the posterior distribution.
key_takeaways: The proposed BRSL framework formulates online symbolic discovery as a unified probabilistic state-space model, enabling simultaneous system identification and uncertainty quantification.
The framework incorporates sparse horseshoe priors to transform model selection into a Bayesian inference task, addressing the limitations of existing methods.
The article establishes an online recursive algorithm with a forgetting factor that guarantees the well-posedness of the posterior distribution and provides real-time monitors for data utility.

articles.title: Evolving Technologies, Outdated Regulations Impact Mid-Atlantic Generation Permitting
articles.summary: The article discusses the evolving landscape of energy generation permitting in the Mid-Atlantic region, driven by technological advancements and outdated regulations. States are implementing reforms to address reliability concerns, transmission constraints, and local government obstruction of energy projects. These changes aim to streamline the permitting process, allocate generation development authority to public utilities, and promote the adoption of emerging technologies.
key_takeaways: Energy-generation permitting in the Mid-Atlantic is shifting away from wholesale deregulation and uniform acceleration towards procedural and permitting reform.
States are enacting these reforms to address reliability concerns, transmission constraints, and local government obstruction of energy projects.
The changes aim to allocate generation development authority to public utilities, promote the adoption of emerging technologies like energy storage, and streamline the permitting process.

articles.title: Jackery Brings Creativity & Design To Solar & Energy Storage
articles.summary: The article highlights Jackery's innovative approach to the solar and energy storage market, having started as a portable battery power company 14 years ago. They have evolved their products to integrate solar panels and scalable home batteries, offering a unique blend of creativity and design. key_takeaways: Jackery has been operating in the portable battery market for 14 years before expanding into home storage solutions.
The company's products now blur the line between portable and home battery storage, with solar integration and scalability features.
Jackery's evolution reflects a trend in the industry towards more innovative and design-driven energy storage solutions.

articles.title: 58 Gigawatts Of Solar Power Are Hiding In Plain Sight
articles.summary: The article discusses the underappreciated contribution of rooftop solar power in the US, citing a total of 58.1 gigawatts' worth of installed capacity as of last October, according to the US Energy Information Agency.
key_takeaways: A significant portion of the US's solar power is concentrated in large utility-scale plants, while smaller rooftop installations have a substantial but underappreciated impact on overall energy production.
The article suggests that despite efforts by the Trump administration to hinder renewable energy progress, the growth and development of solar power continue unabated.
The 58 gigawatts of rooftop solar power may not receive as much attention as larger-scale projects, but it still represents a substantial component of the US's overall energy mix.

articles.title: Trump’s plan to make data centers pay for power plants has big flaws
articles.summary: The Trump administration is proposing a plan to require data center developers in PJM Interconnection to pay directly for new power plants, aiming to curb rising energy costs. articles.title: SoftBank pilots solar-wind-powered AI-controlled base station
articles.summary: SoftBank Group is testing a new AI-controlled cellular base station that harnesses solar and wind energy to reduce its carbon footprint. The system uses artificial intelligence to dynamically manage the "sleep" mode of the base station, reducing power consumption during periods of low communication traffic while maintaining service quality. The compact design makes it suitable for deployment in remote areas.
key_takeaways: SoftBank is piloting an AI-controlled cellular base station powered by solar panels and a 3 kW wind turbine to reduce energy use while maintaining service quality.
The system stores excess power in batteries and can automatically switch to the grid when needed, ensuring uninterrupted operation.

articles.title: Eskom launches tender for 17 MW solar plant
articles.summary: Eskom, South Africa's energy utility, has launched a tender for the development of a 17 MW solar plant at its Duvha Power Station. The project aims to alleviate system constraints and decarbonize operations at the facility, which is one of the country's largest fossil fuel plants. Eskom is seeking applicants to provide design, engineering, procurement, construction, and operation services for the project.
key_takeaways: Eskom is developing a 17 MW solar plant at its Duvha Power Station as part of its strategy to alleviate system constraints and decarbonize operations.
The project will have a minimum evacuation capacity of 30 MW AC and will be located on an environmentally authorized land area of 35.2 hectares within the power station.
The tender is open until January 30, 2024, at 10:00 a.m. local South African time, and applicants are required to submit their documentation electronically through Eskom's website.

articles.title: ‘True leadership comes from listening’
articles.summary: The article emphasizes the importance of diverse and inclusive teams in the renewable energy sector, citing how it drives innovation, resilience, and long-term success through collaboration, empathy, and clear communication. A veteran leader in the field shares her personal experiences with subtle biases and challenges faced by women in solar energy, highlighting the need for inclusive environments to thrive. By valuing diverse perspectives, organizations can adapt more effectively to changes and achieve stronger stakeholder relationships.
key_takeaways: Diverse teams improve decision-making, deliver tailored solutions, and contribute to smoother project execution, ultimately driving innovation and operational excellence.
Inclusive teams play a critical role in engagement and retention, particularly in a competitive industry with limited technical talent, by valuing everyone's input.

By combining strong technical expertise with empathy and clear communication, diverse teams can build stronger stakeholder relationships, manage risk more effectively, and achieve more successful project outcomes.

articles.title: Solar power generation drives electricity generation growth over the next two years
articles.summary: The US electric power sector is expected to experience significant growth in electricity generation over the next two years, with total generation reaching 4,423 BkWh by 2027. Solar power generation is expected to play a major role in this growth, with its share of generation rising from 18% in 2025 to 21% in 2027. The overall share of dispatchable sources like natural gas, coal, and nuclear is also expected to decline.
key_takeaways: The US electric power sector is projected to grow by 1.1% in 2026 and 2.6% in 2027, reaching a total generation of 4,423 BkWh.
Solar power generation is expected to significantly contribute to this growth, with its share increasing from 18% in 2025 to 21% in 2027.
The overall share of dispatchable sources (natural gas, coal, and nuclear) in electricity generation is expected to decline, falling to about 72% by 2027.

articles.title: Green Hydrogen Production at Questa: KCEC’s Bold Plan for 41-Hour Renewable Storage
articles.summary: The Kit Carson Electric Cooperative (KCEC) has implemented a groundbreaking plan to produce green hydrogen through electrolysing sunlight and reclaimed mine water in Questa, New Mexico. The 32 MW polymer electrolyte membrane electrolyzer produces storable green hydrogen that can be converted back into electricity using a 7.5 MW fuel cell, providing up to 41 hours of power to three counties and two pueblos. This innovative system is made possible by a $231 million USDA grant and environmental reviews.
key_takeaways: KCEC has successfully implemented a 32 MW polymer electrolyte membrane electrolyzer that produces storable green hydrogen using sunlight and reclaimed mine water, providing a clean source of sustainable energy.

The use of reclaimed mine water reduces the amount of water required for hydrogen production, compared to traditional coal-fired plants, which takes roughly half a gallon of water per kilogram of hydrogen produced.
The system utilizes long-duration energy storage with hydrogen, enabled by a 7.5 MW fuel cell that converts green hydrogen back into electricity, providing up to 41 hours of power to the community.

articles.title: No gravity Hydrogen Fuel Cells: Ace Launch Tests for Artemis Lander
articles.summary: Nimbus Power Systems and Blue Origin have successfully tested their gravity-agnostic PEM fuel cell stack, which has demonstrated its ability to withstand intense vibrations and pyroshock conditions. The tests mimic the extreme conditions that crewed landers will face on the Moon, providing a crucial validation for NASA's Artemis program. This milestone marks a significant advancement in fuel cell technology and lays out a clear path for scaling up hydrogen infrastructure.
key_takeaways: The successful testing of Nimbus Power Systems' gravity-agnostic PEM fuel cell stack provides a critical validation for crewed missions under NASA's Artemis program.
The fuel cell stack has demonstrated its ability to withstand extreme conditions, including random vibrations and pyroshock, which is essential for lunar landers.
This milestone marks a significant advancement in fuel cell technology and lays out a clear path for scaling up hydrogen infrastructure for both lunar and Earth-based applications.

articles.title: Safe Trajectory Gradient Flow Control of a Grid-Interfacing Inverter
articles.summary: The article presents a novel control framework for grid-interfacing inverters that incorporates constraints into the controller design, ensuring safe operation and optimal performance. The proposed "safe trajectory gradient flow" method optimizes the inverter's state while maintaining bounds on current magnitude and other constraints. This approach has been demonstrated through simulation results.
key_takeaways: Existing control methods for grid-interfacing inverters often neglect hardware limitations, leading to potential instability or degraded performance.
The proposed "safe trajectory gradient flow" controller directly incorporates constraints into the control process, providing a more robust and safe operation.
The approach has been shown to drive inverter outputs to optimal values while maintaining state constraints, even with limited optimization steps per control cycle.

articles.title: HyMGP: A Customized MILP-Based Tool for Techno-Economic Planning of Islanded Microgrids
articles.summary: The article presents a customized microgrid planning algorithm and tool, HyMGP, which is used to optimize the sizing of microgrid components for remote and off-grid applications in arid regions. The study compares HyMGP with HOMER Pro and demonstrates its advantages in providing optimal and flexible solutions. The analysis also highlights the importance of incorporating wind turbines and lithium iron phosphate batteries in reducing Net Present Cost.
key_takeaways: HyMGP provides more flexible and optimal solutions than HOMER Pro by allowing user-defined component specifications and enforcing all constraints strictly.
Incorporating wind turbines can reduce the Net Present Cost (NPC) by decreasing the required photovoltaic panels (PVs) and battery energy storage systems (BESS) capacities.
Lithium iron phosphate (Li-ion LFP) batteries are more cost-effective than lead acid batteries due to their longer lifespan, deeper discharge capability, and fewer replacement cycles.

articles.title: Event-Driven Deep RL Dispatcher for Post-Storm Distribution System Restoration
articles.summary: The article presents a deep reinforcement learning (DRL) dispatcher for post-storm distribution system restoration. The dispatcher learns to assign crew-to-repair tasks in real-time, taking into account various factors such as component status, travel/repair times, and crew availability. By using lightweight surrogates for wind and flood intensities, the proposed approach improves online performance compared to traditional methods.
key_takeaways: The proposed DRL dispatcher uses a sequential, information-revealing process to model restoration as a dynamic problem, allowing it to adapt to new information in real-time.

The use of compact features such as component status and crew availability enables the policy to learn efficient crew-to-repair assignments, while a feasibility mask ensures that unsafe or inoperable actions are blocked.

The lightweight surrogates used for wind and flood intensities improve online performance compared to traditional heavy solvers, reducing energy-not-supplied, critical-load restoration time, and travel distance.

The redevelopment by NewYork GreenCloud (NYGC) aims to create a sustainable and environmentally friendly infrastructure for AI applications, potentially reducing the industry's carbon footprint.
This project could be a significant step forward in integrating renewable energy with emerging technologies like AI, paving the way for more sustainable and eco-friendly innovations.

articles.title: Elevate Renewables Acquires Major Battery Storage Project in PJM
articles.summary: Elevate Renewables has acquired the largest standalone battery storage project in the PJM Interconnection, a Massachusetts-based energy group with a focus on energy storage and hybrid power generation assets. The acquisition marks a significant development in the PJM region's transition to renewable energy sources. This move is likely to contribute to the growth of clean energy solutions.
key_takeaways: Elevate Renewables has acquired the largest standalone battery storage project in the PJM Interconnection, underscoring the company's commitment to renewable energy and energy storage.
The acquisition highlights the growing importance of battery storage in supporting the integration of intermittent renewable energy sources into the grid.
This move is likely to contribute to the expansion of clean energy solutions in the PJM region, potentially helping to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and promote sustainable development.

articles.title: GES rolls out manganese-hydrogen battery with significant cost edge over lithium-ion
articles.summary: Green Energy Storage (GES) has unveiled a new manganese-hydrogen flow battery, which offers significant cost advantages over traditional lithium-ion batteries. The battery boasts an efficiency of over 75% and a levelized cost of storage (LCOS) that is "significantly lower" than dominant technologies. GES expects to commercialize the product in 2027.
key_takeaways: GES's manganese-hydrogen flow battery has an efficiency exceeding 75% and a service life of over 10,000 cycles, making it suitable for long-duration energy storage applications.
The battery's levelized cost of storage (LCOS) is "significantly lower" than current commercial solutions like lithium-ion batteries, with a cost of €0.02 per kWh per cycle.

GES has chosen manganese as the core chemistry due to its abundance, established production chain, and low environmental impact, aiming to provide an advanced solution for industrial-scale applications and renewable energy plants.

articles.title: America’s new power barons: Who will rule the AI-grade megawatt megasector?
articles.summary: The article discusses the growing importance of AI-grade megawatt megasector in power and energy systems, with a focus on finding a winning model that balances different components such as gas for firmness, renewables for cost, and storage for stability. This hybrid approach is seen as crucial to meet the increasing demand for clean and reliable energy sources. The article highlights the significance of this sector in shaping America's energy landscape.
key_takeaways: A hybrid power generation model that combines gas for reliability, renewables for cost-effectiveness, and storage for stability is being pursued as a winning approach in the AI-grade megawatt megasector.
This hybrid model aims to balance the needs of different stakeholders, including consumers who require firmness, investors seeking cost-effectiveness, and policymakers demanding stability.
The development of such a hybrid model is crucial to meet the growing demand for clean and reliable energy sources, particularly as the world transitions towards more sustainable energy options.

articles.title: PJM’s power-starved grid will finally get a big battery this year
articles.summary: The PJM Interconnection, which serves a region of over 67 million people in the mid-Atlantic area, is facing a capacity crunch due to rapid growth and increased demand for AI computing. To address this issue, PJM has been investing in new power plants and infrastructure, with a notable focus on large battery storage systems.
key_takeaways: The PJM Interconnection is struggling with a severe capacity shortage, exacerbated by the surge in AI computing investments in its 13-state region.
The grid operator is actively addressing this issue through various means, including investing in new power plants and infrastructure, such as large battery storage systems.
This year, PJM expects to introduce a significant battery storage system that will help alleviate the capacity crunch and ensure a more stable energy supply for its users.

articles.title: See your grid, trust your data: How visual AI is entering utility field workflows
articles.summary: The article discusses how visual AI is being integrated into utility field workflows to improve the accuracy of asset records and provide faster feedback to crews. This integration enables better management of power and energy systems, allowing for more efficient operations and maintenance. By leveraging geospatial work execution and visual AI, utilities can enhance their overall performance.
key_takeaways: The use of visual AI in utility field workflows aims to improve the accuracy of asset records by providing real-time feedback to crews.
Geospatial work execution is being utilized to streamline processes and reduce errors, leading to more efficient operations and maintenance.
By integrating visual AI into their workflows, utilities can enhance their overall performance and make data-driven decisions.

articles.title: Avangrid invests in more made-in-USA power transformers
articles.summary: Avangrid has invested $7 million to purchase five power transformers from WEG Transformers USA, marking a significant commitment to increasing the production of made-in-USA power transformers.
key_takeaways: Avangrid's investment in made-in-USA power transformers is a significant step towards diversifying its supply chain and reducing reliance on foreign-made components.
The purchase of five power transformers from WEG Transformers USA will help to increase domestic production capacity, supporting the growth of the US power transmission industry.
This move may also contribute to the development of a more robust and resilient US-based power infrastructure, enhancing energy security and reliability.

articles.title: Global wind power additions to decline 6% in 2026: WoodMac
articles.summary: The global wind power market is expected to experience a decline in additions by 6% in 2026, primarily driven by a slowdown in China's development and policy challenges in the United States. This decrease will likely have an impact on the growth of renewable energy sources. The analysis from Wood Mackenzie suggests that these factors will affect the buildout of wind power.
key_takeaways: A slowdown in China's development is expected to contribute significantly to the decline in global wind power additions, affecting the country's ambitious renewable energy targets.
Policy challenges in the United States will also curb wind power's growth in the US market, impacting the nation's overall renewable energy goals and objectives.
The 6% decline in global wind power additions by 2026 indicates a potential shift towards more cautious investment decisions in the renewable energy sector, driven by these factors.

articles.title: Duke Energy brings $100M, 50-MW battery online at former coal site
articles.summary: Duke Energy has successfully deployed a $100M, 50-MW battery storage system at its former Allen coal plant in North Carolina and South Carolina, marking a significant step towards transitioning from fossil fuels to renewable energy.
key_takeaways: The new battery storage system is expected to provide reliable backup power to the grid during periods of high demand or outages.
This project demonstrates Duke Energy's commitment to integrating renewable energy sources into its grid, as it replaces a coal-fired plant with a more sustainable and clean energy solution.
The deployment of this large-scale battery storage system highlights the growing importance of energy storage in the transition towards a low-carbon economy.

articles.title: PPA signed for Saskatchewan’s largest solar project
articles.summary: A power purchase agreement (PPA) has been signed between French developer Neoen and Saskatchewan Power Corporation for a 157 MW solar project in Saskatchewan, Canada. The Mino Giizis solar project will be the largest in the province and is expected to come online in 2028. The project will also bring benefits to First Nations communities and the regional economy.
key_takeaways: A 157 MW solar project has been approved for development in Saskatchewan, making it the largest solar project in the Canadian province.
Neoen will sell all electricity generated from the Mino Giizis project to Saskatchewan Power Corporation under a 25-year PPA.
The project will be co-owned by Neoen and four Treaty 4 Nations under a 50% equity partnership, with an estimated 350 construction workers anticipated during the peak construction phase.

articles.title: The eyes and ears of the power grid
articles.summary: The article discusses the importance of sensors in power and energy systems, particularly in the context of smart grids. Sensors are used to capture data on the state of the grid and inform utility managers about disruptions or performance issues. The International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) provides standards and conformity assessment systems that enable the safe and efficient operation of sensors.
key_takeaways: A wide variety of sensors are used in power grids, including environmental sensors (e.g., pyranometers, temperature sensors) and electricity sensors (e.g., voltage, current, power quality monitors).
Sensors can be used to monitor every aspect of a PV solar system's environment and other electricity devices, such as electricity cables, lines, substations, and transformers.

The IEC provides standards and conformity assessment systems that enable the safe and efficient operation of sensors, particularly in the context of smart grids and intermittent sources of energy like wind and solar power.

articles.title: Electricity rate hikes slash commercial solar payback periods in US by 33%, says Wood Mackenzie
articles.summary: Rising utility costs and increasing power demand are driving commercial solar investment in the US, with electricity rate hikes reducing payback periods by 33% according to a Wood Mackenzie analysis. The analysis shows that average annual retail rate growth from 2% to 6% between 2026 and 2050 has decreased the national average payback period for commercial solar projects from 6.3 years to 4.2 years. This trend is expected to continue as federal tax incentives transition out, making commercial solar more attractive.
key_takeaways: The increasing cost of grid power is reducing the payback period for commercial solar projects in the US, with a 33% decrease in national average payback period from 6.3 years to 4.2 years.
Rising retail electricity rates are emerging as the primary catalyst for commercial solar investment, driven by escalating costs of grid power and federal tax incentives transitioning out.

State-level data reveals significant variation in project returns, with California consistently showing the shortest payback periods due to high commercial electricity prices, while North Dakota records the longest.

The reversal was quietly announced in Duke Energy's latest long-term expansion plans.

This decision may be related to concerns about meeting the growing energy demands from data centers and other high-energy users in North Carolina.

The reversal of this expansion plan suggests that Duke Energy is reassessing its priorities or facing challenges in implementing the project due to factors such as environmental, regulatory, or financial constraints.

The company's focus on battery energy storage expansion suggests increasing interest in renewable energy storage solutions to support sustainable energy transition.
Selling a minority stake could be one of the options considered by Akaysha Energy to raise additional funds for its operations and expansion.

articles.title: Hybridization: The new paradigm for a more resilient and competitive renewable market
articles.summary: The article discusses how hybridization is becoming a key strategy for the renewable energy sector to overcome challenges such as price volatility and increased competition. Hybridization involves combining different renewable generation and storage sources, diversifying the energy profile, and balancing production throughout the day. This approach allows for more stable and competitive long-term pricing.
key_takeaways: Hybridization can offer more attractive and stable energy products to clients, covering consumption needs and reducing risks associated with the variability of a single source.

The combination of renewable generation sources such as solar PV + wind, solar PV + batteries, or solar PV + wind + batteries provides diversification and balance in energy production throughout the day.
Hybridization enables more competitive long-term pricing by providing a stable and flexible supply of electricity, making it easier for utilities and developers to secure contracts.

articles.title: Australia: ASL unveils dual-track LTESA strategy as solar-battery hybrids reshape NSW energy market
articles.summary: ASL has launched a consultation on its new Hybrid Generation LTESA product, which is part of its dual-track strategy for Australia's energy market. This move aims to reshape the NSW energy market by integrating solar-battery hybrids into the grid. The company's 2026 NSW Consumer Trustee Investment Priorities also highlight the importance of sustainable energy solutions.
key_takeaways: ASL is introducing a new Hybrid Generation LTESA product, which combines solar and battery storage to generate electricity.
This move is part of the company's dual-track strategy, indicating a shift towards integrating alternative energy sources into the grid.
The launch of this product is expected to reshape the NSW energy market, with solar-battery hybrids becoming increasingly important in meeting renewable energy targets.

articles.title: Battery storage costs fall 11-16% as Australia’s CSIRO maps least-cost route to net zero
articles.summary: The article reports that battery storage costs in Australia have decreased significantly, ranging from 11-16% across different durations. This trend is in contrast to increasing costs for coal and gas power plants. The CSIRO's analysis has identified the least-cost route to achieving net zero emissions.
key_takeaways: Battery storage costs in Australia have decreased by 11-16% across various durations, indicating a downward trend in costs.
Despite rising costs for coal and gas power plants, the battery storage sector is presenting a more favorable cost outlook.

The CSIRO's analysis has mapped out the least-cost route to achieving net zero emissions, suggesting that battery storage could play a significant role in Australia's transition to a low-carbon economy.

articles.title: Residual Power Flow for Neural Solvers
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel approach called Residual Power Flow (RPF) for neural solvers, which aims to address the limitations of current power flow formulations. RPF formulates residual functions based on Kirchhoff's laws and can be learned with neural solvers to achieve faster computations while maintaining flexibility. This work integrates RPF with a Predict-then-Optimise approach to solve operational tasks in power systems.
key_takeaways: The article proposes Residual Power Flow (RPF) as a novel approach for learning with neural solvers, which can improve the accuracy and flexibility of power flow formulations.
RPF formulates residual functions based on Kirchhoff's laws, allowing for faster computations while maintaining flexibility in solving operational tasks.

The Predict-then-Optimise approach, integrated with RPF, demonstrates improved performance compared to common power flow formulations in solving AC Optimal Power Flow (OPF), power-flow, and quasi-steady state power flow tasks.

articles.title: RIS-Aided E2E Multi-Path Uplink Transmission Optimization for 6G Time-Sensitive Services
articles.summary: The article proposes a Reconfigurable Intelligent Surfaces (RIS)-aided end-to-end (E2E) multi-path uplink transmission optimization for 6G time-sensitive services. The proposed architecture aims to reduce E2E latency by explicitly accounting for radio link latency and N3 backhaul latency through the design of UL traffic-splitting ratio, transmit power, receive combining, and RIS phase shift. The results show that the proposed framework can achieve significant reductions in average E2E latency.
key_takeaways: The proposed RIS-aided E2E multi-path uplink transmission architecture can achieve lower E2E latency for 6G time-sensitive services by considering both radio link latency and N3 backhaul latency.
The optimization framework developed in this work can reduce average E2E latency by up to 43% for a single user and 15% for the whole system compared to baselines.
The proposed approach explicitly accounts for traffic flow over multiple access paths to achieve lower-latency E2E delivery, addressing one of the key challenges for 6G time-sensitive services.

articles.title: From Prompt to Protocol: Fast Charging Batteries with Large Language Models
articles.summary: The article discusses the challenges of optimizing battery charging protocols and introduces two novel, gradient-free methods called Prompt-to-Optimizer (P2O) and Prompt-to-Protocol (P2P). These methods utilize large language models to propose and optimize battery charging protocols, outperforming existing optimization techniques in case studies. The results demonstrate that LLM-guided P2O can efficiently improve state of health metrics under fast charging cycling.
key_takeaways: Existing approaches to optimizing battery charging protocols are limited by slow evaluation times and costly constraints, leading to a narrow search space for optimal solutions.
The article introduces two novel methods, P2O and P2P, which use large language models to propose and optimize battery charging protocols, outperforming existing techniques in case studies.
LLM-guided optimization can expand the space of protocol functional forms, incorporate language-based constraints, and enable efficient optimization in high-cost experimental settings.

articles.title: Semi-Contention-Free Access in IoT NOMA Networks: A Reinforcement Learning Framework
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel reinforcement learning framework for power-domain non-orthogonal multiple access networks in IoT systems, aiming to improve uplink traffic efficiency and reduce data detection failures. The framework supports two access modes, contention-based and semi-contention-free, with a policy gradient algorithm executed at the base station. Numerical results demonstrate the framework's efficiency and scalability under varying network sizes and traffic loads.
key_takeaways: The proposed framework employs reinforcement learning to optimize power-domain non-orthogonal multiple access in IoT networks, promoting efficient uplink traffic handling.
The framework supports two access modes: contention-based and semi-contention-free, with a policy gradient algorithm executed at the base station for optimal radio resource allocation.

Numerical results show that the framework can effectively manage energy consumption, throughput fairness, and access delay while maintaining system scalability under varying network sizes and traffic loads.

articles.title: Semi-physical Gamma-Process Degradation Modeling and Performance-Driven Opportunistic Maintenance Optimization for LED Lighting Systems
articles.summary: This article proposes a performance-driven, simulation-in-the-loop framework for optimizing the maintenance of large-scale LED lighting systems. The framework models degradation through a semi-physical Gamma process and driver outages using Weibull lifetime models, and uses ray-tracing-based illuminance mapping to evaluate system performance. The goal is to optimize maintenance decisions while balancing performance deficiency, site visits, and replacements.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a novel approach to modeling LED package degradation and driver outages, using semi-physical Gamma process and Weibull lifetime models respectively.
The framework uses simulation-in-the-loop methods, including Bayesian inference and surrogate-based performance mapping, to optimize maintenance decisions under uncertainty.
The proposed framework balances multiple objectives, including performance deficiency, site visits, and replacements, in a multi-objective optimization setting.

articles.title: EIA Predicts Sustained Power Growth in 2026 and 2027
articles.summary: The US Energy Information Administration (EIA) is predicting sustained power growth in 2026 and 2027, with the highest demand growth in a quarter century, largely due to the proliferation of data centers. Solar power output is expected to increase significantly, while natural gas will provide a slightly smaller percentage of U.S. electricity, and coal will decline further. The predicted growth rate for solar power will be over 20% in both 2026 and 2027.
key_takeaways: The EIA predicts a 1-3% annual power demand growth from 2026 to 2027, the first time since 2007 that power demand has increased four years in a row.
Solar power output is expected to increase by more than 20% in both 2026 and 2027, making it 10% of U.S. power generation by the end of 2027.
The share of natural gas in the US power supply is expected to decrease slightly from 40-42% in 2024 to 39% in 2026, while coal's share will decline further from 17% in 2025 to 15% in 2026 and 2027.

articles.title: Bank Consortium Closes $160M Financing for Spanish Wind, Solar Portfolio
articles.summary: A bank consortium consisting of NORD/LB, Rabobank, and Siemens Bank has provided €135 million ($160 million) in financing for a portfolio of five renewable energy projects in Aragón, Spain. The projects, owned by ENCAVIS, are comprised of three wind farms and two solar farms with a total capacity of 199 MW. This deal highlights the growing demand for renewable energy financing.
key_takeaways: A €135 million ($160 million) financing package has been secured for five renewable energy projects in Aragón, Spain.
The portfolio consists of three wind farms and two solar farms with a combined capacity of 199 MW.
ENCAVIS, the owner of the portfolio, is a leading pan-European independent power producer.

articles.title: How AI’s Energy Challenge is Becoming its Innovation Engine
articles.summary: The article discusses the growing energy demands of artificial intelligence (AI) systems, which are scaling in size and sophistication at an unprecedented rate. As AI continues to innovate, it is also becoming its own innovation engine, with its energy consumption accelerating faster than any previous wave of digital innovation. This shift highlights the need for more efficient and sustainable energy solutions to support the rapid growth of AI.
key_takeaways: The increasing size and sophistication of AI models and workloads are driving up their energy consumption at an accelerated rate.
As AI becomes a major driver of innovation, it is also becoming its own primary source of energy demand, highlighting the need for more efficient solutions.
The article suggests that the growing energy challenges posed by AI are creating new opportunities for innovation and development in the field.

articles.title: This battery is about to change the world in 3 months, or make this guy a fool
articles.summary: The article discusses Donut Lab's announcement of a 400 Wh/kg solid-state battery cell that claims to last for 100 years, charge in 5 minutes, and have a 100,000-cycle life. If true, this would be a groundbreaking development in the electric vehicle industry and energy storage. The article questions the credibility of the claim and explores potential implications.
key_takeaways: Donut Lab's battery cell claims to achieve a high energy density of ~400 Wh/kg, which is considered a significant breakthrough if confirmed.

The claimed 5-minute charge time and 100,000-cycle life are impressive, but battery durability and charging speeds can be affected by various factors, including the type of application and usage patterns.

If Donut Lab's claims hold up, this could have far-reaching implications for the electric vehicle industry and energy storage market, potentially changing the game in terms of range, efficiency, and affordability.

articles.title: The Nuclear Industry’s Race Against the Clock: EPRI Experts on Fleet Optimization, SMRs, and What’s Next
articles.summary: The nuclear industry is facing a significant challenge in meeting growing electricity demand with carbon-free, firm power. The sector's aging fleet and lack of new capacity are creating a "timing problem" that must be addressed to meet the increasing energy needs driven by data centers, AI deployment, and industrial reshoring. Nuclear power is seen as a solution, but can it deliver capacity quickly enough?
key_takeaways: The nuclear industry is under pressure to increase capacity to meet growing electricity demand, particularly for carbon-free, firm power.
The use of Small Modular Reactors (SMRs) may play a key role in addressing the sector's capacity needs and meeting emerging energy demands.
Fleet optimization and revitalization of existing nuclear plants are also crucial strategies for the industry to remain competitive and deliver on its promise of low-carbon energy.

This acquisition aims to bolster Vistra's presence in PJM Interconnection, ISO New England, and the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT). The expansion is expected to enhance Vistra's overall energy production capacity.
key_takeaways: Vistra Corp. has acquired Cogentrix Energy in a $4 billion deal, expanding its gas-fired generation fleet by 5.5 GW.
The acquisition will bolster Vistra's presence in PJM Interconnection, ISO New England, and the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) power markets.
This expansion aims to enhance Vistra's overall energy production capacity across the three regional markets.

articles.title: Dutch long-duration energy storage project targets sub-€50/kWh costs with innovative technologies

With over €30 million in funding, the project aims to address challenges related to grid congestion.

Battery Competence Cluster NL will act as a national catalyst for knowledge sharing and collaboration across the battery value chain in the Netherlands.

articles.title: India deploys 37.9 GW of solar in 2025
articles.summary: India added a record 37.9 GW of solar and 6.3 GW of wind capacity in calendar year 2025, marking its highest annual renewable energy additions to date. The country's cumulative installed renewable energy capacity reached 258 GW as of December 31, 2025, with solar accounting for about 53% of the total. This growth was driven by accelerated construction and commissioning of projects, as well as a rise in domestic manufacturing capacity.
key_takeaways: India added a record 37.9 GW of solar capacity in 2025, with a significant increase of 54.6% year on year.
Utility-scale solar accounted for the majority of new installations (28.6 GW), driven by the commissioning of long-delayed projects and the open-access segment.
The country's cumulative installed renewable energy capacity reached 258 GW as of December 31, 2025, with solar accounting for about 53% of the total.
