articles.summary: HD Renewable Energy is planning an overseas expansion in 2026, with a focus on energy storage playing a key role in its strategy. The company is a Taiwan-headquartered developer and services provider. This expansion aims to capitalize on the growing demand for renewable energy.
key_takeaways: HD Renewable Energy is targeting further overseas expansion in 2026, indicating a significant growth plan.
Energy storage will be a major component of this expansion, suggesting that the company sees it as a crucial element in its strategy.
The focus on energy storage implies that HDRE aims to provide innovative solutions for renewable energy projects, which could help drive its growth and success.

articles.title: Neoen’s battery to pioneer grid-forming services on French transmission network
articles.summary: Neoen's 92 MW/183 MWh Breizh Big Battery is part of a trial with French transmission system operator RTE to provide grid-forming services on France's transmission network. This marks a significant step towards enhancing the stability of the French power grid, as traditional battery storage facilities currently operate in grid-following mode. The trial involves retrofitting inverters with grid-forming technology, which replicates key behaviors of synchronous generators to provide essential stability services.
key_takeaways: Neoen's Breizh Big Battery will be one of the first battery projects to pioneer grid-forming services on France's transmission network.
Grid-forming technology has progressed beyond experimental stages and is being deployed globally to support power systems with high renewable penetration.
The trial aims to enhance the stability of the French power grid by providing essential stability services, such as frequency regulation and voltage control, using advanced control architectures.

articles.title: Who’s driving the 300GWh boom in demand for AI data centre battery storage?
articles.summary: The article discusses the growing demand for AI data centre battery storage, driven by the rapid expansion of the global AI market. To address these energy challenges, HiTHIUM is providing products and strategies that cater to this booming industry. The article highlights the need for innovative solutions to support the increasing energy demands of AI data centres.
key_takeaways: The global AI data centre boom is driving a significant increase in demand for AI data centre battery storage.
Companies like HiTHIUM are emerging as key players in addressing the energy challenges faced by this rapidly expanding industry.
Innovative battery storage solutions are crucial to support the increasing energy demands of AI data centres and mitigate potential power outages or downtime.

articles.title: Australian solar installer fined $6,000 over unsafe battery installs
articles.summary: A Melbourne-based solar installation company, Greenova Pty Ltd, has been fined $6,000 by an Australian court for pleading guilty to unsafe installations of residential battery energy storage systems at five properties. The installations were found to have exposed batteries to uncontrolled voltage, causing fires and damage to property. This incident highlights the importance of independent inspections before connecting battery systems under Victoria's electrical safety laws.
key_takeaways: Greenova Pty Ltd was fined $6,000 for pleading guilty to unsafe installations of residential battery energy storage systems at five properties in Victoria.

The company's installations were found to have exposed batteries to uncontrolled voltage, causing fires and damage to property, including a minor house fire that destroyed the battery and damaged the exterior of the house.
The incident emphasizes the importance of independent inspections before connecting battery systems under Victoria's electrical safety laws to prevent similar incidents.

articles.title: CATL Batteries Stand Out For Minimal Degradation In EVs And Long-Term Energy Storage Systems
articles.summary: Morgan Stanley conducted research on battery degradation in China, analyzing data from ride-hailing firms on 12 EV models and found that CATL batteries showed minimal degradation. The study compared the battery capacity decline of these vehicles to identify the most resilient battery technology for electric vehicles (EVs) and long-term energy storage systems.
key_takeaways: CATL batteries demonstrated minimal degradation, standing out from other EV models in terms of battery capacity retention.
The research involved analyzing data from 100 cars across 12 different EV models, highlighting significant variability in battery degradation among the tested vehicles.
The study suggests that CATL batteries are a promising option for electric vehicles and long-term energy storage systems due to their minimal degradation.

articles.title: Europe Built Hydrogen Infrastructure Instead of the Power Grid It Needed
articles.summary: The article discusses how Europe invested heavily in building a hydrogen infrastructure network, despite having no suppliers or offtakers, as opposed to developing a power grid. This highlights the importance of demand realism over technological aspirations in achieving decarbonization goals. The European experience serves as a cautionary tale for policymakers and industry leaders.
key_takeaways: Europe's failure to develop a functional hydrogen infrastructure network, despite significant investment, underscores the need for robust demand and supply chains in the transition to low-carbon energy.
The article emphasizes that decarbonization success depends on realistic policy goals and strategies, rather than solely relying on technological advancements.
The European experience suggests that policymakers should prioritize building a reliable power grid over investing in unproven technologies like hydrogen infrastructure.

articles.title: Solar accounted for 7.24 million jobs in 2024
articles.summary: The International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA) has reported that solar energy accounted for over 43% of global jobs in the renewable energy sector in 2024, with a total of 7.24 million jobs worldwide. This represents an increase from 7.11 million jobs in 2023. The majority of these jobs are concentrated in China, India, and other countries in Asia.
key_takeaways: Solar energy is the largest employer in the renewable energy sector globally, accounting for over 43% of total renewable energy jobs.
China holds a significant share of global solar jobs, with over 4.2 million positions, followed by India and Brazil.
The top five countries with the most solar jobs are China, India, Brazil, the United States, and Pakistan, which collectively account for around 82% of the global total.

articles.title: MNRE & BIRAC Unveil INR 100 Crore CfP for Biomass-Based Green Hydrogen Pilots
articles.summary: The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) and the Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) have launched a call for proposals to support pilot-scale green hydrogen production in India. The initiative aims to utilize India's vast biomass reserves, reduce waste, and promote public-private partnerships. The project seeks to develop innovative technologies that can be scaled up within 12 months.
key_takeaways: The MNRE and BIRAC are offering INR 100 crore in funding for pilot-scale green hydrogen projects, with each project receiving up to INR 25 crore.
The initiative targets technologies already proven at bench scale, such as biomass gasification, pyrolysis, biological fermentation, and solar-integrated electrolysis.
The project aims to bridge the gap between lab experiments and real-world deployment by targeting Technology Readiness Levels 5-6, with a focus on reducing upfront risk for the private sector.

articles.title: Large Artificial Intelligence Model Guided Deep Reinforcement Learning for Resource Allocation in Non Terrestrial Networks
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel approach to resource allocation in Non-Terrestrial Networks (NTN) using a Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) agent guided by a Large Language Model (LLM). The LLM generates textual guidance that shapes the reward of the DRL agent during training, leading to improved performance. The results demonstrate significant advantages of this approach over traditional DRL methods.
key_takeaways: The proposed Large AI Model (LAM)-DRL agent outperforms traditional DRL by 40% in nominal weather scenarios and 64% in extreme weather scenarios.
The LLM-guided DRL agent achieves improved performance through reduced task-specific training requirements, thanks to its generalization capabilities.
The approach offers benefits in terms of throughput, fairness, and outage probability in NTN resource allocation.

articles.title: Grid-Aware Charging and Operational Optimization for Mixed-Fleet Public Transit
articles.summary: The article presents a comprehensive model to optimize charging schedules and trip assignments for mixed-fleet public transit systems, addressing the challenges of dynamic electricity pricing, vehicle capacity, and route constraints. The proposed approach uses a hierarchical method to tackle potential computational intractability, allowing it to be applied to relatively small fleets. By using real-world data from Chattanooga, Tennessee, the authors demonstrate significant savings in operating costs.
key_takeaways: The model uses mixed-integer linear programming (MILP) to optimize charging and trip assignments for mixed-fleet public transit systems.
The approach addresses the challenges of dynamic electricity pricing, vehicle capacity, and route constraints, which can pose significant operational challenges for transit agencies.
By employing a hierarchical method, the authors aim to make the model computationally tractable even with relatively small fleets, enabling its application in real-world scenarios.

articles.title: AUV Trajectory Learning for Underwater Acoustic Energy Transfer and Age Minimization
articles.summary: This article proposes a novel approach for sustainable underwater acoustic energy transfer and age minimization using autonomous underwater vehicles (AUVs). The authors develop two deep-reinforcement learning algorithms to optimize frequency division duplex (FDD) and time division duplex (TDD) solutions for simultaneous information uplink and energy transfer. The results show significant reductions in average age of information and improved data collection fairness.
key_takeaways: The proposed AUV-based approach enables underwater acoustic energy transfer, potentially allowing IoUT devices to operate indefinitely without battery limitations.
Two deep-reinforcement learning algorithms are developed to optimize FDD and TDD solutions for simultaneous information uplink and energy transfer.
The proposed solutions significantly reduce average age of information and improve data collection fairness compared to baseline approaches.

articles.title: Current and temperature imbalances in parallel-connected grid storage battery modules
articles.summary: The article discusses the challenges of heterogeneous currents and temperatures in parallel-connected grid storage battery modules, a common issue in large battery systems. Researchers conducted simulations and experiments to quantify these imbalances and identified key factors contributing to them, such as contact resistances and cell resistances. The study aims to provide safety thresholds for cell-to-cell variability and robustness metrics to mitigate failures.
key_takeaways: Heterogeneous currents and temperatures in parallel-connected grid storage battery modules can be a significant issue, affecting performance and lifetime of battery cells.
Contact resistances and cell resistances are strong contributors to temperature differences between cells, and safety thresholds for cell-to-cell variability have been defined based on these factors.
Lowering C-rates (charge/discharge rates) and narrowing SOC (state of charge) ranges can help mitigate failures in grid storage battery modules.

articles.title: Multiobjective Model Predictive Control for Residential Demand Response Management Under Uncertainty
articles.summary: The article proposes a multiobjective model predictive control approach for residential demand response management, aiming to minimize electricity costs and user dissatisfaction under real-time pricing. The proposed method uses Laguerre functions to parameterize control signals and incorporates a constrained multiobjective evolutionary algorithm to ensure feasible solutions. This approach is shown to outperform existing methods in simulations.
key_takeaways: The study proposes a novel approach to residential demand response management, integrating electricity cost minimization with user satisfaction under real-time pricing.
The proposed method uses Laguerre functions and a constrained multiobjective evolutionary algorithm to efficiently explore feasible solutions and mitigate uncertainties.

The simulation results show that the proposed approach can limit cost increases to 0.52% under uncertainties, significantly outperforming existing methods which result in cost increases of at least 2.3%.

articles.title: Blockchain-Enabled Renewable Energy Certificate Trading: A Secure and Privacy-Preserving Approach
articles.summary: The article discusses the implementation of Blockchain-Enabled Renewable Energy Certificate Trading, which aims to secure and protect consumer privacy in the tracking of renewable energy production and consumption. The study utilizes a directed acyclic graph (DAG) blockchain system to facilitate REC trading between suppliers and consumers, resulting in improved transaction times and reduced energy consumption compared to traditional proof-of-stake methods.
key_takeaways: The existing Renewable Energy Certificate (REC) schema has two main challenges: inconsistent global adoption and inadequate consumer privacy protection, which are addressed by the proposed Blockchain-Enabled Trading System.

The study demonstrates a 41% reduction in transaction time and a 65% decrease in energy consumption when using the DAG blockchain system for REC trading compared to traditional proof-of-stake methods.

The introduction of the trading schema helps protect consumer information while facilitating secure and transparent REC trading, aligning with global efforts to mitigate climate change by promoting renewable energy adoption.

articles.title: Coordinated Cooling and Compute Management for AI Datacenters
articles.summary: The article discusses the need to optimize power and energy consumption in AI datacenters, particularly those supporting large-language models. Current research has focused on compute-side scheduling without considering thermal objectives or constraints, which can lead to increased energy consumption and reduced efficiency. The authors propose a novel hierarchical control framework that balances computing and thermal management.
key_takeaways: Most prior research on optimizing LLM inference has focused on compute-side scheduling without considering thermal effects, potentially leading to increased total energy consumption.
GPU-intensive inference generates substantial heat, which can degrade datacenter performance if ignored, highlighting the importance of thermal objectives in AI datacenter design.

The proposed hierarchical control framework aims to co-optimize computing and thermal management by identifying optimal GPU parallelism, frequency (DVFS), and cooling control knobs to balance serving latency and thermal constraints.

articles.title: Illinois signs clean energy bill, will drive investments for solar PV, battery storage and VPPs
articles.summary: The Governor of Illinois, JB Pritzker, has signed a clean energy bill into law, which aims to drive investments in solar PV, battery storage, and Virtual Power Plants (VPPs) in the state. This bill is expected to boost the growth of renewable energy sources and reduce carbon emissions in Illinois. The signing of this bill marks a significant step towards a more sustainable future for the state's energy sector.
key_takeaways: The clean energy bill signed by Governor Pritzker will drive investments in solar PV, battery storage, and Virtual Power Plants (VPPs) in Illinois, aiming to increase renewable energy adoption.
The bill is expected to have a positive impact on reducing carbon emissions in the state, contributing to a more sustainable energy future.
The signing of this bill marks a significant step towards promoting clean energy and reducing reliance on fossil fuels in Illinois.

articles.title: This $4,500 Conductive Suit Could Make Power-Line Work Safer
articles.summary: A recent incident involving a line worker who died from an electrical shock highlights the need for safer working conditions. A new conductive suit, priced at $4,500, aims to provide protection against unexpected currents by providing an alternative path for electricity to flow through the body.
key_takeaways: The conductive suit is designed to prevent induction shocks, which occur when an electric or magnetic field causes current to flow through equipment whose intended power supply has been cut off.
Induction shocks can be fatal, as seen in the case of Justin Kropp, a 32-year-old line worker who died after being electrocuted by a rogue current that shot through his body and platform.
The conductive suit is made by Budapest-based Electrostatics and offers an alternative solution to traditional safety practices that rely on grounding all conductive objects in a work zone.

articles.title: Nuclear Waste Disposal Group Completes DOE-Funded Research Project
articles.summary: Deep Isolation Nuclear, a company specializing in nuclear waste disposal technology, has successfully completed a two-year research project funded by the US Department of Energy's Advanced Research Projects Agency–Energy (ARPA-E). The project aimed to develop advanced nuclear waste disposal technologies. The completion of Project SAVANT marks an important milestone for the company and the nuclear industry.
key_takeaways: Deep Isolation Nuclear has completed a two-year research project called Project SAVANT, which aimed to advance nuclear waste disposal technologies.
The project was funded by the US Department of Energy's ARPA-E, indicating significant government support for innovative nuclear waste management solutions.
The successful completion of Project SAVANT marks an important milestone for Deep Isolation Nuclear and could have implications for the future of nuclear waste disposal in the industry.

articles.title: Subaru’s US factory is now exporting clean power to itself
articles.summary: Subaru of Indiana Automotive has installed rooftop solar panels on its factory, which are generating more clean energy than the facility's new expansion needs. This move showcases the company's commitment to renewable energy and reduces its reliance on fossil fuels. The factory's export of clean power highlights innovative solutions for reducing energy costs and environmental impact.
key_takeaways: Subaru's US factory is producing far more clean electricity than it requires, with the rooftop solar panels generating an excess amount of energy.
This initiative demonstrates the company's efforts to reduce its carbon footprint and adopt sustainable practices in its manufacturing operations.
The export of clean power from the factory suggests that innovative solutions like this can help companies offset their energy costs and contribute to a more sustainable future.

articles.title: SolarMax Technologies to deploy three utility-scale BESS projects in Texas, Puerto Rico
articles.summary: SolarMax Technologies plans to deploy three large-scale battery energy storage systems (BESS) projects in Texas and Puerto Rico, totaling 400 MW/1 GWh. This move indicates a strategic shift towards larger commercial installations as regulatory and policy changes drive the adoption of BESS technology. The deployment is expected to advance the transition to cleaner energy sources.
key_takeaways: SolarMax Technologies will deploy three utility-scale BESS projects in Texas and Puerto Rico, representing a significant increase in large-scale commercial installations.
The total capacity of the deployments amounts to 400 MW/1 GWh, indicating a substantial investment in battery energy storage systems.
The deployment is driven by regulatory and policy changes, suggesting that the company is responding to market signals and shifting towards larger-scale projects.

articles.title: Kutch Green Hydrogen Park: Deendayal Port’s Leap into Clean Energy
articles.summary: The Deendayal Port Authority has partnered with Green-Kutch NextGen to establish the Kutch Green Hydrogen Park, a landmark project that aims to transform India's ports into hubs for green hydrogen production. Located in Gujarat, the park will leverage the region's strong solar and wind resources, along with a state-of-the-art battery energy storage system, to power giant electrolyzers and produce green hydrogen. This initiative is part of the National Green Hydrogen Mission and the wider Green Hydrogen India drive.
key_takeaways: The Kutch district in Gujarat is an ideal location for green hydrogen production due to its strong solar and wind resources, with a 30 GW hybrid renewable energy park already operational.
The Deendayal Port Authority has partnered with Green-Kutch NextGen to establish the Kutch Green Hydrogen Park, which will utilize the port's existing infrastructure to produce green hydrogen.
The project aligns with India's National Green Hydrogen Mission and the wider Green Hydrogen India drive, aiming to make Kutch and Jamnagar major centers of green hydrogen production.

articles.title: US withdraws from IRENA
articles.summary: The United States has announced its withdrawal from the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA), citing concerns over redundancy, mismanagement, and a threat to national sovereignty. The move is part of a broader executive order by President Trump, which also affects other international organizations focused on climate change, labor, and migration. Despite this decision, IRENA Director-General Francesco La Camera has expressed regret while maintaining that the door for continued cooperation remains open.
key_takeaways: The United States has withdrawn its membership from the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA) due to concerns over the agency's relevance, management, and potential impact on national interests.
This move is part of a broader executive order by President Trump affecting various international organizations focused on climate change, labor, and migration.
Despite the withdrawal, IRENA Director-General Francesco La Camera has emphasized that the door for continued cooperation remains open, suggesting potential future engagement or collaboration.

articles.title: Another record-breaking year for UK battery storage as 4GWh comes online
articles.summary: The UK battery storage market saw a significant growth in 2025, with the grid-scale capacity increasing by 45% and reaching 12.9GWh. This growth is attributed to the addition of new battery storage projects, including a notable 4GWh installation. The expansion of battery storage will likely contribute to the overall energy mix and help meet future renewable energy targets.
key_takeaways: The UK grid-scale battery storage market saw a significant growth of 45% in 2025, with a total operational capacity of 12.9GWh.
The addition of new battery storage projects, including a 4GWh installation, played a key role in this growth.
This expansion is likely to contribute to the overall energy mix and support future renewable energy targets in the UK.

articles.title: South Australia leads AU$14,271/MW battery storage revenue surge in NEM’s first week of 2026
articles.summary: South Australia has led the way in battery storage revenue, with AU$14,271/MW in revenue during the first week of 2026, according to data from Aurora Energy Research. This growth is part of a larger trend in the energy sector, as more companies invest in renewable energy and energy storage solutions. The data provides insight into the performance of battery storage systems across Australia's National Electricity Market (NEM).
key_takeaways: South Australia has seen a significant surge in battery storage revenue, with AU$14,271/MW generated during the first week of 2026.
This growth is part of a larger trend in the energy sector, as more companies invest in renewable energy and energy storage solutions.
The data highlights the importance of battery storage systems in stabilizing the grid and providing reliable energy supply.

articles.title: Finally, New England’s clean-energy transmission line is ready to go
articles.summary: The New England Clean Energy Connect transmission line, a 145-mile project that aims to bring clean electrons from Canada to Massachusetts, is finally ready to start commercial operations. The project has been nearly a decade in the making and marks a significant step towards reducing carbon emissions in the region. The line will enable the transmission of 1.2 gigawatts of carbon-free hydropower into Massachusetts.
key_takeaways: The New England Clean Energy Connect transmission line is set to begin commercial operations on Friday, marking a major milestone in the transition to clean energy for Massachusetts.
The project has been nearly a decade in the making and represents a significant investment in reducing carbon emissions in the region.
The line will enable the transmission of 1.2 gigawatts of carbon-free hydropower into Massachusetts, contributing to the state's efforts to meet its renewable portfolio standards.

articles.title: Fortum deepens cooperation with Steady Energy
articles.summary: Finnish utility Fortum has signed a framework agreement with Steady Energy, a small modular reactor developer, to support the planning of Steady Energy's district heating reactor's operation and maintenance model. As part of the agreement, Fortum will also invest in Steady Energy. This cooperation aims to promote the development and deployment of small modular reactors for energy production.
key_takeaways: Fortum is supporting Steady Energy's planning efforts for its district heating reactor's operation and maintenance model.
The agreement includes an investment by Fortum in Steady Energy, indicating a partnership between the two companies.
This cooperation may contribute to the growth of small modular reactors as an energy production option.

articles.title: Senate bill exempts fully isolated large loads from FERC, DOE regulation
articles.summary: A Senate bill aims to exempt fully isolated large loads, such as data centers and energy-intensive sectors, from regulation by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) and the US Department of Energy. This exemption is likely to benefit developers of these facilities but may face opposition from utilities concerned about revenue implications. The bill's impact on the industry is expected to be significant.
key_takeaways: The proposed Senate bill would exempt fully isolated large loads from FERC and DOE regulation, potentially benefiting energy-intensive sectors such as data centers.
Utilities might oppose the bill due to concerns about lost revenue, with one industry expert describing it as a "threat" to their business.
The exemption could make developers of these facilities more confident in their projects, with the expert calling the bill "good for the public" and "extremely confident developers."

articles.title: Vietnam proposes increase to surplus power sale from rooftop solar
articles.summary: Vietnam's Ministry of Industry and Trade is proposing to increase the percentage of surplus power that rooftop solar owners can sell back to the grid from 20% to 50%. This move aims to encourage the development of rooftop solar through 2030, in line with the country's national development plan. The proposal also includes provisions for selling excess energy to public buildings and exempting areas not yet connected to the national grid.
key_takeaways: Vietnam is proposing to increase the percentage of surplus power that rooftop solar owners can sell back to the grid from 20% to 50%, aiming to boost the development of rooftop solar.
The proposal includes a purchase price for excess energy based on the average electricity price from the previous year, but with a ceiling rate cap for ground-mounted solar.

Excess electricity could be sold to public buildings, including government offices, hospitals, and schools, and in some areas not yet connected to the national grid, the surplus sale cap may be removed altogether.

articles.title: Hydrogen Fuel Cells, SMRs and Gas Turbines Power Doosan’s AI Data Center Strategy
articles.summary: Doosan Group has unveiled its AI data center strategy, which utilizes a combination of hydrogen fuel cells, small modular reactors (SMRs), and gas turbines to provide reliable and lower-emission power. The company aims to cater to the growing energy demands of cloud operators and data centers, with plans to partner with suppliers across North America and Europe. Doosan's innovative approach brings together different energy technologies under one roof.
key_takeaways: Doosan is developing a one-stop shop for energy solutions for data centers, offering gigawatt-scale turbines, portable fuel cell technology units, and SMRs to cater to the growing demand for reliable and sustainable power.

The company's strategy aims to provide lower-emission power, as data centers are expected to consume nearly 12% of US electricity by 2030, with real-time and latency-sensitive workloads requiring efficient energy solutions.

Doosan is building partnerships across North America and Europe to secure supply deals and expand its offerings, positioning itself as a leader in the development of innovative energy technologies for data centers.

articles.title: Strengthening food and energy resilience with agri-PV
articles.summary: The article discusses a pioneering agrivoltaic pilot project in Fujairah, UAE, which integrates solar panels above native plants to improve soil health, boost crop resilience, and optimize land use. This approach aims to tackle the challenges of producing food, water, and electricity in arid regions like the UAE. The project combines PV system modeling, agronomic monitoring, and microclimate analysis to test the technical feasibility and environmental impact of this innovative solution.
key_takeaways: Agrivoltaics can be a scalable approach to address energy, food, and water challenges in desert regions with high solar irradiation levels.
The pilot project in Fujairah demonstrated the potential of integrating solar panels above crops to improve soil health and boost crop resilience.
The project's use of a reinforced ground-mount structure reduced costs while maintaining scalability, making agrivoltaics a more viable option for large-scale renewable energy production.

articles.title: Batteries ‘the only technology’ that can keep pace with AI data centre power fluctuations
articles.summary: The article suggests that battery storage is the most suitable technology to handle the power fluctuations caused by AI training loads at data centers. This is because batteries can provide a stable and flexible power supply, which is essential for maintaining the performance of AI systems. The article implies that other technologies may struggle to keep pace with the dynamic nature of AI workloads.
key_takeaways: Battery storage is the only technology that can effectively handle the power fluctuations created by AI training loads at data centers.
Other power supply technologies, such as traditional grid connections or alternative energy sources, may not be able to provide the necessary stability and flexibility for AI systems.
The ability of battery storage to mitigate these fluctuations makes it an essential component in the design of modern data centers.

articles.title: Cyprus solar curtailment hits 47% in 2025
articles.summary: The article reports that Cyprus wasted nearly half of its distributed renewable energy in 2025, equivalent to 306 GWh, due to grid constraints and lack of battery storage. This resulted in a curtailment rate of 47.44% for solar and biogas energy generation. The high curtailment rate is attributed to the growing solar capacity and limited grid infrastructure.
key_takeaways: Cyprus wasted 47.44% of its renewable energy generation in 2025, with 306 GWh of energy being curtailed, equivalent to the annual needs of over 51,000 households.
The highest monthly curtailment occurred in March, with a record 38,155 MWh, and average monthly cuts nearly doubled from 13,916 MWh in 2024 to 25,513 MWh in 2025.
Residential PV accounted for 10% of the curtailed energy in 2025, highlighting the impact on households and small prosumers, and raising concerns around fairness and consumer expectations.

articles.title: Grid-forming inverters boost grid stability, say US researchers
articles.summary: Researchers at the National Laboratory of the Rockies analyzed an incident on Kauaʻi Island where a grid-forming inverter was deployed to stabilize the grid. The study found that the batteries provided a fast frequency response, but there were frequency oscillations due to the limited functionality of the inverters used at the solar-plus-storage plants. The analysis highlights the importance of grid-forming inverters in enhancing grid stability.
key_takeaways: Grid-forming inverters can provide a fast frequency response and help contain frequency declines within seconds, but may not completely eliminate oscillations if the underlying issue persists.
The limited functionality of traditional grid-following inverters can lead to problems like frequency oscillations, highlighting the need for upgraded inverters in grid stability applications.
Researchers used the Kauaʻi Island Utility Cooperative as a test case to diagnose grid issues and demonstrate the benefits of grid-forming inverters in stabilizing grids.

articles.title: Australia adds 7 GW of renewables in 2025, stays on track for 2030 target
articles.summary: Australia has made significant progress in its renewable energy transition, with renewables supplying almost half of the country's power in the final quarter of 2025. The addition of 7 GW of new renewable capacity brings the nation closer to its goal of achieving 82% renewable electricity generation by 2030. This milestone is seen as a major step towards Australia becoming a "renewable energy superpower".
key_takeaways: Renewables supplied 49.9% of electricity generated across the National Electricity Market (NEM) in the final quarter of 2025, exceeding the 50% mark for the first time.
The Clean Energy Regulator estimates that close to 7 GW of new renewable capacity was added to Australia's grid in 2025, building on a record 7.5 GW added in 2024.

Australia is on track to meet its goal of achieving 82% renewable electricity generation by 2030, with the country now supplying over 50% of its power from renewables in Western Australia's South West Interconnected System (SWIS).

articles.title: Adani Green unit to supply solar-wind power to Asahi India Glass
articles.summary: Adani Green Energy, a subsidiary of Adani Green Energy Ltd., has signed agreements to supply 20.8 MW of hybrid solar and wind power to Asahi India Glass from its Khavda project in Gujarat, India. The electricity will be sourced from a 25 MW solar power plant unit and a 20.8 MW wind power plant unit. This partnership aims to reduce Asahi's reliance on non-renewable energy sources.
key_takeaways: Adani Green Energy is supplying 20.8 MW of hybrid solar and wind power to Asahi India Glass, sourced from its Khavda project in Gujarat.
The electricity will be generated from a combination of 25 MW solar power plant units and 20.8 MW wind power plant units at the Khavda site.
Asahi India Glass has subscribed to at least 26% of the proportionate equity share capital of the renewable energy project, demonstrating its commitment to investing in clean energy.

articles.title: Ola Electric unveils first fully made-in-India residential battery storage system
articles.summary: Ola Electric has launched Ola Shakti, India's first fully made-in-India residential battery energy storage system (BESS), from its gigafactory in Tamil Nadu. The system is powered by indigenous 4680 Bharat Cells and offers a portable, on-demand energy solution for households, farms, and businesses. This marks Ola Electric's entry into the residential BESS market and expansion beyond the automotive domain.
key_takeaways: First fully made-in-India residential BESS: Ola Shakti is India's first residential battery energy storage system to be fully designed, engineered, and manufactured domestically.

Indigenous technology: The system is powered by Ola Electric's indigenous 4680 Bharat Cells, demonstrating the company's commitment to domestic manufacturing and reducing dependence on imported technologies.

Portable and efficient solution: Ola Shakti offers a portable, on-demand energy solution with automotive-grade safety, high efficiency, and zero running and maintenance costs, making it an attractive option for households, farms, and businesses.

articles.title: Anker Solix launches new E10 whole home backup system in US, offers ‘one-stop’ service to bypass installers
articles.summary: Anker Solix has launched its new E10 whole home backup system in the US, which offers a "one-stop" service to bypass traditional installers. The E10 is a hybrid solution that combines battery, solar, and a DC generator to provide power directly to consumers. This innovative approach aims to make home energy storage more accessible and convenient for homeowners.
key_takeaways: Anker Solix's E10 whole home backup system is a "smart hybrid" product that can handle charging from solar, the grid, or a generator, providing infinite backup power.
The system features a smart gas generator with multi-fuel capabilities (gas, propane, and natural gas), which adds safety and efficiency to its operation.
With its ability to handle 99% of typical US outages, scenarios, and conditions, the E10 is designed to provide reliable energy storage for homeowners.

articles.title: Horizon Power seeks federal approval for 239MWh solar-plus-storage site in Western Australia
articles.summary: Horizon Power is seeking federal approval for a large-scale solar-plus-storage project in Broome, Western Australia. The proposed site would feature a 239MWh battery energy storage system, making it one of the largest BESS projects in the country. If approved, the facility would contribute to the region's renewable energy goals and provide a reliable source of power.
key_takeaways: Horizon Power is planning a significant solar-plus-storage project in Broome, Western Australia, with a capacity of 239MWh.
The proposed project involves a battery energy storage system (BESS) that would contribute to the region's renewable energy goals and provide a reliable source of power.
The facility's size suggests it could play a substantial role in supporting the grid and reducing reliance on fossil fuels in Western Australia.

articles.title: BPA Tx Planning Overhaul Prompts Concern for Northwest Clean Energy Compliance
articles.summary: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) is overhauling its transmission planning processes as part of the Grid Access Transformation project, which includes a two-part approach to address a surge in transmission service requests. The agency's proposal aims to reform its existing transmission processes to prioritize proactive planning, but some stakeholders are concerned that this could push study timelines to meet Washington and Oregon's clean energy targets. BPA is working on a transitional phase to identify customers eligible for transmission service awards while continuing to plan for a longer-term "future state".
key_takeaways: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) is experiencing a surge in transmission service requests, with 61 GW of new generation added to the most recent transmission study, compared to 5.9 GW in 2021.

BPA's proposal includes a two-part approach: a transitional phase to get off the pause and a longer-term "future state" that aims to shift towards proactive transmission planning to forecast transmission needs and prepare the system ahead of time.

The transition analysis process may be affected by the size of the queue, with stakeholders concerned that the agency's customers could run afoul of Washington and Oregon's clean energy targets if the study timelines are pushed too far.

articles.title: NanoCockpit: Performance-optimized Application Framework for AI-based Autonomous Nanorobotics
articles.summary:
Here is the analysis:

  The NanoCockpit framework aims to optimize performance and reduce latency in AI-based autonomous nanorobotics by providing a simplified yet efficient software layer for multi-core processing, image acquisition, data exchange, and Wi-Fi streaming. This is achieved through coroutine-based multi-tasking, resulting in improved control performances and reduced overhead. The framework has shown promising results in real-world TinyML nanorobotics applications.
key_takeaways: The NanoCockpit framework addresses the limitation of underutilized resources on resource-limited embedded systems used in autonomous nano-drones.
The framework achieves ideal end-to-end latency and delivers quantifiable improvements in closed-loop control performance through coroutine-based multi-tasking.
The framework has shown significant improvements in mission success rate, increasing from 40% to 100%, and reducing mean position error by 30%.

articles.title: Studying the Role of Synthetic Data for Machine Learning-based Wireless Networks Traffic Forecasting
articles.summary: This article proposes a novel method for generating synthetic data to improve machine learning-based wireless networks traffic forecasting. The approach uses first-order auto-regressive noise statistics and produces statistically rich traffic patterns that mimic real Access Point behavior, requiring minimal real data inputs while achieving comparable accuracy to real-data-trained models.
key_takeaways: Synthetic data generation can be used to augment and enrich datasets for machine learning-based wireless networks traffic forecasting, offering a cost-effective solution with privacy-friendly benefits.

The proposed method achieves statistically rich traffic patterns that effectively mimic real Access Point behavior, resulting in comparable accuracy to real-data-trained models when trained on the same APs.

Synthetic data-trained models can improve prediction accuracy by up to 50 percent compared to real-data-trained baselines when generalization is required, thanks to the enhanced variability and diversity of the generated traces.

articles.title: Examining the Effectiveness of Transformer-Based Smart Contract Vulnerability Scan
articles.summary: The article presents a vulnerability scan for Ethereum smart contracts using transformer-based methods, proposing VASCOT as a more efficient approach. It evaluates VASCOT's detection efficacy against state-of-the-art models and provides insights into their strengths and limitations.
key_takeaways: The authors proposed VASCOT, a deep learning-based approach for scanning vulnerabilities in Ethereum smart contracts, which performs sequential analysis of bytecode using transformers.

A dataset of 16,469 verified Ethereum contracts was used to evaluate the performance of VASCOT, as well as a state-of-the-art LSTM-based vulnerability detection model, providing insights into their detection capabilities and generalizability.

The study highlights the strengths and limitations of each model, suggesting that transformer-based methods may offer improved efficiency and effectiveness in detecting vulnerabilities in smart contracts.

articles.title: Clipped Affine Policy: Low-Complexity Near-Optimal Online Power Control for Energy Harvesting Communications over Fading Channels
articles.summary: This paper proposes low-complexity online power control policies for energy harvesting communications over wireless fading channels. The approach leverages a relative-value approximation and derived clipped affine policies, which are shown to achieve a good balance between computational complexity and optimality. The proposed methods outperform existing approaches across various scenarios.
key_takeaways: The paper introduces two fundamental power control policies: optimistic and robust clipped affine policies, both based on a clipped affine function of battery level and channel signal-to-noise ratio coefficient.
The proposed approach uses a domain-knowledge-enhanced reinforcement learning algorithm to achieve online power control with reduced computational complexity.

The robust clipped affine policy, combined with the RL algorithm using at most five parameters, outperforms existing approaches across various scenarios with less than 2% performance loss relative to the optimal policy.

articles.title: Energy-efficient torque allocation for straight-line driving of electric vehicles based on pseudoconvex polynomials
articles.summary: The article discusses an approach to minimizing battery energy consumption in electric vehicles with multiple motors by optimizing torque allocation. The proposed method uses pseudoconvex polynomials to approximate electric motor losses, ensuring a well-behaved optimization landscape and robustness against noisy data. The technique is evaluated on several certification driving cycles, showing a modest influence on electric energy consumption.
key_takeaways: The article proposes an approach to optimizing torque allocation in electric vehicles using higher-order polynomials to approximate electric motor losses.
The method incorporates sum of squares programming constraints to ensure monotonicity and positivity, providing robustness against noisy or sparse data.
The proposed technique enables real-time optimization and integration with other vehicle control systems, showing a modest influence on electric energy consumption.

articles.title: Stochastic Power-Water Coordination: Unlocking Flexibility in Hybrid RO Desalination Plants via Variable-Speed Pumps and Tank Mixing
articles.summary: This article proposes a coordinated operation framework for power systems and water desalination plants (DPs) to unlock flexibility in hybrid RO desalination plants. By proactively managing freshwater storage and tank salinity, the operational flexibility of DPs is significantly enhanced, leading to potential energy savings. The proposed approach uses a detailed DP model and a tractable mixed-integer linear programming model to efficiently address uncertainties.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a coordinated operation framework for power systems and water desalination plants (DPs) to unlock flexibility in hybrid RO desalination plants.
The framework, which incorporates variable-speed pumps and tank mixing, aims to significantly enhance the operational flexibility of DPs by proactively managing freshwater storage and tank salinity.
The proposed approach has been validated through case studies, demonstrating up to a 6% operating cost reduction.

articles.title: Why America’s Nuclear Future Depends on its Fuel Supply Chain
articles.summary: The article highlights the importance of a robust nuclear fuel supply chain for America's future in civilian nuclear energy, as the country seeks to regain its global leadership in this field. The US has traditionally set the standard for nuclear innovation and safety practices worldwide, but concerns over climate change, energy security, and industrial competitiveness have raised alarm about the state of its nuclear fuel supply chain. This challenges the country's ability to maintain its position as a leader in civilian nuclear energy.
key_takeaways: The erosion of America's nuclear fuel supply chain poses a significant challenge to its future in civilian nuclear energy.
The US needs to strengthen its nuclear fuel supply chain to regain its leadership in reactor design, safety culture, and regulatory practice worldwide.

The article implies that the current state of the nuclear fuel supply chain is quiet but consequential, suggesting that it may not be receiving sufficient attention or investment from policymakers and industry stakeholders.

articles.title: Federal Policy Makers Can’t Stop The Demand For Solar Power
articles.summary: The article states that despite a recent shift in federal energy policy, the demand for solar power in the US remains strong due to its economic benefits. Solar investors continue to invest in the US market, indicating a steady interest in renewable energy sources. This trend suggests that solar power is becoming increasingly attractive as an option for powering the nation's grid.
key_takeaways: The demand for solar power in the US persists despite changes in federal energy policy.
Solar power is considered the fastest and most economical way to add more kilowatts to the nation's grid, driving investment from solar investors.
The economic benefits of solar power make it an attractive option for powering the US grid.

articles.title: Iberdrola Group Energizes Massive Transmission Line Project in Brazil
articles.summary: The Iberdrola Group has completed and energized a massive transmission line project in Brazil, known as the Alto Paranaíba Project. The 1,600-kilometer transmission line features 3,250 towers and six substations along its route, making it one of the largest transmission projects in Brazil. This project is Iberdrola's largest transmission project in Brazil and a significant electricity delivery initiative.
key_takeaways: The Alto Paranaíba Project is Iberdrola's largest transmission project in Brazil, covering a distance of 1,600 kilometers.
The project features 3,250 towers and six substations along its route, indicating the scale of the infrastructure involved.
The completion of this project marks an important milestone for electricity delivery in Brazil, contributing to the country's energy infrastructure development.

articles.title: AlphaESS launches modular energy storage system for small C&I users
articles.summary: AlphaESS has launched a modular energy storage system, StaX-M29.9/M50, designed for small commercial and industrial users with power ratings of 29.9 kW and 50 kW. The system is aimed at businesses seeking flexible energy storage solutions without the complexity of installation. It features a stackable, plug-and-play architecture and incremental expansion capabilities.
key_takeaways: The StaX-M29.9/M50 modular energy storage system has power ratings of 29.9 kW and 50 kW with scalable capacity up to 216.9 kWh.
The system features a stackable, plug-and-play architecture and incremental expansion capabilities, allowing users to expand capacity as their energy needs grow.
Each module comes with an integrated battery management system (BMS) that features automatic dynamic cell balancing for enhanced efficiency and extended battery life.

articles.title: Researchers Beam Power From a Moving Airplane
articles.summary: Researchers at Overview Energy successfully beamed power from a moving airplane in a test flight, marking the first time this has been achieved. The demonstration is part of a larger goal to develop space-based solar power, where satellites collect energy in geosynchronous orbit and beam it back to Earth as near-infrared waves. This technology has been years in development and is gaining momentum with recent advancements.
key_takeaways: Researchers have successfully beamed power from a moving airplane, marking a significant achievement in the field of wireless power transmission.
The demonstration is part of a larger goal to develop space-based solar power, which aims to collect energy in geosynchronous orbit and beam it back to Earth as near-infrared waves.

This technology has been years in development, with recent advancements, including demonstrations by Caltech's Space Solar Power Project using microwaves and DARPA setting a record for wirelessly transmitting optical signals.

articles.title: World-first 560C Carnot battery unveiled as SPIC launches ultra-high-temperature heat storage
articles.summary: SPIC, a Chinese state-owned power group, has launched the world's first ultra-high-temperature heat-pump energy storage system, called "Chuno," which is based on a Carnot battery concept. The 1 MW/4 MWh pilot system has completed seven full charge-discharge cycles and met or exceeded design targets. This technology provides an alternative to conventional lithium-ion batteries and compressed air energy storage.
key_takeaways: SPIC's Chuno technology uses a heat-pump cycle and heat-engine cycle to convert electricity into stored heat and cold, providing a long-duration energy storage solution.
The 1 MW/4 MWh pilot system has demonstrated stability and met design targets through seven full charge-discharge cycles under third-party testing.

This ultra-high-temperature heat storage technology offers an alternative to conventional lithium-ion batteries and compressed air energy storage systems for long-duration energy storage applications.

articles.title: Nuclear at heart of Kazakh plans says president
articles.summary: Kazakhstan's President has stated that nuclear energy is a key component of the country's strategic plans to become a "digital power". This emphasis on nuclear energy highlights the nation's commitment to this sector. The partnership with the USA further solidifies Kazakhstan's position in the global nuclear industry.
key_takeaways: Kazakhstan's President prioritizes nuclear energy as part of the country's digital transformation efforts.
The announcement of an SMR (Small Modular Reactor) feasibility study between the USA and Kazakhstan signals a potential expansion of their civil nuclear energy partnership.
This development suggests that nuclear power is likely to play a significant role in Kazakhstan's energy landscape as it transitions towards becoming a "digital power".

articles.title: Nordic Power-to-Liquid Project to Produce Synthetic Aviation Fuel in Finland’s Tornio
articles.summary: The Nordic Power-to-Liquid Project aims to produce synthetic aviation fuel in Finland's Tornio, utilizing renewable electricity and steel-mill exhaust to create green hydrogen and CO₂ side streams. The €1.2-1.5 billion facility is expected to produce approximately 100,000 tonnes of synthetic aviation fuel per year. This project represents a significant step towards clean jet fuel production.
key_takeaways: The Power-to-Liquid facility will utilize excess hydro- and wind-power from the Nordic grid to split water into green hydrogen and oxygen.
CO₂ emissions from Outokumpu's stainless-steel mill will be captured, cleaned up, and mixed with green hydrogen to produce synthetic crudes for conversion into drop-in sustainable aviation fuel.
The project is a collaboration between Norsk e-Fuel and Outokumpu, with Norsk e-Fuel bringing expertise in large-scale Power-to-Liquid projects and CO₂ utilization.
The facility has the potential to reduce direct CO₂ emissions by approximately 200,000 tonnes annually.

articles.title: Hydrogen Fuel Cells Power €1.5M Off-Grid CCTV Deal in Central Europe
articles.summary: SFC Energy AG and Linc Polska have partnered to deploy EFOY Pro 2800 direct methanol fuel cells for off-grid CCTV systems in Central Europe, aiming to reduce noise pollution and emissions. The €1.5 million framework deal will see the rollout of mobile CCTV trailers and autonomous surveillance setups across Germany, Poland, and select Central European markets. This partnership represents a shift towards quieter, cleaner operations powered by sustainable energy.
key_takeaways: SFC Energy AG and Linc Polska are deploying EFOY Pro 2800 direct methanol fuel cells for off-grid CCTV systems in Central Europe.
The €1.5 million framework deal aims to reduce noise pollution and emissions from traditional diesel generators.
The partnership represents a shift towards sustainable energy solutions, such as hydrogen fuel cells and zero-emission technology, in the security infrastructure sector.

articles.title: Hydrogen production firm Plug Power faces financial headwinds as key shareholder vote looms
articles.summary: Plug Power Inc., a hydrogen production firm, is facing financial headwinds due to cash burn outpacing revenue growth. The company's stock is at a 52-week low, and a key shareholder vote is looming, which could impact its ability to secure fresh capital and expand its operations. If investors reject the proposed equity compensation plan changes, Plug Power may struggle to keep up with project timelines.
key_takeaways: Plug Power Inc.'s cash burn is outpacing revenue growth, putting pressure on the company's financial health.
A pivotal shareholder vote is expected to authorize changes to the company's equity compensation plans and increase its share count, which could provide a lifeline for the struggling firm.
The company's stock has dropped to a 52-week low of around $0.69, indicating a lack of confidence among investors in Plug Power's ability to turn its business around.
Research firm TD Cowen recently downgraded its price target on Plug Power due to operational headwinds and cash burn issues, further exacerbating the company's financial challenges.

articles.title: Clean energy will take center stage in Virginia’s legislature this year
articles.summary:
The article reports that clean energy is expected to play a crucial role in Virginia's upcoming legislative session, driven by concerns over rising electricity prices and the growth of data centers. Democrats, who won a governing trifecta last year, are likely to focus on promoting clean energy as a key strategy. This shift is seen as a response to voters' worries about high electricity costs.

KEY TAKEAWAYs:
• Clean energy is emerging as a top priority in Virginia's legislature due to growing concerns over rising electricity prices.
• The proliferation of data centers in the state has contributed to increased demand for electricity, fueling calls for more sustainable and renewable energy sources.
• Democrats' focus on clean energy is seen as an attempt to address voters' concerns about high electricity costs and promote a more environmentally friendly policy agenda.

articles.title: Evotrex says its new RV concept makes its own power – here’s how it works
articles.summary: Evotrex, a startup backed by Anker, has unveiled its new RV concept called PG5, which is claimed to generate its own power. The trailer uses advanced technology to convert waste energy into usable electricity, enabling extended off-grid operation without sacrificing comfort. The company's goal is to provide glampers with the freedom to explore while maintaining their electrified lifestyle.
key_takeaways: Evotrex's PG5 RV concept utilizes advanced technology to convert waste energy into usable electricity.
The trailer can operate for an extended period on a single charge, providing users with more flexibility and independence during outdoor adventures.
By harnessing waste energy, the system reduces the need for external power sources, making it an attractive option for those who value off-grid living and sustainable practices.

articles.title: Meghan Dewey helps define a human-centric utility at Duke Energy
articles.summary: Meghan Dewey is a key figure at Duke Energy, bridging the gap between corporate scale and human-centric innovation to design utilities for short-term and long-term operations. Her team's work spans multiple areas, including Emerging Technology Office and customer prototype labs, with a focus on transportation electrification. The goal of her efforts is to shape the future of utilities that prioritize human needs.
key_takeaways: Meghan Dewey's role at Duke Energy involves designing a blueprint for how utilities can operate in both the short and long term, emphasizing human-centric innovation.
Her team's work encompasses various areas, including transportation electrification, with the aim of creating a more sustainable future for utilities.
By combining corporate scale with human-centered approach, Meghan Dewey's efforts may help redefine what it means for a utility to operate in harmony with its customers' needs.

articles.title: Masdar bags PPA for 150 MW of solar in Angola
articles.summary: Masdar, an Abu Dhabi-based developer, has signed a power purchase agreement (PPA) with Angola's state-owned transmission company RNT-EP to develop a 150 MW solar project in the Quipungo area of southern Angola. This marks Masdar's first PPA in Angola and is part of its larger Project Royal Sable, which aims to deploy 500 MW of solar across three sites to support the country's power grid. The project is expected to deliver electricity to around 300,000 homes.
key_takeaways: Masdar has signed its first power purchase agreement (PPA) in Angola, covering a 150 MW solar site as part of Project Royal Sable.
The Quipungo solar project will be located in the Huila province and is expected to deliver electricity to around 300,000 homes once completed.
This marks Masdar's entry into the African market, reflecting its commitment to developing bankable renewable energy infrastructure in emerging markets.

articles.title: Germany adds 6.57 GWh of battery storage in 2025, total hits 24 GWh
articles.summary: Germany has added 6.57 GWh of battery storage capacity in 2025, increasing the total installed capacity to around 24 GWh. This growth is driven by industrial and large-scale systems, with home storage installations declining due to weaker rooftop solar demand. The addition of new battery storage systems is expected to lift the total capacity to approximately 6.57 GWh.
key_takeaways: Germany's stationary battery storage capacity increased by about 8% year on year in 2025, reaching a total of roughly 24 GWh.
Industrial and large-scale battery storage systems drove growth, while home storage installations declined due to weaker rooftop solar demand.
The expansion of industrial storage segments shows steady growth, while the home storage segment experienced a decline of 6.4% compared to the previous year.

articles.title: Energy storage fleet mitigated 2TWh of renewables curtailment in Chile in 2025
articles.summary: The article reports that an energy storage fleet in Chile successfully mitigated a significant amount of renewable energy curtailment, specifically 2TWh, in 2025. This is part of the growing trend of increasing curtailment of solar PV and wind power in Chile due to various factors such as weather conditions and grid management. The article highlights the importance of energy storage in addressing these challenges.
key_takeaways: The energy storage fleet in Chile was able to mitigate 2TWh of renewables curtailment in 2025, demonstrating its effectiveness in stabilizing the grid.
The increasing trend of solar PV and wind power curtailment in Chile suggests that more energy storage solutions are needed to address these challenges.
The success of this energy storage fleet highlights the growing importance of energy storage as a key component in ensuring reliable and efficient renewable energy integration into the grid.

articles.title: Australian state’s utility-scale solar tops 1 TWh in December
articles.summary: In December 2025, New South Wales led Australia's utility-scale solar power generation, surpassing the 1 TWh mark for the first time. The state's clean energy assets produced a total of 1,678 GWh of renewable electricity, with utility PV and wind generating 1,052 GWh and 626 GWh, respectively. This milestone marked the highest month of renewable generation in the National Electricity Market.
key_takeaways: Australia's large-scale solar and wind assets generated a record 5,420 GWh of clean energy in December 2025, up 19% from the same period last year.
New South Wales (NSW) led the way for utility-scale solar power generation, producing 1,052 GWh of renewable electricity, which marked a first for Australia's energy market.
The highest month of renewable generation was achieved by NSW, accounting for 50.4% of total generation in the National Electricity Market and 53.9% in Western Australia's Wholesale Energy Market.

articles.title: Capex-driven strategies can reduce solar LCOE by 20%
articles.summary: A research group led by scientists from Qatar's Hamad Bin Khalifa University has conducted a literature review on capital expenditure-driven strategies to optimize the levelized cost of electricity (LCOE) in utility-scale photovoltaic (PV) systems. The study found that LCOE can be reduced by up to 20% through strategic optimization of system-level design, balance-of-systems, and digital tools. The research highlights the need for integrated research that considers financing, execution, and long-term asset performance.
key_takeaways: System-level optimization, smart balance-of-system (BOS) designs, and digital tools can reduce LCOE by up to 20% in utility-scale PV systems.
The next wave of PV research should focus on cost reduction areas such as tracking optimization, system voltage escalation, and advanced system design.
Yield-centric reliability metrics are necessary for utility-scale PV, which are 30-year assets, and are critical for financing, insurance, and bankability decisions.

articles.title: India’s SECI awards 1.2 GW of solar, 600 MW/3,600 MWh of storage at $0.035/kWh
articles.summary: The Solar Energy Corp. of India (SECI) has awarded a tender for 1.2 GW of interstate transmission system-connected solar projects paired with 600 MW/3,600 MWh of energy storage at a tariff of INR 3.12/kWh ($0.035). The largest allocation went to NLC India Renewables, securing 600 MW of solar capacity. SECI will act as an intermediary nodal agency, selling the contracted power to multiple buying entities across India.
key_takeaways: SECI has awarded a significant amount of renewable energy projects in India, with a total capacity of 1.2 GW of solar and 600 MW of energy storage.
The tariff for this tender is as low as INR 3.12/kWh ($0.035), indicating a competitive bid process and potentially lower costs for the developers.
The projects awarded through this tender will be structured on a build-own-operate basis, with 25-year power purchase agreements signed between SECI and the selected developers.

articles.title: Scatec secures PPA for Africa’s largest solar-plus-storage project
articles.summary: Scatec ASA has secured a 25-year power purchase agreement in Egypt for a 1.95 GW solar and 3.9 GWh battery energy storage project, marking the developer's largest investment to date. The combined capacity of the integrated solar-plus-storage system is expected to deliver 6 TWh of energy annually. This project represents the largest solar and BESS installation in Africa.
key_takeaways: Scatec has signed a 25-year power purchase agreement for a 1.95 GW solar and 3.9 GWh battery energy storage system in Egypt, representing its largest investment to date.
The combined capacity of the project is expected to deliver 6 TWh of energy annually, making it the largest solar and BESS installation in Africa.
Scatec will act as the lead developer for the project, providing engineering, procurement, construction, asset management, and operations and maintenance services.

articles.title: Fuel Cell Data Center Powers Wyoming’s AI Revolution
articles.summary: Project Jade Wyoming is a pioneering initiative that combines cutting-edge AI data hubs with on-site power plants, utilizing natural gas turbines and fuel cells, to create a sustainable energy infrastructure. The project aims to power the state's growing AI industry and has grown from an initial 1.8 GW capacity to a record-breaking 2.7 GW of behind-the-meter power generation. This innovative approach showcases a potential game-changer for the future of digital backbone and sustainable energy.
key_takeaways: Project Jade Wyoming is a significant step towards integrating sustainable energy with AI data hubs, setting a precedent for the nation's largest fuel cell data center campus.

The project partners with Tallgrass Energy to deploy behind-the-meter power generation using natural gas turbines and solid oxide fuel cells from Bloom Energy, marking a unique "bring-your-own-power" approach.

The initiative has grown in scale, increasing from an initial 1.8 GW capacity to 2.7 GW, which is nearly three times what Wyoming currently uses for electricity, highlighting the project's ambitious goals.

articles.title: HYENA POWER POD: Turning LPG into Clean Off-Grid Power in Africa
articles.summary: The HYENA POWER POD is a innovative solution that converts LPG into clean off-grid power in Africa, reducing particulates and CO₂ emissions by 15% compared to traditional diesel generators. The system uses an LPG-to-hydrogen process right on-site, which is then fed into a fuel cell power system, producing electricity while only emitting water and heat. This technology has the potential to transform energy solutions for off-grid communities in Africa.
key_takeaways: The HYENA POWER POD system converts LPG into hydrogen using a compact reforming unit, which is then used as fuel for a fuel cell power stack.
The system produces clean electricity with reduced particulates and CO₂ emissions by 15% compared to traditional diesel generators.
The technology has been developed in partnership with the University of Cape Town Catalysis Institute and HYENA Energy, with initial funding of $2 million raised to date.

articles.title: The biggest US solar-storage project yet takes shape in California
articles.summary: A massive solar-storage project in California's Central Valley is taking shape, aiming to provide a quarter of the state's clean energy needs by 2035. The project, led by the Westlands Water District, involves solar panels, battery storage, and integration with the power grid. This development marks an important step forward for the project.
key_takeaways: The project aims to provide a significant portion of California's clean energy needs, which could be a quarter of the state's total energy demand by 2035.
The project involves solar panels, battery storage, and integration with the power grid, indicating a comprehensive approach to renewable energy production and management.
The location in California's Central Valley highlights the importance of water-constrained regions in harnessing clean energy sources, such as solar power.

articles.title: Pacific Hydro commissions 293 MW of PV with 110 MW/220 MWh of storage in Chile
articles.summary: Pacific Hydro has successfully commissioned its 293 MW Desierto de Atacama solar project in Chile, which combines solar power with 110 MW/220 MWh of battery storage. The facility is expected to supply clean electricity to over 310,000 homes annually and represents an investment of around $300 million. The project, situated in the extreme conditions of the Atacama Desert, demonstrates Pacific Hydro's ability to overcome challenging environmental conditions.
key_takeaways: The Desierto de Atacama solar project combines 293 MWp of solar power with a 110 MW/220 MWh battery system, exceeding its originally proposed capacity of 120 MW.
The facility is expected to generate approximately 780 GWh annually, enough to power more than 310,000 homes, making it a significant contribution to Chile's renewable energy goals.

The project required specialized technical solutions and mobilized over 1,200 workers during construction, highlighting the challenges and investment required for large-scale solar projects in extreme environments.

articles.title: Croatia deploys 417 MW of solar in 2025
articles.summary: Croatia has made significant strides in solar energy deployment, with a record-breaking 417 MW of solar capacity commissioned in 2025. This growth is driven by commercial and industrial customers, which now account for around three-quarters of the country's installed solar capacity. With this pace of deployment continuing, Croatia's solar energy capacity is expected to surpass its wind energy capacity for the first time in early 2026.
key_takeaways: Croatia has exceeded its wind energy capacity with a record-breaking 417 MW of solar capacity commissioned in 2025, driven by growth in commercial and industrial customers.
The country's cumulative solar capacity has surpassed 1 GW, with around three-quarters of the installed capacity coming from commercial and industrial projects.
If current deployment pace continues, Croatia's solar energy capacity is expected to surpass its wind energy capacity for the first time in early 2026.

articles.title: Global solar enters period of adjustment, as market conditions redefine rules of competition
articles.summary: Global solar power systems are entering a period of adjustment, driven by market conditions that are redefining the rules of competition. Oversupply from China and India is leading to declining prices and shifting focus towards execution, policy alignment, and system integration. As a result, energy storage is becoming essential for project viability, particularly in major markets such as the US, Europe, and China.
key_takeaways: Global solar growth is flattening in major markets due to oversupply from China and India, leading to declining prices and shifting competition dynamics.
Energy storage is becoming crucial for project viability, making PV-plus-storage and strong EPC partnerships essential for winning projects in 2026 and beyond.
Major markets such as the US, Europe, and China are experiencing declines in solar installations, with global additions expected to stabilize or decline further in 2026 compared to previous years.

articles.title: US would reach 100% renewable energy by 2148 at current pace
articles.summary: The article reports on a study that predicts the United States could reach 100% renewable energy by 2148 if it maintains its current pace of adding 43 GW of renewables per year. In contrast, China is on track to achieve a fully renewable energy system by 2051, nearly a century earlier than the US. The study suggests that China's transition to renewable energy is happening at an encouraging rate.
key_takeaways: The United States could reach 100% renewable energy by 2148 if it maintains its current pace of adding 43 GW of renewables per year.
China is on track to achieve a fully renewable energy system by 2051, nearly a century earlier than the US, with an annual addition of 397 GW during the first 10 months of 2025.

Despite uncertainty about whether China will electrify all sectors by 2051, recent data suggest that the country is making progress in this area, including a high share of battery-electric vehicles sold in 2024 and a manufacturing base for electric heat pumps.

articles.title: Explicit Reward Mechanisms for Local Flexibility in Renewable Energy Communities
articles.summary: This article proposes an iterative resolution procedure for decentralized flexibility planning in Renewable Energy Communities, aiming to maximize local exchanges while addressing data privacy and fair benefits distribution concerns. The approach ensures individual optimality while converging towards a global optimum, validated through a 20-member domestic case study. By incentivizing flexible consumption of end-users, the system aims to maximize the value of local exchanges within Renewable Energy Communities.
key_takeaways: The proposed approach addresses the challenges of decentralized flexibility planning by allowing a community operator to request upward or downward flexibility from members, while ensuring individual optimality and convergence towards a global optimum.

The use of an iterative resolution procedure can help mitigate computational complexity and convexity challenges associated with state-of-the-art approaches for flexible resource planning in Renewable Energy Communities.

The system's effectiveness is validated through a 20-member domestic case study, which demonstrates that the decentralized approach achieves a collective bill gap of not more than 3.5% compared to centralized coordination schemes.

articles.title: LLM-DMD: Large Language Model-based Power System Dynamic Model Discovery
articles.summary: The article introduces a novel power system dynamic model discovery framework called LLM-DMD, which utilizes large language models to discover dynamic equations and enforce algebraic constraints. This framework addresses the limitations of traditional methods by integrating reasoning and code synthesis capabilities to improve model accuracy and fidelity. The proposed approach has been validated on synchronous generator benchmarks, demonstrating its superiority in complete dynamic model discovery.
key_takeaways: Current model structural discovery methods impose rigid priors on basis functions and variable sets, limiting the formulation of high-fidelity models required for precise simulation and analysis.
LLM-DMD integrates reasoning and code synthesis capabilities to discover dynamic equations and enforce algebraic constraints, addressing this limitation and improving model accuracy.

The framework consists of two sequential loops: a differential-equation loop that identifies state dynamics and associated variables, and an algebraic-equation loop that formulates algebraic constraints on identified algebraic variables.

articles.title: SIaD-Tool: A Comprehensive Frequency-Domain Tool for Small-Signal Stability and Interaction Assessment in Modern Power Systems
articles.summary: The article presents SIaD-Tool, an open-source frequency-domain scanning solution for stability and interaction assessment in modern power systems. The tool enables multi-sequence identification in various frames and supports different perturbation strategies, allowing for a comprehensive analysis of coupling effects and mirrored frequencies. SIaD-Tool has been validated through extensive case studies involving various types of power systems.
key_takeaways: SIaD-Tool offers an open-source frequency-domain scanning solution for stability and interaction assessment in modern power systems.
The tool enables multi-sequence identification in the abc, dq0, and 0pn frames, as well as supports both series voltage and parallel current perturbation strategies.

SIaD-Tool integrates automated stability evaluation through four standardized methods, including Generalized Nyquist Criterion (GNC), modal impedance analysis, phase margin assessment, and passivity checks.

articles.title: 400km Hydrogen Pipeline With No Users Will Raise Germany’s Electricity Prices
articles.summary: Germany has completed a 400km hydrogen pipeline segment, but with no meaningful suppliers or customers connected, it will likely raise the country's electricity prices. The project is technically ready, suggesting that infrastructure is in place, but the lack of users hinders its economic viability. articles.title: Exact Continuous Reformulations of Logic Constraints in Nonlinear Optimization and Optimal Control Problems
articles.summary: The article presents a new approach to reformulating logical constraints in nonlinear optimization and optimal control problems, allowing for the direct integration of discrete logic conditions into continuous models.
