The method is evaluated on two benchmark problems and shown to be more efficient than existing binary variable elimination techniques.
key_takeaways: The proposed approach enables the direct integration of discrete logic conditions into nonlinear programming models by reformulating logical constraints as binary-variable-free expressions.

The new approach is evaluated on two benchmark problems and shown to achieve optimal solutions more consistently and efficiently than existing binary variable elimination techniques.

articles.title: La Niña Ridge drives December solar gains across U.S. Southwest
articles.summary: The article reports that December's solar resource in the U.S. Southwest followed a classic La Niña pattern, with above-normal conditions and strong solar gains due to a persistent subtropical ridge. This blocking high forced storm systems away from the West Coast, resulting in suppressed irradiance in the Pacific Northwest and western Canada. The Southwest, Texas, and the Great Plains experienced dry subtropical air dominance.
key_takeaways: A subtropical ridge anchored over the Southwest acted as a blocking high, steering storm systems away from the U.S. West Coast and forcing the Pacific jet stream north into British Columbia and Alberta.
This led to suppressed irradiance in the Pacific Northwest and western Canada, with values 20-30% below normal due to frequent cloud cover and moisture-laden air.
The Southwest, Texas, and the Great Plains experienced above-normal solar gains and dry subtropical air dominance, driven by the blocking configuration.

key_takeaways: CAISO is proposing to remove projects that have requested to extend their commercial operation date (COD) beyond seven years from the original interconnection request.
The proposed change aims to "broaden the applicability of CVC" and apply it to all projects, including energy-only projects, rather than just those with transmission plan deliverability.

CAISO is looking to address the issue of stagnant projects in its interconnection queue, which has reached record volumes, and wants to encourage projects to advance toward commercial operations or withdraw from the queue.

articles.title: Illinois Gov. Pritzker Signs Storage and VPP Bill Aimed at Affordability
articles.summary: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker has signed the Clean and Reliable Grid Affordability Act, which aims to expand virtual power plants (VPPs) and energy storage in the state. The bill seeks to reduce power bills while promoting a clean energy vision, despite the federal government's abandonment of clean energy policies. The legislation requires significant investments in grid-scale battery storage and energy efficiency programs.
key_takeaways: The bill aims to save Illinois customers approximately $13.4 billion in savings over two decades through expanded energy storage and VPPs.
The legislation lifts a ban on building new nuclear facilities, allowing for the procurement of 3 GW of grid-scale battery storage by 2030.
The bill requires utilities to offer time-of-use pricing and expand standard energy efficiency programs, including new spending requirements for low-income customers.

articles.title: Campaign group protests giant solar projects in Portugal
articles.summary: A campaign group in Portugal, known as the Portuguese Platform for the Defence of the Tejo International Natural Park (PDPNTI), is protesting large-scale solar projects in Beira Baixa due to concerns over biodiversity loss, rural community decline, and economic harm. The campaign has garnered over 18,200 signatures on a public petition opposing the development of new solar power plants in the region. Despite acknowledging the need for renewable energy, the group prioritizes deploying solar on existing surfaces like rooftops and industrial areas instead.
key_takeaways: A public petition in Portugal has collected over 18,200 signatures to halt large-scale solar project developments in Beira Baixa due to environmental concerns.

The campaign argues that large-scale solar development leads to biodiversity loss, decline of rural communities, and economic harm, and advocates for prioritizing deployment on existing artificial surfaces.

A proposed 867 MW solar project in Castelo Branco, valued at €590 million, is under contention, with the Portuguese Environment Agency having approved or reviewed projects covering over 1,254 hectares of Beira Baixa.

articles.title: Environmental Groups Demand Georgia PSC Reconsider Data Center Energy Plan Overreach
articles.summary: Environmental groups in Georgia are pushing the Public Service Commission to reevaluate a plan by Georgia Power to build expensive gas plants, citing concerns over its impact on the environment and energy efficiency. The groups argue that the plan exceeds regulatory guidelines and may not be in the best interest of the state or its citizens. A motion has been filed to reconsider the proposal.
key_takeaways: Environmental groups in Georgia are demanding a reevaluation of a proposed gas plant project by Georgia Power, citing environmental concerns.
The Sierra Club, SELC, and SACE have filed a motion to reconsider the plan, which they claim exceeds regulatory guidelines.
The groups argue that the plan may not be in the best interest of the state or its citizens, raising questions about energy efficiency and environmental impact.

articles.title: Pacifico Energy Achieves Commercial Operations at Sunpro Wind Farm in Vietnam’s Mekong Delta
articles.summary: Pacifico Energy Vietnam has announced the commencement of commercial operations at its 30 MW Sunpro Wind Farm in Vietnam's Mekong Delta, marking a significant milestone in the company's growth in the Vietnamese energy market. This achievement is part of Pacifico Energy Group's efforts to develop and deploy renewable energy projects globally. The Sunpro Wind Farm is expected to contribute to the country's growing renewable energy capacity.
key_takeaways: Pacifico Energy Vietnam has successfully launched a 30 MW wind farm, Sunpro, in Vietnam's Mekong Delta region.
This commercial operation marks an important milestone for the company's growth in the Vietnamese energy market.
The launch of Sunpro Wind Farm contributes to Vietnam's growing renewable energy capacity, aligning with the country's efforts to reduce its carbon footprint.

articles.title: Duke Energy Florida Launches DeBary Green Hydrogen Production System
articles.summary: Duke Energy Florida has launched its DeBary Green Hydrogen Production System, a unique utility-owned site that produces, stores, and burns up to 100% green hydrogen. The system integrates solar PV, electrolysis, hydrogen storage, and a retrofitted gas turbine to provide a clean energy solution. This demonstration project is the first of its kind in the US, showcasing the potential of green hydrogen as a reliable energy source.
key_takeaways: The DeBary Green Hydrogen Production System is an end-to-end integration of solar PV, electrolysis, and hydrogen storage, enabling 24/7 power generation that's not dependent on weather conditions.
The system's hydrogen storage vessels allow for flexible dispatch, providing a stable energy supply even when demand spikes or the sun isn't shining.

The partnership between Duke Energy Florida and GE Vernova has enabled the retrofitted gas turbine to burn blends of up to pure hydrogen, paving the way for more efficient and cleaner energy production.

articles.title: RWE and Indiana Michigan Power Company Enter Long-Term Agreement for Prairie Creek Power Project
articles.summary: RWE and Indiana Michigan Power Company have entered a long-term agreement to develop the Prairie Creek Power Project, which is expected to generate enough electricity to serve approximately 42,000 homes in the state. The project's details are not provided in the article, but the partnership suggests a significant investment in renewable energy. The agreement implies a commitment to sustainable power production.
key_takeaways: The Prairie Creek Power Project is expected to produce enough electricity to serve around 42,000 homes in Indiana.
RWE and Indiana Michigan Power Company have entered a long-term agreement, indicating a significant partnership for the project's development.
The partnership suggests a focus on renewable energy, as indicated by the involvement of two major companies in the project.

articles.title: Meta announces 'landmark' agreements for new nuclear
articles.summary: Meta, a tech giant, has announced agreements with several companies to support the development of new and existing nuclear energy capacity in the US. These agreements aim to generate up to 6.6 GW of electricity by 2035. This marks one of the most significant corporate purchases of nuclear energy in US history.
key_takeaways: Meta has secured agreements with Vistra, TerraPower, Oklo, and Constellation Energy to develop new and existing nuclear energy capacity.
The total capacity supported by these agreements is expected to be up to 6.6 GW by 2035, making it a significant investment in the US nuclear energy sector.
This marks one of the largest corporate purchases of nuclear energy in US history, underscoring the growing interest in nuclear power as a clean and reliable source of electricity.

articles.title: China to abolish solar export tax rebates in April
articles.summary: China is set to abolish solar export tax rebates in April 2026, with the VAT export rebate rate for battery products being cut from 9% to 6% between April 1 and December 31, 2026. This policy change could raise export costs for manufacturers and potentially pull shipments forward into early 2026. The move aims to reduce trade distortions in the solar industry.
key_takeaways: China will eliminate value-added tax (VAT) export rebates for photovoltaic products from April 1, 2026, which could increase production costs and lead to a shift of shipments forward.
The VAT export rebate rate for battery products will be reduced from 9% to 6% between April 1 and December 31, 2026, before being eliminated entirely in January 2027.
The policy change aims to address trade distortions in the solar industry by reducing the incentives provided to manufacturers through export rebates.

articles.title: Green Hydrogen: LONGi Hydrogen Delivers 5 MW Electrolyser System to Europe
articles.summary: LONGi Hydrogen has delivered a 5 MW pressurised alkaline water electrolysis system to an undisclosed European customer, marking a significant milestone in the company's expansion into Europe. This delivery demonstrates LONGi's ability to meet Europe's stringent technical and regulatory standards, which could help alleviate supply bottlenecks in the competitive green hydrogen market. The EU Green Deal and RepowerEU initiatives have set ambitious targets for decarbonizing key sectors through green hydrogen production.
key_takeaways: LONGi Hydrogen has successfully delivered a 5 MW pressurised alkaline water electrolysis system to an undisclosed European customer, marking a significant entry into the European market.
The company's ability to meet Europe's stringent technical and regulatory standards could help alleviate supply bottlenecks in the competitive green hydrogen market.

This delivery is part of LONGi Hydrogen's broader efforts to support the EU's goals of decarbonizing key sectors through green hydrogen production, as outlined in the EU Green Deal and RepowerEU initiatives.

articles.title: California introduces bill to legalize plug-in balcony solar
articles.summary: California State Senator Scott Wiener has introduced Senate Bill 868, also known as the Plug Into the Sun Act, which aims to legalize plug-in balcony solar systems by reclassifying them as appliances. The bill seeks to establish statewide safety standards and eliminate regulatory barriers for portable and balcony solar devices. This legislation is part of the Clean Homes and Energy Affordability Package.
key_takeaways: California has introduced a new bill that allows small plug-in solar systems to connect directly to household outlets, eliminating utility interconnection and permitting requirements.

The proposed law defines balcony solar systems as devices between 400 W and 1,200 W that use integrated microinverters to convert direct current into alternating current for direct connection with home appliances.

Proponents of the bill estimate that balcony solar can reduce a household's average electricity use by up to 20%, resulting in estimated annual savings of approximately $450 or about $37.50 per month for typical California households.

articles.title: Black Hills Completes $350M Tx Project as New BA Prepares to Join CAISO’s WEIM
articles.summary: Black Hills Energy has completed a $350 million transmission expansion project, interconnecting electric systems in Wyoming and South Dakota. The project is part of the company's Ready Wyoming initiative, which will expand access to energy markets for its customers. This development also marks a significant step for CAISO's Western Energy Imbalance Market (WEIM), as two utilities are set to join the market.
key_takeaways: Black Hills Energy has completed a $350 million transmission expansion project, connecting electric systems in Wyoming and South Dakota, as part of its Ready Wyoming initiative.
The completion of this project will benefit customers for decades to come, providing them with reliable and cost-effective energy access.
This development also marks a significant step for CAISO's WEIM, as two utilities (Black Hills Power and Cheyenne Light) are set to join the market in 2026.

articles.title: SPP Works to Augment Western Energy Transfers
articles.summary: SPP is working to develop an inter-market optimization (IMO) framework for energy transfers between its two Western Interconnection markets, aiming to create a coordinated real-time market-clearing process. This initiative aims to improve the efficiency of energy use and reduce operating costs by up to $20 million per year. The goal is to deploy IMO in the West by October 2028, with RTO expansion planned for April 1, 2026.
key_takeaways: SPP is developing an inter-market optimization (IMO) framework to improve energy transfers between its two Western Interconnection markets, aiming to create a coordinated real-time market-clearing process.
The IMO framework has the potential to reduce operating costs by up to $20 million per year through more efficient use of existing transmission system components and decreased production costs.
SPP aims to deploy the IMO framework in the West by October 2028, with RTO expansion planned for April 1, 2026.

articles.title: Wyoming Approves Data Center Campus that Includes 2.7 GW of New Natural Gas-Fired Generation
articles.summary: A data center campus in Wyoming has been approved, with the facility set to be powered by 2.7 GW of new natural gas-fired generation. This project is part of a growing trend of large-scale data centers being built in the western United States. The approval marks an important step forward for the development of this major infrastructure project.
key_takeaways: A 2.7 GW data center campus has been approved in Wyoming, marking one of the largest natural gas-fired generation projects in the state.
The facility will be powered by new natural gas-fired generation, contributing to Wyoming's growing energy landscape.
This project is likely part of a larger trend of large-scale data centers being built in the western United States, driven by demand for cloud computing and digital services.

articles.title: JinkoSolar pushes on perovskite-silicon tandem solar with new partnership
articles.summary: JinkoSolar has partnered with XtalPi to advance high-throughput research and development of perovskite-crystalline-silicon tandem solar cells using an AI platform and quantum-physics-based models. The partnership aims to accelerate the discovery and optimization of tandem device stacks for higher efficiency and improved stability. JinkoSolar will utilize XtalPi's materials R&D stack, including automated experimentation and iterative model training.
key_takeaways: JinkoSolar is using an AI platform combined with quantum-physics-based models to advance high-throughput research and development of perovskite-crystalline-silicon tandem solar cells.
The partnership involves a joint venture between the two companies, establishing a fully closed-loop tandem development line that automates experimentation, model training, and data feedback.

XtalPi's materials R&D stack includes over 200 robots and an end-to-end workflow for precursor synthesis, device fabrication, characterization, and ageing tests, enabling rapid iteration and optimization of tandem device stacks.

articles.title: MOCHI Blocks 90% Of Heat Transfer In Windows
articles.summary: A new process called MOCHI has been developed that can block up to 90% of heat transfer in windows, potentially reducing solar gain and mitigating the negative effects of solar heat. This innovation could lead to more energy-efficient and comfortable building designs. The technology has the potential to significantly impact the way we design and build structures.
key_takeaways: MOCHI (Multi-Optimized Coatings for Heat Insulation) is a new process that can block up to 90% of heat transfer in windows.
This technology could reduce solar gain and mitigate the negative effects of solar heat, leading to more energy-efficient buildings.
The impact of this innovation on building design and construction could be significant, potentially improving comfort and reducing energy consumption.

articles.title: Definition and Formulation of Inertia Service Incorporating Inverter-Based Resources
articles.summary: The article discusses the definition and formulation of inertia service, a crucial ancillary service in power systems, particularly for addressing the scarcity of inertia. The authors propose a power-oriented (P-oriented) definition based on inertial response to establish consistency between synchronous inertia and virtual inertia from inverter-based resources. This definition aims to make the inertia service commensurable with other ancillary services.
key_takeaways: The proposed P-oriented definition establishes a consistent conceptual framework for both synchronous inertia and virtual inertia, enabling commensurability with other ancillary services.
A security-constrained economic dispatch framework is formulated based on this definition, which demonstrates practical effectiveness through simulations on a modified IEEE 30-bus system.
The study shows that the proposed bidirectional service definition ensures price signals that reflect the economic value of inertial provision in frequency drop events.

articles.title: On-Device Deep Reinforcement Learning for Decentralized Task Offloading Performance trade-offs in the training process
articles.summary: The article proposes a decentralized Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) agent to optimize task offloading performance in edge devices, with the goal of achieving better trade-offs between latency, energy consumption, and task requirements. This approach aims to enable new applications that cannot run on devices themselves. The study evaluates the proposed DRL agent in a real testbed composed of various edge devices.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a decentralized Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) agent to optimize task offloading performance in edge devices, enabling new applications that may not be suitable for devices themselves.
The study analyzes the trade-offs between training locally versus remotely in terms of latency and energy consumption, which are crucial factors in edge computing applications.
The proposed DRL agent is evaluated in a real testbed composed of various edge devices, providing insights into its performance and implications for task offloading decisions.

articles.title: CircuitLM: A Multi-Agent LLM-Aided Design Framework for Generating Circuit Schematics from Natural Language Prompts
articles.summary: The article introduces CircuitLM, a multi-agent LLM-aided design framework that generates accurate circuit schematics from natural language prompts. The system addresses the challenges of large language models hallucinating in granular details and producing non-machine-readable outputs. By incorporating a curated component knowledge base and a hybrid evaluation framework, CircuitLM enables reliable circuit prototyping by non-experts.
key_takeaways: CircuitLM tackles the challenge of generating accurate circuit schematics from high-level natural language descriptions, overcoming issues with large language models hallucinating in granular details.

The system incorporates a five-stage pipeline, including LLM-based component identification, canonical pinout retrieval, chain-of-thought reasoning, JSON schematic synthesis, and force-directed SVG visualization.

CircuitLM uses a hybrid evaluation framework called Dual-Metric Circuit Validation (DMCV) to ensure safety and evaluate the system's performance on 100 diverse embedded-systems prompts across six LLMs.

articles.title: A Systems-Engineered ESP32 DAQ Architecture and FAIR Data Workflow for Small-Scale Wind Turbine Performance Measurement in Tropical Environments
articles.summary: The article presents a systems-engineered data acquisition (DAQ) architecture for small-scale wind turbine performance measurement in tropical environments. It aims to address the challenges faced by small-scale wind turbine research in resource-constrained academic settings, such as unreliable or unpublishable datasets. The proposed methodology is designed to ensure high-quality and complete data across six-month campaigns.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a systematic DAQ methodology for small-scale wind turbines, incorporating hardware selection strategies for high-humidity environments and an embedded firmware architecture featuring interrupt-driven rotor speed measurement.

A local-first hybrid storage design combining SD-card persistence with optional MQTT cloud telemetry is presented to ensure data durability and accessibility in tropical/coastal deployment constraints.

The proposed methodology adapts CRISP-DM and FAIR principles, emphasizing quality dimensions and publication templates to ensure high-quality and publishable datasets, targeting $>90\%$ data completeness over six-month campaigns.

articles.title: Meta-backed solar surge adds 385 MW to Louisiana’s grid
articles.summary: A Meta-backed solar farm project, owned by Treaty Oak Clean Energy, is set to add 385 megawatts of renewable energy capacity to Louisiana's grid. The project involves two solar farms, and construction has begun after securing financing. This move marks a significant increase in the state's clean energy production.
key_takeaways: The project aims to increase Louisiana's renewable energy capacity by 385 megawatts through two new solar farms.
Meta is backing this investment, indicating a growing commitment to sustainable energy solutions.
The addition of these solar farms will contribute to a cleaner energy mix in Louisiana.

articles.title: Constellation Completes Acquisition of Calpine; Groups Have 55 GW of Generation Capacity
articles.summary: Constellation has completed its acquisition of Calpine Corp., creating the nation's largest producer of electricity. The deal, worth $26.6 billion, unites Constellation's nuclear power fleet with Calpine's natural gas-fired and geothermal generation. This move expands Constellation's generation capacity to 55 GW.
key_takeaways: Constellation has acquired Calpine Corp., forming the nation's largest producer of electricity.
The deal includes both Constellation's nuclear power fleet and Calpine's natural gas-fired and geothermal generation assets.
The combined entity has a total generation capacity of 55 GW, created through the integration of these two companies' portfolios.

articles.title: From Dumb To Dumber To Dumberer-est, Trump Is Losing The Renewable Energy War
articles.summary: The article discusses President Trump's energy policy and its failure to keep pace with the growing demand for renewable energy. The author suggests that Trump's policies are becoming increasingly outdated and ineffective, as he struggles to address pressing issues like climate change and energy security. The article implies that Trump's energy policies are losing ground in the "renewable energy war".
key_takeaways: President Trump's energy policy is failing to adapt to the rapidly changing landscape of renewable energy.
The author suggests that Trump's focus on fossil fuels makes him out of touch with the growing demand for clean energy.
The article implies that Trump's policies are becoming increasingly outdated and ineffective in addressing pressing issues like climate change.

articles.title: India’s solar capacity additions on track in 2025, says SBICAPS
articles.summary: India's solar capacity additions were on track in 2025, with the country adding an estimated 40 GW of new solar power generation capacity. However, the average capacity utilization factor of solar plants declined to around 16.5% due to overcast conditions and lower daytime demand. Despite this, energy storage tendering accelerated in 2025.
key_takeaways: India added a record 40 GW of new solar power generation capacity in calendar year 2025, driven by utility-scale projects and rooftop growth.
The average capacity utilization factor of solar plants declined to around 16.5% in the first 11 months of calendar year 2025, due to overcast conditions and lower daytime demand.

Transmission infrastructure additions continue to lag renewable capacity growth, creating bottlenecks for grid integration, with less than 50% of targeted transmission capacity completed by the end of fiscal year 2026.

articles.title: The Next Blackout Won’t Be Caused by a Storm—It Will Be Sparked by a Talent War
articles.summary: The article warns that the next blackout in the US may not be caused by a natural disaster or cyberattack, but rather by a shortage of skilled workers to restore power after a routine failure. Utilities are struggling to compete with hyperscale data centers for talent, which is leading to a "talent war" that could have severe consequences for the grid. This lack of skilled workers is becoming a major vulnerability in the energy system.
key_takeaways: The US grid's biggest vulnerability is not its physical infrastructure (hardware), but rather a shortage of skilled workers (human capital) needed to maintain and restore power after outages.
Utilities are facing intense competition with hyperscale data centers for talent, leading to premium salaries and exacerbating the worker shortage.
This "talent war" poses a significant risk to the reliability and resilience of the energy system, as utilities struggle to attract and retain skilled workers in critical roles.

articles.title: Understanding Cable Rejuvenation: A Modern Approach to Grid Reliability
articles.summary: The article discusses the limitations of traditional underground cables, specifically polyethylene and ethylene-propylene rubber (EPR) cables, which are prone to water treeing that degrades insulation and reduces reliability. This has led to a need for a new solution to extend their lifespan beyond decades. A modern approach called cable rejuvenation is being explored as a cost-effective alternative.
key_takeaways: Traditional underground cables like polyethylene (PE) and ethylene-propylene rubber (EPR) are aging more rapidly than expected due to water treeing, which degrades insulation.
Water treeing is a microscopic moisture-induced formation that threatens the reliability of these cables, leading to costly and labor-intensive replacements.
Cable rejuvenation represents a modern approach to grid reliability that aims to extend the lifespan of underground cables beyond decades.

articles.title: Terra-Gen puts 129MW/515MWh BESS in operation at California solar PV complex
articles.summary: Terra-Gen, a jointly owned independent power producer by Masdar and Igneo Infrastructure Partners, has successfully brought its 129MW/515MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) into operation at its solar PV complex in San Bernardino County, California. This is the first operational BESS project for Terra-Gen, marking an important milestone in the company's growth. The project demonstrates Terra-Gen's commitment to renewable energy and energy storage solutions.
key_takeaways: Terra-Gen has successfully deployed a 129MW/515MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) at its solar PV complex in San Bernardino County, California, marking the company's first operational BESS project.
The project is jointly owned by Masdar and Igneo Infrastructure Partners, highlighting a partnership between international renewable energy players.
Terra-Gen's entry into the commercial operation of this BESS project signifies an expansion of the company's presence in the renewable energy sector.

articles.title: Illinois sets 3-GW energy storage target, requires utilities to develop virtual power plants
articles.summary: Illinois has set a 3-GW energy storage target and requires utilities to develop virtual power plants as part of its efforts to reduce energy costs and incentivize new resources, expand solar, and grow efficiency programs.
key_takeaways: The state of Illinois aims to reduce energy costs by incentivizing new resources, expanding solar, and growing efficiency programs.
A 3-GW energy storage target has been set, indicating a significant investment in renewable energy infrastructure.
Utilities in Illinois are required to develop virtual power plants as part of the state's efforts to diversify its energy mix and improve grid resilience.

articles.title: The Mystery Of The Massachusetts Battery Tender
articles.summary: The article discusses the Massachusetts battery storage tender, a result of Governor Maura Healey's signed law, aiming to address energy storage needs. The 1,500-megawatt tender has sparked interest and concern among stakeholders. The outcome of the tender is still unclear, with questions surrounding its implications for the energy sector.
key_takeaways: The Massachusetts battery storage tender aims to secure 1,500 megawatts (MW) of battery storage capacity, addressing the state's growing energy demands.
The law was signed by Governor Maura Healey on November 20, indicating a commitment to increasing renewable energy sources and reducing carbon emissions.
The outcome of the tender is uncertain, raising questions about how it will impact the energy sector and the overall transition to cleaner energy sources in Massachusetts.

articles.title: Malaysia launches new net metering scheme for rooftop PV
articles.summary: Malaysia has launched a new net metering scheme called the Solar Accelerated Transition Action Programme (Solar ATAP) to promote rooftop solar energy adoption. The program aims to build on the country's previous net metering program and incentivize consumers to export excess generation to the grid. Effective since January 1, 2026, the scheme has set capacity limits for residential and non-domestic consumers.
key_takeaways: The Solar Accelerated Transition Action Programme (Solar ATAP) sets a capacity limit of 100% of the consumer's maximum demand or 1 MW for non-domestic consumers.
Domestic consumers are allowed to install solar PV systems with capacities ranging from 5 kW to 15 kW, depending on their energy needs.
The program provides a cost-neutral and transparent mechanism for consumers to install and operate solar photovoltaic (PV) systems for self-consumption and surplus energy export to the grid.

articles.title: How Trump’s offshore wind halt is derailing his party’s energy agenda
articles.summary: The Trump administration's halt on offshore wind construction is having an impact on the Republican Party's energy agenda, as it was previously seen as a key component of their strategy. The freeze on offshore wind projects is expected to delay or derail many energy-related initiatives for the party. This move is particularly concerning given the potential economic benefits of offshore wind energy.
key_takeaways: The Trump administration's decision to halt offshore wind construction could delay or prevent the development of renewable energy sources, which are becoming increasingly important in reducing carbon emissions.
The Republican Party had seen offshore wind as a key component of their energy strategy, but this move may indicate a shift away from supporting clean energy initiatives.
The halt on offshore wind projects is expected to have significant economic implications, particularly for coastal communities that rely on the industry.

articles.title: Sodium-ion battery cells already near lithium-ion cost parity, set to get cheaper
articles.summary:
Here is the analysis:


Sodium-ion battery cells are approaching cost parity with lithium-ion batteries, with estimates suggesting that they could deliver storage at 11–14€/MWh by 2050. This makes them a potentially cheaper alternative to lithium-ion batteries, which are currently dominant in the market. The development of solid-state sodium-ion batteries is also expected to improve their energy density and make them more competitive.
key_takeaways: Sodium-ion battery cells are already cost-competitive with lithium-ion batteries, with costs estimated at 11–14€/MWh by 2050.
While sodium-ion batteries have yet to achieve widespread market adoption due to energy density limitations, they are expected to gain traction as solid-state versions enter the market.

The construction of commercial utility-scale battery energy storage facilities demonstrates that sodium-ion batteries are on the verge of full-scale market entry and could potentially take over the market once supply chains are established.

articles.title: Podcast: battery holy grail too good to be true, NVIDIA open sources self-driving, Tesla Model Y ‘Standard’, and more

articles.title: Time for a nuclear renaissance? – This Week in Cleantech

articles.title: Meta Locks In Up to 6.6 GW of Nuclear Power Through Deals With Vistra, Oklo, and TerraPower
articles.summary: Meta has entered into landmark agreements with Vistra, Oklo, and TerraPower to secure up to 6.6 GW of nuclear power, providing financial certainty for aging plants, accelerating the deployment of advanced reactors, and alleviating PJM's capacity constraints. These deals will establish Meta as an anchor customer for a corporate-backed nuclear fleet and reinforce Big Tech's growing role in underwriting nuclear energy projects. The agreements support 20-year contracts for existing nuclear capacity across three Vistra facilities in Ohio and Pennsylvania.
key_takeaways: Meta has secured up to 6.6 GW of nuclear power through deals with Vistra, Oklo, and TerraPower, providing financial certainty for aging plants.
The agreements will accelerate the deployment of advanced reactors and alleviate PJM's capacity constraints, establishing Meta as an anchor customer for a corporate-backed nuclear fleet.
The deal supports 20-year contracts for existing nuclear capacity across three Vistra facilities in Ohio and Pennsylvania.

articles.title: China’s switches on world’s first GWh-scale supercapacitor-energy storage project
articles.summary: China has successfully connected its first GWh-scale supercapacitor-energy storage project, the Jiayuguan NingSheng 500 MW/1,000 MWh independent energy storage project, to the grid. The project combines lithium batteries and supercapacitors to support grid stability and renewables integration. This milestone marks a significant development in hybrid energy storage systems.
key_takeaways: The Jiayuguan NingSheng project is a 500 MW/1 GWh hybrid energy storage system that combines 475 MW of lithium iron phosphate (LFP) batteries with a 25 MW supercapacitor system.
The project's hybrid configuration enables both long-duration energy shifting and peak shaving provided by the battery storage, as well as rapid grid stabilization through the supercapacitor segment.
The supercapacitor system can deliver millisecond-level response times, making it suitable for frequency regulation, inertia support, and other applications that require fast grid stabilization.

articles.title: India’s smart metering boom reshapes grid through decentralized IoT
articles.summary: India's power system is rapidly decentralizing due to the expansion of electricity demand, rooftop solar, electric vehicles, and distributed generation. The country's smart metering rollout under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) has led to a wave of technological innovation, redefining what modern grid infrastructure can look like. This transformation aims to achieve scale, affordability, and long-term resilience while meeting India's renewable energy ambitions.
key_takeaways: India is rapidly decentralizing its power system due to the growth of renewable energy sources, electric vehicles, and distributed generation, turning the traditional one-way grid into a dynamic network that relies on decentralized data systems.

The country's smart metering rollout under RDSS has become a foundational redesign of how electricity is measured, managed, and understood across the subcontinent, with a focus on accurate, timely data and improved operational control for distribution companies, reliability and transparency for consumers, and grid resilience for the nation.

The evolution of India's power system is faster than most global peers, driven by the need to address challenges such as scalability, affordability, and long-term sustainability while meeting the country's renewable energy ambitions.

articles.title: Over 1 TW of renewables awaiting approval in Europe
articles.summary: The European power market requires a significant investment of €600 billion by the end of the decade and €1.5 trillion by the middle of the century to support the expansion of renewable energy, according to a report by Aurora Energy Research. Over 1 TW of renewable capacity is awaiting grid connection across Europe, with Italy accounting for approximately 370 GW. Permitting times are stretching up to a decade in some European markets, contributing to the growing pipeline.
key_takeaways: The European power market requires significant investment: €600 billion by the end of the decade and €1.5 trillion by the middle of the century.
Over 1 TW of renewable capacity is awaiting grid connection across Europe, with Italy accounting for approximately 370 GW.
Permitting times are stretching up to a decade in some European markets, contributing to the growing pipeline and making it challenging to connect new renewable projects to the grid.

articles.title: From Sea to Shining Sea: A Recap of 2025 State Solar Policy Wins
articles.summary: The article highlights state policy wins in the US solar industry for 2025, with Illinois being a notable example of Governor J.B. articles.title: Effect of Dispatch Decisions on Small-Signal Stability of Converter-Dominated Power Systems
articles.summary: The article investigates the impact of dispatch decisions on the small-signal stability of converter-dominated power systems. It aims to bridge a gap in research by analyzing how power flow variables affect system stability, particularly in grid-forming and grid-following converters. The study uses both a three-bus system and the IEEE 39-bus test system to demonstrate its findings.
key_takeaways: High-voltage capacitive operation of GFL (grid-following) converters limits their active power injection, while inductive operation permits higher injections.
It is generally preferable for GFM (grid-forming) converters to supply more active power compared to GFL converters.

Dispatch decisions have a significant impact on the small-signal stability of converter-dominated power systems, which can be influenced by the operating mode and design parameters of grid-following and grid-forming converters.

articles.title: Eavor’s First-of-Its-Kind Closed-Loop Geothermal Project Produces Grid Power in Germany
articles.summary: Eavor Technologies has achieved a milestone in geothermal energy production by successfully connecting its closed-loop geothermal project in Bavaria, Germany to the commercial power grid. This marks the first time a closed-loop geothermal system has delivered electricity to a commercial power grid. The Geretsried facility uses Eavor's multilateral Eavor-Loop well system, which generates electricity and district heat without fluid exchange with subsurface formations.
key_takeaways: Eavor Technologies has successfully connected its closed-loop geothermal project in Bavaria, Germany to the commercial power grid, marking a new pathway for advanced geothermal deployment.

The Geretsried facility uses Eavor's multilateral Eavor-Loop well system, which generates electricity and district heat without fluid exchange with subsurface formations, a novel approach in geothermal energy production.

Congressional representatives from both parties acknowledged the need for increased nuclear capacity to meet growing energy demands and support the transition away from fossil fuels.

articles.title: Clean Energy Groups Sue Feds Over Solar, Wind Restrictions

The lawsuits argue that wind and solar generation is a critical US grid asset that offers the fastest path to increasing national capacity. As of January 7, the federal government had not responded to either complaint.
key_takeaways: The IRS has eliminated the Five Percent Safe Harbor provision for claiming federal tax credits for large solar projects, limiting developers' ability to demonstrate compliance with tax credit requirements.
The lawsuits challenge the Trump administration's efforts to thwart permitting for solar and wind energy development, arguing that these sources are crucial for meeting national grid capacity needs.

The complaints highlight the importance of wind and solar generation as a critical US grid asset, offering the fastest path to increasing national capacity and addressing concerns about the nation's energy future.

articles.title: How To Lose The War On Renewable Energy, Bigly

Renewable energy sources like wind and solar continue to dominate new capacity additions in the power generation sector. This suggests that the policy shift may not be effective in hindering the growth of renewable energy.
key_takeaways: Despite the US energy policy's shift against renewable energy, wind and solar power have continued to gain momentum, with renewables dominating new capacity additions.
The policy change appears to have failed, as signs of its impact are already emerging, indicating that it may not be effective in hindering the growth of renewable energy.

This milestone marks the culmination of significant work by Origin Energy and its contractor partners.
key_takeaways: Australia's largest approved battery project, a 700 MW / 3,160 MWh energy storage system, has started commercial operations.
The initial stage of the project, a 460 MW / 1,770 MWh battery energy storage system, is fully operational and connected to the National Electricity Market (NEM).
The successful commissioning of this milestone marks the culmination of significant work by Origin Energy and its contractor partners.

articles.title: UK startup claims its electrolytes can triple flow battery energy density
articles.summary: Kodiaq Technologies, a UK startup led by Cambridge University scientists and the former chair of Oxford PV, claims to have developed organic electrolytes for redox flow batteries that can triple the energy density of vanadium-based alternatives. The current energy density is already above typical vanadium-based electrolyte levels at 50 Wh per liter. The company aims to further increase energy density through its development pathway.
key_takeaways: Kodiaq Technologies' organic electrolytes for redox flow batteries have achieved an energy density of up to 50 Wh per liter, exceeding that of traditional vanadium-based electrolytes.
The startup claims that its electrolytes can triple the energy density of vanadium-based alternatives, making it a promising solution for increasing battery efficiency.
Redox flow batteries store charge in a liquid electrolyte separated by a membrane, unlike lithium-ion batteries which use solid materials.

articles.title: Solar Panel-based Visible Light Communication for Batteryless Systems
articles.summary: The article discusses a novel power and energy system that harnesses ambient light to enable batteryless wireless communication in the Internet of Things. A solar panel serves as both an energy harvester and optical antenna, capturing modulated signals from LED light sources. The system uses a lightweight analog front-end and an 8-bit low-power processor to minimize energy consumption.
key_takeaways: The system uses a solar panel as an energy harvester and optical antenna to capture modulated signals from LED light sources.
The prototype can reliably decode 32-bit VLC frames at 800 Hz, consuming less than 2.8 mJ of power.
The system's sleep-mode power is maintained below 30 uW, reducing overall energy consumption when not actively transmitting or receiving data.

articles.title: Derivation of the Thermal Conductivity in a Latent Thermal Energy Storage Unit for Use in Simplified System Models
articles.summary: This article aims to derive simplified thermal conductivity models for Latent Thermal Energy Storage (LTES) units, which are crucial for designing Rankine-based Carnot Batteries. The authors focus on the interaction between phase change materials (PCMs), fins, and the shell of an LTES unit, aiming to develop a numerical approach to understand its behavior. By comparing complex model results with simplified models, they can provide insights for designing efficient system models.
key_takeaways: The article emphasizes the need for simplified models of LTES units due to the complexity of natural convection phenomena in these systems.
A numerical approach using COMSOL software is employed to develop a simplified model of an LTES unit, focusing on the interaction between fins and phase change materials (PCMs).

The effective thermal conductivity of a single finned tube is used as a basis for approximating the performance of the LTES unit in simplified system models, enabling the transfer of results from complex modeling approaches.

articles.title: Accounting for Optimal Control in the Sizing of Isolated Hybrid Renewable Energy Systems Using Imitation Learning
articles.summary: The article presents a flexible and computationally efficient sizing framework for energy storage and renewable capacity in isolated energy systems, accounting for uncertainty in renewable generation and optimal feedback control. The proposed approach uses imitation learning to relate battery storage and wind peak capacities to emissions reduction and investment costs, enabling decision makers to evaluate effective emission reduction and costs at any price point. This framework is evaluated on a case study of an offshore energy system, highlighting the complexity of accounting for optimal control in isolated energy systems.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a novel approach using imitation learning for stochastic neural model predictive control (MPC) to account for uncertainty in renewable generation and finite horizon in isolated energy system sizing.

The proposed framework enables decision makers to evaluate effective emission reduction and costs of different storage and wind capacities at any price point, accounting for the nonlinear relationship between investment costs and reduction in gas usage relative to wind and battery capacity.

The study emphasizes the importance of considering optimal control in the design of isolated energy systems, highlighting the complexity of balancing supply and demand with renewable generation and finite horizon constraints.

articles.title: Cyberattack Detection in Virtualized Microgrids Using LightGBM and Knowledge-Distilled Classifiers
articles.summary: The article presents a method for detecting cyberattacks in virtualized microgrids using Light Gradient Boosting Machine (LightGBM) and knowledge-distilled classifiers. A structured cyberattack framework was developed to inject adversarial signals into the secondary control pathways of a virtual microgrid, generating labeled datasets under both normal and attack conditions. The results demonstrate that lightweight machine learning-based intrusion detection methods can provide fast, accurate, and efficient cyberattack detection.
key_takeaways: The article introduces a complete virtual microgrid design in MATLAB/Simulink, integrating heterogeneous renewable sources and secondary controller layers.
LightGBM models achieved high accuracy (99.72% for multiclass, 94.8% for binary) and F1 scores (99.62%, 94.3%) in detecting cyberattacks and distinguishing among attack types, respectively.

A knowledge-distillation step reduced the size of the multiclass model without significantly impacting performance, making it suitable for fast predictions on edge devices with limited computational resources.

articles.title: Online Decision-Making Under Uncertainty for Vehicle-to-Building Systems
articles.summary: The article discusses the challenges of optimizing vehicle-to-building (V2B) systems, which integrate electric vehicles with smart buildings to manage energy use. The V2B optimization problem is complex due to factors such as fluctuating electricity pricing, long planning horizons, and heterogeneous chargers. A new approach using a Markov decision process (MDP) is proposed to address these challenges.
key_takeaways: The V2B optimization problem is challenging due to fluctuations in electricity pricing, long planning horizons, and heterogeneous chargers with varying charging rates and controllability.

A Markov decision process (MDP) approach is proposed to model the V2B optimization problem, which offers a more realistic representation of the complex setting compared to existing combinatorial optimization methods.
The proposed MDP framework leverages online search and domain-specific heuristics to address the challenges of the large state space and prunes unpromising actions to improve performance.

articles.title: Generator Bearing Failures: Root Cause Analysis and the Role of Integrated Data
articles.summary: The article discusses the reliability of hydropower plants, which rely heavily on generators that operate under immense loads. Generator bearing failures can have severe consequences due to their critical role in plant performance. Integrated data and root cause analysis are crucial in understanding and preventing these failures.
key_takeaways: Generators are a critical component of hydropower plants, carrying significant radial and axial loads.
Bearing failures can have severe consequences for generator reliability and overall plant dependability.
Integrated data and advanced monitoring solutions play a vital role in identifying root causes of bearing failures and preventing future occurrences.

Despite current challenges, including hostility from the president and Republicans in Congress, the renewable energy market is expected to continue growing steadily.
The growth of US solar and wind power is attributed to increasing demand for clean energy and government policies supporting sustainable development.

The use of software in battery management and control is highlighted as an essential aspect of optimizing the performance and efficiency of BESS systems.

articles.title: Poland’s massive new airport project to host utility-scale solar-plus-storage project
articles.summary: Poland's Central Transport Port company has tendered for the development of a utility-scale solar-plus-storage project at the planned Port Polska airport. The project, worth approximately 70 MW, will feature 20 MW of solar PV and 50 MW of battery storage capacity with a two-hour working time. key_takeaways: Poland is planning a massive new airport project, Port Polska, which will be powered by a utility-scale solar-plus-storage system worth approximately 70 MW.
The solar PV component of the system will generate 20 MW, while the battery storage capacity will be 50 MW with a two-hour working time.

Battery storage systems can be prone to fires due to various reasons, including design, installation, or maintenance issues.

articles.title: Third tier of Iran’s Bushehr 2 nuclear power unit installed

The installation suggests that the project is moving forward as planned, despite any potential delays or challenges.
The success of this milestone could pave the way for further progress on the power unit, potentially leading to a completed second unit in the near future.

articles.title: India’s energy storage market set for breakout year in 2026
articles.summary: India's energy storage market is poised for a breakout year in 2026, with many projects awarded since mid-2023 expected to begin commissioning. articles.title: Western Australia prioritises long-duration energy storage in latest clean energy funding round
articles.summary: Western Australia has announced the latest round of its Clean Energy Innovation Grants programme, focusing on long-duration energy storage as part of its efforts to support clean energy innovations. articles.title: Calif. Electricity Consumption Headed off the Charts, CEC Forecast Shows

The state's planned artificial intelligence data center capacity is expected to grow significantly, with potential increases of up to 6,510 MW in the "high-case" scenario by 2039.

articles.title: NRC Approves First Digital Conversion of Nuclear Plant Safety Controls
articles.summary: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) has approved the digital conversion of Constellation Energy's Limerick Clean Energy Center, marking the first time a nuclear plant in the US has been upgraded to a single digital system. key_takeaways: The NRC's approval of Constellation Energy's Limerick Digital Modernization Project marks a significant milestone in the transition from analog to digital safety systems at US nuclear power plants.
The upgrade is expected to improve safety system reliability and cybersecurity, as well as reduce manual maintenance requirements and costs associated with obsolete components.

articles.title: Grid code standards key to unlock Indonesia’s solar potential
articles.summary: A Danish-Indonesian research group has analyzed the challenges of integrating higher shares of renewable energy in Indonesia's electricity system and recommends updating grid codes to ensure system reliability. The study highlights the need for coordinated action across grid investment, regulatory reform, financing, and institutional strengthening to unlock Indonesia's solar potential. Modern technical standards are essential for managing growing renewable penetration without compromising system reliability.
key_takeaways: The lack of robust, updated grid-code standards in Indonesia is a major bottleneck for renewable energy deployment, but introducing and enforcing grid codes can be part of a broader systemic transformation.

A proposed grid code includes reactive power compensation mechanisms and harmonic analysis to assess grid hosting capacity and manage growing renewable penetration without compromising system reliability.

The study's findings highlight the importance of comparing existing standards with international best practices, such as those applied in Denmark and developed by the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE), to identify necessary adjustments for Indonesia's renewable energy ambitions.

articles.title: Solar power overtakes coal and gas in Germany, a country with little sun

This shift towards solar power indicates a growing trend towards renewable energy sources in Germany.

articles.title: The POWER Interview: Challenges and Opportunities for DERs

articles.title: China connects world’s largest vanadium flow battery project

key_takeaways: Commonwealth Fusion Systems is developing a digital twin of its SPARC fusion machine in collaboration with NVIDIA and Siemens.

articles.title: From inconsistency to decision: explainable operation and maintenance of battery energy storage systems
articles.summary:
Here is the analysis:

 The article proposes a new paradigm for the operation and maintenance of Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESSs) that leverages inconsistency-driven monitoring data to provide explainable, decision-oriented guidance. This framework integrates multi-dimensional inconsistency evaluation with large language model-based semantic reasoning to bridge the gap between quantitative diagnostics and practical maintenance decisions. By doing so, it aims to improve the accuracy and speed of operation and maintenance, reducing response time and operational cost.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a new approach for operating and maintaining Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESSs) that utilizes inconsistency-driven monitoring data to provide actionable insights.

The proposed framework combines multi-dimensional inconsistency evaluation with large language model-based semantic reasoning to bridge the gap between quantitative diagnostics and practical maintenance decisions.

The approach aims to reduce response time and operational cost by over 80% compared to conventional expert-driven practices, improving reliability, safety, and cost-effective integration of energy storage into modern power systems.

articles.title: Closed-Loop Transmission Power Control for Reliable and Low-Power BLE Communication in Dynamic IoT Settings
articles.summary: The article discusses a closed-loop transmission power control framework for reliable and low-power Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) communication in dynamic IoT settings. The proposed framework uses Proportional-Integral-Derivative (PID) controllers to adjust transmission power based on Received Signal Strength Indicator (RSSI) and data throughput. This allows for robust control of both RSSI and throughput, even under rapidly changing environmental conditions.
key_takeaways: Adjusting transmission power effectively influences both RSSI and data throughput in BLE communication.
Two proposed control strategies are investigated: an RSSI-based approach and a throughput-based approach, each with distinct advantages and limitations.
A hybrid RSSI-throughput control strategy is developed to combine the responsiveness of RSSI feedback with the accuracy of throughput measurements, achieving robust control under dynamic conditions.

articles.title: Post-Earthquake Restoration of Electricity-Gas Distribution Systems with Damage Information Collection and Repair Vehicle Routing
articles.summary: The article discusses a novel adaptive restoration framework for integrated electricity-gas distribution systems (IEGDS) after an earthquake, which takes into account dynamic damage assessment and repair. The framework uses a partially observable Markov decision process (POMDP) with an advanced belief tree search (BTS) algorithm to enable real-time decision-making. The proposed method is evaluated through case studies, demonstrating its effectiveness and scalability in reducing outage costs.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a novel adaptive restoration framework for IEGDS after an earthquake, considering dynamic damage assessment and repair.
The framework uses a POMDP with BTS algorithm to enable real-time decision-making, allowing crew members to update their actions based on evolving belief states.
The proposed method achieves outage cost comparable to the ideal solution and reduces total outage cost by more than 15% compared to existing strategies.

articles.title: Scaling Laws of Machine Learning for Optimal Power Flow
articles.summary: The article discusses the scaling laws of machine learning for optimal power flow (OPF) in power systems, with a focus on understanding the relationships between training data volume, computational resources, and performance metrics such as prediction error and constraint violations. The study reveals consistent power-law relationships across two dimensions: data scale and compute scale, providing quantitative guidance for principled ML pipeline design and deployments. This research aims to address the challenges of deploying machine learning models in real-world OPF applications.
key_takeaways: The accuracy metric (MAE) scales with dataset size and training compute, indicating that larger datasets and more computational resources can lead to improved prediction accuracy.
There is a divergence between prediction accuracy and constraint feasibility, suggesting that optimizing one may come at the cost of compromising on the other in ML-OPF models.

The study provides consistent power-law relationships across different machine learning architectures (DNNs and PINNs) and performance metrics, enabling predictable and principled ML pipeline design for OPF applications.

articles.title: Corrosion-free bromine flow battery promises longer life and higher energy density
articles.summary: A new bromine-based flow battery chemistry has been developed by researchers at Dalian Institute of Chemical Physics, addressing the issue of severe corrosion caused by free bromine during charging.
