key_takeaways: The new chemistry reduces or eliminates corrosion caused by free bromine during charging, which is a significant barrier to the widespread adoption of zinc-bromine flow batteries.
The approach also extends cycle life and increases energy density, which could improve the commercial prospects of Zn/Br flow batteries for long-duration energy storage applications.
Bromine is an attractive component for grid-scale energy storage due to its abundance, high solubility, and high redox potential.

articles.title: US state repurposes wastewater land for 250 MW solar plant
articles.summary: Consumers Energy has successfully commissioned a 250 MW solar plant in western Michigan, built on an active municipal wastewater treatment site. The project demonstrates the industry's shift toward developing large-scale utility assets on unconventional landscapes. This initiative marks a significant milestone in Michigan's transition towards a coal-free capacity mix by 2025.
key_takeaways: The Muskegon Solar Energy Center is the largest solar installation in Consumers Energy's fleet, showcasing the company's commitment to renewable energy and its shift away from coal.
The project utilizes 1,900 acres of wastewater treatment land, demonstrating "land-use efficiency" and avoiding competition with prime agricultural land for solar development sites.

The successful deployment of large-scale solar on unconventional landscapes like wastewater treatment sites underscores the potential for innovative land use strategies in the renewable energy sector.

articles.title: RI, CT attorneys general move to join forces with Revolution Wind developers in case against feds
articles.summary: Rhode Island and Connecticut attorneys general have filed a motion to join forces with Revolution Wind developers in their lawsuit against the Trump administration, seeking to challenge federal policies that impact the offshore wind project.
key_takeaways: Rhode Island and Connecticut attorneys general are joining forces with Revolution Wind developers to challenge federal policies related to the offshore wind project.
The lawsuit aims to address concerns over the Trump administration's handling of the project, which is a significant source of renewable energy for the region.
Consolidating their efforts may strengthen the case against the feds and potentially lead to more favorable outcomes for the development of the Revolution Wind project.

articles.title: Jackery New Year Sale returns HomePower 3600 Plus station to $1,519, Autel AC Elite Home 50A Smart AI EV charger new low, more
articles.summary: The article highlights a current sale on various power and energy-related products, including portable power stations, electric vehicle chargers, and e-scooters. Discounts range from up to 53% off, with some items reaching their lowest prices yet. The Jackery New Year Sale is particularly notable, offering significant savings on popular products.
key_takeaways: Portion of the sale: A portable power station like the HomePower 3600 Plus is discounted to $1,519, which is the second-lowest price it has been offered.
Electric vehicle charger deal: An Autel AC Elite Home 50A Smart AI Level 2 EV Charger is now priced at $450, a new low for the product.
Additional discounts: Other products like Hiboy's MAX Pro e-scooter and Segway's Navimow i and X3 series are also discounted, with savings ranging from up to $700.

articles.title: Final unit at Bilibino Nuclear Power Plant permanently shut down
articles.summary: The Bilibino Nuclear Power Plant in Chukotka, Russia, has permanently shut down its last operable unit after completing a planned shutdown. This marks the end of the plant's operational life. No further information is provided about potential causes or future plans.
key_takeaways: The Bilibino Nuclear Power Plant, located in Chukotka, Russia, has permanently shut down its third and final operable unit.
The shutdown was part of a planned maintenance process, but no specific details are available on the reasons for this decision.
This event concludes the operational life of the plant, marking a significant milestone in the country's nuclear energy program.

articles.title: Programmatic alignment is key to scaling residential battery demand response
articles.summary: The article highlights the importance of programmatic alignment in scaling residential battery demand response, emphasizing that different stakeholders (utilities, battery manufacturers, technology providers, and customers) operate under varying incentive structures.
key_takeaways: Programmatic alignment is crucial to create a cohesive market for residential battery demand response, as different incentives can create conflicting goals among stakeholders.
Utilities, in particular, play a key role in shaping the program structure and design to maximize benefits for all parties involved.
Effective alignment requires careful consideration of various factors, including regulatory frameworks, technology capabilities, and customer behaviors.

articles.title: SolarMax secures two EPC agreements for 400MWh total BESS capacity in Puerto Rico
articles.summary: SolarMax Technology has secured two engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) agreements for battery energy storage systems (BESS) in Puerto Rico, totaling 400MWh of capacity. This project will likely support the island's increasing demand for renewable energy sources and stabilize its grid. The company is focused on providing energy solutions to customers in the Caribbean region.
key_takeaways: SolarMax Technology has secured two EPC agreements for BESS projects in Puerto Rico, demonstrating its commitment to expanding its presence in the Caribbean market.
The total capacity of 400MWh will contribute to a more stable and renewable-powered grid in Puerto Rico, supporting the island's transition towards cleaner energy sources.
This project aligns with SolarMax Technology's focus on providing energy solutions to customers in the region, highlighting the company's growth strategy in the Caribbean.

articles.title: Spain opens €90 million funding round for 7 GWh of pumped hydro storage
articles.summary: The Spanish government has announced a €90 million funding round for pumped hydro storage projects, which will provide nearly 7 GWh of long-duration energy storage by 2035. The funding scheme is part of the Recovery, Transformation and Resilience Plan (PRTR) and aims to support innovative pumped hydro energy storage projects. The project winners must complete their work by June 30, 2035.
key_takeaways: Spain is providing €90 million in funding for nearly 1 GW of pumped hydro projects, which will add 7 GWh of long-duration energy storage (LDES) to the grid by 2035.
Each project eligible for the grant can receive up to €50 million and must be completed by June 30, 2035.

The funding scheme is part of the PRTR and follows a previous call in September 2023 that attracted strong interest and awarded €100 million for four projects totaling over 2 GW of new pumped storage capacity.

articles.title: India’s biggest solar manufacturer Waaree raises funds toward 20GWh energy storage factory
articles.summary: Waaree Energies, India's largest solar manufacturer, is expanding its energy storage business with a new 20GWh factory. The company has raised INR10 billion (US$110.9 million) to fund the project, which aims to increase Waaree's presence in the growing Indian energy storage market. This investment suggests significant growth plans for Waaree's energy storage subsidiary.
key_takeaways: Waaree Energies, India's largest solar manufacturer, is investing INR10 billion (US$110.9 million) in a new 20GWh energy storage factory.
The planned factory will increase Waaree's presence in the Indian energy storage market, which is expected to grow significantly in the coming years.
This investment highlights the growing importance of energy storage solutions for India's renewable energy sector and the country's ambitious clean energy targets.

articles.title: AER: 244 community battery storage systems now connected across Australia
articles.summary: The Australian Energy Regulator (AER) has confirmed that 244 community battery energy storage systems (BESS) are now connected to the country's distribution networks, representing a significant milestone in Australia's renewable energy transition. This development demonstrates growing adoption of BESS technology and its integration into the national grid. The increased connectivity is expected to enhance the overall resilience and efficiency of the energy system.
key_takeaways: 244 community battery energy storage systems (BESS) have been connected to the Australian distribution networks, showcasing significant growth in their adoption.
This development highlights Australia's shift towards renewable energy sources and its commitment to integrating sustainable technologies into the national grid.
The increased connectivity of BESS systems is expected to improve the overall resilience and efficiency of the energy system, contributing to a more stable and reliable supply of electricity.

articles.title: World’s first gigawatt-hour-scale flow battery project goes into operation in China
articles.summary: A groundbreaking flow battery project has been completed in China, marking a significant milestone in the development of large-scale energy storage systems. The project, developed by Dalian Rongke Power and China Three Gorges Corporation, is the world's first to scale gigawatt-hour (GWh) energy storage capacity. This achievement demonstrates the growing adoption of flow batteries as a viable solution for grid-scale energy storage.
key_takeaways: The project represents a major breakthrough in the development of large-scale energy storage systems, with a record-breaking gigawatt-hour capacity.
Flow batteries have emerged as a promising technology for grid-scale energy storage, offering a scalable and flexible solution to meet increasing energy demands.
The success of this project is expected to pave the way for further expansion of flow battery applications in various industries, including renewable energy, grids, and industrial power.

articles.title: Full-scope integration: The forgotten advantage in Australia’s energy storage race
articles.summary: Australia's complex battery storage market presents a challenge, but Kashish Shah of Wärtsilä Energy Storage suggests that full-scope integration is the most viable path for successful project delivery. This approach considers the entire energy system, including generation, transmission, and distribution, to achieve optimal outcomes. By taking a holistic view, Australia can unlock the potential of its battery storage market.
key_takeaways: Full-scope integration involves considering the entire energy system, from generation to transmission and distribution, to ensure that battery storage projects align with the overall energy strategy.
This approach allows for more effective use of battery storage resources, reducing waste and maximizing their impact on the grid.
By adopting a full-scope integration mindset, Australia can potentially overcome some of the challenges posed by its complex market, such as conflicting incentives and regulatory hurdles.

articles.title: Australian battery storage projects attract international lenders in year-end financing spree
articles.summary: Australian battery storage projects have attracted international lenders in a year-end financing spree, with Atmos Renewables and Potentia Energy securing financing packages for their Australian renewables and energy storage portfolios.
key_takeaways: International lenders are investing heavily in Australian renewable and energy storage projects, indicating a strong demand for clean energy solutions.
The year-end financing spree suggests that investors are seeking to close deals before the end of the year, possibly due to changes in market conditions or regulatory environments.
Securing financing packages will enable Atmos Renewables and Potentia Energy to move forward with their projects, contributing to the growth of Australia's renewable energy sector.

articles.title: Fox ESS rolls out stackable battery system
articles.summary: Fox ESS, a Chinese manufacturer, has launched a stackable battery energy storage system with a capacity of 5.99 kWh per unit, which can be scaled up to 83.86 kWh when configured with 14 units in series. The system is designed for Australian homes and businesses, particularly for the Cheaper Home Batteries Program. It offers high-performance, scalability, and customization, making it suitable for various settings.
key_takeaways: Fox ESS has launched a stackable battery energy storage system with a capacity of 5.99 kWh per unit, which can be scaled up to 83.86 kWh when configured with 14 units in series.
The system is designed specifically for Australian homes and businesses, particularly for the Cheaper Home Batteries Program, offering flexibility and customization options.
The battery's high-performance capabilities and scalability make it an ideal choice for suburban rooftops, regional properties, or industrial facilities.

articles.title: Is the US headed toward an electricity crisis of its own making?
articles.summary: The article discusses how the US, despite producing record-high amounts of oil and gas, is at risk of an electricity crisis due to various factors such as aging infrastructure, climate change, and increasing demand. This threat was initially downplayed by President Trump but has now become a growing concern. The country's energy landscape is undergoing significant changes that could impact its ability to meet future energy demands.
key_takeaways: The US is facing an electricity crisis due to the nation's aging infrastructure, with many power plants nearing or already at the end of their lifespan.
Climate change poses another significant threat, as warmer temperatures and increased frequency of extreme weather events can damage equipment and disrupt supply chains.

Despite record-high oil and gas production, the country's energy mix is becoming increasingly dependent on renewable sources like wind and solar power, which can be intermittent and unreliable at times.

articles.title: DOE Issues $2.7B Orders to Scale Domestic Nuclear LEU and HALEU Enrichment
articles.summary: The US Department of Energy (DOE) has awarded $900 million each to three companies, Centrus Energy Corp., General Matter, and Orano Federal Services, under a $2.7-billion program to expand domestic capacity for low-enriched uranium (LEU) and high-assay low-enriched uranium (HALEU) enrichment over the next decade.
key_takeaways: The US government has launched a $2.7 billion program to scale up domestic nuclear LEU and HALEU enrichment, with the aim of increasing domestic capacity over the next decade.
Three companies have been awarded production-scale task orders under this program: Centrus Energy Corp., General Matter, and Orano Federal Services, each receiving $900 million in funding.
The expansion of domestic LEU and HALEU enrichment capacity is expected to support the growing demand for nuclear fuel in the US nuclear industry.

articles.title: EdgeSSVEP: A Fully Embedded SSVEP BCI Platform for Low-Power Real-Time Applications
articles.summary: The article introduces EdgeSSVEP, a fully embedded microcontroller-based Steady-State Visually Evoked Potential (SSVEP) Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) platform designed for low-power real-time applications. The system performs real-time EEG acquisition, filtering, and classification within a limited 222 mW power consumption. It achieved high classification accuracy and information transfer rate while offering energy efficiency, scalability, and security.
key_takeaways: EdgeSSVEP is a fully embedded microcontroller-based BCI platform that consumes only 222 mW of power, making it more energy-efficient than conventional desktop-based systems.
The system performs real-time EEG acquisition, zero-phase filtering, and on-device classification, eliminating the need for PC-based processing and enabling real-time applications.

EdgeSSVEP achieved high classification accuracy (99.17%) and information transfer rate (27.33 bits/min) with six stimulus frequencies and 10 participants, demonstrating its potential for assistive communication and neurofeedback applications.

articles.title: CONSENT: A Negotiation Framework for Leveraging User Flexibility in Vehicle-to-Building Charging under Uncertainty
articles.summary: The article proposes a negotiation framework, CONSENT, to address the conflict between building operators and EV drivers in vehicle-to-building charging. The framework aims to reduce energy costs for both parties by offering drivers incentives for modest flexibility in their departure time or state of charge. Through simulations, the authors show that CONSENT creates mutually beneficial outcomes for both operator and user.
key_takeaways: The proposed framework, CONSENT, transforms EV charging into a strategic resource by providing drivers with incentive-backed options for flexible departure times or states of charge.

Simulations demonstrate that CONSENT reduces building operator costs by over 3.5% compared to an optimized, non-negotiating smart charging policy, while lowering user charging expenses by 22% below the utility's retail energy rate.

The framework aims to align operator and EV user objectives, providing a strategic bridge between energy and mobility systems to promote collaboration and shared savings in vehicle-to-building charging.

articles.title: Machine Learning Guided Cooling Optimization for Data Centers
articles.summary: The article presents a machine learning framework for optimizing data center cooling, which can reduce excessive energy consumption. The framework uses a three-stage approach to identify and mitigate cooling energy waste, achieving accurate predictions and identifying significant annual inefficiencies. The study demonstrates the potential of this framework to recover up to 96% of excess cooling energy through small setpoint changes.
key_takeaways: The proposed machine learning framework achieves high accuracy in predicting facility accessory power from coolant flow rates, temperatures, and server power, with a mean absolute error of 0.026 MW.

The framework identifies approximately 85 MWh of annual inefficiency concentrated in specific months, hours, and operating regimes, highlighting the potential for significant energy savings through optimization.
The study shows that up to 96% of identified excess cooling energy can be recovered through small, safe setpoint changes while respecting thermal limits and operational constraints.

articles.title: Optimal Dispatch of Electricity and Water in Renewable-Integrated Desalination Plants
articles.summary: The article proposes a mathematical framework for the optimal dispatch of flexible water desalination plants (WDPs) in renewable-integrated systems. WDPs offer unique operational flexibility and can participate in both water and electricity markets, allowing for simultaneous sale of desalinated water and bidirectional transactions with the grid. The proposed framework provides computationally tractable coordination suitable for large-scale deployment.
key_takeaways: Flexible water desalination plants (WDPs) can simultaneously participate in two markets: selling desalinated water to a water utility and bidding electricity onto the grid based on their net electricity demand.
The article formulates a mathematical framework for optimal WDP dispatch, capturing operational, technological, and market-based coupling between water and electricity flows.
The proposed framework offers significant improvements relative to benchmark algorithms, with extensive simulations illustrating the optimal WDP's operation, profit, and water-electricity exchange.

articles.title: A Survey on Applications of Quantum Computing for Unit Commitment
articles.summary: The article discusses the application of quantum computing to solve the Unit Commitment (UC) problem in power systems, which determines the optimal operation of generating units while satisfying various constraints. Recent advances in quantum computing have opened new opportunities for accelerating UC solution processes by exploiting quantum parallelism and entanglement. The paper presents a comprehensive survey of existing research on applying quantum computing to UC.
key_takeaways: Traditional optimization methods used for Unit Commitment (UC) face scalability challenges as systems grow in size and uncertainty, highlighting the need for alternative approaches.
Quantum computing offers new opportunities to accelerate UC solution processes through exploiting quantum parallelism and entanglement, opening up potential solutions to scaling challenges.

The article categorizes existing research on quantum-enabled UC into four paradigms: annealing-based, variational hybrid, quantum machine learning, and quantum-inspired methods, highlighting current progress and limitations.

articles.title: Full-Time-Scale Power Management Strategy for Hybrid AC/DC/DS Microgrid with Dynamic Concatenation and Autonomous Frequency / Voltage Restorations
articles.summary: The article proposes a full-time-scale power management strategy for hybrid AC/DC/DS microgrids, which combines transient inertia sharing and steady-state power allocation. The proposed approach uses a dynamic concatenator to unify these two aspects and introduces autonomous frequency/voltage restoration to eliminate steady-state deviations. This strategy enables seamless transition between transient inertia support and proportional power sharing across all time scales.
key_takeaways: The proposed strategy unifies transient inertia sharing and steady-state power allocation through a novel dynamic concatenator, addressing the limitations of existing power management methods.
The approach introduces autonomous frequency/voltage restoration to eliminate steady-state deviations in each subgrid, improving the overall stability and reliability of the microgrid.

Experiments confirm that the proposed strategy maintains nominal frequency and voltage in steady state while enabling seamless transition between transient inertia support and proportional power sharing across all time scales.

articles.title: Reliable Grid Forecasting: State Space Models for Safety-Critical Energy Systems
articles.summary: The article discusses the importance of accurate grid load forecasting in safety-critical energy systems and introduces a new evaluation framework to measure operational risk. The authors evaluate Mamba-based State Space Models for California grid forecasting, revealing that standard accuracy metrics are poor proxies for operational safety and that weather-aware modeling is more effective than loss function modification alone.
key_takeaways: Standard accuracy metrics (e.g., MAPE) do not accurately capture the operational risk associated with grid load forecasting, as models with identical MAPE can require vastly different reserve margins.
Forecast errors are significantly associated with temperature, highlighting the importance of weather-aware modeling in improving forecast reliability.
The S-Mamba model outperforms other models (e.g., iTransformer) in achieving low reserve margins, demonstrating superior forecast reliability under tail-risk reserve proxies.

articles.title: Spain Starts New €355 Million Renewable Energy Manufacturing Program
articles.summary: The Spanish government has launched a new €355 million renewable energy manufacturing program to support the production of various clean technologies. This initiative aims to promote sustainable growth and reduce dependence on fossil fuels. The funding will be allocated to equipment manufacturers in specific categories.
key_takeaways: Spain is investing €355 million in a renewable energy manufacturing program, indicating a significant commitment to supporting the transition to cleaner energy sources.
The program targets various renewable energy technologies, suggesting an effort to diversify and promote multiple clean energy solutions.
By subsidizing the manufacturing of equipment for these technologies, the Spanish government aims to create a more sustainable and environmentally-friendly economy.

articles.title: Liberty Energy Will Develop Gas-Fired Power for Data Center Group
articles.summary: Liberty Energy, a Denver-based oil and gas company, has partnered with Vantage Data Centers to develop natural gas-fired power solutions for data centers. This partnership aims to provide utility-scale, high-efficiency power for Vantage's expansion of its North American portfolio. The collaboration marks an effort by Liberty Energy to diversify into the renewable energy sector.
key_takeaways: Liberty Energy and Vantage Data Centers are collaborating on a project to develop gas-fired power solutions for data centers.
The partnership aims to provide high-efficiency, utility-scale power for Vantage's expansion in the North American region.
This collaboration represents Liberty Energy's entry into the renewable energy sector, diversifying its business beyond traditional oil and gas operations.

articles.title: Tata Power Commissions 1.4-Gigawatt Solar Farm Just Before Year End
articles.summary: Tata Power has commissioned a 1.4-gigawatt solar power plant in Rajasthan, India, marking the largest solar power project undertaken by the company to date. The INR 54.9 billion ($611 million) investment will produce approximately 2.454 TWh of electricity annually. This milestone signifies significant progress in India's renewable energy sector.
key_takeaways: Tata Power has commissioned a 1.4-gigawatt solar power plant, which is the largest project undertaken by the company to date.
The INR 54.9 billion ($611 million) investment will generate approximately 2.454 TWh of electricity annually, showcasing India's growing commitment to renewable energy.
This milestone highlights Tata Power's role in contributing to India's ambitious renewable energy targets and demonstrates the company's focus on sustainable development.

articles.title: The Data Center Boom Is Concentrated in the U.S.
articles.summary: The article states that more than half of upcoming global data centers will be developed in the United States, with power usage varying widely depending on factors such as land availability and services provided. Data centers in the US are larger on average compared to those in other countries due to these factors. The dataset used for analysis may undercount new Chinese data centers, which are not always publicly announced.
key_takeaways: More than half of upcoming global data centers will be developed in the United States.
Power usage and size of data centers vary widely among countries, with US data centers being larger on average due to factors such as land availability and services provided.
The dataset used for analysis may undercount new Chinese data centers, which are often not publicly announced.
Data centers in the US are likely ahead of China and other parts of the world in terms of development and growth.

articles.title: First Japanese Floating Offshore Wind Farm Comes Online
articles.summary: A 16.8-MW floating offshore wind farm, the Goto Floating Wind Farm, has come online in Japan, marking the country's first commercial application of a hybrid SPAR-type floater technology. This milestone represents a significant step forward for the country's renewable energy sector and its commitment to reducing carbon emissions. The project partners include some of Japan's biggest names in energy.
key_takeaways: The Goto Floating Wind Farm is Japan's first commercial floating offshore wind farm, utilizing hybrid SPAR-type floater technology.
This innovation marks a significant milestone for Japan's renewable energy sector and its efforts to reduce carbon emissions.
The project partners include prominent Japanese energy companies, highlighting the country's growing commitment to clean energy.

articles.title: Can Restructured Markets Meet the Challenge of Data Center Demand Growth?
articles.summary: The power and energy systems face a significant challenge in meeting the growing demand for electricity from data centers. The lack of new generation capacity, particularly baseload power sources like combined cycle gas, is putting pressure on existing infrastructure to meet reliability requirements. FERC and RTO markets are grappling with how to address this issue, particularly with regards to financing and building new power plants.
key_takeaways: The growth in demand from data centers has not been matched by the build-out of new generation capacity, leading to a reliability crisis in PJM and other RTO markets.
Financing is a primary driver behind the inability to meet this demand, with baseload generation sources like combined cycle gas being particularly difficult to bring online.

Wind and solar power, while important for grid resilience, are not sufficient on their own to meet the 99.999% reliable power requirements of data centers, highlighting the need for more diversified and resilient energy infrastructure.

articles.title: Engie asks CEC to pause review of 1GWh Compass Energy Storage project in order to consider alternative sites
articles.summary: Engie's North American arm has requested the California Energy Commission to pause the review of its Compass Energy Storage project in Orange County, citing a need to assess alternative development sites. This move suggests that Engie may be reconsidering its original site selection due to potential issues or concerns. The pause in the review process will likely provide Engie with more time to explore other options.
key_takeaways: Engie is seeking alternative development sites for its Compass Energy Storage project, indicating a possible change of plans or concerns about the original location.
The request to pause the review process suggests that Engie wants to reassess the feasibility and suitability of its proposed site in Orange County.
This development may be a response to potential issues or challenges related to the original site selection, such as environmental concerns, regulatory hurdles, or market factors.

articles.title: China begins construction of two new nuclear power units
articles.summary: China has begun construction on two new nuclear power units, marking the start of work on CAP1000 reactors at the Bailong and Lufeng plants in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region and Guangdong province, respectively. The project involves pouring concrete for unit 1 at Bailong and unit 2 at Lufeng. This marks an official start to construction on these two new nuclear power units.
key_takeaways: China is expanding its nuclear power capacity with the construction of two new CAP1000 reactors.
The construction of these reactors will provide a significant increase in the country's nuclear energy output, contributing to its growing energy demands.
The Bailong and Lufeng plants are part of China's efforts to diversify its energy mix and reduce reliance on fossil fuels.

articles.title: Google acquires data centre and energy developer Intersect for US$4.75 billion
articles.summary: Alphabet, the parent company of Google, has announced a definitive agreement to acquire Intersect Power, a data centre and energy developer, for US$4.75 billion. This acquisition aims to strengthen Alphabet's presence in the renewable energy sector and expand its offerings in the field of clean energy. The deal is expected to enhance Alphabet's ability to develop and manage large-scale clean energy projects.
key_takeaways: Google's acquisition of Intersect Power underscores its commitment to investing in the renewable energy sector, particularly in data centre development.
The deal is likely to result in increased deployment of solar and wind power, contributing to a more sustainable energy mix.
This acquisition may also lead to improved efficiency and cost-effectiveness in large-scale clean energy projects, benefiting Alphabet's various businesses.

articles.title: ESIG task force recommends transmission reforms for a more reliable, efficient grid
articles.summary: The ESIG task force recommends transmission reforms to create a more reliable and efficient grid, with scenario-based planning potentially reducing over-building and easing permitting challenges. This approach aims to balance the need for modernization with the costs associated with new infrastructure development. By considering multiple scenarios, experts hope to minimize waste and optimize investment.
key_takeaways: Scenario-based planning can help reduce over-building of transmission infrastructure by considering various development scenarios.
Input from state officials may facilitate easier permitting processes later in development, allowing for more efficient project timelines.
The task force's recommendations aim to strike a balance between modernizing the grid and controlling costs associated with new infrastructure development.

articles.title: ISO-NE proposes capacity market overhaul with shift to ‘prompt’ auction
articles.summary: ISO-NE proposes a significant overhaul of its capacity market framework, shifting from long-term three-year forecasts to more accurate "prompt" auctions that buy capacity a month ahead. This change aims to improve the grid operator's load forecasts and key metrics. The proposed shift is expected to enhance the reliability and efficiency of New England's power system.
key_takeaways: ISO-NE plans to transition from buying capacity three years in advance to more accurate "prompt" auctions that purchase capacity a month ahead.
This change is intended to improve the grid operator's load forecasts and other key metrics, enhancing the overall reliability and efficiency of New England's power system.
The proposed overhaul aims to address potential issues with long-term forecasting and ensure a more agile response to changes in energy demand.

articles.title: EcoFlow New Year Sale takes up to 65% off power stations + flash sale, MOD e-bikes up to $400 off, Jackery exclusive, Aiper, more
articles.summary: The EcoFlow New Year Sale is offering up to 65% discounts on power stations and accessories, with some products starting as low as $229. Additionally, there are flash sales on other products such as MOD e-bikes and Jackery power stations. The sale also includes exclusive deals and CES 2026 reveals.
key_takeaways: Up to 65% discounts are available on EcoFlow power stations and accessories during the New Year Sale.
MOD e-bikes are on sale with up to $400 off, starting from $1,799.
Aiper offers budget-friendly pool cleaners at a discounted price, as part of the sale.

articles.title: Can new hydro development help Tajikistan’s VMKB province meet rising demand?
articles.summary: The article discusses the potential of new hydroelectric development to meet increasing energy demand in VMKB province, Tajikistan, through a Power System Plan 2025-2050. The plan was presented by the Hydropower Sustainability Alliance at a ministerial meeting. This initiative aims to ensure sustainable and reliable energy supply for the region.
key_takeaways: New hydroelectric development is proposed as a solution to meet rising energy demand in VMKB province, Tajikistan.
The Power System Plan 2025-2050 outlines strategies for sustainable energy management and infrastructure development in the region.
The initiative aims to balance energy supply with environmental concerns and ensure reliable energy supply for the province's growing population.

articles.title: Industrial batteries in France earn revenue through secondary reserve
articles.summary: Storio Energy has successfully enabled behind-the-meter industrial battery systems to participate in the automatic Frequency Restoration Reserve (aFRR) service in France, a milestone that previously saw front-of-the-meter storage dominate this service. This achievement marks a significant step towards integrating behind-the-meter batteries into grid stability efforts. Storio's innovative approach aims to demonstrate that these batteries can contribute to grid stability despite technical challenges.
key_takeaways: Behind-the-meter industrial battery systems are now participating in the Frequency Restoration Reserve (aFRR) service in France, previously dominated by front-of-the-meter storage.
The introduction of behind-the-meter batteries into aFRR is made possible by Storio Energy's innovative solution to address technical challenges related to metering and real-time monitoring.

This development marks a significant step towards integrating industrial batteries more widely into grid stability efforts, enabling them to contribute to frequency stabilization despite traditional limitations.

articles.title: Verge unveils 370-mile electric motorcycle with solid state battery; sounds too good to be true?
articles.summary: Verge Motorcycles has unveiled its electric motorcycle, the first production model to feature solid-state batteries. This technology promises improved range and charging speed, with a claimed range of up to 370 miles. The company is positioning itself as a leader in electric motorcycles.
key_takeaways: Verge Motorcycles claims to be launching the "world's first" production motorcycle equipped with solid-state batteries.
The use of solid-state batteries could provide significant improvements in range and charging speed for electric motorcycles.
The company's innovative design, including its hubless rear wheel, is also a notable feature of its product.

articles.title: Zelestra’s solar-plus-storage Spain offtake deal is ‘PPA 2.0’, firm says
articles.summary: The article discusses a recent power purchase agreement (PPA) deal between IPP Zelestra and utility EDP for a solar-plus-storage project in Spain. This deal is considered a milestone as it marks the first PPA of its kind in Europe, representing "PPA 2.0". The arrangement signifies a significant move forward in the market.
key_takeaways: The PPA deal between Zelestra and EDP for a solar-plus-storage project in Spain was the first of its kind in Europe.
This agreement represents "PPA 2.0", indicating an evolution in the market with more innovative and comprehensive arrangements.
The arrangement signifies a significant move forward in the market, marking a milestone in the adoption of solar-plus-storage solutions in European power markets.

articles.title: India: KPI Group, POWERGRID win VGF-supported BESS tenders in Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh
articles.summary: KPI Green Energy Ltd and Power Grid Corporation of India have won tenders for large-scale battery storage projects in Gujarat and Andhra Pradesh, supported by the VGF (Visvesvaraya Gramin Bank). The wins are significant as they mark a major step forward for India's renewable energy sector. The two companies will implement BESS (Battery Energy Storage System) projects to enhance grid resilience.
key_takeaways: KPI Green Energy Ltd and Power Grid Corporation of India have won tenders for large-scale battery storage projects in Gujarat and Andhra Pradesh, marking a significant development in India's renewable energy sector.
The VGF is supporting these projects through competitive solicitations, which demonstrates the growing interest in energy storage solutions in the country.
These wins are expected to enhance grid resilience and contribute to India's transition towards a low-carbon economy.

articles.title: Spain allocates funding for 9.4 GWh of large-scale storage projects
articles.summary: Spain has allocated €818.3 million in European Union funding to 126 energy storage projects, which will add 2.2 GW of power output and 9.4 GWh of storage capacity. This is a result of the Spanish Ministry for Ecological Transition and Demographic Challenge's (MITECO) call for proposals, which attracted over 1,700 applications. The funding will support various types of energy storage projects, including hybrid, standalone batteries, thermal storage, and pumped storage.
key_takeaways: Spain is investing heavily in large-scale energy storage projects, with a total capacity of 9.4 GWh, which is expected to play a crucial role in the country's renewable energy transition.
Hybrid storage projects dominate the selected projects, followed by standalone batteries, thermal storage, and pumped storage, highlighting the versatility of different energy storage technologies.

The funding will primarily support solar (38 projects) and wind (18 projects) power generation, indicating a strong focus on pairing renewable energy sources with energy storage to ensure a stable grid.

articles.title: India’s 2025 renewable energy sector review: capacity growth and constraints
articles.summary: India's renewable energy sector has experienced significant growth in 2025, with over 40 GW of new solar and wind installations, transforming the country into one of the world's lowest-cost renewable energy markets. This expansionary trend is driven by rapid solar and wind deployment, scaling up of domestic solar manufacturing, and project momentum across various segments. Despite this progress, grid constraints, power contracting delays, and supply chain risks continue to affect project execution.
key_takeaways: India added over 40 GW of new solar and wind capacity in 2025, further solidifying its position as a global clean energy leader.
The country's domestic solar manufacturing sector has seen significant growth, with module and cell manufacturing capacity crossing 175 GW and 30 GW marks, respectively.
Grid constraints, power contracting delays, and supply chain risks remain challenges for the renewable energy sector in India, affecting project execution.

articles.title: Google acquires Intersect Power for nearly $5 billion
articles.summary:
**SUMMARY**
Google has agreed to acquire Intersect Power, a solar and storage developer, for nearly $5 billion. The acquisition aims to enable Google to bypass grid bottlenecks and build energy parks that co-locate data centers with generation and battery energy storage assets. This move represents a significant step by Google in its efforts to scale its AI operations rapidly.

**KEY TAKEAWAYS**

* **Google acquires a renewable energy developer**: For the first time, a Big Tech firm has directly acquired a major renewable energy developer, giving Google control over Intersect Power's solar and storage assets.
* **Energy parks to mitigate grid congestion**: The acquisition is expected to help Google build "energy parks" that co-locate data centers with generation and battery energy storage assets, reducing the strain on public grids and enabling faster scaling of AI operations.
* **Significant scale and capacity**: Intersect Power currently manages $15 billion in assets and has a portfolio of 2.2 GW of solar and 2.4 GWh of battery energy storage, with plans to expand its capacity to 10.8 GW by 2028.

articles.title: Greece struggling to connect grid-scale battery storage projects
articles.summary: Greece has awarded permits for over 900 MW of standalone battery storage projects through three auctions, but none have been successfully connected to the grid. Despite having installed approximately 300 MW of awarded capacity, the lack of grid connection remains a significant issue. The reasons behind this delay are currently unclear.
key_takeaways: Greece has awarded permits for over 1 GW (900 MW + 300 MW) of standalone battery storage projects through three auctions, but none have been successfully connected to the grid.

The country's renewable energy development is hindered by the lack of progress in connecting these projects to the grid, which could impact its ability to integrate more renewable energy sources into its power mix.
The delay in connecting these projects has left Greece facing uncertainty and delays in its efforts to increase its use of battery storage as a means to stabilize the grid.

articles.title: Gujarat Supercharges Hydrogen Production with Bold 100 GW Renewable Targets
articles.summary: Gujarat is making a bold move to become a leading player in global sustainable energy, aiming to produce 100 GW of renewable capacity by 2030 and 3 million tonnes per annum (MMTPA) of green hydrogen by 2035. The state has launched three new policies to achieve this goal, covering the entire clean power value chain, including solar, wind, hybrid projects, electrolyzer rollout, hydrogen production storage, and pumped hydro storage. Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel is pushing Gujarat as a real Indian heavyweight in global sustainable energy arenas.
key_takeaways: Gujarat has set ambitious targets of 100 GW of renewable capacity by 2030, which would be 13 GW per year, to keep pace with its existing 30 GW base.
The state has launched three new policies: Integrated Renewable Energy Policy-2025, Green Hydrogen Policy-2025, and Pump Storage Project Policy, to drive clean energy production and storage.
Gujarat's goals align with India's overall target of 500 GW of non-fossil generation by 2030 and zero emissions by 2070 under the Panchamrit pledge.

articles.title: Japanese airport terminal hosting chalcopyrite solar modules
articles.summary: The Japanese airport terminal Fukuoka International Airport is hosting a demonstration project using flexible, glass-free chalcopyrite solar modules provided by PXP Corporation. The project aims to test the performance of these innovative panels, which are part of Kyuden Mirai Energy and Nissan Motor's renewable energy initiatives. The modules have been installed on the airport terminal roof and will be used to power various devices such as vending machines and smartphone chargers.
key_takeaways: PXP Corporation has developed glass-free flexible chalcopyrite PV panels, which are 0.6mm thick and weigh 0.7kg/m2, offering a new option for the renewable energy sector.
The chalcopyrite solar panels have been successfully used in two separate projects: one at Fukuoka International Airport and another at a Nissan Motor Corporation car dealership in Yokohama City.

These innovative panels have achieved high efficiency rates, with some modules reaching an efficiency of 12.25% as reported by PXP Corporation, offering promising potential for future renewable energy applications.

articles.title: Green Hydrogen Production Expands to Namibia with Plug Power’s 5 MW GenEco Electrolyzer
articles.summary:
**SUMMARY**
The article reports on the expansion of green hydrogen production in Namibia with Plug Power's 5 MW GenEco Electrolyzer at Walvis Bay. The facility, powered entirely by renewables, is one of Africa's first fully integrated commercial green hydrogen facilities and sets a blueprint for ports across the continent to reduce fossil fuel use and carbon emissions. The electrolyzer produces high-purity hydrogen for use in yard trucks, cargo cranes, and small vessels.

**KEY TAKEAWAYS**
* Plug Power's 5 MW GenEco Electrolyzer at Walvis Bay is one of Africa's first fully integrated commercial green hydrogen facilities, powered entirely by renewables.
* The facility produces approximately two tons of green hydrogen per day, enough to keep over 40 heavy-duty port trucks rolling 24/7.
* The electrolyzer uses electricity from adjacent solar arrays and wind farms, with the oxygen byproduct being either vented safely or captured for industrial purposes.

articles.title: University of Tulsa, Hurricane Ventures Back Tobe Energy’s Breakthrough in Hydrogen Production
articles.summary: The University of Tulsa and its venture arm, Hurricane Ventures, have backed Tobe Energy, a clean hydrogen startup co-founded by alumni Colby DeWeese and Caleb Lareau. This partnership aims to support next-generation hydrogen production, leveraging federal incentives designed to reduce heavy-industry emissions. The collaboration will focus on testing the efficiency and feasibility of Tobe Energy's membrane-free electrolyzer technology.
key_takeaways: Tobe Energy has developed a membrane-free electrolyzer with 94.7% wall-to-plug efficiency, which is faster and less cooling-intensive compared to traditional systems.
The company's innovation involves using a caustic electrolyte bath and stainless steel electrodes, resulting in reduced capital and operating costs of up to 75%.
The Zeeco's Broken Arrow campus will serve as the proving ground for Tobe Energy's technology, undergoing stress-testing and real-world performance evaluation.

articles.title: Hydrogen Fuel Cells Power Vinssen’s Hydro Zenith in South Korea’s Zero-Emission Push
articles.summary: The Hydro Zenith, a hydrogen fuel cell-powered boat, has successfully completed its maiden voyage in South Korea's Yeongam test facility. Powered by two 100 kW proton exchange membrane (PEM) hydrogen fuel cells and four lithium-ion battery packs, the vessel showcases a hybrid setup that balances range, reliability, and responsiveness. This achievement highlights Vinssen's innovative fuel cell technology for marine vessels.
key_takeaways: The Hydro Zenith is South Korea's first hydrogen fuel cell-powered boat built under interim rules from the Ministry of Oceans and Fisheries, demonstrating the country's push towards zero-emission operations.
Vinssen has developed a proprietary Titanium Bipolar Plate PEM (proton exchange membrane) stack for marine vessels, which is lighter and more durable than traditional designs.

The Hydro Zenith features a hybrid setup combining hydrogen fuel cells with lithium-ion batteries, allowing for efficient balancing of power and energy storage, as well as improved range, reliability, and responsiveness.

articles.title: Huawei, Sungrow lead Wood Mackenzie’s inverter market ranking
articles.summary: Huawei and Sungrow top the Wood Mackenzie's global solar inverter ranking, followed by SMA, Fronius, Ginlong/Solis, GoodWe, TMEIC, SolarEdge, Aiswei/Solplanet, and Enphase. The top 10 manufacturers account for 71% of the global market share, indicating increased confidence in product longevity and commitment to matching solar module lifespan. The companies also demonstrate strong sustainability efforts, with six among them holding an EcoVadis ranking of silver or higher.
key_takeaways: The top 10 leading solar inverter manufacturers have a combined 71% global market share, reflecting the dominance of Chinese manufacturers in the industry.
Almost all of the top 10 companies (8 out of 10) are reinvesting more than 6% of their revenue in sustainability and social responsibility initiatives.
The ranking highlights the growing importance of product longevity, with all top 10 manufacturers offering warranty extensions of 20 years or more.

articles.title: France, Germany, Italy break solar records in December
articles.summary: France, Germany, and Italy have broken records for solar production in December, with Germany reaching a record high of 87 GWh on Christmas Day. The three countries achieved the same feat three days later, registering 66 GWh and 54 GWh respectively. This increase in solar energy production has had a downward influence on electricity prices in many markets.
key_takeaways: Germany broke its record for solar production on Christmas Day, reaching 87 GWh, while Italy and France achieved the same feat three days later.
The trend of increasing solar energy production is expected to continue in Italy and Spain, but decline in Germany.
The increase in solar energy production has driven down electricity prices in many markets, with weekly averages below €85/MWh in most cases.

articles.title: China strengthens intellectual property protection in solar industry
articles.summary: Chinese authorities are strengthening intellectual property protection in the solar industry to promote a fair and orderly market environment. This move aims to encourage technological advancements and reserve basic patents for developing technologies such as perovskites and tandem.
key_takeaways: Chinese authorities are implementing stronger intellectual property protection measures in the solar industry to promote a fair market environment.
The government is encouraging enterprises to accelerate technological advancements in key areas such as TOPCon, back-contract (BC), and heterojunction (HJT) PV technologies.

Key policy tasks include improving patent pre-examination efficiency, strengthening IP risk monitoring, and handling administrative adjudication of disputes to promote the healthy development of the photovoltaic industry.

articles.title: Hydrogen Fuel Cells Stocks Surge on Analyst Optimism and Industrial Decarbonization
articles.summary: The article reports that hydrogen fuel cell stocks are experiencing a surge in value, driven by growing optimism about the industry's potential for industrial decarbonization and increasing demand for clean energy solutions. Analysts predict a significant growth in the global fuel cell technology market, with market research firms estimating a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 26.3% from 2025 to 2030. key_takeaways: The global fuel cell technology market is expected to experience significant growth, with analysts predicting a CAGR of 26.3% from 2025 to 2030.

Jackery's new product lineup aims to cater to outdoor enthusiasts and individuals who use power stations in real-world scenarios, rather than just storing them indoors.

articles.title: From Riverboats To Global Ports: CATL Is Winning The Shipping Electrification Race

This deployment suggests that shipping companies are adopting electric propulsion, which is often challenging due to safety, longevity, and certification concerns. articles.title: FERC Pulls Mich. Dam License After 15 Years of Safety Shortcomings
articles.summary:
**SUMMARY**
The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) has revoked the operating license for the Au Train Dam in Michigan's Upper Peninsula, citing a failure to address safety issues that could put lives at risk. The dam, which was built in the early 1900s, had been operated by UP Hydro since 2010 without addressing inadequate spillway capacity, a condition of FERC's transfer of the license. The revocation caps a tumultuous year for the dam and its owners.

**KEY TAKEAWAYS**
* FERC has revoked the operating license for the Au Train Dam in Michigan due to safety shortcomings that could cost lives.
* The dam's owner, UP Hydro, had failed to address inadequate spillway capacity, a condition of FERC's transfer of the license, despite warning from regulatory agencies.
* The revocation shifts oversight of the dam to the Michigan Department of Environment, Great Lakes and Energy (EGLE), which had previously warned about the dam's safety issues.

articles.title: Convoy – electric semi brand SANY pairs autonomy with human experience
articles.summary: SANY, a Chinese equipment and heavy truck brand, is introducing an electric semi-truck convoy system that pairs autonomy with human experience by having a seasoned driver in the lead vehicle accompanied by up to four autonomous trucks programmed to follow their lead. This approach allows for a balance between automation and human oversight, mitigating potential risks associated with fully self-driving trucks. By combining technology with experienced human drivers, SANY aims to improve safety and efficiency.
key_takeaways: SANY is using a convoy system where a seasoned driver leads the way in an electric semi-truck, accompanied by up to four autonomous heavy trucks.
This approach allows for a balance between automation and human oversight, mitigating potential risks associated with fully self-driving trucks.
By combining technology with experienced human drivers, SANY aims to improve safety and efficiency in its electric semi-trucks.

articles.title: Trump’s year of offshore wind carnage
articles.summary: The article discusses the impact of Donald Trump's presidency on offshore wind energy, particularly in terms of policy changes and legal actions that hindered the development of wind farms. Despite initial skepticism about Trump's commitment to dismantling offshore wind, he made significant moves to undermine the industry. His policies and actions had a detrimental effect on the growth of offshore wind energy.
key_takeaways: Trump's administration took steps to limit the leasing of federal waters for offshore wind farms, making it more difficult for developers to secure permits.

The article mentions the infamous legal fight over a wind farm off the coast of Trump's golf course in Scotland, which suggests that Trump was actively involved in blocking or halting wind energy projects on his personal properties.

Trump's policies and actions were seen as part of a broader effort to dismantle offshore wind energy development, with potential long-term consequences for the environment and the renewable energy sector.
The article implies that Trump's actions had a negative impact on the growth of offshore wind energy, suggesting that he was not committed to supporting or promoting the industry.

articles.title: Cyberscurity Threats and Defense Mechanisms in IoT network
articles.summary: The article discusses the growing cybersecurity challenges posed by the rapid proliferation of Internet of Things (IoT) devices, which are projected to reach 30 billion by 2030. The study analyzes vulnerabilities and threats in IoT networks, highlighting critical threat categories such as sensor vulnerabilities and public cloud insecurity. It also explores advanced defense mechanisms leveraging Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, and Zero Trust Architecture.
key_takeaways: Critical threat categories identified in the study include sensor vulnerabilities, Denial-of-Service (DoS) attacks, and public cloud insecurity.
Advanced defense approaches highlighted include Artificial Intelligence for anomaly detection, Blockchain for decentralized trust, and Zero Trust Architecture for continuous verification.
The study contributes a novel five-layer IoT model and outlines future research directions involving quantum computing and 6G networks to bolster IoT ecosystem resilience.

articles.title: Impact Assessment of Heterogeneous Grid Support Functions in Smart Inverter Deployments
articles.summary: The article examines the impact of heterogeneous smart inverter (SI) groups operating under different control modes on grid stability and efficiency. With increasing penetration of distributed energy resources, uncoordinated control modes can lead to adverse interactions, compromising system stability. This study assesses the dynamic interactions among multiple SI groups using a real-time setup and simulation platform.
key_takeaways: The use of heterogeneous smart inverters (SIs) operating under different control modes, such as Constant Power Factor (CPF), Volt-VAR, and Volt-Watt modes, can lead to adverse interactions in low-voltage distribution networks.
Uncoordinated control modes can compromise system efficiency, voltage regulation, and overall stability, particularly with increasing penetration of distributed energy resources.
The study highlights the need for coordinated inverter control and optimal dispatch strategies to mitigate these adverse interactions and ensure grid stability.

articles.title: Stochastic Actor-Critic: Mitigating Overestimation via Temporal Aleatoric Uncertainty
articles.summary:
Here is the analysis of the article:

 The article proposes a new algorithm called Stochastic Actor-Critic (STAC) that aims to mitigate overestimation in off-policy actor-critic methods for reinforcement learning. STAC incorporates temporal aleatoric uncertainty into its critic network, which naturally leads to risk-averse behavior in stochastic environments. By using a single distributional critic network and dropout regularization, STAC achieves improved computational efficiency.
key_takeaways: Current methods address overestimation by introducing pessimistic bias based on epistemic uncertainty, but this can be limiting due to data and model ambiguity.

The proposed Stochastic Actor-Critic (STAC) algorithm incorporates temporal aleatoric uncertainty into its critic network, which naturally mitigates overestimation without relying on epistemic uncertainty.
STAC achieves improved training stability and performance through the use of dropout regularization, resulting in improved computational efficiency with a single distributional critic network.

articles.title: Optimal Transport-Based Decentralized Multi-Agent Distribution Matching
articles.summary: The article presents an optimal transport-based decentralized control framework for distribution matching in multi-agent systems. The framework reformulates the global optimization problem into a tractable per-agent decision process, enabling each agent to achieve its desired terminal locations using locally available information. Simulation results demonstrate the effectiveness and scalability of the proposed framework.
key_takeaways: The article formulates the distribution-matching objective using optimal transport (Wasserstein distance) as a principled measure of distributional discrepancy.

A sequential weight-update rule is introduced to construct feasible local transport plans, and a memory-based correction mechanism maintains reliable operation under intermittent and range-limited communication.
Convergence guarantees are established for both linear and nonlinear agent dynamics, showing cycle-wise improvement of a surrogate transport cost.

articles.title: NMPC-Augmented Visual Navigation and Safe Learning Control for Large-Scale Mobile Robots
articles.summary: The article presents a comprehensive navigation and control framework for large-scale mobile robots (LSMRs) that operate on loose, unconsolidated terrain. The proposed architecture comprises four main modules: visual pose estimation, high-level nonlinear model predictive control, low-level deep neural network control policy, and logarithmic safety module. This framework ensures stability and safety-defined performance, delivering robust operation on slip-prone terrain.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a comprehensive navigation and control framework for LSMRs that leverages high-performance techniques to ensure stable and safe operation on slip-prone terrain.

The proposed architecture comprises four main modules: visual pose estimation, high-level nonlinear model predictive control, low-level deep neural network control policy, and logarithmic safety module, which work together to guarantee stability and safety.

The framework is designed to handle out-of-distribution disturbances and ensures uniform exponential stability of the actuation subsystem, while also monitoring the entire robot stack for safe operation.

articles.title: Safety for Weakly-Hard Control Systems via Graph-Based Barrier Functions
articles.summary: The article discusses a novel approach to ensure safety in control systems that are prone to communication and computational failures. A new notion of graph-based barrier functions is introduced to address this issue, providing constraints that guarantee system safety despite packet dropouts or computational overruns. The proposed method offers a trade-off between conservativeness and computational tractability.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a novel approach to safety verification and controller synthesis for control systems with weakly-hard constraints, which can tolerate limited failures within a given time horizon.

Graph-based barrier functions are introduced as a specific solution to address communication failures in networked control systems, providing safety guarantees despite packet dropouts or computational overruns.

The proposed method offers trade-offs between conservativeness and computational tractability, making it an attractive solution for improving the reliability of safety-critical engineering applications.

articles.title: Next Generation Intelligent Low-Altitude Economy Deployments: The O-RAN Perspective
articles.summary: The article discusses the development of an open radio access network (O-RAN)-enabled low-altitude economy (LAE) framework that leverages AI and machine learning to facilitate seamless coordination between aerial nodes in complex environments. The proposed architecture aims to address fundamental challenges in LAE applications, including real-time orchestration and limited integration of AI specialized for LAE missions. This framework is evaluated using a semantic-aware rApp and reinforcement learning-enabled xApp.
key_takeaways: The article proposes an O-RAN-enabled LAE framework that integrates AI-powered coordination between aerial nodes, facilitating closed-loop, AI-optimized operations in complex environments.
A semantic-aware rApp acts as a terrain interpreter, providing guidance to a reinforcement learning-enabled xApp for real-time trajectory planning of LAE swarm nodes.
The proposed architecture aims to address fundamental challenges in LAE applications, including real-time orchestration and limited integration of AI specialized for LAE missions.

articles.title: From 2D to 3D terrain-following area coverage path planning
articles.summary: The article presents an algorithm for 3D terrain-following area coverage path planning, which generates multiple adjacent paths that are both spatially and temporally coordinated. The complexities of the algorithm are highlighted compared to its 2D equivalent, including the use of Inverse Distance Weighting-approach for elevation data generation. Real-world results from an agricultural context validate the effectiveness of the algorithm.
key_takeaways: The algorithm generates multiple adjacent paths that meet both spatial and temporal coordination requirements.
Uniformly spaced elevation data is generated using an Inverse Distance Weighting-approach, which is a local search method.
The 3D terrain-following area coverage path planning algorithm has been validated through real-world results in an agricultural context.

articles.title: FirstEnergy: Power Grid Upgrade Underway in Pennsylvania’s Lehigh and Berks Counties
articles.summary: FirstEnergy is undertaking a significant upgrade of its power grid in Lehigh and Berks Counties, Pennsylvania, with the goal of improving reliability through a 15-mile transmission line rebuild and substation upgrades. This effort aims to enhance the stability and efficiency of the region's electrical infrastructure. The project is part of FirstEnergy's broader efforts to modernize its transmission system.
key_takeaways: A 15-mile transmission line rebuild is being undertaken as part of the power grid upgrade, indicating a significant investment in the infrastructure.
Substation upgrades are also included in the project, suggesting that the focus is on improving the overall reliability and stability of the electrical system.
The upgrade aims to improve power grid efficiency, implying that FirstEnergy is working to optimize energy transmission and distribution in the region.

The project's implementation is seen as a significant step towards reducing California's carbon footprint.
key_takeaways: The Westlands Water District has identified land that can no longer be used for irrigated agriculture in San Joaquin Valley, California, to be repurposed for solar power generation.
The planned 21-gigawatt solar power plant would significantly contribute to the state's renewable energy goals and help reduce carbon emissions.

This project represents a notable example of how land that was once dedicated to agricultural use can be transformed into a hub for clean energy production, promoting sustainable development in California.

articles.title: FERC Orders PJM to Clarify Rules for Data Centers Co-Located With Power Plants
articles.summary: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) has ordered PJM to clarify its rules for data centers co-located with power plants, citing a lack of clarity in the tariff that could impact reliability and consumer protection. This move aims to prevent potential reliability issues and mitigate negative impacts on consumers.
key_takeaways: FERC has directed PJM to revise its rules for co-located data centers, citing a lack of clarity in the tariff that could impact reliability and consumer protection.
The commission is concerned about large loads from data centers, which could compromise grid reliability if not properly addressed.
The revisions are aimed at ensuring that data centers are subject to reasonable standards, protecting both reliability and consumers.

articles.title: Adaptive Learning Guided by Bias-Noise-Alignment Diagnostics
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel adaptive learning framework that explicitly models error evolution in nonstationary and safety-critical environments. This framework, known as bias-noise-alignment diagnostics, decomposes the error signal into its temporal structure, capturing persistent drift, stochastic variability, and repeated directional excitation. By incorporating these diagnostics, the proposed framework provides a unifying control backbone for various optimization and reinforcement learning methods.
key_takeaways: The proposed bias-noise-alignment diagnostics framework explicitly models the temporal structure of the error signal, providing a new perspective on error evolution in adaptive learning.

The framework offers a unifying control backbone for supervised optimization, actor-critic reinforcement learning, and learned optimizers, providing a potential solution to instability, slow convergence, or brittle adaptation issues in dynamic environments.
The work establishes bounded effective updates and stability properties under standard smoothness assumptions, making it a reliable foundation for adaptive learning in dynamic environments.

articles.title: Bayesian Subspace Identification in the MIMO Case

A new framework is proposed, which includes derivations of equivariant priors and posterior distributions specifically suited for MIMO systems. The approach is validated through numerical results on the DAISY dataset.
key_takeaways: The article investigates a Bayesian Subspace System Identification method tailored for Multiple-Input Multiple-Output (MIMO) systems.
New derivations are presented, including equivariant priors and posterior distributions specifically designed for the MIMO framework.
Numerical validation of the approach is reported using the DAISY dataset.

articles.title: Waste-to-Energy-Coupled AI Data Centers: Cooling Efficiency and Grid Resilience
articles.summary: This article proposes a novel Waste-to-Energy-AI Data Center (WtE-AIDC) configuration that integrates energy production and cooling, aiming to improve the efficiency of AI data centers. The system uses low-grade waste thermal output for absorption cooling, reducing the reliance on electricity for cooling. By modeling the coupled system as an input-output "black box", the authors evaluate its thermoeconomic superiority and provide a computable prototype for decision-making.
key_takeaways: The WtE-AIDC configuration can improve cooling efficiency by using low-grade waste thermal output to power absorption cooling, thereby reducing the electricity burden for cooling.
Three key determinants govern thermoeconomic superiority: (i) cooling coverage of IT heat load, (ii) parasitic electricity for transport and auxiliaries, and (iii) distance-driven delivery decay.

The proposed system provides a siting-ready feasibility condition for WtE-AIDC coupling in urban AI corridors under grid stress, enabling decision-makers to evaluate its benefits through computable prototypes and ESG valuation channels.

articles.title: BatteryAgent: Synergizing Physics-Informed Interpretation with LLM Reasoning for Intelligent Battery Fault Diagnosis
articles.summary: The article proposes BatteryAgent, a novel framework that combines physics-informed interpretation with Large Language Models (LLMs) for intelligent battery fault diagnosis. The framework addresses the limitations of existing deep learning methods, which often lack interpretability and provide only binary classification results. By integrating physical knowledge features with LLM reasoning capabilities, BatteryAgent aims to provide root cause analysis and maintenance recommendations.
key_takeaways: BatteryAgent integrates 10 mechanism-based features derived from electrochemical principles into its framework, balancing dimensionality reduction with physical fidelity.
The framework employs Gradient Boosting Decision Trees and SHAP to quantify feature contributions, allowing for a more comprehensive understanding of fault types and root causes.

BatteryAgent achieves an AUROC of 0.986, outperforming current state-of-the-art methods in correcting misclassifications on hard boundary samples and providing intelligent diagnosis for battery safety management.

articles.title: Control of Microrobots with Reinforcement Learning under On-Device Compute Constraints

They also introduce a resource-aware gait scheduling viewpoint to optimize the selection of gait modes for maximum expected reward within the device's power budget.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a compact RL policy for microrobot locomotion that can be deployed on ultra-small systems-on-chip, enabling lower latency control under compute constraints.
The authors introduce domain randomization and integer quantization to enhance robustness and inference efficiency of the RL policy, respectively.
A resource-aware gait scheduling viewpoint is proposed to optimize the selection of gait modes within a device's power budget, maximizing expected RL reward at feasible update frequencies.

articles.title: A Graph Neural Network with Auxiliary Task Learning for Missing PMU Data Reconstruction
articles.summary: This article proposes an auxiliary task learning (ATL) method for reconstructing missing phasor measurement unit (PMU) data in wide-area measurement systems, addressing limitations of existing data-driven methods. The proposed method leverages a graph neural network with two complementary sub-networks to extract spatial-temporal dependencies and utilize low-rank properties of PMU data. This approach enables robustness under high missing rates and incomplete observability.
key_takeaways: The article proposes an auxiliary task learning (ATL) method for reconstructing missing PMU data in WAMS, addressing limitations of existing methods.
The proposed method uses a graph neural network with two complementary sub-networks to extract spatial-temporal dependencies and utilize low-rank properties of PMU data.
The approach enables robustness under high missing rates and incomplete observability, making it suitable for real-world applications.

articles.title: Multipliers for forced Lurye systems with slope-restricted nonlinearities
articles.summary: This article discusses the use of dynamic multipliers for forced Lurye systems with slope-restricted nonlinearities. The researchers demonstrate that these multipliers can guarantee the stability and boundedness of the closed-loop power gain, but do not provide guarantees on finite incremental gain or noise sensitivity. They also develop a new class of multipliers that can ensure a unique, attractive, and period-preserving solution.
key_takeaways: Dynamic multipliers can be used to guarantee the stability and boundedness of the closed-loop power gain for Lurye systems with slope-restricted nonlinearities.
These multipliers provide no guarantee on finite incremental gain or noise sensitivity unless other exogenous signals have a constant steady-state value.
A new class of multipliers has been developed that can ensure a unique, attractive, and period-preserving solution, using classical tools and reconsidering assumptions required for their application.

articles.title: One-Shot Camera-Based Extrusion Optimization for High Speed Fused Filament Fabrication
articles.summary: This article presents a novel method for optimizing fused filament fabrication (FFF) in high-speed printing using off-the-shelf 3D printers and a phone camera. The approach involves a one-shot calibration process that identifies extrusion dynamics and cornering behavior, allowing for the generation of optimized G-code that synchronizes motion and extrusion. This enables users to achieve high-quality prints at double the production speed without requiring specialized hardware or extensive calibration.
key_takeaways: The method employs a one-shot calibration approach using two simple printed patterns captured by a phone camera to identify extrusion dynamics and cornering behavior.
The approach generates optimized G-code that synchronizes motion and extrusion, reducing width tracking error, corner defects, and surface roughness while maintaining print quality at high speeds.

The system effectively doubles production speed while maintaining print quality, making it accessible to a wide range of FFF users who can achieve high-quality, high-speed additive manufacturing with minimal hardware and no extensive calibration required.

articles.title: Energy-Aware Bayesian Control Barrier Functions for Physics-Informed Gaussian Process Dynamics
articles.summary: The article discusses the development of an energy-aware Bayesian control barrier function (CBF) framework for safe control of dynamical systems with learned Gaussian process dynamics. The proposed framework leverages the structure of the GP Hamiltonian posterior to design conservative energy-based barriers that provide probabilistic safety guarantees. Numerical simulations demonstrate the effectiveness of the approach in achieving high-probability safety under noisy sampled GP-learned dynamics.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a Bayesian CBF framework for safe control of dynamical systems with learned Gaussian process dynamics, focusing on mechanical and port-Hamiltonian systems.

The proposed energy-aware Bayesian-CBFs construct conservative energy-based barriers directly from the Hamiltonian and vector-field posteriors, yielding safety filters that minimally modify a nominal controller.
The approach achieves high-probability safety under noisy sampled GP-learned dynamics, as demonstrated by numerical simulations on a mass-spring system.

articles.title: MSACL: Multi-Step Actor-Critic Learning with Lyapunov Certificates for Exponentially Stabilizing Control
articles.summary:

The article introduces MSACL, a framework for model-free reinforcement learning that integrates exponential stability theory with maximum entropy RL. MSACL utilizes off-policy multi-step data to learn Lyapunov certificates, achieving provable stability and rapid convergence under simple rewards. The framework demonstrates superiority over state-of-the-art Lyapunov-based RL algorithms across various benchmarks.
key_takeaways: MSACL integrates exponential stability theory with maximum entropy RL through multi-step Lyapunov certificate learning, enabling provable stability in model-free reinforcement learning.
The framework effectively balances the bias-variance trade-off in multi-step learning using Exponential Stability Labels (ESL) and a λ-weighted aggregation mechanism.
MSACL achieves exponential stability and rapid convergence under simple rewards, while exhibiting significant robustness to uncertainties and generalization to unseen trajectories.
