articles.summary: ZincFive, a nickel-zinc battery company, has raised $30 million in funding through its Series F round, bringing its total funding to $254 million since its founding in 2016. The funding aims to support the rapid scaling of its commercial footprint. This investment demonstrates growing confidence in the technology behind zinc batteries.
key_takeaways: ZincFive has secured $30 million in funding for its nickel-zinc battery technology.
The company's total funding raised now stands at $254 million since its founding in 2016.
The new funding round aims to support the rapid expansion of ZincFive's commercial operations.

articles.title: Taiwan on track to deploy 31.2 GW of solar by 2035
articles.summary: Taiwan is on track to deploy a significant amount of solar power by 2035, with GlobalData forecasting that the country will reach 31.2 GW of solar capacity by the end of the decade. This growth is expected to be driven by rooftop deployment programs, floating solar projects, and utility-scale installations. Solar energy is set to become Taiwan's leading form of renewable power.
key_takeaways: Taiwan plans to add 1.1 GW of solar capacity this year, taking its cumulative capacity to 15.4 GW, and is expected to surpass 20 GW of solar in 2029 and 30 GW in 2035.
The country's total renewable power capacity is projected to reach around 50.7 GW by 2035, with solar accounting for over 61% of the figure.
Taiwan's shift away from nuclear power is being driven by a focus on expanding renewable energy sources, including solar, as well as flexible gas-fired generation to replace lost baseload supply.

articles.title: Novel solar-aided liquid carbon dioxide energy storage system
articles.summary: Researchers from China have developed a novel solar-aided liquid carbon dioxide energy storage system that integrates solar thermal energy and cascade waste heat utilization. The system achieves high efficiency rates, including an electrical round-trip efficiency of 44.51% and an exergy efficiency of 48.40%. This innovative system aims to enhance the performance of traditional liquid carbon dioxide energy storage systems for more effective integration with renewable energy.
key_takeaways: The novel solar-aided liquid carbon dioxide energy storage system achieves high efficiency rates, including an electrical round-trip efficiency of 44.51% and an exergy efficiency of 48.40%.
The system integrates solar thermal input and cascade waste heat use to preheat CO2 and reuse residual heat for additional electricity, cooling, space heating, and domestic hot water.

The novel system demonstrates significantly improved techno-economic performance compared to traditional liquid carbon dioxide energy storage systems, with a net present value (NPV) of $181 million in the Beijing region.

articles.title: India tenders 1 GW of pumped storage to bolster grid-scale energy storage

This initiative is part of India's efforts to bolster its grid-scale energy storage capabilities.
key_takeaways: India has opened a tender for the development of up to 1 GW of pumped storage capacity across the country, with an eight-hour storage duration.
The project aims to provide long-duration energy storage services to power distribution companies and other buyers under long-term contracts, bolstering grid-scale energy storage capabilities.
Bidders can quote a minimum cumulative capacity of 100 MW/800 MWh, and developers with existing or under-construction pumped storage projects are also eligible.

articles.title: Mexico Awards 20 Renewable Energy Projects 3.3 Gigawatts of Contracts

Green hydrogen is being explored as a long-term potential source of energy for the company.

articles.title: Google just spent $4.75B chasing power for AI data centers

This trend suggests that as AI technology continues to evolve, the focus will shift from just server hardware to a broader range of supporting systems, including energy management and power distribution.

articles.title: Agrivoltaic Company Okovate Acquires Stanford University & Carnegie Mellon Tech Startup
articles.summary: Agrivoltaic company Okovate has acquired a startup from Stanford University and Carnegie Mellon Tech, further solidifying its presence in the agrivoltaic industry. Agrivoltaics combine agriculture and solar power generation, offering a promising solution for sustainable energy production. The acquisition may bring new innovations and technologies to this rapidly growing field.
key_takeaways: Okovate's acquisition of the startup enhances its capabilities in the agrivoltaic sector, potentially leading to improved efficiency and scalability.
Agrivoltaics have gained significant attention in recent years due to their potential to combine agricultural activities with renewable energy generation.
The partnership may lead to new innovations and technologies that could drive growth in the agrivoltaic industry.

articles.title: A Bezier Curve Based Approach to the Convexification of the AC Optimal Power Flow Problem
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel convex reformulation of the Alternating Current Optimal Power Flow (ACOPF) problem using Bezier curves, aiming to provide an efficient and reliable solution for assessing and operating weak power systems. The proposed model achieves convergence on large test systems in seconds and is validated against exact AC solutions with high accuracy. This approach offers a transparent and intuitive structure, making it accessible for researchers and system operators.
key_takeaways: The authors propose a convex reformulation of the ACOPF problem using Bezier curves to isolate nonlinear terms and exploit product-sum properties.
The proposed model achieves convergence on large test systems (e.g., IEEE 118 bus) in seconds and is validated against exact AC solutions with high accuracy.

The use of logarithmic transformations and a novel convexifying butterfly shaped function enables the model to closely mirror the original AC formulation while maintaining mathematical transparency and ease of implementation.

articles.title: Robust Deep Learning Control with Guaranteed Performance for Safe and Reliable Robotization in Heavy-Duty Machinery
articles.summary: This dissertation presents a control framework for electrified heavy-duty mobile machines (HDMMs) that aims to simplify control design, guarantee safety-defined performance, and integrate artificial intelligence. The framework addresses technical and economic challenges of full electrification while ensuring stability and robustness across different actuators and energy sources. The research aims to advance nonlinear control and robotics.
key_takeaways: The dissertation proposes a generic modular approach for control design that is energy-source independent and supports future modifications, making it suitable for electrified HDMMs.
The framework guarantees safety-defined performance and stability, even in the presence of uncertainty and faults, while balancing robustness and responsiveness.

The research investigates methods to interpret and trust black-box learning strategies, which can be integrated stably into existing control systems and verified against international safety standards.

articles.title: A Review of Community-Centric Power Systems Resilience Assessment and Enhancement Strategies
articles.summary: This paper provides a comprehensive review of resilience metrics and strategies for enhancing power system resilience, with a focus on community-centric approaches. The study examines the interdependencies between power systems resilience and community resilience, highlighting socioeconomic and behavioral dimensions, infrastructure interconnections, and the role of resilience hubs. It also outlines state-of-the-art strategies for mitigating the impacts of high-impact, low-probability events.
key_takeaways: The paper reviews various resilience metrics, including engineering-based measures and data-driven approaches, to assess power system resilience and community resilience.

Key strategies for enhancing power system resilience include network hardening, resource allocation, optimal scheduling, and reconfiguration techniques, with a focus on integrating Artificial Intelligence (AI) methods.

The study identifies critical research gaps in mitigating the impacts of high-impact, low-probability events and outlines promising directions for future investigation into the techno-legal dimensions of resilient power systems and communities.

articles.title: Agentic AI-Enhanced Semantic Communications: Foundations, Architecture, and Applications
articles.summary: This article explores the intersection of semantic communications and agentic artificial intelligence, proposing a unified framework for intelligent communication systems. The authors review existing studies on agent types and present an agentic AI-enhanced SemCom framework that covers application layer, semantic layer, and cloud-edge collaboration layer. The framework is demonstrated through various scenarios and a case study on joint source-channel coding.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a unified agentic AI-enhanced SemCom framework that integrates perception, memory, reasoning, and action capabilities to empower intelligent communications.
The authors present several application scenarios, including multi-vehicle collaborative perception, multi-robot cooperative rescue, and agentic operations for intelligent networks.
An experimental case study, AKB-JSCC, demonstrates the effectiveness of the proposed framework in achieving higher information reconstruction quality under different channel conditions.

articles.title: Revealing design archetypes and flexibility in e-molecule import pathways using Modeling to Generate Alternatives and interpretable machine learning
articles.summary: The article discusses the limitations of optimizing e-molecule import pathways in energy transition studies, which often rely on cost optimization models that may not account for real-world constraints. A novel approach using modeling and interpretable machine learning is presented to generate a diverse set of near-cost-optimal alternatives within an acceptable cost margin, revealing great flexibility in hydrogen import pathways.
key_takeaways: The traditional cost-optimization approach may not capture the complexity of real-world implementation constraints, making it difficult to achieve cost-optimal designs.
The study reveals that solar, wind, and storage are not strictly required to remain within 10% of the cost optimum, indicating great flexibility in hydrogen import pathways.
The results show that wind constraints favor solar-storage methanol pathways, while limited storage favors wind-based ammonia or methane pathways.

articles.title: A Learning-Driven Stochastic Hybrid System Framework for Detecting Unobservable Contingencies in Power Systems
articles.summary: The article proposes a Learning-Driven Stochastic Hybrid System (LSHS) framework for detecting unobservable contingencies in power systems. The framework uses machine learning classifiers to analyze system outputs and behaviors, categorizing contingencies into physical, control, or measurement groups based on their impact on the SHS model. Simulations on IEEE 5-bus and 30-bus systems demonstrate substantial improvements in detection speed and accuracy.
key_takeaways: The proposed LSHS framework can detect unobservable events, such as undetected protection system malfunctions, that are hidden from standard sensing infrastructures.
The framework integrates system dynamics and observer-driven state estimation error dynamics to analyze deviations in system outputs and behaviors.
Machine learning classifiers achieve rapid and accurate categorization of contingencies, demonstrating substantial improvements in detection speed and accuracy compared to existing approaches.

articles.title: The Dawn of Agentic EDA: A Survey of Autonomous Digital Chip Design
articles.summary: The article discusses the emerging field of Agentic EDA, which integrates Generative AI and Agentic AI to create autonomous digital chip design. The survey reviews the evolution from traditional CAD to AI-assisted EDA and AI-native designs, highlighting its application across the digital chip design flow. It also explores the potential benefits and challenges of this paradigm shift.
key_takeaways: The article discusses the integration of Generative AI and Agentic AI in digital electronic design automation (EDA) to create autonomous design systems.

The survey highlights the potential for cross-stage feedback loops between agents, where backend PPA metrics are used to autonomously refine frontend logic, and the dual-faceted impact on security, including novel adversarial risks and automated vulnerability repair.
The work aims to define the emerging field of Agentic EDA and provide a strategic roadmap for the transition from AI-assisted tools to fully autonomous design engineers.

articles.title: Global Frequency Reference Tracking as an Oscillation Suppression Mechanism in VSM Primary Control: A Coupled-Oscillator Study
articles.summary: The article discusses the use of a global frequency reference for virtual synchronous machine (VSM) based inverters in power systems to improve synchronization and transient behavior. By tracking a common frequency, VSMs can reduce prolonged transients and large phase excursions, leading to improved grid-forming capabilities. The proposed control architecture employs a PI frequency controller with a washout mechanism to ensure stable operation.
key_takeaways: Implementing a global frequency reference transforms synchronization from a mutual oscillator locking problem to a reference tracking problem, allowing for more efficient coordination of VSMs.
Using a PI frequency controller with a washout mechanism can significantly improve transient behavior, reducing frequency overshoot and underdamped oscillations.
The proposed control architecture preserves network-determined power sharing by ensuring that the additional control action vanishes in steady state, maintaining stable operation.

articles.title: Multi-objective control strategy of Electro-Mechanical Transmission Based on Driving Pattern Division
articles.summary: The article proposes a multi-objective control strategy for an Electro-Mechanical Transmission (EMT) system in heavy-duty vehicles, aiming to optimize power balance and fuel economy under different driving patterns. The strategy is based on Dynamic Programming (DP) and uses the analytic hierarchy process (AHP) to determine weighting factors. Simulation results show that the proposed strategy outperforms a rule-based approach, leading to improved comprehensive performance and fuel economy.
key_takeaways: The article presents a multi-objective control strategy for EMT systems in heavy-duty vehicles, aiming to optimize power balance and fuel economy.
The strategy uses Dynamic Programming (DP) and analytic hierarchy process (AHP) to determine weighting factors based on driving pattern division.
Simulation results demonstrate that the proposed strategy outperforms a rule-based approach, leading to improved comprehensive performance and fuel economy.

articles.title: Data Centers, the Grid, and the Assumptions That Don’t Hold Up
articles.summary: The power sector is facing a challenge in meeting the high electricity demands of hyperscale data centers, which require unprecedented speed and scale. The infrastructure to serve these data centers operates on timelines measured in years, rather than months. This mismatch between demand and supply is causing strain on the grid.
key_takeaways: Hyperscale data centers demand electricity at an unprecedented scale, but the existing infrastructure to serve them can't keep up with this rapid growth.
The power sector's timeline for upgrading infrastructure (measured in years) doesn't align with the short-term needs of data centers (measured in months).
This mismatch between demand and supply is straining the grid, highlighting the need for more efficient and scalable solutions to support growing data center operations.

articles.title: EIA: All net new generating capacity in 2026 may be renewables

This growth is attributed to the rapid expansion of solar and battery storage technologies. Renewable energy sources are becoming increasingly dominant in the energy landscape.
key_takeaways: All net new generating capacity in 2026 is forecast to be provided by renewable energy and batteries.
Solar and battery storage have dominated growth among competing energy sources, driving this shift towards renewable energy.

articles.title: China commissions world’s largest 1 GW open-sea offshore solar project

articles.title: Solar Power Continues to Make Gains, but Slowdown Expected in 2026

articles.title: China is running out of critical battery material: here are the countdowns

articles.title: Two Charts, One Grid: Clean Electricity Is Getting Cheaper But Feels More Expensive
articles.summary: The article discusses how the cost of clean electricity is decreasing, but its price relative to other energy sources may be increasing. This apparent paradox is highlighted through two charts that show nominal residential electricity prices against carbon intensity for major electricity-producing countries in 2015 and 2024. The comparison with inflation-adjusted prices further supports this trend.
key_takeaways: Clean electricity costs are decreasing, but its relative price compared to fossil fuels may be increasing due to growing demand.
Adjusting prices for inflation reveals that the cost of clean electricity is actually getting cheaper when accounting for inflationary pressures.

The article highlights a potential paradox where the benefits of clean energy seem to come with an increased cost perception, suggesting a need to reevaluate how we discuss and price clean energy in the market.

articles.title: US solar installer adapts business model as policy support shifts

ReVision Energy's unique approach has enabled it to grow into the leading residential rooftop solar contractor in New England.
key_takeaways: ReVision Energy has leveraged a relationship-driven model and workforce innovation to navigate evolving clean energy policies and sustain long-term growth.

articles.title: Optimal Placement of Data Centers to Support Power Distribution Networks Using Intelligent Algorithms with Economic Indicators
articles.summary: This article proposes a techno-economic framework for optimizing the placement of data centers in power distribution networks. The framework uses an intelligent algorithm to select the optimal bus connection and size of on-site renewable generation capacity, considering factors such as active power losses, voltage deviation index, and investment cost. The approach aims to balance economic indicators with network operating limits.
key_takeaways: The proposed framework employs a mixed integer nonlinear optimization model to jointly select the connection bus and size the distributed generation (DG) capacity while respecting network operating limits.

An intelligent genetic algorithm is embedded in a multi-scenario decision framework, which includes three stakeholder scenarios prioritizing losses, voltage quality, or techno-economic balance, as well as additional balanced scenarios generated automatically until convergence.

The approach has been demonstrated on the IEEE 33 bus radial system, where the converged design selects bus 14 with 1.10 MW DG, reducing total losses and improving minimum bus voltage while moderate investment cost is incurred.

articles.title: Smart IoT-Based Leak Forecasting and Detection for Energy-Efficient Liquid Cooling in AI Data Centers

This approach has the potential to prevent significant energy waste through proactive maintenance.
key_takeaways: The proposed system uses a combination of LSTM neural networks for probabilistic leak forecasting and Random Forest classifiers for instant detection, achieving high accuracy rates.
Humidity, pressure, and flow rate are identified as strong predictive signals for coolant leaks, while temperature exhibits minimal immediate response due to thermal inertia in server hardware.
The system could prevent approximately 1,500 kWh of annual energy waste through proactive maintenance, making it a promising approach for sustainable data center operations.

articles.title: Economic and Reliability Value of Improved Offshore Wind Forecasting in Bulk Power Grid Operation: A Case Study of The New York Power Grid

The risk-based aggregation technique leverages spatial diversification to address the issue of over-procurement, further reducing total production costs by 7.21%.
The enhanced forecast also lowers system Loss of Load Probability (LOLP) by approximately 19%, enhancing system reliability during real-time grid operations.

The model incorporates dynamic quality scores and focuses on a finite time horizon, providing insights into the impact of retail competition on cooperative alliances in the SEA market.

The research explores the effects of sensitivity analysis for both quality score and gross margin, as well as the initial market share of the competing retailer, to inform optimal policies for participants engaged in cooperative advertising.

articles.title: Spatiotemporal Tubes for Probabilistic Temporal Reach-Avoid-Stay Task in Uncertain Dynamic Environment
articles.summary: This article extends the Spatiotemporal Tube (STT) framework to address Probabilistic Temporal Reach-Avoid-Stay (PrT-RAS) tasks in dynamic environments with uncertain obstacles. The authors develop a real-time tube synthesis procedure that provides formal probabilistic safety guarantees, and derive an approximation-free control law that ensures both probabilistic safety and task satisfaction. The method is demonstrated through simulation studies and hardware experiments on various robots.
key_takeaways: The Spatiotemporal Tube (STT) framework is extended to address PrT-RAS tasks in dynamic environments with uncertain obstacles.
A real-time tube synthesis procedure is developed that provides formal probabilistic safety guarantees for the system trajectory.
The control law derived from the STT framework ensures both probabilistic safety and task satisfaction, without requiring approximation or optimization.

articles.title: Convergence Analysis of Natural Power Method and Its Applications to Control
articles.summary: The article analyzes the discrete-time natural power method and its applications to control. The method converges to the dominant r-dimensional subspace corresponding to the r eigenvalues with the largest absolute values, which is a property that contrasts with the Oja flow. This property is leveraged to develop methods for model order reduction and low-rank controller synthesis for discrete-time LTI systems.
key_takeaways: The discrete-time natural power method converges to the dominant subspace corresponding to the r eigenvalues with the largest absolute values, which is a unique property compared to the Oja flow.
The article develops methods for model order reduction and low-rank controller synthesis using this convergence property, preserving key system properties.
The research extends the low-rank control framework to slowly-varying LTV systems, showing its utility for tracking time-varying dominant subspaces.

articles.title: Optimal Trajectory Planning for Orbital Robot Rendezvous and Docking

This allows for closer and safer access to the target, making it feasible for robotic manipulators onboard servicing satellites.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a trajectory planning method using nonlinear optimization for safe capture of debris objects in space.
A dynamic keep-out sphere is introduced to adapt to changing approach conditions, enabling closer and safer access to the target.
The proposed method considers practical implementation constraints by developing a control strategy that can reproduce the optimized trajectory using discrete ON/OFF thrusters.

articles.title: Peak Oil Is Not Dead: Reviewing the IEA’s World Energy Outlook for 2025
articles.summary: The article reviews the IEA's World Energy Outlook for 2025, which reportedly stated that oil demand will continue growing until 2050, sparking controversy among media outlets and experts. However, the author of the article disagrees with this conclusion, suggesting that the IEA may have misinterpreted or exaggerated the data. The article aims to provide a critical analysis of the report's findings.
key_takeaways: The IEA's World Energy Outlook for 2025 reported that oil demand would continue growing until 2050, sparking concerns about the sustainability of fossil fuels.

Despite potential inaccuracies in the report, the article acknowledges that the IEA's assessment still highlights the importance of transitioning to cleaner energy sources to mitigate climate change and ensure a sustainable energy future.

articles.summary: Japan is planning to introduce stricter regulations on large-scale solar projects, including mandatory environmental impact assessments and a third-party verification system. This move is part of the "Mega Solar Countermeasure Package" aimed at addressing concerns related to large-scale solar development.
key_takeaways: Japan plans to introduce stricter environmental oversight for large-scale solar projects, including mandatory environmental impact assessments.

articles.title: Korean researchers build tin monosulfide solar cell with 4.81% efficiency
articles.summary: Researchers at Chonnam National University in South Korea have developed a tin monosulfide solar cell with an efficiency of 4.81%, surpassing previous records for thin-film solar cells. The device's rear contact interface was engineered to enhance charge transport, and the team used germanium oxide layer deposition to improve performance. This breakthrough could pave the way for more efficient and scalable photovoltaic applications.
key_takeaways: Researchers have achieved an efficiency of 4.81% with tin monosulfide solar cells, outperforming previous records for thin-film solar cells.
The device's rear contact interface was optimized to enhance charge transport, and a germanium oxide layer was deposited between the molybdenum back contact and SnS absorber layer.
Despite being considered a promising material, tin monosulfide has struggled to achieve conversion efficiencies better than 5% in previous research, making this breakthrough particularly significant.

articles.title: Remote sensing-based tech for hourly snow-induced PV power losses assessment
articles.summary: A team of researchers from Sweden-based Becquerel Sweden has developed a remote sensing-based snow loss model to estimate hourly snow-induced PV power losses. The model relies on data from aerial imagery, LIDAR, and satellite sources, providing an alternative approach to traditional physical simulations. This innovation aims to improve the accuracy of solar power predictions during winter months.
key_takeaways: The researchers developed a generalizable snow loss model using remote sensing data, reducing reliance on physical simulation models that have been shown to produce systematic errors.
The new model was built using an adapted version of the Marion snow loss model and was optimized with data from 16 PV reference systems in Sweden, demonstrating its accuracy and reliability.

The study's findings suggest that the remote sensing-based approach can provide consistent improvements in model performance, including lower mean absolute error and root mean square error, compared to previous models.

articles.title: Financing secured for 134 MW solar project in North Macedonia
articles.summary: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) and German development bank KfW have signed a €87 million financing package to support the development of the 134 MW Bitola 3 solar power plant in North Macedonia. The project, developed by state-owned electricity generation utility Elektrani na Severna Makedonija (ESM), will become North Macedonia's largest solar asset upon completion. The funding package includes sovereign-guaranteed loans from both EBRD and KfW.
key_takeaways: A €87 million financing package has been secured for the 134 MW Bitola 3 solar power plant in North Macedonia, with sovereign-guaranteed loans from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) and German development bank KfW.
The project will become North Macedonia's largest solar asset, capable of generating around 180 GWh of electricity annually upon completion.

The funding package is part of a series of solar and wind projects under development by ESM, which aims to increase domestic production from renewables by more than 200 MW in the next two to three years.

articles.title: Relative Localization System Design for SnailBot: A Modular Self-reconfigurable Robot
articles.summary: The article presents a relative localization system design for SnailBot, a modular self-reconfigurable robot. The system integrates ArUco marker recognition, optical flow analysis, and IMU data processing into a unified framework, enabling robust and accurate positioning for collaborative robotic tasks. Experimental validation demonstrates the effectiveness of the system in real-time operation.
key_takeaways: The relative localization system combines multiple sensing modalities (ArUco markers, optical flow, and IMU data) to achieve accurate and robust positioning.
A rule-based fusion strategy is used to ensure reliability across dynamic scenarios, allowing for scalable deployment in modular robotic systems.
The system has been experimentally validated, demonstrating its effectiveness in real-time operation for collaborative robotic tasks.

articles.title: Partitioned robustness analysis of networks with uncertain links
articles.summary: The article presents a new approach to analyzing power and energy systems with uncertain links, developing an input-output model that uses integral quadratic constraints (IQCs) to ensure robust stability. The IQCs are localized according to an edge-based partition of the network graph, allowing for trade-offs between scalability and conservativeness. This method is illustrated through a numerical example.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a new framework for analyzing power and energy systems with uncertain links, using integral quadratic constraints (IQCs) to ensure robust stability.
The IQCs are localized according to an edge-based partition of the network graph, enabling trade-offs between scalability and conservativeness in network analysis.
The method presented in the article can be used to study the behavior of power and energy systems under uncertainty, allowing for more informed decision-making and optimization.

key_takeaways: Nissan Australia has partnered with Relectrify to install a 120 kWh battery energy storage system featuring repurposed electric vehicle batteries, reducing waste and increasing the use of retired EV batteries.
The system combines cell-level control technology that increases battery cycle life and reduces energy storage costs, making it possible to repurpose high-quality end-of-life batteries from EVs.
The project aims to reduce energy costs for Nissan Australia's production facility in Melbourne and supply two new EV chargers as part of the initiative.

articles.title: Hermetic Sealing Solutions for High-Performance Miniaturized Battery Systems
articles.summary: The article discusses the use of dual-seal epoxy adhesive methods for achieving reliable hermetic sealing in high-performance miniaturized battery systems. This method is designed to maximize energy density while preventing electrolyte leakage and moisture ingress, enabling microbatteries to operate at extreme temperatures and maintain long continuous performance. The technique has shown promising results with a 2mm breakthrough and proven materials.
key_takeaways: A dual-seal approach combining epoxy adhesives with gaskets is used to achieve optimal hermeticity in miniaturized battery systems.
The method has successfully demonstrated microbatteries operating at 120°C with 22-hour continuous performance, achieving a significant breakthrough in energy density and reliability.
Surface-area-to-volume optimization is key to maximizing energy density while maintaining high Wh/L and Wh/kg ratios, ensuring the longevity of the batteries.

articles.title: Early warning signals for loss of control

key_takeaways: The article introduces the concept of critical slowing down as a phenomenon that occurs in complex nonlinear systems approaching criticality, which can be used to monitor the stability of feedback systems.

articles.title: Extragradient methods with complexity guarantees for hierarchical variational inequalities

The work matches and improves upon existing state-of-the-art results in terms of iteration complexity and problem generality.

articles.title: Robustness Certificates for Neural Networks against Adversarial Attacks
articles.summary: The article introduces a formal robustness certification framework for neural networks against adversarial attacks, particularly data poisoning attacks. The framework models gradient-based training as a discrete-time dynamical system and formulates poisoning robustness as a formal safety verification problem. This approach provides sufficient conditions to certify a robust radius ensuring the terminal model remains safe under worst-case ℓp-norm based poisoning.
key_takeaways: The framework introduces sufficient conditions to certify a robust radius, generalizing beyond the training set, by parameterizing barrier certificates (BCs) as neural networks trained on finite sets of poisoned trajectories.
The approach provides confidence lower bounds on certified robustness radius using scenario convex programs (SCPs), making it practical and model-agnostic.
The framework extends to certification against test-time attacks, providing formal guarantees in both training and test-time attack settings.

articles.title: A Multimodal Human-Centered Framework for Assessing Pedestrian Well-Being in the Wild
articles.summary: The article presents a multimodal framework for assessing pedestrian well-being in urban environments, which integrates physiological sensing, geospatial tracking, and self-reports. This framework aims to capture the dynamic and subjective aspects of everyday walking experiences, providing a more comprehensive understanding of how urban environments influence well-being. The proposed approach offers a scalable and transferable method for advancing human-centered urban analytics.
key_takeaways: Existing approaches to evaluating pedestrian environments often rely on static or retrospective methods, which neglect the dynamic and psychophysiological dimensions of everyday walking experience.

The new framework integrates three complementary data streams: continuous physiological sensing, geospatial tracking, and momentary self-reports, enabling a holistic understanding of how urban environments influence well-being.

The proposed framework highlights context-dependent patterns associated with traffic exposure, pedestrian infrastructure quality, and environmental enclosure, suggesting that commonly used walkability indices may not fully capture experiential dimensions of pedestrian well-being.

articles.title: Enhancing Grid Resilience for Giga-Watt Scale Data Centers Using High Voltage Circuit Breaker Operated Braking Resistors
articles.summary: This article proposes the use of high voltage circuit breaker operated braking resistors at data center transmission substations to enhance grid resilience during large load loss scenarios. The approach has been theoretically demonstrated and tested on a gigawatt scale data center load cluster connected to a 345 kV network, showing promising results in reducing frequency rate of change and providing time for governor response and capacitor switching. The method integrates with existing protection systems and can be scaled up or down according to the growth of the data center facility load.
key_takeaways: High voltage circuit breaker operated braking resistors can effectively reduce the rate of change of frequency during large load loss scenarios, allowing primary governor response and capacitor switching to restore steady state.

The approach is a practical means to enhance Bulk Electric System (BES) resilience for gigawatt scale data centers, requiring no generator changes and scalable with cluster size or growth of the data center facility load.
The use of braking resistors in conjunction with circuit breakers provides a dynamic solution that can mitigate grid frequency rise and voltage rise caused by sudden load loss events.

articles.title: Accelerating Underground Pumped Hydro Energy Storage Scheduling with Decision-Focused Learning
articles.summary: The article presents a decision-focused learning (DFL) framework for optimizing day-ahead scheduling in underground pumped hydro energy storage (UPHES) systems. The proposed methodology addresses the computational complexity of nonlinear turbine performance characteristics and discrete operational modes by employing neural networks to predict penalty weights. This enables efficient solution quality and computation time, with significant improvements in profitability.
key_takeaways: The decision-focused learning framework presents a novel approach to addressing the computational-accuracy trade-off in UPHES day-ahead scheduling.

By employing neural networks to predict penalty weights, the framework transforms an intractable MINLP into a sequence of convex quadratic programs that can be trained end-to-end via differentiable optimization layers.

The proposed methodology achieves significant improvements in profitability and computation time, with a 300-fold speedup as a real-time scheduler initialized with linear approximations while maintaining profitability within 3.6% of the piecewise MIQP benchmark.

articles.title: A Lyapunov-Based Small-Gain Theorem for Fixed-Time ISS: Theory, Optimization, and Games
articles.summary: The article presents a Lyapunov-based small-gain theorem for establishing fixed-time input-to-state stability (FxT-ISS) guarantees in interconnected nonlinear dynamical systems. The proposed framework provides robustness with respect to external inputs and complements existing Lyapunov-based small-gain theorems for asymptotic and finite-time stability. It enables a systematic analysis of interconnection structures exhibiting fixed-time stability.
key_takeaways: The article develops a Lyapunov-based small-gain theorem for FxT-ISS in interconnected nonlinear systems, providing robustness with respect to external inputs.
The proposed framework complements existing results on asymptotic and finite-time stability, enabling the analysis of interconnection structures with fixed-time stability properties.

The authors demonstrate the applicability of the theory through optimization problems and noncooperative games with nonlinear dynamical plants in the loop, providing a class of controllers that achieve fixed-time convergence using real-time feedback.

articles.title: Systemization of Knowledge: Resilience and Fault Tolerance in Cyber-Physical Systems
articles.summary:
Here is a summary and key takeaways based on the provided article:


The article discusses the Systematization of Knowledge (SoK) framework for understanding resilience and fault tolerance in Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS). The SoK taxonomy provides a structured lens for analyzing how faults arise, propagate, and amplify across CPS systems. By mapping representative systems onto the taxonomy, researchers identified four structural gaps that span multiple CPS domains.
key_takeaways: Small disturbances in sensors, firmware, networks, or physical interfaces can propagate through estimation and control pipelines, producing cascading instabilities in CPS systems.

The SoK taxonomy identifies four structural gaps in CPS resilience research: (1) physical-model manipulation, (2) ML-enabled control without stability guarantees, (3) semantic inconsistencies between formal models and firmware, and (4) inadequate forensic visibility across cyber and physical layers.
These insights motivate new directions for resilient CPS design, including the integration of robust control, runtime monitoring, formal assurance, and system-level visibility.

articles.title: Energy-Gain Control of Time-Varying Systems: Receding Horizon Approximation
articles.summary: The article discusses an approximation method for designing energy-gain control policies for linear time-varying systems with finite receding-horizon preview of model parameters. The proposed synthesis leverages the strict contraction of lifted Riccati operators to establish a sufficient number of preview steps for performance loss below a set tolerance. This is achieved while avoiding the dependence on all forward model data, which is necessary in standard formulations.
key_takeaways: The article proposes an approximation method that allows for energy-gain control policies with finite receding-horizon preview of model parameters, without relying on all forward model data.

The proposed synthesis leverages the strict contraction of lifted Riccati operators to ensure performance loss remains below a set tolerance relative to the baseline gain bound of the associated infinite-preview controller.
The method is designed for linear time-varying systems and aims to establish sufficient preview steps for performance optimization, with aspects explored in a numerical example.

articles.title: Flocking phase transition and threat responses in bio-inspired autonomous drone swarms
articles.summary: The article presents a bio-inspired 3D flocking algorithm for autonomous drone swarms, which uses minimal local interactions to achieve sharp transitions between swarming and schooling phases. By tuning interaction gains, the swarm exhibits enhanced responsiveness to external disturbances, rapid collective turns, and reliable recovery of alignment in the presence of intruders. The results demonstrate the effectiveness of simple gain modulation in adjusting stability, flexibility, and resilience.
key_takeaways: The proposed algorithm uses minimal local interactions between drones, relying solely on local alignment and attraction cues, which is a significant departure from traditional swarm control methods.

Operating near the phase transition between swarming and schooling enhances responsiveness to external disturbances, such as intruders, and allows for rapid collective turns and reliable recovery of alignment.
Simple gain modulation offers an efficient mechanism to adjust stability, flexibility, and resilience in drone swarms, which can be useful for adapting to various environmental conditions or threats.

articles.title: Universal Transient Stability Analysis: A Large Language Model-Enabled Dynamics Prediction Framework
articles.summary: The article proposes a new power and energy systems framework, TSA-LLM, for transient stability analysis that leverages large language models to achieve universality across diverse operating conditions and unseen faults. The framework overcomes the limitations of existing dynamics prediction frameworks by introducing innovative data processing pipelines, parameter-efficient architecture modifications, and a two-stage fine-tuning scheme. This universal framework demonstrates zero-shot generalization on multiple systems with minimal fine-tuning.
key_takeaways: TSA-LLM introduces a novel data processing pipeline featuring channel independence decomposition, sample-wise normalization, and temporal patching to resolve dimensional heterogeneity and improve long-sequence modeling.

The framework's parameter-efficient freeze-and-finetune strategy combines dedicated input embedding and output projection layers with frozen core transformer blocks to preserve generic feature extraction capabilities while augmenting the model's architecture.

TSA-LLM employs a two-stage fine-tuning scheme that combines teacher forcing and scheduled sampling to mitigate cumulative errors in long-horizon iterative prediction, enabling zero-shot generalization across diverse operating conditions and unseen faults.

articles.title: Decentralized water-level balancing for irrigation channels in storage critical operations
articles.summary: A proposed feedback control system is designed to balance water levels in irrigation channels with uncertain supply-demand mismatch. The decentralized controller adjusts gate flows between pools to regulate neighboring water-level errors to zero, ensuring steady-state balancing. The sequential SISO loop-shaping procedure for designing local flow controllers is developed and verified through numerical simulations and field trial results.
key_takeaways: A decentralized feedback control system is proposed to balance water levels in irrigation channels with uncertain supply-demand mismatch, enabling steady-state balancing.
The system uses a sequential SISO loop-shaping procedure to design local flow controllers based on distributed parameter transfer function models of channel dynamics.
The proposed approach aims to regulate potentially weighted differences between neighboring water-level errors to zero, ensuring stable and efficient water management.

key_takeaways: Hydrostor has received permitting approval for its A-CAES project, a California-based energy storage system that will likely contribute to the state's increasing reliance on renewable energy.

Hawaiian Electric is set to begin construction on a battery energy storage system (BESS) project on Maui, highlighting the growing importance of energy storage in supporting island-wide power systems.
Peregrine has chosen Wärtsilä as the technology provider for a 500MWh Texas BESS, underscoring the company's commitment to advancing large-scale energy storage solutions.

articles.title: Trina Solar completes sale of 5 GW U.S. module plant to T1 Energy
articles.summary: Trina Solar has completed the sale of its 5 GW US solar module factory to T1 Energy, exiting direct manufacturing while retaining a minority equity stake. The transaction was finalized in December 2024 after regulatory clearance and marks Trina's exit from direct manufacturing in the US market. The facility, previously operated by Trina, will now be renamed T1 G1 Dallas Solar Module.
key_takeaways: Trina Solar has sold its 5 GW US solar module factory to T1 Energy in exchange for a combination of cash, senior preferred notes, and equity, marking Trina's exit from direct manufacturing in the US market.
The transaction retains Trina's minority equity stake in T1 Energy, with Trina holding 17.4% of the company's shares, alongside cash and debt securities received earlier under the deal structure.
The acquisition provides T1 Energy with an operational US module manufacturing asset as part of its strategy to supply modules aligned with US domestic content requirements.

articles.title: CATL Battery Factory in Spain, Lithium Mine in Yichun
articles.summary: CATL, the largest EV battery producer in the world, is expanding its operations with a new factory under construction in Spain and the restart of a lithium mine in Yichun, China. This expansion indicates CATL's commitment to meeting growing demand for electric vehicle batteries. The move also underscores the increasing importance of renewable energy sources.
key_takeaways: CATL is expanding its operations globally, with a new factory set to be built in Spain.
The company has also restarted a lithium mine in Yichun, China, indicating an increase in lithium production.
CATL's expansion suggests a strong demand for electric vehicle batteries and the company's efforts to meet this growing need.

articles.title: Trina Solar posts new milestones for tandem efficiency, module power
articles.summary: Trina Solar has achieved new certified benchmarks in perovskite-crystalline silicon tandem solar cell efficiency and module power output, setting world records for industrial-format devices. The company's researchers have made significant progress in developing next-generation PV technology through collaboration with China's Huairou Laboratory and European testing bodies. These advancements demonstrate the commercial potential of tandem architectures.
key_takeaways: Trina Solar has achieved a certified power conversion efficiency of 32.6% for an industrial-scale tandem solar cell, setting a world record for industrially relevant formats.
The company has also developed a standard-size tandem module with a peak power output of 865 W, which is verified by European testing bodies and represents another world-record performance.

Trina Solar's progress in perovskite-crystalline silicon tandem solar technology builds on previous milestones reported over the past two years, demonstrating the commercial potential of tandem architectures beyond laboratory prototypes.

articles.title: Sweden gets first application for state aid for new nuclear
articles.summary: The Swedish government has received an application for state aid to support the development of new nuclear power plants at Ringhals, with proposals for either five GE Vernova Hitachi BWRX-300 reactors or three Rolls-Royce SMRs. The proposed capacity is approximately 1500 MW. This marks the first time Sweden has sought state aid for a nuclear project.
key_takeaways: The Swedish government is considering support for two different nuclear reactor designs: GE Vernova Hitachi BWRX-300 and Rolls-Royce SMR.
The proposed projects aim to increase Ringhals' capacity by approximately 1500 MW, indicating a significant expansion of Sweden's nuclear power capabilities.
This application marks the first time Sweden has sought state aid for a nuclear project, suggesting that the country is exploring new financing options for its energy infrastructure.

articles.title: Hydrogen Production Powers $6B e-Fuels Boom in Uruguay’s Paysandú
articles.summary: Uruguay's Paysandú is set to become a major hub for hydrogen production, with HIF Global and ANCAP signing a $6 billion deal to produce 700,000 tons of drop-in synthetic fuel annually through electrolysis-powered hydrogen production. The project aims to recycle 900,000 tons of CO2 and operate on a 97% renewable grid. This partnership is significant for Uruguay's transition into green energy and its potential impact on the global e-fuels market.
key_takeaways: HIF Global has partnered with ANCAP and ALUR to invest $6 billion in producing 700,000 tons of drop-in synthetic fuel annually in Paysandú, Uruguay.
The project will utilize electrolysis-powered hydrogen production, operating on a 97% renewable grid, making it an environmentally friendly solution for the e-fuels market.
The partnership aims to recycle 900,000 tons of CO2, with 150,000 tons coming from ALUR's biofuel production, contributing to Uruguay's goal of reducing carbon emissions.

articles.title: T1 Energy signs 900 MW US solar module deal with Treaty Oak Clean Energy
articles.summary: T1 Energy has signed a three-year deal to supply a minimum of 900 MW of US-made solar modules to Treaty Oak Clean Energy, with the goal of increasing its annual capacity to 5 GW at its planned Austin cell fab. The move is expected to help buyers navigate trade and tariff risks related to foreign solar module imports. T1 Energy's G2 Austin facility, currently under construction, is scheduled to begin producing solar cells in the second half of 2026.
key_takeaways: T1 Energy has entered a three-year supply agreement with Treaty Oak Clean Energy for a minimum of 900 MW of US-made solar modules.
The deal aims to help buyers navigate trade and tariff risks related to foreign solar module imports, particularly given FEOC restrictions.
T1 Energy's planned G2 Austin facility is expected to reach an annual output of 5 GW of solar cells by the end of 2026, creating up to 1,800 full-time jobs.

articles.title: A new era of utility wildfire defense is defined by a shift from reactive maintenance to proactive risk mitigation
articles.summary: The article discusses a shift in wildfire defense strategies for utility companies, moving from reactive maintenance to proactive risk mitigation. key_takeaways: The article suggests a shift in wildfire defense strategies from reactive maintenance to proactive risk mitigation, indicating a move towards more preventive measures.

articles.summary: The article discusses key moments in the nuclear energy industry for the year 2025, as selected by World Nuclear Association Director General Sama Bilbao y León. articles.title: Aiko achieves 34.76% efficiency for 2-terminal perovskite-silicon tandem solar cell
articles.summary: Aiko, a Chinese manufacturer, has achieved a record-breaking power conversion efficiency of 34.76% for its 2-terminal perovskite-silicon tandem solar cell using heterojunction technology. The lab-scale cell was developed through collaboration with researchers in Germany and China. This achievement is significant as it demonstrates the potential of perovskite-silicon tandem devices for high-efficiency and scalable manufacturing.
key_takeaways: Aiko has achieved a power conversion efficiency of 34.76% for its 2-terminal perovskite-silicon tandem solar cell, setting a new record in this field.
The device uses heterojunction technology and was developed through collaboration between Solarlab Aiko Europe, Aiko headquarters, and its R&D in Yuwi, China.

The success of this 2T monolithic tandem device hinges on its compatibility with existing silicon solar module manufacturing processes, highlighting the need for scalable processing and long-term stability.

articles.title: Energy industry dealmaking soared in 2025 on large utility, IPP mergers
articles.summary: Energy industry dealmaking saw a significant surge in 2025, with the dollar value of mergers and acquisitions increasing fivefold since 2024. The increase in dealmaking activity suggests a dynamic market with a high level of investment.

articles.title: Hydrogen for Transportation Didn’t Fail Just Once in 2025. It Failed Everywhere.
articles.summary: The article discusses the failure of hydrogen for transportation in 2025, where withdrawals outpaced commitments across various industries and sectors. This was not a localized issue but rather a widespread phenomenon. articles.title: Korean bank backs Guam’s largest solar project
articles.summary: The Export-Import Bank of Korea is investing $241 million in a 132 MW solar plus 325 MWh battery energy storage project in Guam, with a consortium of Korean developers leading the development. The Yona solar power project will provide clean energy to approximately 20,000 households on the island and has a 25-year power purchase agreement in place. This investment is part of Eximbank's commitment to financing eco-friendly energy projects abroad.
key_takeaways: A 132 MW solar plant and 325 MWh battery energy storage system will be installed, powered by approximately 200,000 solar panels covering an area roughly the size of 360 soccer fields.
The project has a 25-year power purchase agreement with the Guam Power Authority, ensuring a stable revenue stream for the developers.

Eximbank's financing package includes $150 million in project finance loans and $91 million in equity bridge loans, demonstrating the bank's commitment to supporting large-scale renewable energy projects.

articles.title: PV redox flow battery with 4.2% solar-to-electricity conversion efficiency
articles.summary: Scientists at Nanjing Tech University in China have developed a novel solar redox flow battery (SRFB) device with an average solar-to-electricity conversion efficiency of 4.2%. The device uses a single triple-junction amorphous-silicon photoelectrode paired with redox couples to capture sunlight and store chemical energy. This achievement represents a significant improvement over previous anthraquinone-based SRFBs, which exhibit relatively low efficiencies due to corrosion and instability issues.
key_takeaways: The new device achieves an average solar-to-electricity conversion efficiency of 4.2%, outperforming previous anthraquinone-based SRFBs.
The device uses a single triple-junction amorphous-silicon photoelectrode paired with redox couples to capture sunlight and store chemical energy, enabling simultaneous power generation and storage.
The development of this novel SRFB device is an important step towards advancing the field of renewable energy storage and potentially improving solar-to-electricity conversion efficiencies.

articles.title: New York Power Authority renewables plan shows financial challenges for building solar
articles.summary:
**** The New York Power Authority's (NYPA) renewable energy plan suggests that the cost of building solar projects in New York exceeds the expected revenue from selling solar power, with project success potentially depending on the sale of renewable energy credits (RECs) at a satisfactory price. The levelized cost of energy for new solar projects is estimated to be $100/MWh, while merchant revenue projections are significantly lower. NYPA believes that selling RECs can help bridge the financial gap.

**
key_takeaways: The levelized cost of energy (LCOE) for new solar projects in New York has increased to at least $100/MWh, indicating significant financial challenges for building solar projects.
Projected merchant revenue from selling solar power is estimated to be less than $50/MWh annually, highlighting a substantial gap between costs and revenue.

NYPA's plan suggests that the sale of renewable energy credits (RECs) could play a crucial role in making up this difference, providing revenue necessary for financing and returns on larger renewable projects.

articles.title: Carmaker uses repurposed EV batteries to help power production plant
articles.summary: Nissan Australia has successfully integrated repurposed electric vehicle (EV) batteries into its production facility in Melbourne, providing energy storage for a rooftop solar array and powering operations. The "first-of-its-kind" 120 kWh battery energy storage system features nine retired Nissan Leaf batteries, showcasing the potential for closed-loop recycling of EV batteries. This innovative approach aims to reduce waste and lower costs associated with traditional battery recycling methods.
key_takeaways: Repurposed electric vehicle (EV) batteries have been successfully integrated into a production facility, reducing electronic waste and lowering costs.
A 120 kWh battery energy storage system featuring retired Nissan Leaf batteries has been installed at Nissan Australia's Melbourne plant, powered by a 100 kW rooftop solar array.
The innovative approach uses cell-level control technology to increase battery cycle life and reduce energy storage costs, enabling the repurposing of high-quality end-of-life batteries.

articles.title: Pacifico Energy aims to prove subsidy-free BESS in Japan ‘demonstrates competitive returns’
articles.summary:

 Pacifico Energy has successfully funded a new grid-scale battery storage project in Japan using a unique multi-stream revenue stacking model, which allows for self-funding without subsidies. key_takeaways: Pacifico Energy's use of a "multi-stream revenue stacking model" enabled the company to self-fund its new grid-scale battery storage project without relying on subsidies.

articles.title: European Energy switches on 148 MW of solar in Denmark
articles.summary: The Danish green energy company European Energy has completed and connected a 148 MW solar project in southern Denmark, known as the Glejbjerg Solar Park. The project was finished ahead of schedule, with construction taking around one year to complete. The solar park is connected to the same grid point as another 175 MW solar asset owned by the company, creating a natural linkage between the two assets.
key_takeaways: European Energy has successfully completed and connected a 148 MW solar project in southern Denmark, known as the Glejbjerg Solar Park.
The solar park, which comprises 238,368 PV modules, is expected to produce around 133 GWh of electricity annually, equivalent to the consumption of approximately 33,000 Danish households.
The project has been completed ahead of schedule, with construction taking around one year to complete, and is connected to another 175 MW solar asset owned by the company.

articles.title: Solar and storage program forecast to save all Massachusetts ratepayers $313 million per year
articles.summary: A study by Synapse Energy Economics and the Solar Energy Industries Association predicts that Massachusetts' solar and storage program will save all ratepayers $313 million per year by 2030. The program aims to deploy 3.5 GW of new solar capacity, which would bring significant savings through reduced wholesale electricity prices. This could lead to lower "supply charges" on utility bills for customers.
key_takeaways: Solar and storage deployment in Massachusetts is expected to save ratepayers $313 million per year by 2030, with the majority of savings (80%) coming from reduced wholesale electricity prices.
The program aims to deploy 3.5 GW of new solar capacity by 2030, which would also benefit neighboring states across New England, increasing total savings to $684 million.
Solar and storage can improve winter reliability and reduce gas consumption, making them valuable assets in managing energy affordability and reducing reliance on fossil fuels.

articles.title: Nuclear power’s loud-but-quiet year
articles.summary: The article discusses the progress of nuclear power in 2025, highlighting the contrast between promises and actual outcomes. Despite a "gangbusters year" for press releases and policy changes, few new reactors were added to the grid, with more retiring than being built. This suggests that the industry's growth plans may not be translating into tangible results.

This indicates a decline in the nuclear power sector, which is not matching expectations for new capacity additions despite promises and policy changes.
The data suggests that the industry's growth plans may be hindered by various factors such as economic concerns, regulatory issues, or technological challenges.

articles.title: PacifiCorp Contests Amazon Data Center Service Complaint
articles.summary: PacifiCorp, a utility company based in Portland, Oregon, has filed a partial motion to dismiss a complaint submitted by Amazon Data Services, alleging that PacifiCorp breached agreements to provide electric service to four data centers. Amazon claimed that PacifiCorp failed to deliver promised power and refused to complete its standard contracting process for two of the campuses. The utility company argues that it has worked in good faith with Amazon and is seeking to have the PUC shift the data centers into another utility's territory.
key_takeaways: Amazon alleges that PacifiCorp has breached agreements to provide electric service to four data centers, including supplying significantly less power than promised for one campus (Specialized) and refusing to complete its standard contracting process for two other campuses (Pivot and Gray).
PacifiCorp contests the allegations, arguing that it has worked in good faith with Amazon and is seeking to have the PUC shift the data centers into another utility's territory.

The dispute highlights potential issues between a large technology company like Amazon and a traditional utility provider like PacifiCorp, particularly when it comes to providing specialized power services for data centers.

articles.title: New York, Ontario team up for nuclear
articles.summary: A collaborative agreement has been established between Ontario Power Generation and the New York Power Authority to develop advanced nuclear energy technologies, with leaders from both regions signing a declaration of intent to work together on advancing nuclear power.
key_takeaways: An agreement has been formed to collaborate on the development of advanced nuclear energy technologies between Ontario Power Generation and the New York Power Authority.
The collaboration aims to advance the development of nuclear power through cooperation between the two regions.
A declaration of intent has been signed by leaders from both New York and Ontario to work together on this initiative.

articles.title: A path to fast, cheap home solar and batteries: Go through the meter
articles.summary: The article discusses how slow and burdensome local permitting and utility interconnection processes in the US contribute to high costs for rooftop solar and home batteries, and introduces tools that can help reduce these "soft costs".
key_takeaways: Local permitting and utility interconnection processes are a significant barrier to widespread adoption of rooftop solar and home batteries in the US.
The cost of these "soft costs" accounts for approximately two-thirds of the total price of rooftop solar and home battery systems, making them a major obstacle to affordability.

Using tools such as smart meters that can communicate directly with the grid can help reduce these soft costs by streamlining the permitting process and eliminating the need for traditional meter installation.

The article likely covers notable projects, such as large-scale energy storage installations or innovative applications of energy storage systems.

articles.title: Leveraging High-Fidelity Digital Models and Reinforcement Learning for Mission Engineering: A Case Study of Aerial Firefighting Under Perfect Information
articles.summary: This article proposes an intelligent mission coordination methodology that integrates digital mission models with Reinforcement Learning (RL) for Mission Engineering. The approach leverages a Digital Engineering-based infrastructure to create a high-fidelity digital mission model and agent-based simulation, which is used to formulate the mission tactics management problem as a Markov Decision Process (MDP). The RL agent trained via Proximal Policy Optimization is demonstrated to improve mission performance and reduce variability.
key_takeaways: The article proposes an innovative approach that combines high-fidelity digital models with Reinforcement Learning for Mission Engineering, enabling adaptive task allocation and reconfiguration in uncertain and dynamic environments.

The proposed methodology leverages Digital Engineering-based infrastructure and Markov Decision Process (MDP) to formulate the mission tactics management problem, providing a mission-agnostic framework for improving Mission Engineering practice.

The use of Reinforcement Learning (RL) agent trained via Proximal Policy Optimization is shown to significantly improve mission performance and reduce variability in aerial firefighting case study, demonstrating its potential for complex fleet design and selection problems.

articles.title: Joint Design of Embedded Index Coding and Beamforming for MIMO-based Distributed Computing via Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
articles.summary: The article discusses the joint design of Embedded Index Coding (EIC) and beamforming for MIMO-based distributed computing systems, aiming to minimize total transmission time. The authors propose a multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) framework to address the complexity of the problem, achieving near-optimal performance with reduced complexity. This approach is particularly suitable for real-world wireless systems.
key_takeaways: Most prior work on EIC focused on minimizing code length in wired environments and overlooked channel conditions and spatial multiplexing gains in MIMO systems.
The proposed multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) framework enables decentralized agents to manage the hybrid action space of discrete EIC selection and continuous beamforming design.
The MARL-based approach achieves near-optimal performance with significantly reduced complexity, making it a promising solution for real-world wireless systems.

articles.title: A Tutorial to Multirate Extended Kalman Filter Design for Monitoring of Agricultural Anaerobic Digestion Plants
articles.summary: The article discusses the design of a Multirate Extended Kalman Filter (EKF) for monitoring agricultural anaerobic digestion plants. The EKF is modified to accommodate measurements at different sampling rates and with time delays, which is common in biotechnology applications. The study demonstrates the effectiveness of the MR-EKF in estimating process state and fusing delayed offline measurements.
key_takeaways: The multirate extended Kalman filter (MR-EKF) can effectively estimate process state and fuse delayed offline measurements in agricultural anaerobic digestion plants.

The performance of the MR-EKF is robust to varying delay lengths, measurement noise levels, plant-model mismatch, and initial state error, but poor state initialization and model mismatch have a greater impact on convergence.
A systematic approach for selecting an appropriate tuning of the MR-EKF is presented, which is crucial for successful application in demand-driven operation of biogas plants.

articles.title: $\mathscr{H}_2$ Model Reduction for Augmented Model of Linear Non-Markovian Quantum Systems
articles.summary: The article proposes an $\mathscr{H}_2$ model reduction method for the augmented model of linear non-Markovian quantum systems, addressing the challenge of large system dimensions caused by internal modes. The approach establishes necessary and sufficient conditions for physical realizability, derives conditions for input matrix determination, and converts nonlinear constraints to inequality constraints for semidefinite programming solution. This enables efficient design of filters and controllers for non-Markovian quantum systems.
key_takeaways: The proposed $\mathscr{H}_2$ model reduction method aims to address the computational burden associated with large system dimensions in augmented models of linear non-Markovian quantum systems.

The approach requires establishing necessary conditions for physical realizability, which are more stringent than those for Markovian quantum systems, and deriving conditions for input matrix determination in reduced models.
A semidefinite programming algorithm is developed to solve the optimization problem, allowing for efficient design of filters and controllers for non-Markovian quantum systems.

articles.title: GE Vernova to Modernize a Key High-Voltage Power Transmission Link in India
articles.summary: GE Vernova has been awarded a contract by Power Grid Corp. in India to modernize a key high-voltage power transmission link using advanced HVDC controls and valves, marking the company's first HVDC refurbishment project in India.
key_takeaways: GE Vernova will deliver its Electrification Systems business services for the Chandrapur 2 x 500-MW back-to-back high-voltage direct-current (HVDC) link project.
This contract represents Power Grid Corp.'s decision to modernize an existing power transmission link, which is a significant undertaking in India's energy infrastructure.
GE Vernova's involvement in this project highlights the company's expertise in providing advanced HVDC solutions for power transmission and its growing presence in the Indian market.

key_takeaways: Entergy Arkansas will add 2.6 GW of new power generation capacity, primarily through converting old coal-fired units to burn natural gas.

articles.summary: A report by AnnDyl suggests that investing in residential energy efficiency upgrades for data centers could not only reduce their own energy consumption but also offset their loads on local grids, create jobs, and benefit utility ratepayers.
key_takeaways: Investing in residential energy efficiency upgrades for data centers could help reduce their energy consumption and offset their loads on local grids.
This investment could lead to job creation and economic benefits for the local community where the data centers are located.
Utility ratepayers would also likely benefit from this approach, as reduced demand on the grid would result in lower costs.

articles.title: Kazakh-Japanese nuclear cooperation highlighted during presidential visit
articles.summary: Kazakhstan's President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev recently visited Japan, where he signed agreements with Kazatomprom and Japanese utility Kansai to supply Kazakh uranium products for Japanese nuclear power plants. This cooperation aims to strengthen bilateral relations between the two countries in the field of nuclear energy. The visit highlights Kazakhstan's growing role as a supplier of uranium for the global nuclear market.
key_takeaways: Kazakhstan is supplying uranium products to Japan, which will be used for nuclear power generation.
The agreement marks an expansion of Kazatomprom's presence in the Japanese nuclear energy market.
The bilateral cooperation also includes other nuclear-related initiatives, such as joint research and development projects.

articles.title: Masdar signs PPA for 200 MW floating solar project in Malaysia
articles.summary: Masdar, an Abu Dhabi-based developer, has signed a power purchase agreement (PPA) for a 200 MW floating solar project in Malaysia. The Chereh Dam solar plant will be developed by Masdar in collaboration with Malaysian partners Citaglobal and Tiza Global. The project is valued at over $208 million and aims to provide enough energy to power over 100,000 homes.
key_takeaways: Masdar has entered into a PPA for a 200 MW floating solar project in Malaysia, marking its first project in the country under the fifth large-scale solar program.
The project, valued at over $208 million, will be developed by a consortium led by Masdar and is expected to cover an area of approximately 950 acres (384 hectares).
The Chereh Dam solar plant will provide enough energy to power over 100,000 homes and marks Masdar's entry into the Malaysian market.

articles.title: European Energy secures approval for 1.1 GW of solar in Australia
articles.summary: European Energy has secured development approval for its 1.1 GW Upper Calliope Solar Farm in central Queensland, Australia. The project is expected to be the largest solar farm in the National Electricity Market (NEM) and produce 2.8 TWh of clean energy per year. Construction of the project is targeted for 2026.
key_takeaways: European Energy has received planning approval from the Gladstone Regional Council, paving the way for the final design, grid connection processes, and construction planning of its 1.1 GW Upper Calliope Solar Farm.
The project will be the largest in the National Electricity Market (NEM) and will produce enough clean energy to meet about 5% of Queensland's current demand.

With both planning and federal environmental approvals in place, the project has progressed into an "advanced stage" of development, with remaining steps including grid connection finalisation, procurement, and final investment decisions.

articles.title: This solid-state EV battery maker is going public after a real-world test clears 745+ miles
articles.summary: Factorial Energy, a solid-state EV battery maker, has completed a real-world test that achieved over 745 miles of range on a single charge. As a result, the company is going public in an effort to bring its promising new battery technology to market by 2027. This development marks a significant step forward for the adoption of solid-state batteries in electric vehicles.
key_takeaways: Factorial Energy has successfully completed a real-world test of its solid-state EV battery, demonstrating its potential for long-range electric vehicle applications.
The company aims to bring its innovative battery technology to market as soon as 2027, which could significantly impact the future of electric vehicle charging infrastructure.
The successful test and upcoming public offering position Factorial Energy at the forefront of the growing solid-state battery industry.

articles.title: Bots Are Manipulating The Clean Energy Information You Seek Online
articles.summary: A recent study in Nature found that conversing with chatbots can significantly influence participants' preferences, potentially shifting their opinions by up to 15 percentage points. This suggests that AI models hold a persuasive advantage for powerful actors seeking to manipulate information online. The implications of this phenomenon are particularly concerning in the context of clean energy policy and decision-making.
key_takeaways: Chatbots may be used to manipulate public opinion on clean energy policies, with potentially significant consequences for policy outcomes.
The persuasive power of chatbots highlights the need for critical evaluation of online information and sources, particularly when it comes to sensitive topics like energy policy.
The growing sophistication of AI models underscores the importance of developing strategies to mitigate their potential for manipulation and misinformation.

articles.title: Zambia opens solar-plus-storage tender
articles.summary:
**** Zambia National Energy Corp. Ltd. has launched a tender to deploy solar-plus-storage facilities in all 156 constituencies across the country as part of its national electrification initiative. The project aims to implement constituency-level solar infrastructure, utilizing existing substations and connection points for rapid implementation. Local and international companies are invited to apply.

**
key_takeaways: Zambia is launching a tender for the deployment of 2 MW solar plants and 4 MWh battery energy storage systems (BESS) in all 156 constituencies as part of its national electrification initiative.
The chosen EPC contractor will be responsible for the procurement, installation, testing, and commissioning of all required equipment, with BESS integration options available.
The tender aims to implement constituency-level solar infrastructure using existing substations and connection points, allowing for rapid implementation within 5 km of the nearest substation.

articles.title: Neoen begins construction of Tesla Megablock battery in Australia
articles.summary: Neoen Australia has begun construction on its 226 MW/866 MWh Goyder North battery energy storage project in South Australia, marking the world's first deployment of Tesla's new Megablock technology. The project features Tesla's Megablock, a pre-engineered, plug-and-play block that combines four of Tesla's new Megapack 3 units to deliver 20 MWh capacity. This technology is optimized for rapid deployment and cost-efficiency, offering 23% faster installation and up to 40% lower construction costs compared to previous systems.
key_takeaways: Neoen Australia has launched the construction of its third big battery in less than 90 days, accelerating Australia's energy transition with a growing portfolio of utility-scale solar, wind, gas, batteries, and pumped hydro projects.
The Goyder North project will utilize Tesla's new Megablock technology, which combines four Megapack 3 units into a single block for rapid deployment and cost-efficiency.

The Megablock offers several advantages over previous battery systems, including 23% faster installation time and up to 40% lower construction costs, making it an attractive option for utility-scale energy storage projects.

articles.title: Off-grid floating PV-desalination system for hydrogen production
articles.summary: A research team from the University of Exeter has simulated an off-grid floating PV-desalination system for hydrogen production, which could potentially yield a low levelized cost of electricity and hydrogen.
