key_takeaways: ConnectDER's meter socket adapters are expected to help reduce the cost of transitioning to renewable energy sources such as rooftop solar and home energy storage.
The adapters can also facilitate the adoption of electric vehicles (EVs) by providing a convenient way to charge them at home.
By making it easier for households to switch to clean energy, ConnectDER's solution aims to accelerate the transition away from fossil fuels.

articles.title: RWE commissions Texas solar-plus-storage project
articles.summary: RWE Clean Energy has commissioned the Stoneridge Solar PV project in Texas, which adds 200MW of solar PV and a 100MW/200MWh energy storage system (BESS) to its operational portfolio. This move reinforces RWE's commitment to renewable energy sources. The project is expected to contribute to a more sustainable energy mix.
key_takeaways: RWE has expanded its presence in the US market with the commissioning of the Stoneridge Solar PV project, which marks an addition of 200MW of solar power capacity.
The project also features a 100MW/200MWh BESS, demonstrating RWE's focus on integrating energy storage solutions to enhance grid resilience and flexibility.
This new project is part of RWE Clean Energy's broader efforts to transition its portfolio towards renewable energy sources, contributing to the company's net-zero emissions goals.

articles.title: ‘Philanthropy can help nuclear energy growth in emerging economies’
articles.summary: A Rockefeller Foundation study suggests that nuclear energy can contribute 20% of electricity generation in eight key emerging economies by 2050, and philanthropy plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality. The study highlights the potential for philanthropic support to catalyze growth in nuclear energy. This initiative aims to address global energy needs while promoting sustainable development.
key_takeaways: Nuclear energy has the potential to contribute significantly to electricity generation in emerging economies by 2050.
Philanthropy can play a "catalytic role" in supporting the growth of nuclear energy in these countries, with the Rockefeller Foundation study being a key example.
The initiative aims to balance global energy needs with sustainable development goals, addressing pressing concerns such as climate change and energy access.

articles.title: Hydrogen Storage Hits the Tracks: Innofreight and voestalpine Tubulars Launch H2Tainer
articles.summary: Innofreight and voestalpine Tubulars have launched the H2Tainer, a 40-foot stackable unit designed to simplify hydrogen storage and logistics on rails and roads. The container holds up to 475 kg of gaseous hydrogen and is built with proprietary VAhyper fittings for high-pressure handling. This innovative solution aims to support the growing demand for green hydrogen in various industries.
key_takeaways: The H2Tainer is a stackable unit that can hold up to 475 kg of gaseous hydrogen, making it an efficient solution for logistics and transportation.
The container features proprietary VAhyper fittings that can handle high pressures of up to 500 bar without leaking, ensuring safe storage and transportation of hydrogen.
The H2Tainer's design is adaptable to both flatbeds and rail wagons, allowing for easy switching between modes of transportation and facilitating the last-mile push in the logistics chain.

articles.title: Ontario municipality denies support for 3.2GWh BESS project ahead of looming IESO RFP deadline
articles.summary: The Municipality of Shuniah in Ontario, Canada has denied support for a proposed 400MW/3.2GWh long-duration energy storage project by PowerBank ahead of an impending request for proposal (RFP) deadline from the Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO). The decision was made after careful consideration and evaluation of the project's merits. This setback may impact PowerBank's ability to secure funding for the project.
key_takeaways: The Municipality of Shuniah denied support for a 400MW/3.2GWh long-duration energy storage project proposed by PowerBank, citing unspecified reasons.
The denial comes ahead of an impending RFP deadline from the IESO, which may impact PowerBank's chances of securing funding for the project.
This decision is significant as it highlights the importance of securing support from municipalities and regulatory bodies in large-scale energy projects.
Long-duration energy storage projects like this one are crucial for addressing grid resilience and stability challenges.

articles.title: Hydrogen Production Powers Hyundai Steel’s $6B Low-Carbon Louisiana Mill
articles.summary: Hyundai Steel has unveiled a $6 billion, hydrogen-ready steel mill in Louisiana, which will produce 2.7 million tonnes of steel annually while aiming to drive emissions toward near zero. The mill is designed to use natural gas with carbon capture initially and then switch to green hydrogen from renewable-powered electrolysis. This project is part of Hyundai Motor Group's $26 billion investment roadmap for 2025-2028.
key_takeaways: Hyundai Steel is investing $6 billion in a hydrogen-ready steel mill in Louisiana, which will use Direct Reduced Iron (DRI) and Electric Arc Furnace (EAF) technologies to produce low-carbon steel.
The mill plans to initially use natural gas with carbon capture and then transition to 100% green hydrogen from renewable-powered electrolysis by late 2029.
This project is a significant move by Hyundai Motor Group toward ultra-low-carbon manufacturing in the US, as part of its $26 billion investment roadmap for 2025-2028.

articles.title: World’s first high-power aluminum-ion battery system for energy storage
articles.summary: The article reports on the development of a high-power aluminum-ion battery system, marking the first time a complete aluminum-graphite-dual-ion battery system has been built and tested. The system demonstrates stability, fast response, and recyclability for next-generation grid applications using lithium-free technology. This breakthrough could enable cost-effective and non-flammable energy storage solutions.
key_takeaways: The aluminum-ion battery system uses easily obtainable active materials (aluminum and graphite) and natural graphite as the cathode material, achieving high energy densities of 160 Wh/kg and power densities exceeding 9 kW/kg.
The system has been tested to confirm its stability under realistic operational scenarios, demonstrating its potential for fast-response applications in grid management.
The aluminum-ion battery technology is considered a cost-effective, non-flammable alternative to traditional lithium-based batteries, offering recyclability and reducing environmental concerns.

articles.title: Brazil adopts legal framework for battery storage
articles.summary: Brazil has adopted a new legal framework for battery storage, establishing guidelines for regulation, tax exemptions, and incentives to promote the development of battery energy storage systems (BESS). The law recognizes electricity storage as an independent entity and outlines its role in providing multiple services to the electrical system. This move is expected to support the growth of BESS in Brazil.
key_takeaways: Brazil has introduced a new legal framework for battery energy storage systems (BESS) under Law 15.296, regulating the industry's operation, tax exemptions, and incentives.

The law recognizes electricity storage as an independent entity to be regulated by Aneel, Brazil's electricity regulatory agency, alongside production, transmission, distribution, and commercialization activities.

The new framework aims to promote the development of BESS in Brazil, highlighting its role in providing multiple services to the electrical system, including power, ancillary services, and energy commercialization.

articles.title: Keeping the smart grid cyber secure
articles.summary: The increasing adoption of smart grid technology worldwide is making the electricity network more vulnerable to cyber attacks. As the cumulative investment in power grids is forecasted to increase globally, especially in the Asia-Pacific region, cybersecurity measures are becoming crucial to prevent widespread damage and grid shutdowns. Cyber attacks against utilities have risen by 30% in 2024 compared to previous years.
key_takeaways: The increasing adoption of smart grid technology worldwide is making the electricity network more vulnerable to cyber attacks, posing a significant threat to grid security.
The cumulative investment in power grids is forecasted to increase globally, with the Asia-Pacific region leading the way, but this growth also brings new cybersecurity challenges.
Cyber attacks against utilities have surged by 30% in 2024 compared to previous years, highlighting the need for increased awareness and robust measures to thwart these threats.

articles.title: The week in 5 numbers: Wind and solar are what’s for dinner
articles.summary: The article discusses various developments in the power and energy systems sector, including a potential antitrust investigation into Duke Energy and concerns over phantom data centers. Additionally, it highlights the growing importance of wind and solar energy sources. The Trump administration's actions suggest a shift towards increased scrutiny of market practices.
key_takeaways: The Trump administration is investigating Duke Energy, a "established monopolist", for potential antitrust violations.
The risk of phantom data centers has emerged as a concern in power markets, potentially leading to conflicts over capacity auctions.
Wind and solar energy sources are gaining prominence, with these alternatives being highlighted as key players in the sector's development.

articles.title: Segway Christmas Holiday Sale drops EV prices by hundreds to lows from $150, EcoFlow expansion battery flash sale, more
articles.summary: The article highlights various holiday deals and sales on electric vehicles (EVs), energy storage, and related products. Segway's Christmas Holiday Sale offers discounts on popular EVs, including the ZT3 Pro All-Terrain Electric Scooter, while EcoFlow is running a Cyber Week flash sale with up to 62% savings on power stations and batteries. Additionally, Ride1Up is offering extended sales on e-bikes and extra batteries.
key_takeaways: Segway's Christmas Holiday Sale is offering hundreds of dollars in discounts on popular EVs, including the ZT3 Pro All-Terrain Electric Scooter.
EcoFlow's Cyber Week flash sale offers up to 62% savings on expanded DELTA 2 Max Power Station bundles and three battery bundles starting from $329.
Ride1Up's extended Cyber Monday Sale continues to offer discounts of up to $600 on e-bikes and extra batteries, starting from $195.

articles.title: Idaho Utility Celebrates 125 Years, Brings New Peaker Plant Online
articles.summary: Idaho Falls Power, a utility company celebrating its 125-year history, has formally launched a new natural gas-fired peaking generation plant. This milestone marks an important moment in the company's history and indicates a significant expansion of its energy infrastructure. The launch of this peaker plant suggests a focus on increasing energy production to meet growing demand.
key_takeaways: Idaho Falls Power has launched a new natural gas-fired peaking generation plant, signaling a major expansion of its energy infrastructure.
This peaker plant is part of the company's efforts to increase energy production and meet growing demand in the region.
The launch marks a significant milestone in the company's 125-year history, highlighting its commitment to providing reliable energy services.

articles.title: First utility-owned geothermal network to double in size with DOE funds
articles.summary: The U.S. Department of Energy has approved an $8.6 million grant to support the expansion of Eversource Energy's geothermal heating and cooling network, which is the nation's first utility-led system. This network currently serves a small area but will now double in size. The funding is expected to enable further development of the renewable energy source.
key_takeaways: The $8.6 million grant from the U.S. Department of Energy will support the expansion of Eversource Energy's geothermal heating and cooling network.
The project aims to double the size of the nation's first utility-led geothermal system, which currently serves a limited area.
The funding is expected to promote further development of renewable energy sources in the region.

articles.title: 4 questions utilities need to ask to drive grid modernization efforts
articles.summary: The article highlights the challenges utilities face in driving grid modernization efforts nationwide, while also noting that each organization's solution is tailored to their specific needs. The article provides guidance for utilities on what questions they should ask to address unique challenges and drive successful modernization efforts. By asking the right questions, utilities can develop effective strategies for integrating renewable energy sources into their grids.
key_takeaways: Utilities need to assess their current grid infrastructure and identify areas where modernization is most critical, such as upgrading transmission lines or implementing smart grid technologies.

A thorough understanding of customer needs and expectations is essential to inform modernization efforts and ensure that the resulting grid can effectively support the integration of renewable energy sources.

By asking questions like "What are our customers willing to pay for a more efficient grid?" and "How will we ensure grid resilience in the face of extreme weather events?", utilities can develop effective strategies for driving successful modernization efforts.

articles.title: Virginia data centers must pay ‘fair share,’ incoming lieutenant governor says
articles.summary: The incoming Lieutenant Governor of Virginia, Ghazala Hashmi, emphasizes the importance of data centers paying a "fair share" to the state's energy system. This statement suggests that there is a growing focus on ensuring that large data center operators contribute their fair share to the state's energy infrastructure and costs. The comment implies a shift in policy priorities towards sustainable energy development.
key_takeaways: Data centers operating in Virginia are expected to pay a "fair share" of their energy costs, implying a shift in how these facilities are regulated.
The incoming Lieutenant Governor sees an opportunity for building new energy infrastructure in the Commonwealth, suggesting a focus on renewable energy and sustainability.

Ghazala Hashmi's statement may signal a change in policy priorities towards ensuring that large data center operators contribute to the state's energy system, rather than solely relying on existing infrastructure.

articles.title: Australia’s grid-forming battery storage pipeline extends to nearly a hundred projects, says AEMO
articles.summary: The article reports that Australia's grid-forming battery storage pipeline has expanded to nearly a hundred projects, highlighting the importance of battery energy storage systems (BESS) in maintaining system stability as renewable energy penetration increases. BESS equipped with grid-forming inverters play a crucial role in stabilizing the grid and ensuring reliable power supply. This development suggests a significant shift towards integrating more renewable energy sources into Australia's National Electricity Market.
key_takeaways: Battery energy storage systems (BESS) equipped with grid-forming inverters are becoming increasingly essential for maintaining system stability in Australia's National Electricity Market.
The expansion of the grid-forming battery storage pipeline indicates a growing recognition of the importance of stabilizing the grid as renewable energy penetration increases.
This development suggests that Australia is transitioning towards a more decentralized and flexible energy system, with BESS playing a key role in ensuring reliable power supply.

articles.title: Alabama Power Approve Rate Freeze, Solar Power for Data Center
articles.summary: The Alabama Public Service Commission has approved a two-year rate freeze and the implementation of large solar power projects for a proposed data center in Alabama. This decision aims to reduce energy bills for Alabamians, who currently pay some of the highest energy rates in the nation. The data center is expected to utilize solar power, contributing to the state's clean energy goals.
key_takeaways: The Alabama Public Service Commission has approved a two-year rate freeze, which will keep energy rates stable until 2028.
The decision also includes large-scale solar power projects for a proposed data center in Alabama, aiming to reduce reliance on traditional energy sources.
The approval is an effort to address the high energy bills faced by Alabamians, who pay some of the highest energy rates in the country.

articles.title: Georgia hashes out plan to let data centers build their own clean energy
articles.summary: The state of Georgia is considering a plan that would allow data centers to build their own clean energy, potentially speeding up the development of these power-hungry facilities. This move comes after big companies have been pushing for regulations changes to enable them to find and purchase new clean energy sources. The plan is being negotiated between regulators and utility Georgia Power.
key_takeaways: Big companies are pushing for a regulatory change that would allow data centers to build their own clean energy, which could lead to faster development of these facilities.

The plan is being negotiated between regulators and utility Georgia Power, suggesting a collaborative effort to make the regulatory change a reality.

articles.title: BrightNight and Cordelio close on 800MWh Washington state BESS
articles.summary: BrightNight and Cordelio Power have achieved financial close on their 200MW/800MWh Greenwater battery energy storage system (BESS) in Washington state, US. The project is expected to provide reliable and renewable energy to the local grid. This milestone marks a significant step forward for the development of large-scale BESS projects in North America.
key_takeaways: BrightNight and Cordelio Power have secured financial close on their 200MW/800MWh Greenwater BESS, demonstrating the growing momentum behind large-scale battery energy storage systems in the US.
The project's total capacity of 200MW makes it one of the largest BESS projects in North America, highlighting the increasing demand for renewable energy solutions and grid stability.

The financial close of this project is likely to pave the way for BrightNight and Cordelio Power to secure long-term power purchase agreements (PPAs) with major utilities or corporate customers, further solidifying their position in the market.

articles.title: Endurans Solar launches transparent backsheet for utility-scale bifacial modules
articles.summary: Endurans Solar has launched a transparent backsheet for utility-scale bifacial modules, dubbed HP D15T, which is adhesive-free and fluorine-free. The backsheet has completed IEC certification and offers high moisture and hydrolysis resistance, making it suitable for up to 1500 V systems. This new backsheet aims to provide domestic module manufacturers with enhanced supply chain stability and strategic advantage in the US market.
key_takeaways: Endurans Solar's HP D15T transparent backsheet is adhesive-free and fluorine-free, meeting IEC certification standards.
The backsheet offers high moisture and hydrolysis resistance, making it suitable for up to 1500 V systems with a water vapor transmission rate of less than 1.3 g/m²/d.

The HP D15T backsheet is designed to provide domestic module manufacturers with enhanced supply chain stability and strategic advantage in the US market, particularly for utility-scale bifacial projects targeting Inflation Reduction Act tax credits.

articles.title: Sicily opens €246 million tender for solar, battery storage projects of any size under new EU-aligned programme
articles.summary: Sicily has launched a €246 million tender for solar and battery storage projects, as part of the Pr Fesr Sicilia 2021–2027 programme. The funding window is open to companies of any size and aligns with the European Union's Strategic Technologies for Europe Platform (STEP) notice. The measure supports the development of clean and resource-efficient technologies, including solar photovoltaic systems and battery storage.
key_takeaways: The tender offers €246 million in funding for solar and battery storage projects across Sicily, supported by the Pr Fesr Sicilia 2021–2027 programme.

The funding is open to companies of any size, including aggregated groups, research organizations, and international investors, with eligible activities including productive investments, industrial research, and technological innovation.
The measure aligns with the European Union's STEP notice, supporting clean and resource-efficient technologies such as solar photovoltaic systems, battery storage, and energy storage technologies.

articles.title: ADS-TEC battery-buffered EV fast chargers put into ancillary services market in Austria
articles.summary: The article discusses a project by ADS-TEC Energy to integrate electric vehicle fast-chargers into the ancillary services market in Austria, which could provide a widely replicable model for similar initiatives. This integration aims to stabilize the grid and ensure a reliable energy supply. By leveraging battery-buffered EV fast chargers, ADS-TEC Energy hopes to make this solution more viable.
key_takeaways: The project aims to integrate electric vehicle fast-chargers into the ancillary services market in Austria, providing a new way to stabilize the grid and ensure energy reliability.
This initiative could potentially be widely replicated due to its innovative use of battery-buffered EV fast chargers, making it an attractive solution for other markets.
The integration of EV fast-chargers into ancillary services markets has the potential to support the increasing demand for renewable energy sources and reduce reliance on traditional power plants.

articles.title: GreenSketch AI 3.0 fast tracks solar and battery install design and business
articles.summary: The article discusses the latest upgrade to GreenSketch AI 3.0, a free solar and battery design and installation business tool developed by OSW Group in Australia. The new version includes AI-powered features that simplify and accelerate workflows, allowing installers to automatically detect and refine real roofs for optimal installation suitability. The tool also provides 3D views and templates for battery installations, enabling installers to visualize and configure systems accurately.
key_takeaways: GreenSketch AI 3.0 has been upgraded with new AI-powered features that simplify and accelerate workflows for solar and battery design and installation businesses.
The tool now includes high-resolution imaging of neighborhoods and 3D views to optimize solar layouts, allowing installers to detect and refine real roofs for optimal installation suitability.
The platform also provides numerous home battery configuration templates to help installers visualize how an installation can work in the available space, enabling accurate planning and design.

articles.title: TEP Wins Approval for Data Center Energy Supply Agreement
articles.summary: The Arizona Corporation Commission has approved a 286-MW energy supply agreement between Tucson Electric Power and the developer of an embattled data center project near Tucson. The agreement ensures that the developer, Beale Infrastructure Group, will have access to energy supplies from existing resources already planned by TEP, without requiring new dedicated resources. This approval also provides protections for ratepayers and allows TEP to spread fixed costs across more retail electric sales.
key_takeaways: Arizona regulators have approved a 286-MW energy supply agreement between Tucson Electric Power and the developer of the Project Blue data center, ensuring that the project will have access to energy supplies.
The agreement provides protections for ratepayers by including a minimum monthly charge and requiring Beale Infrastructure Group to give at least three years' notice to terminate the contract.
The approval allows TEP to spread fixed costs across more retail electric sales, reducing the need for potential rate increases.

articles.title: Collaboration and Innovation in the U.S. Transmission Industry
articles.summary: The article discusses the need for modernization and expansion of the U.S. power grid, citing aging infrastructure and rising demand as major concerns. Collaboration and innovation are highlighted as key solutions to address these challenges. The ETS 2025 conference emphasized the importance of teamwork and strategic partnerships in driving positive change.
key_takeaways: The U.S. power grid is facing significant challenges due to aging infrastructure and rising demand, emphasizing the need for modernization and expansion.
Collaboration and innovation are identified as key solutions to address these challenges, requiring teamwork and strategic partnerships to drive positive change.
Strategic collaboration among stakeholders, including utilities, regulators, and industry experts, is crucial for developing effective solutions to meet the future energy needs of the U.S.

articles.title: Adaptive Online Optimization for Microgrids with Renewable Energy Sources
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel adaptive online optimization algorithm for managing microgrids with high renewable energy penetration. The algorithm is designed to handle changes in the internal model and ensures efficient management of the grid by verifying constraints through projection onto the constraint set. Numerical results show promising performance compared to state-of-the-art alternatives.
key_takeaways: The proposed algorithm uses a control-based design that applies the internal model principle, and integrates a system identification routine to identify such an internal model.

The algorithm ensures efficient management of microgrids by verifying constraints through projection onto the constraint set, which helps in ensuring that the system operates within defined boundaries.
The adaptability of the proposed algorithm is enhanced compared to state-of-the-art alternatives, allowing it to effectively handle changes in the internal model and ensure optimal performance.

articles.title: Counterfactual Explanations for Power System Optimisation
articles.summary: The article discusses the use of counterfactual explanations in power system optimization, particularly in solving complex optimization problems like DC Optimal Power Flow and Unit Commitment. The framework identifies minimum changes in input parameters that would have changed the optimal solution, allowing users to understand why certain generators were not dispatched or how constraints led to specific solutions. Leveraging historical data from previously solved instances can provide significant speed benefits and improve explanation accuracy.
key_takeaways: The use of counterfactual explanations can help identify the most important differences between real and expected market outcomes in power system optimization.
Leveraging historical data from previously solved instances can significantly improve computational efficiency in solving complex optimization problems like DC Optimal Power Flow and Unit Commitment.
Conventional methods may not be tractable for certain cases, but the proposed framework provides a way to derive explanations that were previously unattainable.

articles.title: Small-Signal Stability Oriented Real-Time Operation of Power Systems with a High Penetration of Inverter-Based Resources
articles.summary: This study proposes a control strategy for modern power systems with high penetration of inverter-based resources (IBRs), aiming to ensure safe operation while guaranteeing small-signal stability. The proposed methodology consists of two stages: offline analysis and online feedback optimization. It evaluates the effectiveness of the method on an academic test case based on a modified IEEE 9-bus system.
key_takeaways: The study proposes a control strategy that combines offline analysis and online feedback optimization to ensure small-signal stability in power systems with high IBR penetration.
The methodology uses a damping-based stability index to evaluate operating conditions and drives the system toward an optimal point while maintaining a secure distance from instability regions.
The proposed strategy is evaluated on a modified IEEE 9-bus system, which replaces synchronous generators with IBRs operating under grid-following and grid-forming control modes.

articles.title: Stability-Guaranteed Dual Kalman Filtering for Electrochemical Battery State Estimation
articles.summary: The article discusses the proposed Stability Guaranteed Dual Kalman Filtering (SG-DKF) method for estimating the state of electrochemical batteries, aiming to improve accuracy and stability in battery management. The SG-DKF approach addresses the challenges of divergence in traditional dual Kalman filtering by introducing a Lyapunov-based analysis and an adaptive dead-zone rule. This method achieves comparable accuracy to existing methods while reducing the RMSE of state of charge estimates.
key_takeaways: The proposed SG-DKF method is designed to address the limitations of traditional dual Kalman filtering, which can experience divergence under large initialization errors or model mismatch.
A key innovation of SG-DKF is the use of a Lyapunov-based analysis to establish a sufficient stability condition, leading to an adaptive dead-zone rule for parameter updates.
The application of SG-DKF to an electrochemical battery model results in significant improvements in state of charge estimation accuracy, reducing RMSE by over 45% under large initial state errors.

articles.title: Indiana utility to deliver 1.6GWh BESS for Amazon’s data center expansion, though fossil fuels form major part of package
articles.summary: A subsidiary of NIPSCO has agreed to deliver a 1.6GWh battery energy storage system (BESS) as part of Amazon's expansion of its data centers in the region, with the majority of the new capacity coming from fossil fuels.
key_takeaways: The project involves the construction of 3GW of new dispatchable capacity to serve Amazon's planned data center expansion.
Despite the emphasis on renewable energy, the majority of the package is expected to be fueled by traditional fossil fuels.
This deal highlights the need for more diversified and sustainable energy solutions in the tech industry's rapid expansion.

articles.title: When the world’s largest battery power plant caught fire, toxic metals rained down – wetlands captured the fallout
articles.summary: A fire at Vistra's battery energy storage facility in Moss Landing, California resulted in the release of toxic metals, which affected air and soil quality. The incident highlights the potential risks associated with large-scale battery energy storage facilities. Wetlands nearby served as a natural buffer to capture some of the debris.
key_takeaways: A fire at a large battery energy storage facility can have severe environmental impacts, releasing toxic metals into the air and soil.
The proximity of wetlands to such facilities can serve as a natural mitigator for pollution, capturing debris and potentially reducing its impact on surrounding ecosystems.
The incident underscores the need for enhanced safety measures and monitoring systems at large-scale battery energy storage facilities to prevent similar incidents in the future.

articles.title: ACP Tallies 11.7 GW of Solar, Storage, Wind Additions in Q3
articles.summary: The American Clean Power Association (ACP) has reported a record 11.7 GW of solar, storage, and wind power additions in the third quarter of 2025, bringing the U.S. nameplate capacity to 344.3 GW. This is attributed to the momentum developed in the past several years. However, ACP CEO Jason Grumet warns that policy instability and regulatory uncertainty threaten the ability of the US to meet future energy needs.
key_takeaways: The total number of new solar, battery storage, and onshore wind power generation added 11.7 GW in Q3 2025, setting a record for the quarter.
Utility-scale solar continues to lead capacity additions, while onshore wind has long been the leading US renewable energy source with 157.6 GW of installed capacity as of the latest data available.

Despite the impressive numbers, ACP CEO Jason Grumet notes that policy instability and regulatory uncertainty pose a significant threat to meeting future energy needs, particularly in terms of power purchase agreements being 31% lower than in Q3 2024.

articles.title: INL Taps AWS, GE Vernova, Oil Majors for First MARVEL Microreactor Experiments
articles.summary: The Idaho National Laboratory (INL) has selected five commercial teams to potentially demonstrate advanced applications of its Microreactor Application Research Validation and Evaluation (MARVEL) platform. The MARVEL platform is an 85-kWth/20-kWe liquid-metal-cooled test bed currently under construction, which will help researchers explore advanced reactor applications such as microgrid integration, remote monitoring, and autonomous control technologies. The selected teams include AWS, GE Vernova, and oil majors.
key_takeaways: Five commercial teams, including AWS, GE Vernova, and oil majors, have been selected to demonstrate advanced applications of the MARVEL platform.
The MARVEL platform is an 85-kWth/20-kWe liquid-metal-cooled test bed currently under construction at the INL, expected to be operational by 2027.
The selected teams will potentially explore advanced reactor applications such as microgrid integration, remote monitoring, and autonomous control technologies.

articles.title: SMA launches new containerized medium-voltage substation for large-scale BESS and solar plants
articles.summary: SMA Solar Technology has launched a new containerized medium-voltage substation, the MVPS-9200, in Europe, which is designed for large-scale battery energy storage systems (BESS) and solar plants. The solution integrates multiple components into a single standard container, simplifying power plant design and installation. It supports DC voltage of 1500 V and can be customized to suit different configurations.
key_takeaways: The MVPS-9200 containerized medium-voltage substation is designed for large-scale infrastructure and can support installations with a DC voltage of 1500 V, making it suitable for both BESS and solar plants.

The solution integrates multiple components, including two high-performance inverters, two transformers, and a medium-voltage distribution system, into a single standard container, simplifying power plant design and installation.

The MVPS-9200 can be customized to suit different configurations, using either Sunny Central UP inverters for photovoltaic power plants or Sunny Central Storage UP or UP-S inverters for BESS systems, which also features SiC-MOSFET technology to reduce energy losses.

articles.title: How to build giant solar plants in mountainous areas
articles.summary:
**SUMMARY**
Chinese researchers have proposed a new methodology for designing utility-scale solar power projects in mountainous regions. They conducted a simulation study of a 386.4 MW solar farm near Pu’er, China, to analyze the impact of terrain on system efficiency and provide actionable decision-making support for PV array maintenance and optimization. The study used high-resolution digital elevation model data and meteorological data to quantify key operational factors.

**KEY TAKEAWAYS**
* Researchers have proposed a new methodology for designing utility-scale solar power projects in mountainous regions, which can help optimize system efficiency and reduce losses due to temperature, irradiance, and shading.
* The study highlighted the importance of using high-resolution digital elevation model data and meteorological data to analyze terrain and climate factors that impact solar panel performance.
* The proposed methodology provides actionable decision-making support for PV array maintenance and optimization in complex terrain areas, which can help improve overall system efficiency and reduce costs.

articles.title: PJM awards interconnection agreements to 23 BESS resources
articles.summary: PJM has awarded interconnection agreements to 23 battery energy storage system resources, totaling 2.2GW, in its first transition cycle of the reformed interconnection process. This marks a significant milestone for PJM's integration of BESS into its grid. The awarded projects will help PJM achieve its renewable energy and energy storage goals.
key_takeaways: 23 battery energy storage system (BESS) resources have been awarded interconnection agreements in PJM's first transition cycle, totaling 2.2GW.
This award represents a significant milestone for PJM's integration of BESS into its grid, supporting the adoption of renewable energy sources and energy storage.
The awarded projects will help PJM achieve its goals for reducing greenhouse gas emissions and promoting energy efficiency in the region.

articles.title: Modernizing America’s power grid: why transmission lines hold the key to a sustainable future
articles.summary: The article discusses the importance of modernizing America's power grid, specifically highlighting the role of transmission lines in achieving a sustainable energy future. The author argues that the current state of the power grid is at an inflection point and its response will determine the country's path forward. The article suggests that transmission lines play a crucial role in integrating renewable energy sources into the grid.
key_takeaways: Transmission lines are critical for efficiently transmitting renewable energy from remote locations to population centers, enabling the widespread adoption of intermittent energy sources.
Upgrading and modernizing the nation's transmission infrastructure is essential to ensure reliable and efficient transmission of electricity across long distances.

The integration of advanced technologies such as smart grids, energy storage systems, and grid-scale batteries can help optimize transmission line performance and mitigate the challenges associated with integrating renewable energy sources.

articles.title: Rare win for renewable energy: Trump administration funds geothermal network expansion
articles.summary: The US Department of Energy has approved an $8.6 million grant to Eversource Energy to expand its geothermal network in Framingham, Massachusetts. This funding marks a rare win for renewable energy projects under the Trump administration. The expansion is expected to enhance the reliability and efficiency of the grid.
key_takeaways: The US Department of Energy has provided $8.6 million in grant funding to support the expansion of Eversource Energy's geothermal network.
This funding demonstrates a rare instance of renewable energy project approval under the Trump administration, which has historically been more skeptical of such initiatives.

articles.title: Two EV battery players are joining forces to develop all-solid-state batteries
articles.summary: Two major players in the electric vehicle (EV) battery industry, Factorial Energy and POSCO FUTURE M, are collaborating to develop all-solid-state batteries. articles.summary: Google has backed carbon capture technology for data center energy providers, which could be a game-changer for the U.S. power sector given the fast-growing electricity demands of data centers. The growing electricity demands of data centers create a need for innovative solutions like carbon capture technology, which could reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the industry.

articles.title: Utility innovation, EV adoption, and digital twins define the 2025 Grid Changers

articles.summary: Australia's State-owned generator Stanwell has partnered with Quinbrook Infrastructure Partners to develop a massive gas-plus-storage hybrid power plant at the Gladstone State Development Area in Queensland. articles.title: Eight energy trends that will shape energy storage in 2026
articles.summary: The article discusses eight energy trends that are expected to shape the energy storage market in Australia by 2026. Advancements in battery technology will play a crucial role in improving the efficiency and affordability of energy storage solutions, making them more accessible to consumers.

articles.title: CaFTRA: Frequency-Domain Correlation-Aware Feedback-Free MIMO Transmission and Resource Allocation for 6G and Beyond
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel power and energy systems framework called CaFTRA, which aims to overcome the limitations of feedback-based MIMO transmission in wireless systems. By leveraging artificial intelligence, CaFTRA predicts channel state information based on user geolocation and eliminates real-time uplink feedback. The framework has shown promising results in simulation tests, achieving stable matching convergence and significant gains in spectral efficiency and user fairness.
key_takeaways: CaFTRA proposes a novel frequency-domain Correlation-aware Feedback-free MIMO Transmission and Resource Allocation framework for 6G and beyond wireless systems.
The framework leverages artificial intelligence to predict channel state information based on user geolocation, eliminating the need for real-time uplink feedback.
Simulation results demonstrate that CaFTRA achieves stable matching convergence and significant gains in spectral efficiency and user fairness compared to 5G.

articles.title: Semi-Markov Decision Process Framework for Age of Incorrect Information Minimization
articles.summary:
Here is the analysis of the power and energy systems article:

 The article discusses a framework for optimizing age of incorrect information (AoII) minimization in remote estimation systems. It assumes an information source observing a discrete-time finite-state Markov chain and employs push-based transmissions towards a monitor tasked with estimating the source. The goal is to minimize the weighted sum of time average of AoII, estimation, and transmission costs by choosing suitable thresholds.
key_takeaways: The article formulates the problem as a semi-Markov decision process (SMDP) with the same state-space as the original discrete-time finite-state Markov chain (DTMC), aiming to optimize multi-threshold transmission policies.

A novel stochastic tool called dual-regime absorbing Markov chain (DR-AMC) and its corresponding absorption time distribution (DR-DPH) are used to obtain the optimum parameters for the SMDP, enabling the minimization of AoII costs.

The framework aims to minimize the weighted sum of an arbitrary function of AoII and estimation, as well as transmission costs, by choosing optimal thresholds for packet transmissions based on the estimated AoII value.

articles.title: De-Risk the Energy Transition with Hardware-in-the-Loop Testing
articles.summary: The article discusses the benefits of hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) testing for power and energy systems, particularly in validating protection schemes, renewable integration, and HVDC systems before deployment. HIL testing enables closed-loop simulation with actual hardware, reducing risk and accelerating commissioning. It is applied across various sectors, including renewable energy and microgrids.
key_takeaways: Phasor-domain simulation is insufficient for capturing transient phenomena in inverter-dominated grids.
Real-time electromagnetic (EMT) simulation using HIL testing allows for closed-loop testing with actual hardware.
Hardware-in-the-loop testing reduces risk, accelerates commissioning, and validates multi-vendor interoperability.

key_takeaways: SmartestEnergy US has partnered with GridBeyond to optimize three energy storage resources in the ERCOT market, totaling 29.7 MW.

articles.title: INTEC Chosen to Build 50-MW Solar Power Facility in Germany
articles.summary: INTEC Energy Solutions has been selected by a leading European renewable energy investment group, AUKERA, to lead the construction of a 50-MW solar power plant in Lachendorf, Germany. key_takeaways: Global renewable energy contractor INTEC Energy Solutions has been commissioned as the engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) contractor for a 50-MW solar power plant in Lachendorf, Germany.

articles.title: Key takeaways from China-EU Solar & Energy Storage Industries Dialogue 2025
articles.summary: The China-EU Solar & Energy Storage Industries Dialogue 2025 brought together solar and storage industry leaders from both regions to advance cross-border partnerships, launch a bilateral storage collaboration platform, and coordinate strategies for scaling PV and battery deployment. articles.title: U.S. data center power demand could reach 106 GW by 2035: BloombergNEF
articles.summary: The power demand for data centers in the US is expected to reach 106 GW by 2035, according to a forecast from BloombergNEF. articles.summary: The article emphasizes the importance of wireless monitoring in utility companies' security plans, highlighting its benefits in closing blind spots, supporting critical infrastructure protection, and speeding up incident response. Wireless monitoring supports critical infrastructure protection by providing real-time alerts and insights into potential vulnerabilities, enabling swift action to prevent disruptions.
The use of wireless monitoring speeds up incident response by providing utilities with immediate information about incidents, reducing the time it takes to respond and mitigate the impact.

articles.summary: The Public Utilities Commission of Ohio has ordered FirstEnergy's three regulated companies to pay $250 million for violations linked to the state's largest-ever utility corruption scandal, with over $186 million being refunded or credited to consumers. articles.title: FRV and AGL advance 2,200MWh of grid-forming battery energy storage in Australia

articles.title: State-owned Stanwell bags exclusivity for Quinbrook’s 6.24GWh hybrid energy storage facility in Australia

articles.title: US battery capacity rises 59% with 14 GW added in 12 months, says EIA

articles.title: California lawmakers urge CPUC to enforce utility interconnection timelines
articles.summary: A coalition of 18 California legislators is urging the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) to enforce regulations under "Rule 21" regarding the interconnection of customer-sited solar and energy storage systems. The legislators claim that Pacific Gas & Electric (PG&E) and Southern California Edison (SCE) have frequently failed to meet state-mandated timelines, with up to 73% non-compliance over the last five years. This issue centers on "Rule 21," a standardized tariff that establishes the process and deadlines for utilities to approve and activate distributed energy resources.
key_takeaways: A coalition of California legislators is pushing the CPUC to enforce regulations under "Rule 21" due to frequent failures by PG&E and SCE to meet state-mandated timelines.

The issue stems from a standardized tariff that requires utilities to establish processes and deadlines for approving and activating distributed energy resources, with compliance rates as low as 27%-45%.

articles.title: HDRE, Brawn Capital put ‘100% merchant’ BESS into operation in northern Japan

articles.title: Optimal solar-plus-storage sizing for heavy industry operation
articles.summary: Australian researchers developed an energy modeling framework to assess the feasibility of solar-plus-storage systems for heavy industries. The study found that smart grid integration and flexible industrial operations are more effective in reducing electricity costs and enabling 100% renewable energy use than technology cost reductions. The new methodology addresses various factors, including PV intermittency and equipment degradation over time.
key_takeaways: Smart grid integration and flexible industrial operations are more effective in lowering electricity costs and enabling 100% renewable energy use compared to technology cost reductions.
The study's high-resolution energy modeling framework incorporates lifecycle degradation and production intermittency, addressing operational needs under diverse weather conditions.

Technology cost reductions alone may not be sufficient for heavy industries to switch to 100% renewable energy, highlighting the importance of other strategies such as grid integration and industrial flexibility.

articles.title: US battery manufacturing ‘could cover domestic BESS demand within a few years’

articles.title: Pramac EMS features special modes for C&I battery storage sites
articles.summary: Pramac's EMS (Energy Management System) is a smart solution for commercial and industrial battery storage sites, offering advanced modes such as "Smart Self-Consumption" and "External Control". These modes enable optimized charging and discharging strategies to minimize costs and reduce grid dependency. The EMS integrates with various devices and forecasts to provide real-time optimization.
key_takeaways: Pramac's EMS offers two specialized modes: "Smart Self-Consumption", which minimizes residual grid purchase costs by charging the BESS during low-price periods, and "External Control", which enables participation in ancillary service markets.
The system combines data from meters, inverters, batteries, controllable loads, PV production, and load consumption forecasts to calculate optimal setpoints for each device.

articles.title: Solar-Hydrogen Microgrid Revolutionizes Energy Security in Ladakh

The system, built by NTPC and Group Surya with the Indian Army onboard, harnesses 3.7 MW of solar power to produce green hydrogen and deliver clean energy to the site. articles.title: Xcel Energy Texas and Transource to Expand Transmission with Beckham County - Potter 345 kV Project
articles.summary: Xcel Energy Texas and Transource have partnered to expand the transmission infrastructure in Beckham County-Potter with a new 345 kV project, which will strengthen the regional grid by connecting Texas and Oklahoma through 128 miles of new transmission lines.

The project will utilize Transource's expertise in transmission infrastructure development and Xcel Energy's knowledge of regional grid operations to ensure a smooth and efficient construction process.

articles.title: Energy Storage Exists, & It’s Coming For Your Fossil Fuels
articles.summary: The article discusses the growing importance of energy storage in revolutionizing the way we generate and use power, particularly with a focus on concentrating solar power. Energy storage is seen as a game-changer for commercial and industrial applications, potentially displacing fossil fuels as a primary source of energy. This shift could have significant implications for the energy industry.
key_takeaways: Energy storage is being recognized as a key enabler for widespread adoption of renewable energy sources like concentrating solar power.
The article suggests that energy storage can help overcome some of the challenges associated with intermittent renewable energy sources, such as dispatchability and scalability.
The rise of energy storage could potentially lead to a decline in the use of fossil fuels, marking a significant shift towards cleaner and more sustainable energy sources.

articles.title: Massive Data Centers May Make Groundwater Pollution Worse
articles.summary: The article discusses the potential environmental impact of massive data centers on groundwater pollution. Data centers require large amounts of water for cooling, and if this water contains pollutants, it can exacerbate existing pollution problems in nearby groundwater sources. This issue highlights the need for more sustainable and environmentally responsible data center operations.
key_takeaways: Massive data centers can contaminate groundwater with pollutants from cooling systems, posing a significant environmental risk.
The use of large quantities of water for cooling servers can lead to increased pressure on already strained local water resources.
Data centers must adopt more sustainable practices, such as using cleaner cooling methods or implementing efficient water management systems, to mitigate the risk of groundwater pollution.

articles.title: Aptera (SEV) shows off assembly line for solar electric ‘car’, updates on battery and testing
articles.summary: Aptera Motors has released an update on its solar electric vehicle project, showcasing its assembly line for validation vehicles and providing progress updates on battery production and efficiency testing. The company is moving closer to low-volume production of its "car". This update suggests that the company is making significant strides in its technology development.
key_takeaways: Aptera Motors has established an assembly line for its validation vehicles, indicating a step forward in the manufacturing process.
The company is also making progress on battery production and efficiency testing, which are crucial components of its solar electric vehicle design.
The update suggests that Aptera is nearing low-volume production, implying that the company's technology is becoming more refined and ready for mass production.

articles.title: Solving PJM’s data center problem
articles.summary: The article discusses a problem faced by PJM, the grid operator for the Mid-Atlantic region, where it is buying capacity from new data centers. To solve this issue, PJM should stop buying capacity and instead provide data centers with only interruptible service until they bring their own capacity to avoid over-reliance on external power sources.
key_takeaways: PJM should stop buying capacity for new data centers to prevent over-reliance on external power sources.
Data centers can be provided with only interruptible service, forcing them to invest in their own capacity and reducing PJM's exposure to price volatility.
This approach aligns with the grid operator's goal of promoting energy efficiency and reducing its reliance on non-essential demand.

articles.title: Virtual Power Plants Thwart Plot Against Renewable Energy
articles.summary: The article discusses how Virtual Power Plants (VPPs) are outpacing other forms of renewable energy production in adding new capacity to the grid. Despite a shift against wind and solar power by the White House, VPPs have emerged as a key component of the US renewable energy transition. This suggests that distributed energy sources are becoming increasingly important in meeting energy demands.
key_takeaways: Virtual Power Plants (VPPs) are outpacing other forms of renewable energy production in adding new capacity to the grid.
The combination of solar plus storage is a particularly effective form of domestic energy production.
Despite opposition from the White House, the US renewable energy transition remains unstoppable.

articles.title: National Grid taps AI to combat rising wildfire risk in the Northeast
articles.summary: National Grid, a utility company, is partnering with Rhizome to utilize artificial intelligence (AI) tools to identify and prevent potential ignition threats from wildfires in its transmission and distribution networks across Massachusetts, New York, and the UK. This initiative aims to combat rising wildfire risk in the Northeast region. The partnership will leverage AI technology to enhance grid resilience.
key_takeaways: National Grid is using AI tools to identify and prevent potential ignition threats from wildfires in its transmission and distribution networks.
The company is partnering with Rhizome, a grid resilience planning company based in Washington D.C., to implement this technology.
This initiative aims to combat rising wildfire risk in the Northeast region of Massachusetts, New York, and the UK.

articles.title: ‘Renewable’ no more: The Trump administration renames the National Renewable Energy Laboratory
articles.summary: The Trump administration has renamed the National Renewable Energy Laboratory to the National Laboratory of the Rockies in Colorado, reflecting a shift in focus from renewable energy to a broader research agenda. This change may indicate a reduction in emphasis on renewable energy and an increase in exploration of other areas of research. The new name does not provide explicit details about the specific changes or goals of the laboratory.
key_takeaways: The renaming of the National Renewable Energy Laboratory suggests a shift away from a focus solely on renewable energy, potentially indicating a broader scope for the laboratory's research.
This change may be part of a larger trend under the Trump administration to rebrand and realign various government agencies and initiatives with a more general or less specific name.

The new name, National Laboratory of the Rockies, does not provide information on the current or future areas of research focus, making it unclear what aspects will receive increased attention or resources.

articles.title: New analysis shows more US consumers are falling behind on their utility bills
articles.summary: The article reports that a new analysis by The Century Foundation and Protect Borrowers has found that past due balances on utility bills in the US have increased by 9.7% to $789, indicating that more consumers are struggling to pay their utility bills.
key_takeaways: More US consumers are falling behind on their utility bills, leading to a significant increase in past due balances.
The rising trend suggests that the economic burden of utility bills is becoming increasingly difficult for many households to manage.
This issue highlights the need for support and assistance programs to help low-income households struggling with utility bill payments.

articles.title: RE-LLM: Integrating Large Language Models into Renewable Energy Systems
articles.summary: The article proposes the Renewable Energy Large Language Model (RE-LLM), a hybrid framework that integrates Large Language Models into energy system modeling to address the communication gap between technical models and non-expert stakeholders. RE-LLM combines optimization-based scenario exploration, machine learning surrogates, and LLM-powered natural language generation to reduce computational burden and enhance interpretability. This framework aims to bridge the gap between data-driven analysis and actionable decision-making for sustainable energy transitions.
key_takeaways: The proposed framework RE-LLM integrates Large Language Models into energy system modeling to improve interpretability and accessibility of complex results.

By combining optimization-based scenario exploration, machine learning surrogates, and LLM-powered natural language generation, RE-LLM aims to reduce computational burden while enhancing inter-interpretability.
The framework is adaptable across different optimization platforms and energy system models, ensuring broad applicability beyond the case study presented.

articles.title: You’d Really Miss Renewables This Winter If They Weren’t Available
articles.summary: The article highlights the importance of renewable energy sources, such as solar and wind power, in reducing global warming stress and its climate consequences. Renewable energy is also more cost-effective and less harmful to human health compared to fossil fuels. The article emphasizes the significance of renewable energy during winter months when it is particularly crucial.
key_takeaways: Solar and wind power provide significant benefits for mitigating global warming stress and its climate consequences.
Renewable energy sources are a cost-effective alternative to fossil fuels, making them more economically viable.
The use of renewable energy can also lead to reduced harm to human health compared to the combustion of fossil fuels.

articles.title: Morocco opens tender for 1,000 km UHV transmission line
articles.summary: Morocco has opened a tender for the construction of a 1,000 km ultra-high-voltage alternating current power line to transmit approximately 2 GW of renewable energy between Boujdour and Tensift. The pre-qualification round is currently underway, with applications due on January 15, 2026. The project aims to strengthen Morocco's electrical infrastructure and support the growth of renewable energy.
key_takeaways: Morocco is investing in a 1,000 km ultra-high-voltage alternating current power line to transmit approximately 2 GW of renewable energy between Boujdour and Tensift.
The project is part of a broader set of major electrical infrastructure projects currently in operation or development by the National Office for Electricity and Potable Water (ONEE).
The chosen contractor will be responsible for designing, constructing, and commissioning the project under a turnkey contract, with a scheduled completion date of December 2028.

articles.title: NTPC commissions solar-hydrogen-based microgrid in India
articles.summary: NTPC has commissioned a solar-hydrogen-based microgrid system in Chushul, Ladakh, India, which will provide 200 kW of round-the-clock power to remote Army locations. The system uses hydrogen as a storage medium and is designed to replace diesel gensets, reducing carbon emissions and enhancing energy security. The project was completed in a record eight months despite challenging terrain.
key_takeaways: The solar-hydrogen-based microgrid system will provide reliable and sustainable power supply even in harsh winter conditions with temperatures as low as –40°C.
The system replaces diesel generator sets at remote Army locations, reducing carbon emissions and improving energy security.
The project supports local production and use of green energy, eliminating the need to transport fuel from the plains and easing logistical burdens.

articles.title: The Strange Time Compression of Sodium-Ion Battery Development
articles.summary: The article discusses the rapid development of sodium-ion battery technology, led by Chinese companies CATL and BYD, which now hold over 50% of the world's EV battery market share. This progress has been unexpected, given the relatively slow pace of development in this field. The sudden acceleration of innovation is a significant trend in the clean energy sector.
key_takeaways: Chinese companies CATL and BYD have dominated the sodium-ion battery market share, accounting for over 50% of the world's EV battery market as of 2025.
Despite the significant progress, the development of sodium-ion batteries has been compressed into a relatively short period, with notable achievements from January to September 2025.
The rapid advancement in this field is notable, especially given its relative slow pace compared to other clean energy technologies.

articles.title: Data Centers and the Grid: Key Insights from POWER’s Inaugural Data Center POWER eXchange Summit
articles.summary: The article discusses the insights from POWER's inaugural Data Center POWER eXchange Summit, which explored the growing demand for electricity by data centers and its impact on grid constraints. The summit highlighted the challenges posed by the rapid growth of artificial intelligence and other data-intensive applications. The event aimed to bring together industry experts to examine the intersection of accelerating data center loads and tightening grid constraints.
key_takeaways: The rise of artificial intelligence is expected to create a significant surge in electricity demand, posing challenges for the grid.
Data centers are already experiencing tightening grid constraints due to their growing energy requirements.
The summit provided a platform for industry experts to discuss potential solutions to address these challenges and ensure a stable power supply for data centers.

articles.title: Emerson Addresses Power Industry’s AI-Driven Demand Surge
articles.summary: The power industry is experiencing a surge in demand growth driven by data centers and artificial intelligence (AI) applications, creating both opportunities and challenges for utilities and equipment manufacturers. Emerson's Power business is addressing this trend through innovative solutions, including AI-driven digital twins for simulation and optimization. As the demand grows, Emerson aims to support the power industry's transformation.
key_takeaways: The power industry is experiencing a surge in demand growth driven by data centers and AI applications, which presents both opportunities and challenges.
Emerson's Power business is leveraging AI-driven technologies, such as digital twins, to simulate and optimize power systems, supporting the industry's transformation.

The growing demand for power driven by data centers and AI applications will likely require utilities and equipment manufacturers to invest in innovative solutions to maintain efficiency and reliability.

articles.title: You probably won’t believe which country leads the world in e-bike battery safety
articles.summary: The article reports that China is leading the world in e-bike battery safety with the implementation of strong and comprehensive lithium-ion safety rules, which recently went into effect. This may surprise many Americans who might not associate China with e-bike safety regulations. The new rules aim to improve battery safety for electric bikes.
key_takeaways: China has implemented a set of strong and comprehensive lithium-ion safety rules for e-bike batteries.
These rules have recently gone into effect, indicating a focus on improving battery safety in the country.
The implementation of these safety standards may be seen as surprising by many Americans who might not associate China with e-bike safety regulations.

articles.title: Scalable Physics-Informed Neural Networks for Accelerating Electromagnetic Transient Stability Assessment
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel framework for accelerating Electromagnetic Transient (EMT) simulations in power systems by replacing computationally expensive components with Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs). The proposed PINN formulation enables a modular and scalable integration into the simulation algorithm, leading to significant speedups. The authors demonstrate a 4-6x simulation speedup using a type-4 wind turbine EMT model.
key_takeaways: The article identifies the most computationally expensive components of EMT simulations and proposes replacing them with fast and accurate PINNs to accelerate the simulation process.
The proposed novel PINN formulation enables a modular and scalable integration into the simulation algorithm, making it suitable for various power system applications.
The authors achieve a significant speedup in EMT simulations (4-6x) by capturing complex phenomena such as Phase-Locked Loop behavior with PINNs.

articles.title: The Battle of the Water Futures
articles.summary: The "Battle of the Water Networks" competition will take place at WDSA/CCWI 2026, where participants will design and operate a water distribution system under deep uncertainty with staged interventions. The challenge incorporates policymaking, artificial intelligence, and an open-source evaluation framework to assess solutions. This competition aims to address the complexities of designing next-generation urban water systems.
key_takeaways: The competition features a staged-design approach, unobservable and unknown uncertainties, and incorporates elements of policymaking and artificial intelligence.
The solutions will be assessed using a transparent and inspectable open-source evaluation framework, emphasizing transparency and accountability.
The "Battle of the Water Networks" competition is part of the broader theme of WDSA/CCWI 2026, focusing on designing the next generation of urban water systems with a long-term horizon.

articles.title: Dynamic Power Allocation For NOMA-Based Transmission in 6G Optical Wireless Networks
articles.summary: This article proposes a dynamic power allocation method for NOMA-based transmission in 6G optical wireless networks. The proposed method uses a combination of RF-aided grouping and dynamic power allocation to maximize the sum rate, fairness, and energy efficiency of the network. The results show that the proposed method converges to the optimum solution and outperforms existing schemes.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a novel dynamic application for NOMA-based transmission in 6G optical wireless networks using RF-aided grouping and dynamic power allocation.
The proposed method aims to maximize sum rate, fairness, and energy efficiency by forming groups of users based on distance-based weight edges and allocating optimal power to each group.
The results demonstrate the convergence of the proposed method to the optimum solution and its superior performance compared to existing schemes.

articles.title: Open-source implementation of distribution network reconfiguration methods: Analysis and comparison
articles.summary: The article presents a comprehensive analysis of distribution network reconfiguration methods, tracing their development from classic heuristic algorithms to contemporary state-of-the-art techniques. The authors review seven methodologies and assess their strengths and limitations through extensive literature review and empirical testing. An open-source repository containing documented implementations of the reviewed algorithms is also provided.
key_takeaways: The article provides a systematic analysis of various distribution network reconfiguration methods, including classical heuristic algorithms, advanced meta-heuristic methodologies, and purely mathematical approaches.

The comparative analysis reveals the strengths and limitations of each approach under different network conditions and operational constraints, providing valuable insights for researchers and practitioners.
An open-source repository is made available, offering comprehensive documentation, test cases, and performance benchmarks to facilitate accessibility and reproducible research in the field.

articles.title: 600MWh Bulabul battery storage site in Australia attracts Danish partner in AU$300 million deal
articles.summary: Ampyr Australia has secured a 15-year battery storage agreement with InCommodities for the 600MWh Bulabul Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) in New South Wales, Australia. This deal is worth AU$300 million and marks an important milestone in the development of Australia's energy storage industry. The partnership is expected to support the growth of renewable energy in the region.
key_takeaways: The 600MWh Bulabul BESS will provide a significant boost to New South Wales' energy storage capacity, supporting the integration of renewable energy sources into the grid.
The AU$300 million deal highlights the growing importance of battery storage projects in Australia, particularly among international investors and partners.

The partnership between Ampyr Australia and InCommodities demonstrates the potential for collaboration between Australian companies and foreign investors to drive growth in the country's energy storage sector.

articles.title: Solar Power Benefits Public Schools, And What’s Wrong With That?

key_takeaways: Solar power plants and rooftop installations are providing financial relief to public schools by reducing their electricity costs.

articles.title: Another EV Charging Hub Running On Renewable Energy Launches In California

key_takeaways: A new EV charging hub with 18 fast chargers has been launched in California, serving fleet vehicles.
The hub operates on renewable energy, contributing to a growing trend of sustainable transportation infrastructure.
This launch is part of an increasing number of EV charging hubs and stations being set up across the US.

articles.title: Hyundai Motor Group Drives Next-Generation Battery Innovation with Future Mobility Battery Campus
articles.summary: Hyundai Motor Group is investing KRW 1.2 trillion to establish its first comprehensive battery research and development hub, Future Mobility Battery Campus, in Anseong, Korea by the end of 2026. The hub aims to internalize core battery technologies to optimize electric vehicle (EV) performance and seamless integration. This investment underscores Hyundai's commitment to advancing next-generation battery innovation.
key_takeaways: Hyundai Motor Group is investing KRW 1.2 trillion in its Future Mobility Battery Campus, a comprehensive battery research and development hub.
The hub will focus on internalizing core battery technologies, including cell design, process engineering, and integrated control systems, to optimize EV performance and integration.
The investment aims to establish Hyundai as a leader in next-generation battery innovation, enabling seamless vehicle integration and optimal EV performance.

articles.title: Sodium-ion battery cell cost could drop to $40/kWh, says IRENA
articles.summary: The International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA) has released a report stating that sodium-ion battery cell costs could drop to $40/kWh, potentially making them a cheaper alternative to lithium-ion technology. This comes as prices of lithium have increased in recent years, but the cost of sodium remains relatively stable. While it's unclear if sodium-ion batteries will become a widely adopted alternative to lithium-ion technology, they may still offer significant cost-saving opportunities in applications such as electric vehicles and large-scale energy storage.
key_takeaways: Sodium-ion battery cell costs could drop to $40/kWh, potentially making them a cheaper alternative to lithium-ion technology.
The report suggests that the abundance and accessibility of sodium, which is considerably cheaper than lithium, may hold a potential advantage over lithium-ion batteries.

Despite recent price increases in lithium, the cost of sodium remains relatively stable, which could impact the long-term viability of sodium-ion batteries as an alternative to lithium-ion technology.

articles.title: China moves to curb irrational competion in battery energy storage industry
articles.summary: The Chinese Ministry of Industry and Information Technology has announced plans to curb aggressive low-price competition in the power and battery energy storage industry, which has led to oversupply and eroded margins. The move aims to safeguard quality and ensure long-term stability in the industry. Minister Li Lecheng emphasized the importance of the development of the industry.
key_takeaways: China is taking measures to curb "irrational competition" in the power and battery energy storage industry, which has been driven by aggressive low-price bidding.
The government's actions aim to prevent oversupply and maintain industry margins, ensuring the long-term viability of businesses.
Higher standards and reforms are expected to be implemented to safeguard quality and promote sustainable growth in the industry.

articles.title: Texas To Host Gigantic 11-GW Solar, Energy Storage, Nuclear, & Gas Energy Island
articles.summary: The US startup Fermi is planning to host a massive energy island in Texas, featuring an 11-gigawatt project with a mix of solar power, energy storage, nuclear energy, and natural gas. This ambitious initiative aims to provide clean and sustainable energy solutions for the region. The project's specifics are still under development.
key_takeaways: The 11-gigawatt Project Matador campus in Texas will feature a combination of solar power, energy storage, nuclear energy, and natural gas.

The project's development aims to provide clean and sustainable energy solutions for the region, although specific details are still being finalized.

articles.title: Battery storage fire safety: Sungrow, Wärtsilä, Chint Power products put through LSFT
articles.summary: Battery storage products from prominent international providers Sungrow, Wärtsilä, and Chint Power have undergone recent fire safety tests. The results of the LSFT (Large Scale Fire Test) were analyzed to assess the fire safety performance of these products. This analysis aims to provide insights into the fire safety of commercial-scale battery energy storage systems.
key_takeaways: The testing revealed that most of the tested batteries from Sungrow, Wärtsilä, and Chint Power showed acceptable fire behavior, with some exceeding international safety standards.
However, one product from each manufacturer exhibited unacceptable fire behavior during the LSFT, indicating potential design or material flaws.
The analysis highlights the importance of rigorous testing and evaluation for commercial-scale battery energy storage systems to ensure their compliance with established safety standards.

articles.title: Australia opens Capacity Investment Scheme Tender 8, seeking 16GWh of energy storage across NEM
articles.summary: The Australian government has officially opened CIS Tender 8, a capacity investment scheme to secure 16GWh of energy storage across the National Electricity Market (NEM). Successful bidders will benefit from a fixed revenue stream over a set period, providing a stable financial return on their investments.

articles.title: Michigan Township enacts one-year BESS moratorium after greenfield developer sizes up area for utility-scale project

This move aims to provide time for residents and local authorities to consider the implications of large energy storage projects.

The moratorium aims to provide time for residents and local authorities to consider the implications of large energy storage projects.

articles.title: Trina Storage launches AC-coupled battery for utility-scale applications
articles.summary: Trina Storage has launched Elementa Electra, an AC-coupled modular battery energy storage system designed for large-scale renewable storage applications. The system integrates battery technology with power conversion hardware to enable efficient operation and simplified grid connection. This solution is aimed at utility-scale deployments and offers various applications such as renewable shifting, frequency regulation, and black-start capabilities.
key_takeaways: Elementa Electra is an AC-coupled modular battery energy storage system designed for large-scale renewable storage applications.
The system integrates in-house battery technology with purpose-built power conversion hardware to enable efficient operation and simplified grid connection.

Trina Storage's solution aims to support various applications, including renewable shifting, frequency regulation, grid-forming, and black-start capabilities, while helping to manage project costs for utility-scale deployments.

articles.title: Sodium-Ion Battery Applications Grow

key_takeaways: Sodium-ion batteries are being explored for use in industrial settings, including farm equipment like forklifts.
