The growing adoption of sodium-ion batteries suggests increased interest in the technology beyond its initial applications in electric vehicles and home storage.

articles.title: FERC Approves PECO-Amazon Transmission Agreement for Pa. Data Center
articles.summary: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) has approved a transmission security agreement between PECO Energy and Amazon for a data center planned in Falls Township, Pennsylvania. The data center is one of the investments Amazon announced, totaling $20 billion across Pennsylvania. The agreement includes provisions to prevent costs associated with the interconnection from being shifted to other customers.
key_takeaways: The FERC-approved agreement includes provisions to prevent cost shifting and ensure a committed revenue contribution from Amazon for the data center's load.
The ramp schedule outlines when the data center's load is expected to come online, with shortfall payments if milestones aren't reached and termination fees if the load is permanently reduced.
The agreement sets a baseline revenue contribution of 80% of what a load-serving entity would pay to serve 80% of the monthly load, subject to a customer shortfall event liability cap.

articles.title: Italian battery storage market pipeline soars, developers flock from around Europe
articles.summary: The Italian battery storage market is experiencing significant growth, attracting developers from across Europe. The increasing demand for renewable energy and grid stability is driving the development of utility-scale battery storage projects in Italy. This trend is expected to continue, with new projects being announced and existing ones coming online.

Developers from across Europe are flocking to Italy to capitalize on the country's favorable policies and growing interest in utility-scale battery storage projects.
As the grid becomes increasingly reliant on intermittent renewable energy sources, battery storage will play an essential role in ensuring grid stability and reliability in Italy.

articles.title: Western Australia seeks local vanadium for 500MWh Kalgoorlie battery storage project
articles.summary: The Western Australian government is seeking local vanadium for a 500MWh battery storage project in Kalgoorlie, with the goal of utilizing a 50MW/500MWh vanadium flow battery energy storage system. The project aims to store renewable energy and provide grid stability. This initiative highlights the importance of securing local materials for critical infrastructure projects.
key_takeaways: The Western Australian government is launching an Expression of Interest (EOI) process to secure a vanadium flow battery energy storage system in Kalgoorlie, which will have a total capacity of 50MW/500MWh.

articles.title: UBS upgrades China BESS installation forecast, industry to ride policy tailwinds

articles.title: IRENA seeks consultant for solar feasibility study in Ukraine

articles.title: Pakistan needs to declare a ‘battery emergency’
articles.summary: Pakistan is experiencing a booming solar capacity additions, but the industry is calling for urgent deployment of energy storage to complement this growth. The country's generous net metering policy and favorable tax rates on solar imports have contributed to the surge in PV installations. However, the lack of similar incentives for battery energy storage has created a mismatch, prompting industry leaders to advocate for quick deployment of BESS.
key_takeaways: Pakistan is experiencing rapid growth in solar capacity additions, with solar module imports reaching 17 GW in 2024.
The country's battery energy storage market is growing, but faces significant barriers due to high taxes and custom duties that make imported BESS uncompetitive.

The industry is calling for urgent deployment of energy storage to support the continued growth of the PV sector, which could lead to a surge in behind-the-meter storage demand if Pakistan's net metering policy is phased out.

articles.title: Largest Tesla Supercharger Hub Opens — Is Powered By Solar
articles.summary: Tesla's largest Supercharger hub has been launched in California, utilizing solar power and battery storage to support its operations. The Lost Hills hub features 164 V4 Supercharger stalls capable of delivering over 300 kW of electricity each. This innovative setup makes the hub mostly off-grid, showcasing a sustainable energy solution.
key_takeaways: Tesla's largest Supercharger hub is powered by solar energy, demonstrating a significant shift towards renewable energy sources in the electric vehicle charging infrastructure.
The Lost Hills hub boasts an impressive capacity with 164 V4 Supercharger stalls, each delivering over 300 kW of electricity, making it a critical component for long-distance EV travel.

This innovative setup utilizes battery storage, further reducing the hub's reliance on the grid and enabling it to operate mostly off-grid, highlighting the potential of decentralized energy solutions.

articles.title: Sungrow unveils new modular C&I battery with long-duration storage capability
articles.summary: Sungrow, a Chinese inverter and battery manufacturer, has unveiled its new modular commercial and industrial (C&I) battery energy storage solution, the PowerKeeper series. The system features a long-duration storage capability with up to 1,000 kWh of storage per cluster, supporting flexible configurations up to 250 kWh per system. This solution aims to deliver zero waste, zero outages, and seamless operational experiences across various benefits.
key_takeaways: The PowerKeeper series has a modular design that supports flexible configurations up to 250 kWh per system.
The system features an optional long-duration combiner box that can accommodate up to 1,000 kWh of storage per cluster for up to 8 hours.
Sungrow's new C&I battery solution offers a one-stop DC-coupled system with zero waste, zero outages, and seamless operational experiences across seven key benefits.

articles.title: Understanding Regional Inertia Dynamics in CAISO from Real Grid Disturbances
articles.summary: The article discusses the uneven distribution of power system inertia in California's grid due to the shift from synchronous generators to inverter-based resources. By analyzing real-time frequency data, researchers identified trends in regional inertia and its relationship with renewable generation and battery energy storage systems. The study highlights the importance of monitoring regional inertia to ensure grid reliability amidst growing renewable integration.
key_takeaways: Regional RoCoF values were significantly higher than interconnection-wide values, indicating uneven distribution of power system inertia across California's grid.
Declining inertia is linked to increasing deployment of battery energy storage systems with synthetic inertia capabilities, which helped mitigate the effects of high rate-of-change frequency.
The study emphasizes the need for strategic resource planning and adaptive operational practices to ensure grid reliability in the face of growing renewable integration.

articles.title: The Theory of Storage in a Power System with Stochastic Demand
articles.summary: The article discusses the theory of storage in power systems, specifically focusing on balancing supply and demand with energy storage systems. It explores how to determine the optimal volume of storage required and what form of hedge contracts are necessary for storage facilities. The study assumes a scenario where uncertainty in the power system involves successive draws of an independent, identically-distributed random variable.
key_takeaways: The article provides conditions for the optimal operation and investment in energy storage systems, which can be understood graphically using price-duration curves.
Storage volume is dependent on various factors, including the level of demand uncertainty, prices, and time duration.
The study characterizes optimal hedge contracts for storage units, aiming to provide a framework for balancing supply and demand in power systems with stochastic demand.

articles.title: Evaluation of Large Language Models for Numeric Anomaly Detection in Power Systems
articles.summary: This article evaluates the performance of large language models (LLMs) for numeric anomaly detection in power systems. The study uses a representative model, GPT-OSS-20B, on the IEEE 14-bus system and assesses its detection performance and rationale quality across various learning paradigms. The findings provide insights into the limitations and capabilities of LLM-based AD for cyber-physical power grid applications.
key_takeaways: The study employs a standardized prompt framework to evaluate LLMs for numeric anomaly detection in power systems, assessing their performance on zero-shot, few-shot, in-context learning, low rank adaptation (LoRA), fine-tuning, and hybrid approaches.

A rule-aware design based on the three-sigma criterion is used to assess detection performance and rationale quality, highlighting the potential of LLMs for accurate and interpretable decisions in grid resilience.

The research aims to lay the groundwork for further investigation into the limitations and capabilities of LLM-based AD and its integration with classical detectors in cyber-physical power grid applications.

articles.title: 250MWh ‘Sand Battery’ to start construction in Finland, for both heating and ancillary services
articles.summary: A large-scale "Sand Battery" project is set to commence in Finland, utilizing Polar Night Energy's technology for district heating and ancillary services. The project, partnered by Lahti Energia, will provide a significant boost to the region's energy infrastructure with a massive 250MW thermal energy storage capacity. This initiative aims to increase the efficiency and reliability of the heating network.
key_takeaways: The "Sand Battery" technology is being used in its largest scale yet for a 250MW thermal energy storage system, marking a significant milestone in the adoption of this innovative energy solution.
The project will provide both heating power (2MW) and ancillary services to Lahti Energia's district heating network in Vääksy, Finland.
This large-scale deployment is expected to enhance the efficiency and reliability of the region's energy infrastructure, contributing to a more sustainable future.

articles.title: Suggestions Offered for DOE’s ‘Speed to Power’ Initiative
articles.summary: The US Department of Energy's "Speed to Power" initiative aims to accelerate the development of large-scale grid infrastructure for data centers and artificial intelligence. The DOE has solicited feedback from stakeholders, including public power utilities, which have shared their concerns and suggestions for the initiative. The American Public Power Association (APPA) emphasized the importance of providing financial and technical assistance, streamlining applications, and promoting public-private joint ownership of transmission projects.
key_takeaways: Public power utilities face significant constraints in expanding capacity while protecting existing customers from risks and costs, and welcome a federal role in accelerating critical projects.
APPA suggests that ensuring financial and technical assistance are available for public utilities and streamlining the application process is crucial for the initiative's success.
Joint action on projects by individual utilities alone may be limited, and public-private partnerships, such as public-private joint ownership of transmission, could facilitate progress.
Coordination among federal agencies is also essential to ensure the initiative's effectiveness.

articles.title: Indian state sets record low battery storage tariff
articles.summary: Rajasthan Rajya Vidyut Utpadan Nigam Ltd. (RRVUNL) has concluded a tender for a 500 MW/2000 MWh standalone battery energy storage system at a record-low price of INR 285,000 ($3,195)/MW per month, making it the nation's lowest tariff to date for a four-hour, single-cycle system. This achievement is significant, as it nearly matches the two-hour, two-cycle L1 tariff without viability gap funding. The selected developers will set up the systems on a build-own-operate basis to meet Rajasthan's peak and off-peak energy requirements.
key_takeaways: The tender price of INR 285,000 ($3,195)/MW per month is the nation's lowest tariff for a four-hour, single-cycle system, marking a significant decline from previous rates.

The selected developers will use the storage systems on an on-demand basis to meet Rajasthan's peak and off-peak energy requirements, demonstrating the utility's commitment to efficient energy management.
The projects awarded are eligible for central financial assistance in the form of viability gap funding through the Power System Development Fund scheme issued by the Ministry of Power.

articles.title: Australia: Potentia gains consent for 1GWh solar hybrid as Fluence delivers to 600MWh battery storage site
articles.summary: Potentia Energy has received federal environmental approval for its 1,000MWh Tallawang Solar Hybrid project in Australia. Fluence has also successfully delivered its Gridstack battery energy storage equipment to Ampyr Australia's Bulabul Battery installation, which features a capacity of 600MWh. These developments demonstrate the growing momentum behind Australia's renewable energy sector.
key_takeaways: Potentia Energy has secured federal environmental approval for its Tallawang Solar Hybrid project, indicating that the project is moving forward with minimal regulatory hurdles.

The delivery of Fluence's Gridstack battery energy storage equipment to Ampyr Australia's Bulabul Battery installation highlights the increasing adoption of large-scale battery storage solutions in Australia.

These developments suggest a growing trend towards hybrid solar energy projects and expanding grid-scale battery storage capacity in Australia, underscoring the country's commitment to renewable energy development.

articles.title: California sees sustained decline in natural gas use as solar output rises
articles.summary: California's electricity generation mix is shifting towards solar energy, with utility-scale solar generation nearly doubling its output from 2020. The state's natural gas use has also declined, with a 9.5 billion kWh decrease in 2025 compared to the previous year. This trend suggests that California's transition to renewable energy sources is gaining momentum.
key_takeaways: Solar energy is rapidly increasing in California, nearly doubling its output from 2020 and accounting for a significant portion of the state's electricity generation.
Natural gas use has declined by 9.5 billion kWh in 2025 compared to the previous year, representing a 17% decrease, with the trend showing consistency since 2021.
The growth of solar energy is contributing to a shift away from natural gas as a primary source of electricity in California, indicating a significant transition towards renewable energy sources.

articles.title: Small but mighty grid batteries take root in Virginia amid energy crunch
articles.summary: A growing trend of midsize energy-storage units is taking root in Virginia, with two new projects on the eastern peninsula aiming to provide a clean-energy solution amid an energy crunch. These small but mighty grid batteries are cheaper and quicker to build than traditional large-scale utility projects. The 10-megawatt battery project mentioned could be part of this trend.
key_takeaways: Midsize energy-storage units, larger than typical home batteries paired with rooftop solar, are becoming a growing trend in the clean-energy transition.
These smaller batteries are cheaper and quicker to build compared to massive utility-scale projects, making them more accessible for widespread adoption.
The development of these midsize grid batteries may provide a cleaner alternative to meet energy demands amid energy crunches or supply chain disruptions.

articles.title: Liquid air energy storage startup Highview breaks ground at 300MWh UK project
articles.summary: Highview, a startup specializing in liquid air energy storage, has commenced construction on its 300MWh facility in the UK. The project is marked by the presence of Mayor of Greater Manchester Andy Burnham, indicating significant support for the initiative. This development showcases the growing interest in liquid air energy storage as a viable alternative to traditional energy storage methods.
key_takeaways: Highview's 300MWh liquid air energy storage facility is one of the largest such projects currently under construction in the UK.
The project's commencement suggests strong support from local authorities, with Mayor Andy Burnham actively involved in marking the start of construction.
Liquid air energy storage represents a promising alternative to traditional energy storage methods, offering potential benefits in terms of scalability and efficiency.

articles.title: ‘Rapid growth but disorderly competiton’: Longi enters energy storage industry with PotisEdge deal
articles.summary: Longi, a Chinese solar PV giant, has entered the energy storage industry through its acquisition of system integrator PotisEdge. This move marks Longi's foray into the rapidly growing but competitive energy storage market. The deal underscores the increasing importance of energy storage solutions in meeting global renewable energy targets.
key_takeaways: Longi's entry into the energy storage industry highlights the growing demand for sustainable energy solutions and the need for companies to diversify their product offerings.

The acquisition of PotisEdge represents a strategic move by Longi to establish itself as a major player in the rapidly growing energy storage market, which is expected to continue its rapid growth in the coming years.
The deal suggests that China's solar PV industry is expanding into adjacent markets, such as energy storage, to drive innovation and capture new business opportunities.

articles.title: Parties Warn FERC that Jurisdictional Fight Could Slow Data Center Connection Effort
articles.summary: The article reports on comments received by FERC regarding its Advance Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (ANOPR) to improve the rules for large load interconnections. Parties, including the Edison Electric Institute, have expressed concerns that over-expansion of jurisdictional issues could hinder the speed-to-market effort and undermine traditional regulatory paradigms. They argue that states and FERC can regulate retail interconnections without disrupting the existing regulatory framework.
key_takeaways: Parties are warning FERC not to go too far into jurisdictional issues, which could potentially slow down data center connection efforts.

The Edison Electric Institute emphasizes that large load customers are end-use retail customers, requiring local distribution service and wholesale transmission service, suggesting that traditional regulation can be effective in facilitating rapid interconnections.

States have successfully regulated retail interconnections for decades, including those of large retail loads, and over-expansion of jurisdictional issues could have unintended consequences that undermine the goals of FERC and its stakeholders.

articles.title: Safety and sustainability: Dual pillars shaping Australia’s energy storage sector
articles.summary: Australia's transition to renewable energy sources has led to a growing demand for reliable and sustainable energy storage solutions. The country is rapidly developing its energy storage sector, driven by the need for safety and sustainability in power and energy systems. This trend is expected to shape the future of Australia's energy landscape.
key_takeaways: The article highlights the increasing importance of safety and sustainability in the development of energy storage solutions in Australia.
As Australia transitions towards renewables, there is a growing demand for reliable and sustainable energy storage solutions to ensure a stable power supply.
The country's energy storage sector is expected to play a crucial role in meeting the demands of a rapidly changing energy landscape.

articles.title: Acacia Energy to resell OptiGrid’s AI-powered battery platform for C&I customers in Australia
articles.summary: Acacia Energy has partnered with OptiGrid to resell its AI-powered battery platform to commercial and industrial (C&I) customers in Australia, aiming to accelerate the deployment of battery storage solutions.
key_takeaways: The partnership between Acacia Energy and OptiGrid aims to expand access to battery storage technologies for C&I customers in Australia.
OptiGrid's AI-powered battery platform is designed to optimize battery performance and trading, providing a more efficient energy management solution.
The collaboration is expected to accelerate the adoption of battery storage in the C&I sector, supporting Australia's transition towards renewable energy sources.

articles.title: Toshiba Targets Motorcycles and Boats With Its Batteries
articles.summary: Toshiba has established itself in the lithium-ion battery market, particularly in industrial, automotive, and energy sectors. Despite using a more expensive anode material with lower energy density, Toshiba's batteries are gaining traction in price-sensitive markets such as low-power vehicles, boats, and industrial equipment. The company's SCiB batteries offer flexible configurations and applications in various industries.
key_takeaways: Toshiba is targeting the lithium-ion battery market for its industrial, automotive, and energy sectors, using a more expensive anode material with lower energy density to gain competitiveness in price-sensitive markets.

The company's SCiB batteries are available in single cells, modules, and packs, offering flexible configurations and applications in industries such as renewable energy systems, energy storage, and grid-frequency regulation.

Toshiba is leveraging its battery technology for various applications beyond traditional automotive use cases, expanding into emerging markets like low-power vehicles, boats, and industrial equipment.

articles.title: Plenitude tests perovskite-silicon tandem solar modules in utility-scale installation pilot
articles.summary: Plenitude, an Italian renewable energy company controlled by Eni, has partnered with Swift Solar to test and evaluate the performance of Swift Solar's perovskite-silicon tandem solar technology in a utility-scale installation pilot. The partnership aims to validate the technology's efficiency and durability under commercial conditions. This milestone represents a significant step forward in the commercialization of perovskite technology for utility-scale solar.
key_takeaways: Plenitude is partnering with Swift Solar to test and evaluate the performance of its 28% efficient perovskite-silicon tandem solar technology in a utility-scale project.

The partnership aims to validate the technology's efficiency and durability under commercial conditions, representing a significant step forward in the commercialization of perovskite technology for utility-scale solar.
Swift Solar's technology is expected to achieve module efficiencies of 28% or higher, providing up to 40% more power from the same footprint compared to conventional solar panels.

articles.title: Data centers are breaking the old grid. Let AI build the new one.
articles.summary: The article suggests that the increasing use of data centers is straining the traditional grid, and AI has the potential to revolutionize the way power systems are designed and managed. By leveraging AI, utilities can set new standards for reliability and affordability. This shift could lead to a more efficient and sustainable energy infrastructure.
key_takeaways: Data centers are putting pressure on the traditional grid, highlighting the need for innovative solutions to manage increasing energy demands.
The adoption of AI by utilities could lead to significant improvements in power system efficiency, reliability, and affordability.
AI has the potential to enable a more decentralized and flexible energy infrastructure, reducing strain on traditional grids.

articles.title: No more PJM data centers unless they can be reliably served: market monitor
articles.summary: The PJM Interconnection's market monitor has recommended to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission that large data centers can only be approved if the grid operator can still meet reliability metrics, suggesting a connection between the growth of data centers and grid reliability concerns.
key_takeaways: Large data centers may face stricter regulations unless they can be reliably served by the grid.
The PJM Interconnection's market monitor is urging the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to take action on this issue.
Data center growth has raised concerns about grid reliability, highlighting the need for a more sustainable and efficient energy infrastructure.

articles.title: NERC: Winter Grid Reliability at Risk Amid Soaring Demand, Fuel Supply Gaps
articles.summary: The North American Electric Reliability Corporation (NERC) has warned that winter grid reliability is at risk due to soaring demand and fuel supply gaps. A recent Winter Reliability Assessment found that large areas of the continent face an elevated risk of electricity shortfalls during prolonged, wide-area cold snaps. This poses a threat to power grids in regions such as the Maritimes, New England, and parts of the Southeast.
key_takeaways: The NERC's Winter Reliability Assessment highlights regions at elevated risk of electricity shortfalls during extreme winter conditions, including areas with natural gas pipeline capacity constraints.
Soaring demand for electricity poses a significant challenge to power grids, particularly in regions already facing fuel supply gaps due to infrastructure constraints or other factors.
The assessment underscores the need for improved grid resilience and planning to mitigate the impact of prolonged, wide-area cold snaps on winter power reliability.

articles.title: Toward Trustworthy Digital Twins in Agentic AI-based Wireless Network Optimization: Challenges, Solutions, and Opportunities
articles.summary: The article discusses the challenges and limitations of using agentic artificial intelligence (AI) with reinforcement learning (RL) for optimizing wireless networks, particularly in terms of exploration costs and potential risks in real-world deployments. To address these concerns, a unified digital twin (DT) evaluation framework is introduced to ensure trustworthy DTs, which focuses on task-centric assessments rather than traditional physical accuracy metrics. The article presents the framework's effectiveness in reducing training and testing costs without compromising deployment performance.
key_takeaways: Traditional methods of evaluating digital twins for wireless network optimization rely heavily on isolated physical accuracy metrics, such as channel similarities and user trajectory comparisons, but these may not accurately represent the real-world network.

A more holistic, task-centric evaluation framework is proposed to assess digital twins in agentic AI-based network optimization, which can help mitigate exploration costs and ensure reliable performance in real-world deployments.

The introduction of a unified DT evaluation framework has shown promise in reducing training and testing costs without compromising deployment performance, particularly through pre-filtering candidate digital twins.

articles.title: Quantum-Enhanced Reinforcement Learning for Accelerating Newton-Raphson Convergence with Ising Machines: A Case Study for Power Flow Analysis
articles.summary: The article discusses the use of reinforcement learning (RL) to optimize the initialization of the Newton-Raphson method for solving power flow equations. A novel quantum-enhanced RL environment update mechanism is introduced to mitigate the computational cost of evaluating power system states, leading to significant improvements in convergence speed and robustness under different operating conditions.
key_takeaways: The use of reinforcement learning (RL) can optimize the initialization of the Newton-Raphson method for solving power flow equations, improving convergence speed.
A quantum-enhanced RL environment update mechanism is proposed to reduce the computational cost of evaluating power system states, enabling faster and more efficient optimization.
This approach shows significant improvements in convergence speed, reduction in NR iteration counts, and enhanced robustness under different operating conditions.

articles.title: iRadioDiff: Physics-Informed Diffusion Model for Indoor Radio Map Construction and Localization
articles.summary: The article proposes iRadioDiff, a physics-informed diffusion model for constructing indoor radio maps and localizing signals. This framework addresses the challenges of building high-fidelity indoor radio maps by leveraging a sampling-free diffusion-based approach that incorporates material properties and multipath-critical priors. The model achieves state-of-the-art performance in indoor radio map construction and localization.
key_takeaways: iRadioDiff is a sampling-free diffusion-based framework for constructing indoor radio maps, addressing the limitations of existing methods.
The model incorporates physics-informed prompts encoded by material reflection and transmission coefficients to guide the generative process.
iRadioDiff achieves state-of-the-art performance in indoor radio map construction and localization, offering effective generalization across layouts and material configurations.

articles.title: Indian utility seeks land for new grid-connected solar project
articles.summary: NLC India Ltd. has issued a tender for contractors to secure and develop 1,850 acres of land across multiple states in India for an inter-state transmission system-connected solar power project. The project is expected to be connected to India's grid and will require the contractor to arrange and develop the land, design and build the power evacuation package, and provide operation and maintenance support. This project aims to contribute to India's renewable energy goals.
key_takeaways: NLC India Ltd. has invited bids for a 1,850-acre solar power project connected to India's inter-state transmission system (ISTS), with land requirements spanning multiple states.

The selected contractor will be responsible for arranging and developing the land, designing and building the power evacuation package, and providing operation and maintenance support for three years.
The project aims to contribute to India's renewable energy goals by connecting a solar power plant to the ISTS grid, allowing it to feed electricity into the national grid.

articles.title: Global grid-scale BESS deployment rises 38% through October
articles.summary: Global grid-scale battery energy storage system (BESS) deployments have reached 156 GWh through October 2025, with a year-over-year increase of 38%. The growth is driven by China's 27% expansion, while Europe and North America also saw significant increases. Meanwhile, the rest of the world experienced a remarkable 242% jump in deployments.
key_takeaways: Global grid-scale BESS deployments have reached 156 GWh through October 2025, with an increase of 38% year-over-year.
The growth is driven by regional expansions, particularly China's 27% increase and Europe and North America's 21% growth, as well as a significant jump in the rest of the world (242%).
Over 153 GWh of BESS deployments are still slated for commissioning in 2025, but delays and cancellations may reduce this total by year-end.

articles.title: When solar meets next-gen nuclear
articles.summary:
Here is the analysis of the article:


Scientists in China have proposed a novel scheduling framework for microgrids that integrates solar power with small modular nuclear reactors to improve short-term dispatch capability and long-term economic viability. The framework uses multi-objective distributionally robust optimization with real-time reinforcement learning, resulting in an 18.7% reduction in operational costs. This innovative approach combines multiple energy sources under a single optimization paradigm.
key_takeaways: The proposed system utilizes a hybrid energy management framework that integrates solar power and small modular nuclear reactors to provide complementary power sources.

A multi-objective distributionally robust optimization (DRO) is employed, combined with real-time reinforcement learning (RL), to generate baseline scheduling strategies and continuously adjust control signals for improved adaptability.

The system also incorporates auxiliary resources such as generators, batteries, electrolyzers, and an energy management system (EMS) to manage short-term and long-term storage dynamics and optimize hydrogen production and utilization.

articles.title: US energy offices folded into new structure at Department of Energy
articles.summary: The US Department of Energy (DoE) has removed various energy-focused offices, including those focused on renewable energy, grid modernization, and carbon management, from its organizational chart. These offices will be consolidated into a new structure within the Office of Critical Minerals and Energy Innovation. The move is part of an effort to align operations with "commonsense" energy policy, as stated by Energy Secretary Chris Wright.
key_takeaways: The US Department of Energy has removed several key energy-focused offices, including those focused on renewable energy, grid modernization, and carbon management.

These offices are being consolidated into a new structure within the Office of Critical Minerals and Energy Innovation, which will absorb functions related to energy efficiency, clean energy demonstrations, fossil energy, and grid deployment.

The move is part of an effort to "restore commonsense" to energy policy, with Secretary Chris Wright stating that it aims to lower costs for American families and businesses, while ensuring responsible stewardship of taxpayer dollars.

articles.title: Energy storage ‘significantly underutilised’ in EU despite recent growth and policy support
articles.summary: The energy storage sector in the EU has seen recent growth and policy support, but its potential is still not being fully utilized. Despite a "healthy pipeline of projects," energy storage technologies are underutilized, suggesting that there is room for improvement. This underutilization may be due to various factors, including infrastructure limitations and lack of public awareness.
key_takeaways: The EU's energy storage sector has seen significant growth in recent years, but it still lags behind its potential.
There is a growing pipeline of projects across Europe, indicating increased investment and interest in the sector, but this has yet to translate into widespread adoption.
Energy storage technologies are currently underutilized, suggesting that there may be infrastructure limitations or other barriers to their full utilization.

articles.title: Finland’s Polar Night to build 250 MWh sand battery for district heating provider
articles.summary: Polar Night Energy is building a sand battery for Lahti Energia's district heating network in Vääksy, Finland. The project will be the world's largest sand-based thermal energy storage system, providing 2 MW of thermal output and 250 MWh of storage capacity. This investment aims to reduce fossil-based emissions by approximately 60% annually.
key_takeaways: Polar Night Energy is constructing a massive sand battery with a 250 MWh storage capacity, positioning it as the world's largest sand-based thermal energy storage system.
The project will supply heat to the Vääksy district heating network and reduce natural gas consumption by approximately 80%, resulting in an estimated 60% decrease in fossil-based emissions annually.
The sand battery is expected to contribute to grid balancing markets, helping to balance electricity supply and demand as the share of weather-dependent energy grows.

articles.title: FEMA under pressure to honor court mandate on Puerto Rico’s grid modernization
articles.summary: The article reports that members of Congress have sent a letter to FEMA, urging the agency to comply with a federal court ruling that requires it to fully evaluate rooftop solar, battery storage, and other distributed renewable options for Puerto Rico's grid modernization. The ruling aims to address the island's energy crisis and promote sustainable energy solutions. FEMA is under pressure to honor this mandate.
key_takeaways: FEMA is required by law to evaluate rooftop solar, battery storage, and other distributed renewable options as part of Puerto Rico's grid modernization efforts.
The federal court ruling aims to address the island's energy crisis and promote sustainable energy solutions, which has been ongoing since Hurricane Maria in 2017.
The agency's non-compliance with this mandate may have implications for the implementation of renewable energy projects on the island.

articles.title: NeoVolta secures US$13 million for US energy storage manufacturing
articles.summary: NeoVolta, a San Diego-based home battery storage company, has secured $13 million in private placement financing from Infinite Grid Capital. This investment will support the company's energy storage manufacturing operations in the US. The funding is expected to help NeoVolta expand its production capacity and further establish itself as a leading player in the energy storage market.
key_takeaways: NeoVolta has secured $13 million in private placement financing, with Infinite Grid Capital serving as anchor investor.
The investment will support the company's US-based energy storage manufacturing operations, indicating a focus on domestic production capacity expansion.
This funding milestone suggests that NeoVolta is gaining traction and confidence from investors in its technology and market potential.

articles.title: NIPSCO to supply 3 GW to Amazon data centers in northern Indiana
articles.summary: NIPSCO has agreed to supply 3 GW of power and energy services to Amazon's data centers in northern Indiana, with an expected investment of $7 billion, including $400 million for storage and transmission infrastructure. The deal will be paid for by Amazon, marking a significant partnership between the utility company and the tech giant. This project is part of Amazon's efforts to expand its data center operations in the region.
key_takeaways: NIPSCO will supply 3 GW of power to Amazon's data centers in northern Indiana, with an expected investment of $7 billion.
The deal includes a significant amount of storage and transmission infrastructure, valued at $400 million, which will be paid for by Amazon.

This partnership marks a notable expansion of Amazon's data center operations in the region, highlighting the growing demand for renewable energy and grid infrastructure to support growing tech companies.

articles.title: Solar, batteries push down natural gas generation in California, EIA says
articles.summary: A new report by the US Energy Information Administration (EIA) shows that natural gas output in California has decreased by 17% year-over-year, largely due to the growth of utility-scale solar and battery storage on the state's grid.
key_takeaways: The shift towards renewable energy sources is having a significant impact on California's energy landscape, with natural gas output declining for the first time in several years.
Utility-scale solar and battery storage are playing key roles in this transition, as they help to reduce reliance on fossil fuels and increase the overall efficiency of the grid.

This trend has implications for the wider US energy sector, suggesting that other states may follow California's lead in transitioning away from natural gas and towards cleaner, more sustainable energy sources.

articles.title: Vistra cancels 600MW BESS proposed 150 miles from Moss Landing facility in California
articles.summary: Vistra Energy, a Texas-based independent power producer, has cancelled its proposed 600MW battery energy storage system (BESS) in Morro Bay, California. The project, located 150 miles from the Moss Landing facility, was intended to support the region's renewable energy integration. This decision marks a setback for the state's efforts to increase energy storage capacity.
key_takeaways: Vistra Energy has cancelled its 600MW BESS project in Morro Bay, California, which would have provided significant energy storage capacity for the region.
The cancellation of this project could impact the state's ability to meet its renewable energy goals and integrate more clean energy sources into the grid.
This decision may also affect the local economy, as large-scale infrastructure projects like BESS facilities can create jobs and stimulate economic growth.

articles.title: Hungary opens $151 million grant scheme for business energy storage
articles.summary: Hungary's National Energy Agency has launched a $151.34 million grant program to support businesses in installing energy storage facilities, with or without onsite renewable energy, aiming to promote sustainable and efficient energy production.
key_takeaways: The Hungarian government is providing a significant grant of $151.34 million for businesses to install energy storage systems, either alone or paired with onsite renewable generation.
The program aims to support businesses in adopting more sustainable and energy-efficient practices, reducing their carbon footprint and dependence on traditional energy sources.
The initiative is open to any company operating in Hungary, indicating a broad range of eligible businesses that can benefit from the grant funding.

articles.title: Colorado regulators call Xcel’s grid data ‘totally useless,’ question if utility will comply
articles.summary: Colorado regulators have expressed dissatisfaction with Xcel's grid data, labeling it as "totally useless." This decision has raised concerns about the utility company's compliance with regulatory requirements. The situation involves IREC, a non-profit organization that advocates for renewable energy.
key_takeaways: Colorado regulators are dissatisfied with Xcel's grid data, which they consider to be of poor quality and unreliable.
The lack of trust in Xcel's data raises concerns about the utility company's ability to accurately report on its grid operations and compliance with regulatory requirements.

IREC's involvement in the matter suggests that the organization is working to hold Xcel accountable for providing accurate and reliable grid data, which is essential for ensuring the integrity and efficiency of Colorado's energy grid.

articles.title: Trina Storage charts strategic course in complex US energy storage market landscape
articles.summary: Trina Storage is navigating the complex US energy storage market landscape, which is characterized by policy changes, supply chain challenges, and evolving customer needs. As a leading company in the sector, Trina Storage must adapt to these factors to remain competitive. The article suggests that companies like Trina Storage are taking strategic steps to succeed in this rapidly evolving market.
key_takeaways: The US energy storage sector is experiencing a complex landscape with policy changes, supply chain challenges, and evolving customer needs.
Companies operating in this space must be able to adapt to these factors to remain competitive.
A successful strategy for companies like Trina Storage involves navigating the complexities of the market to chart a course that meets evolving customer needs.

articles.title: Storage, hybrid projects emerging as renewable energy post-OBBBA winners: LevelTen Energy
articles.summary: The article discusses the emerging trend of hybrid power and energy systems, which could potentially surpass standalone wind and solar projects by 2030. Hybrid development combines different renewable energy sources to create a more efficient and stable energy supply. This trend is driven by advancements in technology and increasing demand for reliable energy.
key_takeaways: Hybrid development has the potential to exceed standalone wind and solar projects by 2030, according to a developer survey.
The shift towards hybrid power systems could provide a more efficient and stable energy supply compared to traditional renewable energy sources.
Advancements in technology are driving this trend, enabling the integration of different renewable energy sources into cohesive energy solutions.

articles.title: Demand Response Should be a Priority in PJM’s Large Load Approach
articles.summary: The article discusses the demand for reform in PJM's large load approach, which aims to manage the increasing power consumption of data centers and other large industrial customers. Despite a full day of committee proposals, none were approved, leaving the grid operator to consider alternative approaches that could potentially undermine existing capacity sources. The author advocates for a well-executed policy shift to ensure that demand response remains a critical source of supply.
key_takeaways: PJM's current approach to managing large loads may inadvertently force existing supply out of the market if not implemented carefully.

Manual load shedding is likely to become more common as commercial and industrial customers are dispatched more frequently, potentially discouraging larger customers from participating in demand response programs.
A poorly executed policy shift could undermine a critical source of capacity, namely demand response, which has proven instrumental in maintaining system reliability during peak events.

articles.title: Velotric e-bikes get up to $750 increased Black Friday savings with new lows + extra battery bundles from $999, EcoFlow, more
articles.summary: Velotric's Black Friday sale is offering increased savings and expanded free bundle sizes, with notable deals including a free range extender battery on their T1 ST Plus Lightweight Urban e-bike. EcoFlow is also having a 24-hour flash sale with new low prices on various units, such as the DELTA 2 Max hitting $799 low. Additionally, there are holiday savings roundups on Worx and Husqvarna tools.
key_takeaways: Velotric's T1 ST Plus Lightweight Urban e-bike can be purchased for $1,299 with a free range extender battery valued at $400.
EcoFlow is having a 24-hour flash sale with new low prices on units like the DELTA 2 Max at $799.
Holiday savings roundups are available on Worx and Husqvarna tools, offering discounts on various products.

articles.title: Impact Analysis of COVID-19 in Bangladesh Power Sector and Recommendations based on Practical Data and Machine Learning Approach
articles.summary: The article investigates the impact of COVID-19 on Bangladesh's power sector, analyzing changes in load patterns and system stability. The study uses machine learning techniques to predict load profiles and assess the effectiveness of various measures. It provides recommendations for overcoming future disasters by improving energy efficiency, investing in renewable energy, and developing more resilient power systems.
key_takeaways: The power demand in Bangladesh decreased by approximately 15.4% and 17.2% in April and May 2020 compared to the same periods in 2019, indicating a significant impact of COVID-19 on the country's power sector.

Machine learning models, such as Long-Short-Term Memory (LSTM) frameworks, were used to predict load profiles and compare them with actual values, revealing an average power demand decrease of approximately 19.5% in April 2020 and 18.3% in May 2020 relative to projected values.

The study highlights the importance of developing more resilient power systems, investing in renewable energy, and improving energy efficiency to mitigate the impact of future disasters on the power sector.

articles.title: Massive 20 GWh sodium-ion battery manufacturing plant announced in China

articles.title: Who won at the Energy Storage Awards 2025?

articles.title: Safer by Design Beats Safer by Procedure
articles.summary: The article discusses the importance of designing energy systems with safety in mind, rather than relying solely on procedures. Designing systems with safety in mind can help mitigate risks and ensure a more resilient power grid.
The article suggests that engineers should adopt a proactive approach to design energy systems, rather than simply following established procedures.

articles.title: Arkansas turns on its first-ever utility-scale wind farm
articles.summary: The state of Arkansas has officially turned on its first-ever utility-scale wind farm, the Crossover Wind Farm, located in Cross County. This 135 MW wind farm is a significant milestone for Arkansas and marks the beginning of a new era in renewable energy production in the state. The project is a result of partnerships between various stakeholders.

articles.title: State-Derivative Feedback Control for Damping Low-Frequency Oscillations in Bulk Power Systems
articles.summary: The article discusses a novel control approach for damping low-frequency oscillations in bulk power systems, specifically those with high renewable penetration and long lines. The proposed state-derivative feedback (SDF) controller uses both frequency and its rate of change as feedback signals to enhance modal damping and accelerate frequency recovery. This approach shows promise as a practical solution for stabilizing power-electronics-rich grids.
key_takeaways: The SDF controller is designed to improve modal damping and acceleration in low-frequency oscillations, particularly in systems with high renewable penetration and long lines.
The use of state derivatives as feedback signals enhances the control's performance compared to existing frequency difference-based damping schemes.
The SDF controller has shown promising results in evaluating two- and three-area systems, suggesting its potential as a practical solution for stabilizing power-electronics-rich grids.

articles.title: The Iberian Blackout: A Black Swan or a Gray Rhino? A Thorough Power System Analysis
articles.summary: The Iberian Blackout, which occurred on April 28, 2025, was a significant power system event that highlighted the challenges of integrating high levels of renewable energy into the grid. The paper provides a thorough analysis of the incident, examining its causes and consequences, and offers practical measures to mitigate similar incidents in the future. The study aims to provide clarity on the root causes of the blackout.
key_takeaways: The Iberian Blackout was caused by an overvoltage-driven cascade, which suggests that high levels of renewable energy output may have played a role in triggering the event.
The paper highlights low inertia as another contributing factor to the blackout, implying that traditional power systems may struggle to adapt to rapidly changing energy sources.

The study suggests that practical measures to mitigate similar incidents include improving grid management practices and developing strategies for integrating high renewables output into the power system.

articles.title: Influence of Transmission Rank on EMF Exposure Measured With Provoked Data Traffic Around 5G Massive MIMO Base Stations
articles.summary: The study investigates the impact of transmission rank on measured maximum exposure to electromagnetic fields in a German 5G network employing massive MIMO technology. The researchers used field measurements with a spectrum analyzer to capture maximum field strengths under full-load traffic conditions, comparing results between unshielded and artificially degraded operation. The findings show significant exposure differences due to variations in transmission rank.
key_takeaways: The transmission rank of a 5G network affects the measured maximum exposure to electromagnetic fields.
Variations in transmission rank can result in exposure differences ranging from 1.7 dB to 5.4 dB.
Considering the transmission rank is necessary for accurate electromagnetic field exposure assessments, particularly in networks employing massive MIMO technology.

articles.title: Blue State Steps Up To Save US Farms With Solar Power

articles.title: Profitable Renewable Energy: Abundant & Scalable

This trend suggests that countries are increasingly turning to renewable energy as a norm, rather than just relying on subsidies.

articles.title: How to Spot a Counterfeit Lithium-Ion Battery

key_takeaways: Counterfeit lithium-ion batteries are becoming increasingly common and can masquerade as those from well-known global brands, posing a significant risk to safety and performance.
These fake batteries have been found in various devices, including scooters, vape pens, e-bikes, and have caused fires and explosions with lethal consequences.

articles.title: Santa Cruz County publishes draft BESS zoning ordinance, officials delay environmental review by another three months

articles.title: Efficient solar PV cooking with sand-based thermal energy storage

articles.title: Is AI’s power problem becoming the US energy storage market’s golden opportunity?

articles.title: Utility operating systems at the grid edge pose an overlooked risk

Utilities often focus on network security and access control, but neglect to address the underlying operating systems that manage these systems. This oversight can lead to serious consequences, including potential disruptions to the grid.
key_takeaways: The utility operating system remains a vulnerable foundation for the power and energy system, despite its importance.
Utilities tend to focus on network security and access control, but neglect to address the underlying operating systems that manage these systems.
This oversight can lead to serious consequences, including potential disruptions to the grid.

FERC's focus on simplifying permitting processes suggests an effort to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of its regulatory framework.

articles.title: Spatially Dependent Sampling of Component Failures for Power System Preventive Control Against Hurricane
articles.summary: The article discusses a new approach to modeling spatial dependence in component failures of power systems during hurricanes. The proposed method generates correlated meteorological intensity random variables, which enables joint sampling of multiple component failures. This approach captures long-tailed scenarios and reveals more extreme events than conventional methods, improving the realism of scenario generation for preventive control.
key_takeaways: Strong spatial correlations in weather intensity lead to interdependent component failures, regardless of their mean value level.
The proposed spatially dependent sampling method uncovers more high-severity scenarios that are missed by independent sampling.

Preventive control requires balancing load curtailment and over-generation costs under different scenario severities, and ignoring failure correlations can result in underestimated risk from high-severity events.

articles.title: Grid security trumps battery storage economics as AEMO directs Torrens Island operations in South Australia

Grid security is becoming a top priority, with AEMO directing Torrens Island operations to ensure stability and prevent potential grid disruptions.

articles.title: FERC should side with Voltus and Mission:data because residential demand response is blocked at PJM.

articles.title: Assessing Power Flow Controllability via Variable Line Reactance
articles.summary: The article proposes a framework to quantify network flow controllability in power transmission networks by adjusting variable line reactance with power flow controllers (PFCs). The study demonstrates that installing PFCs on all lines enables complete controllability of feasible flow patterns and explores the impact of the number of PFCs and their adjustability range on controllability. The authors also validate their findings using a mixed-integer linear program.
key_takeaways: Installing PFCs on all transmission lines can enable complete controllability of feasible flow patterns in power transmission networks.
The number of PFCs and their reactance adjustment range significantly impact network flow controllability, with more PFCs and wider adjustability leading to higher controllability.
The proposed framework provides a system-wide perspective on PFC flexibility metrics and analysis approaches, which are often limited to a few operating points and contingencies.

articles.title: GPU-Accelerated Dynamic Programming for Multistage Stochastic Energy Storage Arbitrage
articles.summary: The article presents a GPU-accelerated dynamic programming method for valuing and operating energy storage in multistage stochastic electricity markets. The method uses tensor-based algebraic operations to take advantage of massive parallelism on GPUs, achieving significant speedups over traditional CPU computation and commercial solvers. The proposed approach is demonstrated through numerical experiments using real-time prices from the ISO-NE.
key_takeaways: The article introduces a GPU-accelerated dynamic programming method for energy storage optimization in stochastic electricity markets.
The method achieves substantial speedups over traditional CPU computation (up to 100x) and commercial solvers (up to 8,000x), while maintaining low optimality gaps.
The approach accommodates general payoff structures by combining a discretized DP formulation with a convexification procedure, producing market-feasible bid curves.

articles.title: Techno-Economic Modelling and Component Sizing in Renewable Energy Communities: A Participant Perspective
articles.summary: The article proposes an optimization problem formulation to determine the optimal sizes of Photovoltaics and Battery Energy Storage Systems for individual participants in a Renewable Energy Community. The study aims to maximize the Net Present Value of individual participants by considering dynamic electricity pricing, solar irradiation levels, financial aspects, and operational expenditures. The analysis employs Mixed-Integer Non-Linear Programming and Fast Iterative Shrinkage-Thresholding Algorithm to reduce simulation runtime.
key_takeaways: The article proposes an optimization problem formulation that considers the dynamic nature of electricity pricing, solar irradiation levels, and financial aspects when determining optimal system sizes for individual participants in a Renewable Energy Community.
The study employs Mixed-Integer Non-Linear Programming and Fast Iterative Shrinkage-Thresholding Algorithm to reduce simulation runtime and extend analysis to a wider planning horizon.

The article introduces fairness by applying the individual marginal contribution method to distribute incentives equitably among REC participants, ensuring that each member benefits from their contribution.

articles.title: An Interpretable Federated Learning Control Framework Design for Smart Grid Resilience

The proposed FLC outperforms distributed baselines in achieving faster stabilization in moderate control levels. This framework has potential as a scalable and resilient learning-based control solution for modern power grids.
key_takeaways: The proposed FLC framework employs interpretable neural controllers, making it an attractive option for gaining insights into the control strategy's decision-making process.
The use of ChebyKAN allows for faster stabilization of transient stability in power systems compared to traditional distributed baselines at moderate control levels (10%--60%).
The framework's ability to leverage a shared centralized control policy and be deployed for distributed execution makes it a scalable solution for modern power grids.

articles.title: GeoShield: Byzantine Fault Detection and Recovery for Geo-Distributed Real-Time Cyber-Physical Systems
articles.summary: GeoShield is a resource-efficient solution for defending geo-distributed cyber-physical systems (CPS) against Byzantine faults. It detects and recovers the system within bounded time, guaranteeing safety with fewer resources than existing methods. GeoShield operates effectively under unreliable networks without relying on trusted hardware.
key_takeaways: GeoShield detects Byzantine faults and recovers geo-distributed CPS within bounded time, ensuring safety.
The solution leverages the property of CPS being designed to tolerate brief disruptions and maintain safety, allowing for resource-efficient recovery.
GeoShield outperforms existing methods in both effectiveness and resource efficiency, making it a significant advancement in fault-tolerant systems.

articles.title: Formulation and Experimental Validation of Price-Based Control of Flexible Prosumers in Distribution Grids with the Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers
articles.summary: This article proposes a method for computing price signals to incentivize prosumers to adjust their consumption in distribution grids, preventing voltage violations and line congestion. The proposed approach leverages the Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers (ADMM) to extract a price signal while limiting sensitive information sharing among prosumers. The method is validated experimentally in a 9-node low-voltage distribution grid laboratory.
key_takeaways: The proposed method uses ADMM to compute price signals, allowing for dynamic adjustment of retail electricity tariffs to trigger grid-support actions from prosumers.
The approach aims to prevent voltage violations and line congestion by incentivizing prosumers to adjust their consumption in response to changing grid conditions.
Experimental validation demonstrates the algorithm's performance in terms of convergence and operational efficiency, suggesting its viability in real-life settings.

articles.title: Agentic AI Systems in Electrical Power Systems Engineering: Current State-of-the-Art and Challenges
articles.summary: The article discusses the emerging field of agentic AI systems in electrical power systems engineering, highlighting their transformative capabilities and the need for a clear conceptual understanding to differentiate them from traditional AI paradigms. The paper presents four state-of-the-art use cases in electrical engineering that demonstrate practical impact and provides actionable recommendations for designing and implementing safe and reliable agentic AI systems. By establishing a precise definition and taxonomy, the authors aim to provide a critical resource for researchers and practitioners.
key_takeaways: Agentic AI systems offer capabilities extending beyond traditional AI agents and generative AI models, necessitating a clear conceptual understanding to differentiate them from previous AI paradigms.

The paper presents four state-of-the-art use cases in electrical engineering that demonstrate practical impact, including applications in power system studies, battery swapping stations, and survival analysis of dynamic pricing strategies.
The authors provide actionable recommendations for designing and implementing safe, reliable, and accountable agentic AI systems, offering a critical resource for researchers and practitioners.

articles.title: Towards AC Feasibility of DCOPF Dispatch
articles.summary: The article discusses the development of a unified pipeline to recover AC feasible solutions from DC Optimal Power Flow (DCOPF) based dispatches. The pipeline uses four DCOPF variants and applies two different methods for recovering AC feasibility, with promising results in reducing errors and constraint violations compared to conventional single slack bus methods.
key_takeaways: The article presents a unified pipeline for recovering AC feasible solutions from DCOPF-based dispatches, which is essential due to the inherent losslessness of DCOPF models.
The pipeline achieves significant improvements in reducing errors (by 75%) and constraint violations (by a factor of 3-5) compared to conventional single slack bus methods under various test cases.
The use of distributed slack allocation and PV/PQ switching in the pipeline demonstrates its effectiveness in recovering AC feasibility, with promising results across over 10,000 dispatch scenarios.

articles.title: Entirely Transformerless Universal Direct-Injection Power-Flow Controller
articles.summary: The article presents a novel transformerless universal direct-injection power-flow controller, which addresses the challenges of managing power flow in low-voltage grids with increasing renewable energy penetration and electric vehicle chargers. The circuit combines silicon and silicon-carbide materials to achieve high-current full-power-flow control without the need for transformers or large magnetics. It also requires fewer semiconductors than previous solutions.
key_takeaways: The proposed power-flow controller is transformerless, which reduces costs and size compared to traditional solutions.
The circuit combines silicon and silicon-carbide materials to achieve high-current direct injection with specific advantages for each material.

The design links a shunt converter through an inverter bidirectionally with low-voltage series modules that can practically float with their respective phases, enabling flexible operation between different feeders in low-voltage power grids.

articles.title: Translation-Symmetric Market: Enabling Incentive Compatibility For DER Aggregation

key_takeaways: The enlarged DER market power within each VPP makes it challenging to maintain incentive compatibility, leading to difficulties in profit allocation procedures.

articles.title: Menifee’s EV-Powered Homes: A New Era in Energy Independence

key_takeaways: The homes in Menifee, California are testing a novel "Vehicle-to-Home" (V2H) system that uses an electric vehicle's battery to power the home during blackouts or periods of high electricity prices.

Network diversity helps protect long-term investments as networks evolve with changing energy demands and technological advancements.
Utilities must adopt diverse network structures to mitigate risks and maintain a competitive edge in the evolving energy landscape.

articles.title: After rate case, Con Edison Q3 electric revenues up 10.6% on flat sales
articles.summary: Con Edison's Q3 electric revenues have increased by 10.6% due to the recently approved rate case, driven by flat sales despite the company's significant investment in new infrastructure and storm resiliency measures.
key_takeaways: Con Edison has proposed a $17 billion three-year spending plan for its utility services, which includes investments in new substations, transmission lines, and storm resiliency measures.

The company's Q3 electric revenues have increased by 10.6%, indicating a strong demand for electricity despite the planned infrastructure upgrades and increased costs associated with storm resilience efforts.
Con Edison's rate case has led to higher revenue, suggesting that the utility is seeking to offset increasing operational costs and invest in future-proofing its grid.

articles.title: Capacity Estimation of Lithium-ion Batteries Using Invariance Property in Open Circuit Voltage Relationship
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel capacity estimation method for lithium-ion batteries, leveraging the invariance property in open-circuit voltage (OCV) versus state of charge relationship across aging cycles. The method requires only one cycle of OCV test data and allows for estimating capacity from partial charge or discharge data, making it more efficient and cost-effective than conventional methods. Simulation results demonstrate the method's efficacy in accurately estimating battery capacity.
key_takeaways: The proposed method estimates battery capacity by solving an OCV alignment problem using OCV and discharge capacity data from a single aging cycle.

The method leverages the invariance property of OCV versus state of charge relationship, allowing for efficient estimation of capacity without requiring extensive training datasets or full cycle testing.
Simulation results show that the proposed method achieves high accuracy in capacity estimation, with a mean absolute relative error of 0.85% across 12 samples from 344 aging cycles.

articles.title: Real-Time Co-Simulation for DC Microgrid Energy Management with Communication Delays
articles.summary: The article discusses the need for resilient and efficient energy management systems (EMS) in DC microgrids, which are becoming increasingly prominent due to their benefits in renewable energy integration. A novel real-time cyber-physical system testbed has been proposed to evaluate EMS performance under realistic communication delays, capturing the interplay between power system dynamics, control, and network behavior.
key_takeaways: The growing integration of renewable energy sources (RESs) in modern power systems requires resilient and efficient microgrid solutions.
Traditional EMS algorithms often assume ideal communication conditions or use simplified network models, neglecting the impact of realistic communication delays on performance.

A novel real-time cyber-physical system testbed has been developed to evaluate EMS performance under realistic communication delays, allowing for a comprehensive understanding of power system dynamics, control, and network behavior.

articles.title: Characterisation and Quantification of Data Centre Flexibility for Power System Support
articles.summary: The article presents an integrated model to investigate the flexibility potential of data centers in providing power system support, particularly with high variable renewable energy. The study aims to quantify and utilize this flexibility by optimizing data center operations and accounting for various factors such as IT workload shifting, UPS energy storage, and cooling dynamics. The results provide a clear temporal structure and asymmetry in flexibility provision.
key_takeaways: The article introduces an integrated model that optimizes data center operations to establish a cost-optimal baseline operation, which accounts for IT scheduling, UPS operation, and cooling dynamics.

The study reveals a notable asymmetry in flexibility provision, with upward flexibility (electricity load reduction) driven by deferring IT workload, and downward flexibility (electricity load increase) relying on increasing power consumption of the cooling system and charging the UPS.
The framework provides quantified flexibility magnitude and duration that can be investigated for use in services such as reserve, frequency response, and price-responsive demand.

articles.title: Beyond Prime Farmland: Solar Siting Tradeoffs for Cost-Effective Decarbonization
articles.summary: The article examines the trade-offs between costs and technical potential of different land types for solar photovoltaics in the Eastern U.S. It finds that greenfield sites, particularly prime agricultural lands, offer the lowest levelized costs for meeting capacity targets, while contaminated lands have limited technical potential and impose a cost premium. Rooftop PV comes at consistently higher costs compared to greenfield sites.
key_takeaways: Greenfield sites, especially prime agricultural lands, are the most cost-effective option for utility-scale solar photovoltaics in the Eastern U.S., offering levelized costs of $39-$57/MWh.
Contaminated lands, often prioritized in policy to reduce land use conflict, have limited technical potential and impose a cost premium of 14-33% relative to greenfield sites.
Rooftop PV provides enough technical potential for meeting capacity targets but comes at consistently higher costs, with minimum levelized costs (LCOEs) of around $70/MWh or more.

articles.title: Control Affine Hybrid Power Plant Subsystem Modeling for Supervisory Control Design
articles.summary: The article introduces a modeling and control design framework for hybrid power plants (HPPs) consisting of wind farms, solar plants, and battery storage. The framework adapts established models into a control affine form suitable for supervisory-level control design. It employs nonlinear control and control barrier function techniques to ensure safe and stable operation.
key_takeaways: The article develops generator torque and cell current control laws for wind and battery models using nonlinear control and control barrier function techniques.
A control affine modeling framework is introduced for HPPs, enabling supervisory-level control design.
The utility of the proposed framework is illustrated through a test case using real-time data from wind, irradiance, and demand signals.

articles.title: Computationally Efficient Spline-Based Modeling of DER Dynamics for Voltage Stability in Active Distribution Networks
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel data-driven approach to model the dynamics of Distributed Energy Resources (DERs) in power systems, leveraging B-splines to transform discrete system data into continuous differentiable functions. This approach simplifies the modeling process and enables lower order linear ordinary differential equations with simple linear regression, making it computationally more efficient for real-time applications. The proposed method achieves a comparable goodness-of-fit to traditional System Identification (SysID) methods but at a significantly faster execution time.
key_takeaways: The authors propose a novel data-driven approach using B-splines to model DER dynamics, which simplifies the modeling process and reduces computational complexity.
The approach enables the estimation of lower order linear ordinary differential equations with simple linear regression, making it suitable for real-time power system operations.

The proposed method achieves a comparable goodness-of-fit (GoF) to traditional SysID methods but at a faster execution time of less than one minute, making it more suitable for real-time applications.

articles.title: Strategic Decision-Making Under Uncertainty through Bi-Level Game Theory and Distributionally Robust Optimization
articles.summary: The article introduces a mathematical framework that combines bi-level game theory and distributionally robust optimization to address strategic decision-making under uncertainty in hierarchical systems. The proposed approach leverages the hierarchical structure of bi-level games to model leader-follower interactions while incorporating distributional robustness to handle worst-case probability distributions. The framework is validated through simulation results, demonstrating its potential to improve decision quality and robustness in networked systems.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a new mathematical framework that integrates bi-level game theory with distributionally robust optimization to address strategic decision-making under uncertainty.
The framework is designed to handle hierarchical interactions between leader-follower pairs while incorporating worst-case probability distributions, ensuring robustness against uncertainty.
Simulation results validate the proposed approach, demonstrating up to a 22% cost reduction compared to traditional stochastic methods while maintaining a service level of over 90%.

articles.title: Neural Operators for Power Systems: A Physics-Informed Framework for Modeling Power System Components
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel framework for modeling power system components using Neural Operators, which enables fast and accurate dynamic simulations. This is achieved through the use of Deep Operator Networks (DeepONets) that learn mappings from system states and time-varying inputs to full trajectories without step-by-step integration. The proposed framework, Physics-Informed DeepONets (PI-DeepONets), improves generalization and data efficiency.
key_takeaways: Neural Operators, specifically PI-DeepONets, achieve accurate predictions under diverse scenarios, providing a significant speedup compared to traditional ODE solvers.
The use of residuals from governing equations in the training loss improves the generalization and data efficiency of the model.
The proposed framework demonstrates superior stability and scalability compared to Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) in simulating power system dynamics.

articles.title: Coherency Control in Power Systems
articles.summary:

The article proposes a coherency control strategy for Inverter-Based Resources (IBRs) to improve power system stability and coherence among devices. The proposed control enforces an output current with a proportional magnitude and constant phase shift relative to a reference, making it technology-agnostic. Case studies demonstrate the controller's potential to improve damping and dynamic behavior in two different power systems.
key_takeaways: The article proposes a coherency control strategy for IBRs using the equivalence of Complex Frequency (CF) of injected currents as the definition for coherence among devices.
The proposed control can improve damping and overall dynamic behavior in power systems, demonstrating its potential to enhance stability.
The paper evaluates practical implementation aspects, including delay/noise sensitivity and trade-offs between oscillation mitigation and disturbance propagation.
